My COLA with her was music video analysis, and the content covered in that class was fun and presented in an easy to understand manner. 10/10.

She put on a great advising course! During COVID, I appreciated her efforts to have us conduct a hybrid learning structure, since it was my only in-person class. She makes the topic very interesting and you definitely learn a lot about music videos!

This was the most fun class I have taken at UVA so far. Dean Ozment is so nice and approachable and you can talk to her about anything. There were quite a few group projects but they were all fun things like making an informercial. We did a lot of field trips and hands on learning in the classroom

Professor Smith is incredible intelligent and well-read. He has a sharp sense of humor as well. He selected great books for our seminar and led engaging discussions. Also, great adviser because he knows professors all over UVA.

Janet is an amazing woman. She truly cares about her students. This 1credit class was the best part of my 1st semester at UVA. Very minimal homework, but the discussions were always about thought-provoking world issues. She connected me with numerous people on grounds. Highly recommend for anyone interested in foreign affairs, human rights, etc.

For a COLA class it definitely kept my interest and was something I looked forward to every Tuesday. Class discussions were reassuring as a 1st year and the class really had a community type feel to it.  He's an interesting guy but is strict on coming to class (if that's a problem for you beware). Daily journals were fun and a blessing in disguise.

I thought his COLA was by far the easiest class I've had at UVA so far. Just a 6 page paper as a final and you were good to go. There were only about 4 to 5 actual lectures where he'd actually lecture, the rest were basically guest speakers. He's a great advisor and is ready to help anytime.

Professor Finder is very, very kind and passionate about his teachings. I took his first year seminar, "The Nuremberg Trial" and he was very knowledgeable about the topic. Though there were times it kind of got repetitive, he kept the class alive and well.

I took his COLA on the Salem Witch Trials. Extremely nice guy. Very knowledgeable and cares about his students as well as the material. The class was very easy, a couple short assignments and some reading that you can get away with not doing.

She really cares about her students and is one of the reasons my first year experience has been so great. Her COLA class also helps a lot with developing critical thinking skills without getting into the nitty gritty components of literature and poetry. They were very interesting topics and I looked forward to class every week. Take her class!

PSYC 2700.comment: Awful professor, awful person. She damages people's self-esteem. This class is not worth taking it with her, wait til literally any other professor.

Specs grading style only hurt students instead of helping them choose what grade to strive for (as she claims). Stressed out until the last minute for this class which was not good for students' mental health. Grading is stringent about meeting certain arbitrary requirements. Do not take a specs grading course in general, esp. not with Lillard.

AWESOME! I loved Professor Lillard so much because she is so kind and her passion for child psych clearly shows in her lectures. Some people hate her, but I don't know why. She is strict on her grading and hates phones in class, but as long as you stay on top of your work and pay attention (or at least look like it) the class is really fun

Professor Lillard has implemented a grading scheme which does not allow for student improvement based on feedback. The feedback itself is not helpful even if it were. Lillard repeatedly cites "too many students" as a reason for being inaccessible and unresponsive, as if she did not choose to teach a course of this size. Extremely unprofessional.

I do not recommend this class, insane grading system, does not return assignments until day before or after next assignment is due so no time to fix any mistakes if you missed anything, changes the criteria many times throughout the semester. She is just completely unorganized!

Summary: abusive grading scale, unimportant/mandatory lectures, cold calls, 

To anyone trying to take this class with Lillard, DO NOT. This class is more than brutal. Lillard has a grading scale that is insane. This scale is used to fail students, and is used as a way to abuse power in the classroom.

Singles out students + harms your confidence.
The way that she grades makes absolutely ZERO sense. It's completely unfair.

Professor does not care and is all over the place. Constantly contradicts herself. Very unclear grading system. Heavy on in-class iClicker questions; miss one and you're absent. If you miss more than 5 classes or come in late, good chance you'll fail the class. Worst professor I've ever had. Would not recommend unless you could take it online.

Overall fine. Graded on 500 word papers based on a scholarly article, plus iClicker participation/correctness. About 80-100 pages of reading a week. However, with the way she prowled the aisles waiting to steal someone's phone and call them out in our 300 person lecture, no one really respected her by the end. Sometimes boring, but not hard.

If you don't miss class, you'll have an easy A. If you can't stand to sit through a boring lecture or go to a class with no academic motivation, it's not the class for you. Essays, in-class questions on readings, and attendance are pretty much the only grades, all weighted equally.

This past semester the grades were based on weekly essays and then iclicker questions. Essays were short (around 500 words) and you could skip two. They didn't grade harsh at all, so the class was easy to get at least an A- in. She might be boring sometimes, but she truly cares about if her students are actually learning. Interesting PSYC course.

Not a very tough class in the end, but I ended up dreading it. She's a terrible lecturer, and essentially convinces you you're going to get written up for an honor violation regardless of whether or not you've done anything wrong. Attendance is mandatory due to iClicker questions, but beyond that, lecture is all but worthless.
Very hardcore professor. Makes everyone sit packed at the front and is very obsessed with plagiarism. Interesting topic but intimidating professor.

She was a decent professor, kind of boring but that could've just been me since I already knew a lot about the topic. Her tests aren't very difficult and if you read and pay attention in class you will do pretty good. She also had quizzes after most classes but they weren't too difficult.

Her child psychology class was phenomenal. I learned so much but the tests were straightforward and not at all difficult. Some of her classes go by fast, but if she feels she rushed too much she will go back to the material she rushed through. She assigns readings in the text book, but if you listen in class, all you need to look at is bold terms.

Prof. Vaish very clearly knows her stuff and does an amazing job explaining it. The slides are very clear and neatly organized, and she posts them online, which makes note-taking less stressful. The tests don't try to trick you, so learn the concepts and you'll be fine. She's enthusiastic and friendly, and reasonably no-nonsense. Recommended.

Hafen was awesome! Apparently, Child Psych is tough with another professor but he made it very easy to a point where it was basically common sense. His exams are straightforward and aren't tricky at all. Would definitely take the class if he's teaching it again.

Hafen was a fantastic teacher. I had a much easier time with this class than a lower level psych class. He gives great examples and his lectures are interesting. You can earn extra credit by going to all of them and filling out his survey questions. Fantastic class, and he was a first time professor!

By the end of the semester, I never wanted to hear about deaf people or sign language ever again. Since that's his specialty, he ties it into every single topic. The articles were really interesting, and the tests were pretty easy. He was a nice guy, although he said, "Don't write that down!" after every joke he told, which got old.

how to get an A: read the textbook. Even if you have to skim through it, read. Everything on the test comes straight from the textbook. I say about 80% is from textbook and 20% from lecture. He posts old exams. Do all of them and get the feel of what are the topics that he covers in his exam.

Bonvillian is well-meaning, but his lectures are rambling and barely relevant to the material you will be tested on. There is a LOT of reading and test questions are very specific, sometimes down to one random, insignificant detail. However, he does post old tests online and he has review sections, which are helpful. Overall not the best.

Don't take this class. I was super interested in psych and child psych but Bonvillian killed it for me. this class was boring and I  didn't get much out of it. I disliked lecture and the TA's were unhelpful. Stay away from this one.

He was a bit eccentric and the class was more neuroscience-based due to his own interest. Barely used the textbook, but he copied the book-provided ppts in addition to his own neuro-filled ppts. Not much reading, but he does upload multiple assigned reading PDFs that he expects you to know for the 3 non-cumulative, pretty fair exams

Lectures were extremely boring (literally I would feel like I was going to fall asleep) and the tests would have many questions from completely left-field. Even the test I studied for for AGES and repeated all the information 3 times I only got a B on WITH the curve. I liked the subject, but not the class at all.
WORST class ever!!! Test are so hard and grading is sooo unfair. DONT TAKE IT.

I liked this class because I found the material interesting. Although her lectures are kind of boring, she posts the slides online so you can view them later. Tests a lot of details from the textbook so make sure you actually read and know it all. For Spring 2011 she gave us 3 midterms but no final exam which was great!

PSYC 3260.comment: Literally so much reading but if you put in the work you'll do fine. Uses specifications grading. Lectures super boring but you have to go because of iClickers. She took someone's phone out of their hand in the middle of class and they have to right a 5 page research paper because of it. Class isn't hard if you read and write well. No tests.

PYSC 2700.comment: Control freak, poor lecturer, and constantly interrupting a 200 person lecture to single out one person on their phone. While not a hard class, this professor is not worth it.

APMA 1090.comment: Professor Ma is one of the sweetest professors here. She is incredibly caring and willing to help in the case of different circumstances. Her lectures are very clear and she is willing to listen to questions and take time to explain. Her office hours helped a ton and she is very approachable.

Professor Ma was extremely kind and caring, and tried her best in the class. Her lectures were good and often gave some time to work on group homework. The weekly checkpoints weren't too bad but make sure to be prepared as one little mistake will crush your checkpoint hopes and dreams, though you get 3 attempts per checkpoint to try again.

Professor Ma is great! Her lectures take you step-by-step and help you understand the material. The grading system she uses is a little confusing at times and can be frustrating; however, if you understand the material, it shouldn't be a problem. Aside from the academics, she is very sweet and very approachable. She truly cares for her students.
Professor Ma is the best professor I had at UVA so far. She was so sweet and respectful to every student. Her explanations are clear and helpful. I 100% recommend taking calculus with her.
She the GOAT. End of discussion.

If you are in the E-school and have the opportunity to have Professor Ma, take her class! She cares for her students and actually wants you to learn, not just pass the class. Her mastery grading system is great too.

Amazing professor! Her lectures are so well organized, and she makes sure students understand before moving on. The tests are not too hard as long as you do the homework. Also, she really cares about her students. I will definitely take her class again!

Great professor with concise lectures. Explains information and content very well and would highly recommend. Takes great effort in making sure content is understood. Homework is quite a lot but it's manageable.

Don't listen to the other reviews, trust, this woman is God sent. Shes so understanding and you can tell she actually cares about her students. Math doesn't come to me easily but she helped sooo much. She makes getting help so easy and accessible I love this woman.

Prof Spencer is great. I had her for APMA 1090. She is chill and not strict on attendance. She takes time to teach each class and is extremely approachable and very kind. I was nervous going into her class because of reviews but I am so glad she is my professor. There are checkpoints instead of exams which you get multiple attempts for as well.
She knows all of our names and is very helpful.
She is the best
Professor Morris is just all-around awesome. She makes every lecture engaging with her humor and speaking manner. She makes sure there are plenty of chances to get the grade you want.

This was by far the worst prof. I have ever had. He reads off the textbook for 20 mins and the last 35 mins give a worksheet and puts you in a breakout room. His test are extremely difficult and are not like the problems that he gives on the worksheet or study guide. He mumbles through the lectures and isn't helpful at ALL. Avoid him if you can.

Prof. Fulgham spends a lot of time explaining the basics of topics. Then on the worksheets and tests the questions are way more advanced application problems that you feel prepared for. The tests look absolutely nothing like any of the study guides. Look at the chapter reviews and difficult webAssign/worksheet problems. GO TO THE TA OFFICE HOURS!

Professor Fulgham is a wonderful person, but the weightage of the class really throws you off. The exams are the most difficult thing you can expect, but they take up 70% (including final) of your grade, and there is no best way to study for them. They are a hit or miss, I got a 75% on the one I barely studied for and a 53% on the one I grinded.
Absolutely love the guy but this class is very hard. If you dont know what youre doing on day 1 you will fail this class easily.
he is not a teacher i would recommend

I took this class online because of the pandemic. I would have class for 15 minutes and the rest of the class time was working in groups on the worksheet. The test are not the same on what was given on the worksheets. He finds the most hardest questions possible to put on the quizzes. He stubbles a lot and gets off topic when teaching lectures.

I took this class online due to COVID-19 and it was more challenging than expected. He takes off points on tests for minuscule details and if you do not show all your work (even work that seems unnecessary) you will score lower. It is definitely possible to do well in this class but make sure that you practice a lot before tests and pay atttention

Professor Fulgham is a really nice guy and I thought his lectures were easy to follow, if a little boring. He gave me a couple extensions on homework and classwork when I emailed asking, which was very nice of him. He has test review days that are very helpful and he's good at answering questions. The tests are tough but it's doable.

Fulgham is a quirky guy. You can tell he is brilliant in the field, struggles teaching the material clearly. He would use simple examples in class and put ridiculously hard problems on the tests. I love math, but this class was not enjoyable.

I've been great at math up until this class. Fulgham explains the simple concepts you already know when going through complex problems, and moves too fast through the hard part. I went to office hours and was just as confused. I can tell he is a brilliant man, but that doesn't mean he is a brilliant teacher.

He is rather boring and dull. He is one of those teachers that discovered powerpoint after it had been made passe, but embraced it anyway. Good thing is that he puts all his slides online, so that's good. His tests are ridiculous though: he picks every tricky, challenging problem he can find, but in class the examples he does are super easy.
Mary Beck is the best thing that could happen to your life in college.
I loved the class. Prof. Johnson was one of the most approachable teachers in the engineering school altogether!

prof johnson is a great guy! he's really nice, super approachable, and always willing to help you out, especially when you're sick. he's genuinely concerned about his students doing well. his tests are very fair and i wish i could have him teach every one of my calculus classes! he doesn't put you on the spot during class, like other profs do.
He is alright. As in most APMA classes, long weekly homeworks, weekly quizzes, and mostly learning on your own outside of class. Lectures are worthless

Likes to make you do stuff with the very hardest method. Lots and lots and lots of homework. I suppose its good for you. 3 tests. Don't fail. He proves everything. helpful, though. and he really wants you to succeed. DON'T SLEEP IN CLASS!

APMA 3080.comment: Hui Ma is the best professor I have ever had. Her lectures make the material super easy to understand. Also, she is very understanding and cares about your learning.
best math lecturer I've had. very understandable and teaches concepts in a thorough but manageable way that I really appreciate. don't feel like I have to teach myself!

Best Math Professor Ive ever had, Professor Morris makes this class so much easier. She is very patient and clear. She is also very knowledgeable about the class materials. All the in class activities are super helpful for the exams and finals. If you need to take linear algebra, take it with Professor Morris, you will love it.

The best professor I've had through second year. She's a great teacher and it feels like she genuinely cares about her students learning the subject. She does a great job of highlighting the important things. I had this class at 9am. I was planning on never going. I went because Morris was such a good professor and her lectures were invaluable.

There are not words to express my distaste for how she teaches and treats her students. The most important thing to her is herself, not her students. I wish I had never taken any course with her and would never have taken this course if I had known what she was like.
Maybe the worst professor I have had at my time at UVA. Really makes you wonder how she was hired. Please avoid any class taught by her if possible.

Awful experience in this course with this professor. She does not seem to really care about the success of her students and is overall difficult to interact with. I had been looking forward to taking this course and can confidently say she ruined it for me. I would take any other available professor for this course if at all possible.

Poor experience with this professor, shared by classmates. Seems more self-focused than student success-oriented. Exams graded harshly with no partial credit for minor errors. Difficult to interact with, turning an initially exciting elective into a disappointing experience. Advise against taking courses with her; better APMA professors availible.

Poor experience with this professor, shared by classmates. Seems more self-focused than student success-oriented. Exams graded harshly with no partial credit for minor errors. Difficult to interact with, turning an initially exciting elective into a disappointing experience. Advise against taking courses with her; better APMA professors available.
Really excellent professor. She moves quickly through the material, but is always ready to go back and explain when there are questions.
She is the best APMA professor I have ever had

Abramenko is one of the best professors I've had at UVA!She's personable and wants you to learn. Her office hours are very good when there aren't 100 people there. Linear Algebra is a difficult class to keep up with, the first few chapters can give a false sense of security. She's fun to listen to and really knows her stuff!
The best APMA professor I've had yet.
She pretends to be nice to students, but she is not.

This class is only 3 credits, but professor Li gives us so much homework every week. The way she teaches is so hard to understand, and her notes are not good enough for us to do a lot of the problems on the worksheets. I always to have to learn from outside materials. I really don't recommend people taking Linear Algebra with her.

Absolutely love professor Li. I've taken multiple APMA courses taught by her and I really appreciate the stye in which she teaches (prints out notes for the class, goes through examples in class) and she really cares that you learn and do well in the class.

Great professor who actually cares if you learn. Almost daily office hours, always willing to take time to explain. Has a noticeable accent, but still very understandable and will make sure you understand whatever you had a question about before you leave.

APMA 1110.comment: She is an amazing and caring professor with easy to follow lectures

I took APMA 1110 with Hui Ma and I am very thankful I did. She was awesome and really explained how to do the problems. She is the type of professor who doesn't like to waste time with proofs. She did examples through the whole lecture which I personally enjoy. Calc 2 is not an easy class by any means but taking it with Hui Ma is a good first step.

She's an angel of a professor. Super nice and super fun to talk to. She does a lot of problems in class so you understand the material and really cares if you understand the concepts or not. She is the best professor for Calc 2 in my opinion.

Definitely a lot of work/studying, and a good bit of figuring it out yourself. Grading is mostly fair, but he does like his grade distributions where they are. Overall a good course if you're a capable learner.
This guy is pretty funny. Great guy, loves Leibniz. Unfortunately, you'll need to be locked in 24/7.

After having Morris, any other professor will be disappointing in some aspect.  She is so incredibly passionate and talented that I am planning my entire math future around her schedule. She is the perfect combination of a joy to be around ( hilarious and down to earth) and an effective teacher ( PERFECT communication). She should be cloned!

Whatever math class you take, take it with Morris and she will give you all the tools. Best math professor/teacher I've had in my entire life. She writes clear, concise notes on the board and is sympathetic with students. Plus shes kinda quirky which is always entertaining. You won't regret being in her class.

Morris is EXCELLENT. Her lecture notes (on chalkboard) are organized perfectly. She is so caring and you can tell she loves to teach. Questions are always welcome, and she's willing to explain something as many times as it takes until you understand. One of the best professors at UVA, no doubt!

She is amazing.  She really makes things clear to her students.  She obviously wants them to do well and understand the material.  I loved her class.  She will go out of her way to help you.  She knows her students names, and makes an effort.  Prof. Morris is awesome, I would definitely recommend her.
Best proffesor so far

Morris is THE BEST! Such a sweet woman, cares SO much about the success of her student. Bends over backwards so that you can understand. VERY fair quizzes and tests. She gives you the quiz questions before hand to practice, and that practice helps a lot on tests too. I swear there is not a better Calc professor.
Morris is the best!

One of the best professors in the entire school! She will go way of her way to help you and make sure you understand all the material and get a good grade. The tests and homework are fair and so is the grading.
One of the best calc professors at UVa
Amazing

While Calc 2 is a difficult class, Professor Pisano showed great understanding of the material. Most of her lectures are prerecorded to watch before class. If you need help, she has multiple office hours times a week or is an email away. The tests were difficult, and her grading was strict, but she offered some extra credit for iclicker questions.

Prof Pisano is a great professor who is very knowledgeable about the content she teaches. After every exam, I would sit with her one on one to go over the questions. She never made me feel stupid for making a mistake. Attendance boosts grade so go to class and P2L for extra credit!!

I loved taking Calculus with Professor Pisano. She is very fair with grading and makes tests that reflect the material that was taught in class. She is available for students and amazing at explaining tricky problems. She uses video lectures that must be watched before class, and in class time is reserved for completing the worksheet homework.

Professor Pisano proved to be an effective teacher who shows that she cares about the performance of the students in her class. Her method of teaching, at least for our semester, was for students to watch a 30-60 min Panopto video to learn the material before every class and during class, students completed a worksheet. I was able to learn a lot.

Class was just worksheets, lectures were expected to be watched online before class. Homework due once a week, can be very time-consuming if you don't know how to exploit the system. The work itself can be hard but it works in your favor because tests feel easier.
If you are an A+ math student you will enjoy her. If you are not you will consistently feel like the dumbest person on earth. She is very smart and lets you know that you are not consistently.

I would definitely recommend taking APMA Calc 2 with Professor Pisano. She's a tough grader in that she's looking for specific things but she alerts you before hand. The structure of the class was also really nice (pre-recorded lecture outside of class, worksheet in class that you can get checked). Do the worksheets and you'll be fine on the exams.

Almost every class with Pisano is just going to breakout rooms and working on a worksheet with your group. Every lecture was watched online, which might be helpful for some. VERY harsh grader (cannot stress this enough) and gave little to no partial credit for anything. Extra credit? Simply a joke in this class

I have had this teacher twice now for two different classes (prob stat and calc 2). She is a smart lady but she makes you feel stupid when you ask her questions. My biggest issue with her is that she gives almost no partial credit on tests which is especially a huge issue with prob stat. Least favorite teacher I've had since coming here. Avoid her

I enjoyed Pisano's math class. I felt that she really does a good job at explaining the material that helped me understand it a lot better than I previously did. The first 30-35 minutes of the class is usually lecture, and the last 15-20 minutes is spent doing a worksheet with a group. Reasonable amount of homework.

Easily one of the best professors I've had at UVa so far. Anytime I've asked a question about a topic she's answered it directly in a way that's easy to understand. If you can get her, TAKE HER COURSE. Seriously, it will make 1110 so much easier.

I loved Professor Pisano. You could tell that she cared whether or not you did well in her class. She had office hours often and was always glad to answer any questions I had. Calc 2 is a tough class but Mrs. Pisano did an amazing job in my opinion. The grading is harsh in all of 1110 not just her section. I had a 3.5% curve at the end.
If you review her lecture slides, spend time doing the "optional" homework problems, and do her review sheets, you'll do fine. I definitely recommend Ms. Pisano.

Considering the difficulty of subject matter, she does well.  Not always the clearest in lecture, but is very willing to help in office hours. Go to office hours, do the extra problems, and ALWAYS ask when you aren't clear on something she says.
Possibly my best math professor at UVA, wants you to succeed, material is tricky though but she explains everything well and posts her slides

APMA 2120.comment: Manageable workload and great lectures. Absolutely fantastic professor who really works to make sure you comprehend the content thoroughly. Would take another one of her classes in an instant.
Best math professor at UVA!

After having a terrible experience with the APMA department my first semester, Hui Ma is a savior sent from heaven. She is so far my favorite teacher on grounds and really cares about her students learning.
She is a great math professor, she really engages the students and will repeat a topic as many times as necessary.

Everyone sleeps on Hui Ma because she is fairly new to UVA, but she is easily one of the best math teachers I have ever had. She teaches very comprehensibly and conveys concepts very clearly, exactly how you need to know them for the exams. Although she has an accent, it is not hard to understand her. I would definitely take another class with Ma.

** Eng Math 1 APMA 6410 **
Avoid her at all costs. She is literally the worst. So disorganized, awful at lecturing, takes forever to grade. Final grades are due in 45 minutes, and we still don't have a grade (received grades for a midterm and hw 3 days ago). She makes stupid mistakes in class, but is still a really harsh grader on hw/exams.
the worst teacher I've ever had

I took her class during coivd. Her style of teaching leaves a lot to the student to figure out, I guess she thinks we learn more that way. Before our first test I had to spend about 2 full days studying (free) online math notes to understand the material and I got an A. The class average was a 69. This shows that free material is better than her.

Prof. Spencer can be difficult to follow and seemed unsure of herself sometimes, but I think this was because it was her first semester teaching at UVA, and as the semester went on she got better at teaching in lectures. She made herself very available during office hours, during which she proved she genuinely wants her students to do well.

Spencer was kind of hard to get used to at the beginning of the semester, but she definitely improved a lot as a teacher. I think that's because it was her first time teaching the course. It's also really evident that she cares about her students because she does whatever possible to help us. Also her quizzes are easier than the other professors'.
Great teacher just go to class.

Awesome professor. Very accommodating and flexible but talk to him in person—it takes him a few days to get to your email. Lectures are structured in a way that makes it easy to understand that day's topic. Work is helpful and so is the TA feedback. Attendance not mandatory but you should attend. Semi “Flipped Classroom” structure works well.
Incredibly good at teaching and obviously interested in what he does.

Easily the best math lecturer I have ever had. It is very easy to understand and take notes in his class, and he is very interested in making sure students understand the material, especially if they ask questions.

I am very happy to be in another of his classes this semester.

Prof. Hellings taught the material in a way that was really easy to understand and always made sure to see if we had questions and help us understand the things that confused us. He seemed to really care about the success of his students and everyone in my class thought he was a really good professor!

By far my favorite professor! Professor Hellings is very routine and organized, and he gets through the material concisely, which I appreciate. He is very understanding, and will push back due dates if something comes up, meet with you for extra help,etc. Take this class with him!!!

This professor wants you to fail & even joked about how students were predestined to fail. Many assignment that will take multiple hours each, no time to actually understand the topics with this many assignments. Exams are extremely difficult, partial credit is rarely given & he does not curve either even when the average is less than 50%.

The class is definitely challenging, but I think he did a great job teaching it. There are daily pre-classes, weekly web assignments, daily worksheets, and a few extended assignments, so be prepared to have a lot of work to do. Professor Mahmood is quite funny if you actually pay attention and I liked the way he formatted the lectures.

I am a second year mech-e student and I have just started APMA 2120 with Julie Spencer. Recently they have redesigned this course to be more "hands-on" which is "better for learning", but it is not. Julie literally doesn't teach. We are all lost with 7+ hours of homework a week. And it is only the 4th week of school. I have not learned anything.
Prof Williams is relatively young, relaxed, and lenient. However, he is not a great lecturer. I had to take notes and learn completely out of the online textbook.

Professor Mohajeri was a fantastic professor. He is super nice and loves to get to know his students. I was reading along in the textbook all semester and I did really well. There are weekly quizzes that allow you to practice what you're learning and the tests are very reasonable. I would definitely recommend him.
He's a great guy, knows what he's doing and very helpful. Tests a bit hard but by all means manageable.

Professor Mohajeri is one of the sweetest professors I've ever had. Assuming you show up to class every day and do the homework, should be a very standard class. Saw a review that said he gives off cute grandpa energy, which is 100% true

Professor Mohajeri was the best professor I've had for math. I struggled with multi in high school, but his teaching style and attention to concepts/details helped me understand each chapter very well. He also has cute grandpa energy
Great teacher, very sweet. Cute grandpa type. Lectures are generally easy to follow.

Mohajeri is a really good guy and a really good professor. His online version of the class he taught really well, and you could go back and watch the recorded lectures before quizzes and tests and it really helps. If you're going to take APMA 2120, absolutely take it with Mohajeri and get to know him and go to his office hours.

Mike is the MAN. Hands down the best math teacher and in general the best professor I've had so far. He's passionate about what he's teaching and he really wants all of his students to understand the concepts. If you're taking APMA 2120, go for Prof. Mohajeri immediately.

Professor Mohajeri is a cool guy. Knows his stuff and is able to deliver it well. He likes to joke with people if they show up late or turn in work late, but don't take it to heart. Overall great professor.

Professor Mohajeri definitely knows his content very well and is one of the best math professors especially in conveying concepts, but there have been times he seemed rather unapproachable and made students feel bad about their performance or lack of understanding of a concept, which is the opposite of what professors should do.
Absolutely amazing, actually cares and knows what he's talking about.

APMA 2511.comment: Class isn't easy, but Hui Ma REALLY cares about her students and helping them succeed. I had an issue with the teaching style and talked to her about it. By the next day, she had slightly shifted her teaching style in a way that was far more effective. Worth going to her office hours and talking to if you're struggling.

Hui Ma is one of the best math teachers I've ever had. Her classes are structured where you are discussing topics with your peers more than listening to a lecture. She is very effective in teaching and is very understanding. Make sure you do homework and stay up to date with reading assignments because classes are rooted in participation.

SPAN 4203.comment: I felt respected as a student by Prof. Rini. He explained the Spanish language to us in a beautiful, non-patronizing way. He understood we are learning and took his time during lectures, emphasizing our understanding over everything else. Great man, I'm honored to have taken his class.

Prof. Rini makes a very technical class seem like a fun conversation. There is a lot to handle but he makes it interesting, and his tests are straightforward. He sets up his classes to be low-pressure, though you can't afford to slack. He is a kind, and interesting person (and I never noticed any "constant cursing"!!)

SPAN 3000.comment: Professor Rini is easily my favorite professor at UVA. He is hilarious and makes the 1:15 lectures really entertaining and funny. He is so chill and cool and makes this class really interesting. I definitely suggest him!

I'm a 4th year and this was my favorite class/professor at UVA. It's super easy as long as you pay attention. Prof. Rini is kind and hilarious. Always helpful &will explain any question patiently. We have laughed A LOT in this class (and no cursing). I've never seen him get mad. 4 Exams (1 oral) not cumulative. Everything straight from notes.

Professor Rini is definitely one of the best! He's very knowledgeable, enthusiastic, and helpful. Phonetics is definitely one of my all time favorite classes I've taken at UVA. It's unlike any Spanish class I've taken before! I highly recommend it (especially for Spanish majors)!

PLIR 2050.comment:
CORRECTION: don't know how on earth it changed my rating to a 5. should be a double 1 if possible

Her lectures and personality hinge on trying to sound smart by asking questions and leaving us to teach ourselves anything we actually want to know about trade. I have never had a worse professor or lecturer. Rude, self-absorbed, and unhelpful.

Her lectures and personality hinge on trying to sound smart by asking questions and leaving us to teach ourselves anything we actually want to know about trade. I have never had a worse professor or lecturer. Rude, self-absorbed, and unhelpful.

Prof needs  some public speaking training. I find that her lectures are very jargon heavy and mumble jumble, and it's hard to stay engaged because she is rambling and not making things clear most of the time. Also at the end of her sentences she doesn't speak loudly and it makes it very difficult to understand. Not a UVA quality class

yes!! I remember thinking the same. Why is she treating students as competitors? She should be educating and facilitating debate. this is a classic sign of someone not comfortable with herself. I didn't see a lot of intellectual depth. maybe she has it but i certainly did not see it in class.

Dr Pandya relies too much on her academic qualifications and isn't a flexible thinker. She can't absorb knowledge that conflicts with her preconceived notions. She often gets defensive and starts arguing with students who have a different perspective instead of engaging in a dialogue. It's very weird. These other reviews are mostly accurate

I have been told by countless industry experts that her ideas are garbage. Professor Pandya has interesting theories but sometimes her lack of experience shows. She has never really held a job outside of the college environment. She basically lectures to teenagers for a living, and is rarely invited to engage people outside of her bubble.

Her class is tolerable but not her personality. The reviews are mostly correct. She's socially awkward, cold, insecure, and petty. She has academic credentials but is not really an astute thinker. She gets threatened when students develop intelligent counterarguments to her favorite theories. Some say it's ego but I think it's insecurity.

Wow some people actually liked her? They must have sucked up to her or saved the life of her cat or something. Most found her strange and unlikeable. I breezed through the course. But I found her ego and personality to be very annoying. Just ignore it, don't get your hopes up that you will find a mentor in her or a recommendation letter

The other reviews are slightly over the top but they are not far off from the truth. She's not a friendly professor and does not manage conversations well. I can also understand the social awkwardness angle. I see that in her. At the same time, she's not batshit crazy either. Her class was just okay and you'll learn something by taking it.

These reviews are making it out to be worse than it was. While I would not take a class with Pandya again, it was not the end of the world. The readings are dense but not necessary all of the time- the study guide terms she gives are a good guide to learn the course content. She is very stingy on giving details about the exams though.

She didn't seem to enjoy engaging students. I always got the impression it was a chore to her unless you had interests that aligned with hers. Maybe that's where these other reviews are talking about. The class was nothing more, nothing less than what I expected. If you wanted something more from her, I can see why you'd be disappointed.

I think it's clear that the overwhelming majority of her students thought she was odd and socially awkward. She also gets nasty if you disagree with her. I've been in large gatherings with people that knew her and they all say the same thing. Like I said, there are some students who like her but they are typically people who think exactly like her.

She was a clear and knowledgeable lecturer, though sometimes the lectures moved fast. I really enjoyed writing the essay. The only major critique I had was the lack of guidance before the first exam. I probably learned the most in this class out of all my classes. The other reviews are ridiculous. She was a perfectly sane and normal professor.

She is not very intelligent. No question. I agree that being well educated is not the same as being smart. Being intelligent requires flexibility and humility as the world changes. She may have been smart at one point in her career but she's a joke at the present moment. Everyone else agrees, except for a handful of people who think like her

She acts nice if you agree with her. If you take opposing positions her face starts to look like a demon possessed her. She is never mean openly but is subtle, but it is definitely there. Good thing she has tenure. She would win the prize for the fat girl who gets voted off the island in any other organization. That's how toxic her personality is.

villainous. The entire course is a mystery, you will not know your final grade unless you assume and calculate, i dont even know my grade on my final. She avoids answering any questions regarding the test. Her ego is through the roof. Why is she competing against her students?! Her voice is like a lullaby. If you want to sleep go to her lectures.

She's the classic example of someone who is well educated but not very smart. She sticks to her viewpoints and is not capable or even interested in reexamining her views in light of new information. That's indoctrination not education. She also lacks people skills and emotional intelligence. Total weirdo. She prefers students who think like her.

Ask around about Pandya before doing any work for her or if you're trying to identify professors for letters of recommendation. Taking a class with her is okay because you're in a larger group. But she's awful 1-on-1. Very socially awkward. No ability to advise students. I really think she has psychological issues. I never met someone like this

She says some crazy stuff. When I talk to other people who don't lecture to 18 year olds for living, they tell me to ignore what Dr. Pandya says. Her ideas sound good in the isolated world of a college classroom but not outside of that. I don't think she has personality to interact with other experts so I'm not surprised.
Is it just me or did you gain a ton of weight? looks like 50 pounds at least.

She hold back in her critiques but you can tell when she's dissatisfied if she makes a odd face. Best way to describe it is as a lost beaver. She will look at you cluelessly and make the face. Ugliest face ever. It gets annoying because she's being negative without being transparent.

She has no social skills and is an unpleasant human being. Someone please send her courses on how to behave in a civilized society. I'm fairly certain she eats with her hands at restaurants. It's debatable if she showers before class

She's must be the most unpopular professor ever. There's no way students would find her personality acceptable. She's better on some days than others but she's consistently an unlikeable person. I enjoyed the substance of the class but not her.

PLIR 2010.comment: Her reputation is well deserved!!  (that's not a compliment)

I always felt she was a little outdated in her thinking. She likes to discuss political economy in isolation which is not realistic in the modern world. Partly this is because I don't think she knows anything other than the small IPE literature. Take her class but make sure you supplement it with other opinions. She has a lot of critics.

She tried too hard to prove she was smart, which was strange because we were all undergraduates. It's like: get over yourself. She makes comments on papers for some ego trip. About half of them were just wrong. You could tell she got emotional and really wanted to make certain critiques haha. They were not geared towards helping students

I had a lot of problems dealing with her nasty personality and I'm not the only one. I don't think she is comfortable in her own skin. It probably has something to do with her having a narrow focus and being drowned out by IR scholars and students who have wider interests. It doesn't take a shrink to make this observation, it is very obvious.
Pandya is a weird gal. Her own colleagues do not even like her.

She has annoying habits in class and office hours. She is very hard to like as a person. Some students claim to like her, but they only tolerate her because of her niche expertise. Most students have wider interests but she isn't smart enough to think outside of her little world. She's sheltered. That's obvious right as you meet her
Is she still fat and weird?? That's all I remember about her. A lot of people used to talk about her.

I guess I'm one of the few who enjoyed her classes. I can see how some could dislike her. She can be too much in some ways. She's not the warmest person in the world, but you have to consider your goals. Are you looking for a friend, or someone who will provide you with knowledge?

She's "smart," but not smart. She has a narrow lens for viewing the world and was never able to show intellectual flexibility and curiosity. That's her biggest weakness. I always left meetings with her unimpressed. A more genuine and personable attitude would have helped, but only so much.

PLIR 4500.comment: Wow, the stories about her are true! I met with her recently.
We all laughed at her after class.

haha she not all that bad. It's true that she's socially awkward, narrow minded and probably has some kind of personality disorder like others have said. But she does her job of teaching what she knows. this sounds mean but it is true. Everyone knows about it. but don't let that prevent you from taking her class if it can be relevant to you.

Take feedback from her with a grain of salt. Consult other professors or outside experts. If you do that and just understand that she has certain pet peeves, you'll be fine in her class. If you're interested in IPE, her class has value, even with her quirky demeanor and emotional baggage.

She knows a lot about international political econ which is my passion. She is a little rigid and inflexible in her thinking but you can compensate for that. Just talk to other faculty and mentors for balance. She has some blind spots and doesn't know much outside of political econ, so just prepare to work around that. Work with what u got

She said something that sounded off in class so I later discussed it with experts during a summer internship. Nearly everyone agreed what Professor Pandya said was total crap and they showed me evidence. They explained that it sounded like Panya was trying too hard to protect her favorite theories in the field. The truth can be inconvenient I guess

The feedback on assignments are basically a way for her to vent frustrations. She has certain pet peeves. She hates it when students challenge authors using evidence outside of the IPE field. Instead of engaging competing views she will try to be critical. But she does it in a way that is not useful, she makes generic statements that are abrasive.

I found her helpful if you put in the work. Yes, she isn't well rounded in her knowledge. She is a little too specialized. But she's willing to put in the work to help you if you also put in the work. I have seen some of the negative sides to her that others have mentioned, but I can live with that as long as the course is productive.

Stay away!!  Seriously. She has trouble interacting with different types of students and people with different scholarly interests. The people that love her all tend to be IPE-focused students. The students who dislike her tend to be non-IPE students. That's not a coincidence. She is polarizing. She has some serious issues!

She has no clue on certain areas of IR. There were a couple of times when we asked her some questions on an important issue, and she gave completely erroneous answers (it was clear they were made up). On other occassions she seemed hesitant and unsure of herself. She is not well-rounded. She has parochial interests. Don't expect much from her.
Class discussions can get stale and unpleasant because she is socially awkward. They were always rushed and limited in scope. I did not feel like I get everything I wanted to out of the class.

Honestly, I learned so much in this class. The grading criteria was fair and clear, and the feedback was always useful. Allen Lynch is a gem, and he actually presents a different, but knowledgable perspective. I felt lucky to learn from him. His lectures, while at times rambles on zoom, were always worth attending.

From my experience, he is the best professor the politics department has. He made the topic extremely enjoyable and relevant to today's world of politics. I would take a class with him any day! 2 and a half hours seemed to fly with him. He is very engaging and interesting! He made each student feel important, which makes a world of difference!

took PLIR 4500 Coercion and crises sum. 2014 and he was pretty awesome. I didn't think I would like the subject of the class but he made it interesting. Also he is a TA and it was his first time teaching and he is better than some the professors that I've taken for politics classes. There aren't any tests but there are some papers.

PLIR 4410.comment: Has legit academic accomplishments, but she is not a sharp thinker and is not articulate. Poor interpersonal skills and doesn't really engage well with others. I got the impression she feels that she doesn't need to explain herself because she looks down on students. Not sure how much weight her work has in policy circles. my guess is very little

She narrowly specializes in political economy so be aware of that going in. She gets frustrated when asked about things outside of her narrow interest. Sometimes she will lash out. HUGE sign of insecurity. Other professors are a lot more well read on the full range of IR topics. She is the odd one of the faculty who is super specialized.

The most awkward and unfriendly professor I have experienced at UVA!! It got uncomfortable sometimes in class when she would stare at us awkwardly and try to hide her annoyance that students would dare criticize articles published by her friends. HAHA! We would all just hope time would fly by so we can gossip about it afterward.

She is not a people-person and it shows. Be prepared to learn completely on your own. I got the impression she enjoys being harsh in her critiques of papers because it makes her feel smarter. It's one thing if her critiques were actually helpful, but they're often not. She's there to just collect a paycheck and feel smart around undergrads.

She sets a very different classroom tone than most other professors. Academic discussion requires an openness to new ideas and an encouraging environment that lets all opinions come out. Dr. Pandya would verbally encourage this, but her demeanor and conduct suggested the opposite. She's condescending, rude, and defensive. Avoid her at all cost!

She encourages everyone to challenge the readings but you could tell it bothers her when students criticize certain authors. She's not open to new ideas. That was the most frustrating thing about her. She also does not give useful advice. She likes to criticize without providing any practical suggestion. It doesn't help she contradicts herself!

Professor Pandya focuses on political economy. She didn't appear knowledgeable in other areas of IR. Her lectures were decent, but she wasn't the most objective person. She had her favorite authors in the field and you could tell. She also wasn't very helpful in advising me of my career opportunities. Major disappointment.

ECON 2010.comment: If you are struggling, go to lecture and/or discussion. The class isn't difficult if you pay attention. Prof. Santugini is super nice and he is more than willing to take time outside of class to help you out!

Santugini is a very engaging lecturer, you can really tell how much he loves economics. I didn't find the course content difficult, he gives you lots of practice problems and is easy to reach outside of class.

The tests were a big portion of the grade, but they were fairly difficult. The final exam was also fairly difficult. There were a lot of tiny assignments every week, about 3 or so and you need to stay on top of them as those small assignments add up in points. He was a great lecturer and I enjoyed being in the lectures.

Professor Santugini is a great guy who does whatever he can to make us feel welcome in class. He didn't use a textbook, which has its benefits and drawbacks. Sometimes I had problems understanding the content and the slides didn't help me. I didn't reach out as much as I should've, which is my fault. Teams made it easy to reach out to him. 

10/10

Take Santugini he's amazing and the kindest person ever! He genuinely wants all of his students to succeed. We didn't use a textbook. You basically only learn by attending lecture, so you have to do a lot of learning outside of class. The course is very test-heavy. The first 2 midterms aren't bad, while the final is hard and worth 50%.
> than Elzinga and Doyle. Bros elite.

Santugini is awesome. Very personal teacher and makes every student feel welcome. Walks up and down the lecture hall before class talking to every student. There is no textbook and everything is based on lectures so I highly recommend you go. Test heavy class. Mid terms aren't too bad, but the final is harder so prepare for it. Overall great class.

Professor Santugini is a really great guy. That being said, his course is a mess. There is no textbook, so if you fall behind in the lectures, good luck trying to catch up. The course material is almost entirely math-based and I feel like I barely learned any economic concepts whatsoever. On top of that, my TA couldn't have been less helpful.

Professor Santugini is awesome. He is super approachable, and his lectures go by fast. You can get as many "TA points" as possible so definitely do all of the HW because when you go past 25 it is extra credit. The first two tests are 1/2 take home, 1/2 in class, and they are easy if you pay attention. The final is hard, but the class is very fair.

Santugini understands the concepts of rigor and truly treats economics as a science -- a fun, exciting science. Classwork is beautifully objective and if you try you will do great. Take a course with Santugini!!!
Pretty good lectures, good guy

Professor Santugini is such a gem. You definitely need to attend his lectures, but this isn't a negative thing. If anything, its good to know that the professor is doing the actual teaching, not the textbook (which is totally optional). He's energized in class and is so passionate about Econ. Always available outside of class!! One of UVA's best.

I absolutely love Santugini!!! His teaching is interesting and if you attend all lectures then you will not fail. His tests are sectioned by his lectures NOT TEXTBOOK CHAPTERS. The TA's aren't that much help, but his office hours are very helpful and he really cares for his students.  The lectures aren't mandatory, but there are clicker questions.

Elzinga, while very well-known and has been at UVA for an eternity, would blab about things that weren't specifically related to the content. He kept talking about setting us up for the future/how it's important to be knowledgeable in economics but he was so off-topic and boring. He seemed like a super nice guy but maybe not the best to understand.

Professor Elzinga is a knowledgeable and engaging lecturer, but the class requires a lot of work. Definitely use unstuckstudy ai, ChatGPT, and the textbook to supplement the lectures and nail the exams.

Professor Elzinga is a good professor, but what makes or breaks your grade in the class is a TA. My TA was great; he provided all the materials the discussion section needed to succeed in the class, which is not what some other TAs do. The final is a bit annoying since there are a lot of niche textbook questions that we didn't go over in lectures.

If you're gonna take Econ201, do it with Elzinga. Knowledgeable, lovable guy who you'll learn a lot about econ from. Pray for a good TA, it really makes a difference. Tons of textbook readings which you just have to grind through. Lectures get boring but material isn't that difficult. Going to office hours & working with others really helps.

Mr. Elzinga is clearly knowledgable and passionate about what he teaches. Lectures, while often boring, do help you understand the material and only last an hour. He seems like a genuine person who wants the best for his students. My TA was AWFUL and I felt like I was at a disadvantage because of it. Still, this class wasn't crazy difficult.
If you are not good with economics and have never taken it, you will struggle. If you're gifted and find economic type things easy, you'll be fine.

Prof Elzinga has an interesting personality; the only reason I went to lecture. Often went off-topic and random scenarios to explain concepts. Read the textbook and do the practice problems!!! Hopefully get a good TA and then go to all discussions. This class is VERY HARD to get an A in. Do not rely on Dutch Knockout, work hard throughout semester.

Attending his lectures is not enough to do well on the exams, so you must read the assigned chapters from the textbook as well.  Also, watch his Econ Minutes as soon as they are released because they're time-sensitive, and you'll miss out on easy points on the exams if you forget. Overall, he's a funny professor but a tough grader.

He really is a great guy and you can tell he's super knowledgeable about economics. However, his class is not easy at all, and the exams are terrible. I would not recommend this class with Elzinga to anybody. 

In terms of "the experience of taking econ with elzinga," highly overrated. No one cares about the "experience" if it means your GPA tanks.

Lectures are interesting, but painfully useless. The two midterm exams are difficult, but doable. Good luck getting above a 75 on your final exam. 

If you get a good TA, you might make it out alive. If you get an average or subpar TA, drop and take ECON2010 with someone else. Do not take it with Elzinga if you care about your GPA at all.

If there's one mistake you're going to make at UVA that you will regret forever, it's taking ECON 2010 with Elzinga. 

It is RIDICULOUS how much of a difference there is between taking it with Elzinga vs Doyle/Santugini. Elzinga's final is impossible, has terms that never were taught, and his two midterms are graded so partially it's hilarious.

Elzinga is a legend at UVA. He is clearly experienced in economics, and his jokes in lectures always land. HOWEVER, I would not recommend this class to anyone who is not required to take it. The lectures are useless and the tests are written in riddles. He preaches principles only and then makes super-specific test questions. Not worth it at all.

Lectures are useless. He rambles on about an amount of information you could learn from reading a page of the textbook. Most classes have iClicker questions, but you can answer them from anywhere. Test content varies and are overall pretty difficult even having read text. Pray you get a good TA

Elzinga was a dry speaker, but a very caring man; You could tell he loved teaching, but staying awake was very hard. The material he teaches is very difficult and you better have a good TA to re-explain the material for you because you will definitely need it. Each textbook chapter took me at least 2 hours or more to read, they were so long.

I took this class twice, once with Elzinga and once with Doyle. When I took it with Doyle, everything made sense and was so much easier/far less time-consuming. I got an A+ in the class and learned a lot. Elzinga's final included references and questions/math that were never addressed/taught in class. Do yourself a favor and take it with Doyle.

Elzinga is very knowledgeable about Econ, but his lectures are painfully boring and don't really go in-depth into the topics he tests on. If you get a good TA, his class isn't too bad, but if you have a bad one prepare to read your textbook and get study materials from other people. He's a nice guy, but not the best professor.

Elzinga teaches the most popular course at UVA like a professional. Micro is interesting but the lectures are nothing spectacular, and he doesn't cover everything in class. Exams (most of your grade) are easy enough if you pay attention and go to discussion. Beware, though, Elzinga likes to talk politics even when he promises not to.

ECON 4170.comment: I'm reviewing for ECON 4095 (Dynamic Economics with Applications) but that wasn't an option. The lectures seemed overwhelming at first, but everything was manageable. He posts the slides and recorded practice problems and has tons of office hours. Exams were all take home and a grind, but actually pretty easy As if you put the time in. So rewarding
Santugini Is an amazing professor and his excitement about econ is contagious. He is willing to do whatever it takes to help his students succeed.

Prof Santugini is easily one of my top three Econ professors at UVA. His lectures are fun to come to and he's very approachable outside of class. If you go to his office hours, he helps a lot with some of the math, which is helpful when you haven't taken a calculus class since first year. I would highly recommend taking at least one class with him!

ECON 4559.comment: Professor Santguini stands about because he actually cares about his students and he wants his students to do well (unlike many of ECON professors at UVa who couldn't care less). You have to show up to lectures and he goes over material quickly. He is passionate about ECON and it made me interested in the content as well. Test heavy

PHYS 2030.comment: If you show fear he will prey on you, you have to be brave even if you don't know what you are doing, you musnt show fear

Has a clear passion for physics and physics research. Very nice, personable guy. However, the worst lecturer I have ever had in my career. Unfortunately, it's not his strong suit. Hands-on activities are, however, where he shines. With that being said, I learned more than I realized and that's due to his teaching. He could be a great lecturer.

This was by far one of the worst classes and professors I took while at UVA. The lab is painful. I dreaded it every week. You can get by if your group is motivated and goes to office hours, but if not, seriously, good luck.

He is very enthusiastic and passionate about what he teaches.Make sure to participate in class,he thrives off the engagement and the class is really what you make of it.He is very good at explaining things simply and then building off of that, and is super welcoming to questions.He works to make sure that everyone understands the content effective.

The lab class was very tough online, and Professor Bychkov seems to really enjoy giving students way, way too much work for a 1 credit class and really seems to like making us suffer. Go to your TA office hours, it will probably raise your grade in the class by at least a couple of percentage points.
This guy is absolutely horrific. He doesn't explain anything, his workload is insane for a lab, and all of the work is extremely difficult. Do not take him under any circumstance.

Professor Bychkov is brilliant, he puts a lot of effort into the labs so that students can learn the physics concepts step by step. People who hate this class are usually the people who haven't done any reading or ever tried to understand the material. These labs are set up for people to explore the concept and learn, not just be told the answers.

The class isn't tough at all, but the TAs are there to unnecessarily tank your grade. Maksim isn't helpful at all, and he does absolutely nothing to help your grade, even if you work very hard to get it. Get 100s on quizzes and homework, don't worry, because the TAs will reduce your grade in the lab reports. Definitely a case of grade deflation.
Great professor who always finds time to answer your questions and talk to you. Class does go by fast, but read the book beforehand and it's not bad.

PHYS 1429.comment: For a 1 credit class, the pre and post labs take way longer than they should. TA office hours were a lifesaver for them. TAs are the ones to run the class; in the first few days, Bychkov was nowhere to be seen. Granted, when he does teach, he does so passionately. Also, the ALEKS Skill Tests quite pointless-why are we doing a test for simple math?

This course is best represented by being a medieval peasant (you the student) and being shoved into a brazen bull. The lectures are worthless tangents that derive equations that you couldn't possibly understand nor derive yourself. Unclear grading criteria and borderline masochist exams. I would rather be shoved into a meat grinder than take max.

Bychkov does not actually teach the class. It is all taught by TAs who are helpful but also do not grade your work. Your work is graded by a bunch of graduate buffoons who are arbitrary in their grading methods. Each report is limited to 1 page despite the shear amount of details that Bychkov demands on each report.

In lab, grading was strict and sometimes graders took points off for things groups didn't even know they were expected to do, due to the fact lab manuals were sometimes vague. Also, labs could be a lot of work if your group doesn't do anything. Lastly, lab was based a good amount on the fact you had a strong understanding of physics already.

If you're sick, still come to class and hide it otherwise you will get penalized, for being...sick.
Your only form of contact is email with a sprinkle of attitude, real life sightings are rare and should be bewared.

This one-credit lab has no right to take up the amount of time that it does. The uninspiring tasks and convoluted lab instructions are enough to dishearten the most obedient of students. It's a shame that physics credit does not exempt suffering from Bychkov. If God created pain so we can feel pleasure, Bychkov must be His proudest creation.

This was one of the worst lab professors I have ever had, he is so demanding and assigns so much work for a 1 credit class. I had more work in this class than my actual lecture class. If you can avoid him please save yourself.

Maksim Bychkov has been the worst Professor I have had so far. TA's who grade your reports are not the one's in class helping you out. I've been through several weeks of illnesses, anxiety, depression, ocd attacks, insomnia, hospital visits, and a medical leave. Maksim was not forgiving at all. He ignored my SDAC accommodations on several accounts.

Maksim Bychkov was the worst professor I ever had. Not only did I received a bad score due to an error on his end, but he was also not willing to correct it for me or 40 other students in his class. the TA graders were also harsh. I received assignments back and when I attended office hours, I was never given a clear answer. No one likes Maksim

Maksim Bychkov has been the worst professor I have EVER had. Not only is he not willing to accept errors HE made that affected my grade, but he also bullied me into accepting my fate. Not only this, but all of his TAs are harsh graders. I went to office hours to understand why I had so many points taken off for my labs and I never got a good answer
An alarming lack of compassion and sympathy from this guy. Tried to guilt trip me when I was sick and couldn't make a lab. Unbelievably miserable person.
This is the worst class at UVA. Easily 8 Hours of Homework a week for a 1 Credit Class.
He has specific "graders" that grade all the lab reports and they grade harshly and refuse the correct their grading even after they admit that they were wrong.

Harsh grader. Responds to essay length emails with just a few words. Ignorant and oblivious to the fact that students take classes other than a 1 credit physics lab. worst professor I have ever had at uva.

Good grades are attainable in this class but it often felt needlessly hard, especially for a 1-credit class. I put more time into this lab than I did the lecture. The postlab questions were harder than anything else in the class which was very frustrating. You won't fail if you work hard, but I don't plan on revisiting physics after this.

this physics lab is so hard for no reason, like dude, this is only a one credit class, why would you make us doing so much work, like what. And also we are doing this online, which makes it even worse.

Literally the worst class I've taken at UVA to date. The labs are vague and uninteresting, the post-labs are barely related to what was done in the lab, Maxim isn't very helpful, and can randomly just decide that he thinks too many people are getting A's and change the grading criteria. Overall unenjoyable, avoid if at all possible.
Very disrespectful to students. Try to ask any questions about make up labs or the lab itself and he brushes off your question and gives a very sarcastic and snide response
russian body builder.  Knows physics. Doesn't really run the class, but he will answer questions during lab if you ask him.
All he does it think we have too high of an average in lab, so he makes the TAs give us lower grades for no reason.

PHYS 2040.comment: Utterly evil class. Maksim is completely unavailable and refuses to lift a finger to teach or help students. Everything is graded by a set of sadistic TAs that obviously are taking out some sort of complex on students. Can't think of any class that dissuades more people from going further in the subject than this. Avoid at all costs.

Dr. Bychov is the best professor I have had at this university. I had him for the lecture section and although it was very rigorous, Dr. Bychov was insanely helpful. Before exams he would hold office hours for 2-4 hours AT LEAST to make sure his students were comfortable with the content. I have not met a professor at UVA who cares as much as him.

The lab is hit or miss, but Dr. Bychkov's lecture section was one of the most enjoyable classes I took. Hes highly knowledgeable, passionate, and is really invested in helping everyone in the class understand the material, even if it means lingering on a subject for longer than planned in order to make sure everyone is comfortable.

Max is a really tough proffessor but he is one of the most engaged proffesors I have ever had. He really cares about his students and he will work with you to make sure you understand the material. I took his lecture course and found it really rewarding, however the lab is a lot of work. As long as you put in effort, your grade will be fine.

Awful professor. Shocked that other people say he's helpful, he literally refuses to teach. If you ask a question he asks you to answer it. I wouldn't be asking if I knew. When I got it wrong, he randomly called on someone else in the office hours, who also didn't know. This continued for 30 minutes until someone looked it up online.

This is coming from a student with an A in this class. This professor is terrible. He is blatantly disrespectful in any and every circumstance. His automatic answer is "that is not my job" and does not try to help in any way. What is he payed for? Terrible professor.
This class was tough, but very rewarding. Professor Bychkov takes the time to teach you things as long as you ask. Dont be intimidated! He is actually a really interesting person and very smart.
He's great. You have to put in the time and effort. He's great at explaining concepts when you ask him in person- take the time to do that.
He's really hot. Makes you buy the text (because he has written it). Comes around during lab to help you out if you're having trouble with the equipment. Can be funny. Nice guy, also really hot.

PHYS 2419.comment: I had the pleasure of taking PHYS 1429 and 2419 at the same time. Lab TAs tried and provided decent help, but there was an absurd amount of work for these *one-credit* classes. Some labs were especially vague/random. Questionable grading too which meant going to OH to add points back to your reports. Final grade really depends on the group you get.

Feels very poorly planned. One lab will be straightforward and short, another you'll be trying to decipher the problem for an hour and a half before they just say what they actually wanted isn't indicated. One lab report could be half a page, another could be 3+. One prelab will be a video and 6 questions, another will be 50+ questions.
He is useless. He only make sup rules for the course, the TAs do all the work. As well, they like to hurt your grade.

MATH 1140.comment: Great professor! Straightforward, funny, and engaging. Quizzes every class, two midterms, and a final. Attendance isn't required but worth it. MyMathLab is easy if you don't procrastinate. He made my transition from high school smooth. I'd definitely take him again!

Interesting and easy class. Professor Chandra is extremely helpful and nice. He is always willing to help and if you do all the take home quizzes and the reviews he gives before every exam you'll do very good in the class (You can easily get 100 if you review these.) It is an easy A and the class is not time consuming for a math class.

MATH 1220.comment: Professor A. is the goat. He's one of the most laid back professors and his lectures reflect this, and his stories are funny too. I bought the textbook for the Webassign code but never ended up actually reading from it. The lectures will teach you everything you need to know unless you don't have a good foundation from Calc I.

If you need to take a math class at UVA, take it with Professor Morris. She is wonderful at explaining mathematical concepts, and she truly cares about each student in her class. Seriously, there are only good things I can say about her. If you have the optional of taking a class you need with her, do it.

She is so amazing! She is the only math teacher that I have ever had that is both an effective teacher and an insanely caring person. SO glad to have her as a teacher. She does go through material a little fast, but I took this class over the summer, so that may be the reason why that happens.

Very funny and clearly wants students to succeed. It's not the easiest class, but as long as you do the homework and go to P2L for practice problems, you should be fine. Make sure to ask questions if you have them, old topics will come back to haunt you even after you've moved on.
She is too formulaic and has a tendency to overcomplicate every topic. I would stay away.
Dr. S is a very kind man, however attending class was more of a detriment than an aid. Had to reteach myself most of the material outside of class.
Good grad student to take applied calc with. must attend lectures or it's easy to be lost!

Very good at teaching the materials. I would go with Bradshaw again if I had the choice of taking calculus again. He can confuse himself quite often but he always go back and corrects himself. Quizzes are fair - you study, awesome. you don't, yeah. Definitely worth having him for calculus than any other grad student at uva math dept.

awful professor. was never prepared for class, and always forgot the hw so u ended up having 5 worksheets due on one day. was really bad at explaining concepts, and his accent and god awful handwriting didnt help either. pretty terrible experience with him & this class overall.
Best math teacher I have ever had.

Nathan is an awesome guy. Great teacher and more than willing to help you outside of class during office hours. I am not the best at math but he explains it well and guides you toward what you need to know. He has a personality unlike most math teachers and you won't truly appreciate him until you have another teacher. Great dude.

4 exams, participation, weekly assignments and sometimes quizzes that all count to your grade. Mor uses the 'flipped classroom' method of teaching which explains material extremely clear. She makes complex mathematical concepts simple which is perfect for Applied Calc level. Exams are very straightforward, just need practice.

MATH 1210 and MATH 1220: Class isn't easy but he teaches you what you need to know for the exams. Go to class,take notes and you are set! (assuming you study) The textbook isn't necessary at all... The online hw package that you are required to buy gives you online access to the book.  Great TA! oh and 1220: the Final is HARD.
Good!  Hard class, but that's calculus anywhere.

Rough around the edges, but if you attend class and meet him during office hours when uncertain about a topic, Pryor proves to be an apt, effective teacher. Homework is graded harshly, but he teaches you precision. The curve on final grades was fairly generously; not an easy class, but certainly not as bad as some reviews make it seem.

Dan is actually very logical in his teaching.  He sometimes seems unhelpful during class, but if you see him individually he is super nice and helps you so much. His class isn't an easy A and he grades the homework/tests very harshly, but if you are looking to become a better mathematician, take his class.

I'm not a math person at all.  I found the class really hard at times but I also went to office hours almost every week.  I found Jason to be very helpful during office hours and I grasped the material better after talking to him.  The first day of the class I panicked because I didn't understand anything but I ended up with an A-.
Though the lectures can be a little boring, he teaches the subject well.  Plus he curves the tests so the class is pretty easy.
