MDST 3704.comment: Sean Duncan's background in education has empowered him to think that his "spec" system works. It might, if someone else taught the class using his system, but unfortunately he does not have the focus to maintain the unorthodox structure. The class is also frustrating: it doesn't feel like he cares about students' answers to the questions he asks.
Harsh grading and excessive work. Obsessed with himself and disregards the students all together.

While I ignored the bad ratings here and took the class anyway, I can say with full confidence it was a mistake. This class is not worth the trouble, Sean Duncan is not worth the trouble. Save yourself the headache and take a different class. 

Unless you're a fan of the card game Netrunner. In which case, you'll hear about it plenty...

This class started out hard. The papers were graded 100 or 0, and at first, I wasnt doing great. I didnt understand why I was getting 0s, but after meeting with him, it changed everything. From then on, I knew what was expected. Yes, the class is not a walk in the park, but its fun. He also helped me with some out of class projects too!

This guy is NOT cool and NOT a good teacher whatsoever. DO NOT take his class. He is condescending and extremely rude to his students. Thinks he is a gaming savant but is often unresponsive to emails and shows little empathy for others. I know several people who would completely agree. Takes forever to grade. Honestly guy is a complete jerk.

Professor Duncan is a fantastic professor who gives a lot of feedback on all your assignments. His class may seem daunting at first as he utilizes a system of grading for some assignments that awards either a 100 or a 0, but it really isn't that scary at all and he gives a lot of space to get good grades in the class. I would highly recommend him.

Intelligent, strict professor who makes you work. He challenges you to do your best, giving very detailed feedback on assignments and leaving the floor mostly open for students to lead class discussions. He may seem uncompromising initially, but he is really understanding and provides lots of opportunities to learn. I have a lot of respect for him.

MDST 3501.comment: Duncan is nice enough in class but is obsessed with his grading system. The first three days were spent solely detailing his grading methods and the class procedures, which is never a telltale sign of things going smoothly. TLDR: The class was pretty engaging but he's very particular about things that don't matter. Rules oriented to a fault.

If your an extremely smart student who already knows the topic in full before you enter the class and writes perfect paper then this class is for you. But for any others, I highly suggest you avoid this professor and his horrible grading system at all costs.

This professor assigned too much work and even admitted it but did not change anything. He grades harshly. I spent more time doing work in this class than any other class. His feedback was rude. The grading system is a complete mess. It's basically a pass or fail system per assignment but a pass is an A+. Avoid this professor's classes if you can.

Assigns way too much work. Met w him multiple times to discuss ways I could succeed only to be met with harsh feedback on every assignment I submitted. You need to meet a perfect 100% of his expectations otherwise he tells you that it doesn't pass spec. Acts cheery in class but definitely finds joy in being condescending to his students...

MDST 3510.comment: Sean is a prick. Literally just an insecure jerk who finds some sort of perverse glee in talking down to students about superheroes of all things. I am convinced he thinks he is god because his ego explodes like the Hidenburg every time someone dares question his decrees about stuff like underwear on Superman's costume. Truly a bizarre/rude man.
Rude af. I would never recommend him to anyone

Sean gets a bad rep for being a difficult grader who can seem inflexible and strict in his belief in 100 or 0 spec grading. However, I believe these negative reviews are from students who don't want to put the effort in to get an A in his class. He cares so much about your papers and wants you to improve, which you will if you take his class.

Despite the reviews on here, I wanted to give Prof Duncan a chance. Unfortunately, I should have listened to the reviews. He gives detailed feedback on assignments, yes, but he is the toughest grader I have ever had in my life. If you sign up for one of his classes, prepare to spend all of your time on his class, because if you don't, you will fail

MDST 4559.comment: I was excited to take a class on critical games, but was very disappointed in this course. I feel like I didn't learn anything and the fact that Professor Duncan kept us waiting for feedback and grades for so long didn't help me improve in the course. At times, he was condescending and made me hesitant to ask questions. He needs to improve.

Granted, I never took Intro to Media Studies with Professor Rubin, but his class about Music & Broadcasting was my favorite class at UVa -- and also the most challenging. Intro just sucks, no matter what prof. Prof. Rubin's very smart and makes the class relevant. There's reading quizzes and frequent assignments, but they're all worthwhile.

PSYC 2005.comment: Entire textbook must be memorized in order to pass exams as direct quotes will be on the exam. Only grades are the 4 exams, and clicker questions. Take the other professor as she allows a formula sheet and doesn't rush through the curriculum. I have never received below a B in a class before (3rd yr) and I am anticipating this being the first time.

Smyth claims that you should focus on learning the material over memorizing, but being aware of concepts is never enough to deduce information asked for on his exams. You will, in fact, have to treat this class like a high school memorize & regurgitate class rather than a college class, and Smyth should feel ashamed for his failure as a professor.

Though many people got pretty good grades in this class, most of the learning comes from textbooks and not his lectures. The lectures are usually slow and drag on, and if someone asks a question it is rarely answered directly. The TAs helped carry the class and were able to answer questions luckily.

He's a really great professor, but you do have to apply yourself to his class. Sometimes lectures can be boring, but for the most part he's a great teacher. There is homework due before every class (a chapter- maybe 20-30 pages) and he has lecture clickers for class participation & extra credit. 4 exams, can replace one with clicker percentage.

So much reading and so information dense but the lectures barely cover any of it. he covers things in class that aren't on the tests then never mentions things that are. Teaching new information up to the last class, it is a requirement for psychology major or minor but if you can avoid him you 100% should.

Three exams (lowest can be replaced by clicker score) and a final make up your grade. There's two textbooks with what feels like endless readings per night. Very specific test questions. Might've been easier for me if I had a background in stats.

Worst professor I have had at UVA. When I had him last fall he would refuse to post lecture notes so if you missed class even for an emergency he would not share them. If you asked he'd instead say to "ask a friend". Class was not interesting.  He was not good at explaining the material, also not helpful or sympathetic to students. Don't take him.

How this guy became a professor is beyond me. He got mad at me for taking this class because I've taken a stats class before. THIS IS A REQUIREMENT FOR THE PSYCH MAJOR SO I NEED TO TAKE IT. Was never helpful during office hours, you're lucky if he even shows up. Reads straight off powerpoints during class and goes off topic a lot.

He should not be a professors. Doesn't respond to emails, cancel office hours at the last minute, doesn't provide and practice problems or resources for studying, and says something bad about UVA every class. Stay away from him.

Attendance is mandatory since he gives random quizzes for your participation grade (15%). He has fill in the blank notes/powerpoints and literally just reads them verbatim during class. Every time I've raised my hand and said I was confused and asked him to explain again, he read the slide again and made me feel dumb. Also rambles off topic a lot

He doesn't give ANY practice problems to study with despite the fact that this is a math class. He wouldn't let me see my past exams because it's his "intellectual property" and was not accommodating whatsoever when I had COVID. I obviously couldn't come to class so my participation grade tanked even though I had a legit reason.
He is quite literally a mess. Also he never answers emails.
He is very disorganized. If you can, take this class with any other available professor.

very disorganized but u can cram the night before the exam and do fine, u don't have to pay attention in lectures u just have to complete fill in the blank notes and then teach yourself, also no hw and 85% of the grade is based on 4 exams then 15% is participation

The professor makes the class as easy as possible for the students. It is clear that he truly wants to see us succeed. He makes an effort to answer any questions during class and also encourages office hours. The material is not tough to learn and tests are directly translated from the lectures. If you work for this class, you can do just fine.

As someone who usually struggles with math, I found this class VERY frustrating. Options for study materials are useless- he recommends you do the questions from the textbook, but the test questions look nothing like that. Lectures are posted incomplete and you can't see what test questions you got wrong because it's his "intellectual property."

PSYC 3005.comment: Prof Smyth is one of the nicest, most approachable professors. He also does chin-ups at the AFC ;) I failed my first exam miserably and went to him, and he helped me out with studying for the next few exams. The class requires reading (clickers galore!) and the labs are easy. Midterms are split between Collab and paper. Great guy, Smyth  Morris :)

Great professor, he really wants you to succeed. Knew my name after the first day and never forgot it. Tests are easy so long as you do practice problems and ask him for help if you're confused. He made an intimidating subject a fun one. Definitely would recommend!

Prof. Smyth is amazing! He is really enthusiastic about what he teaches, tries to relate it to funny material, and is great at answering questions and holding office hours. Tests in PSYC 3005 weren't hard, and I'd recommend him for any class.
I failed his class. He's a nice guy and kind of funny but he's too busy to set up meetings with. He doesn't really care much about who you are.
This guy wins. If you ahve to take Psyc 3005, make sure it's with Morris(Avoid Freeman at all costs.). You can ace his tests with 1 hour of studying.

Morris is very friendly and he makes PSYC 3005 easy. To be honest, his slides are monotonous and repetitive with lots of summary sections and worked out examples but it makes studying for exams easier. His tests are very fair & averages are high. The mode on 3 of the 4 midterms was an 100. Also, you can drop one of those or even the final.

Morris is an awesome professor. Really cares about his helping students learn and understand the material. I dreaded this class coming into the semester but it was a total breeze. The material is pretty boring but Morris cracks corny jokes that lighten up the mood of lecture. One of my favorite professors at UVA.

He was very clear with what he wanted and answered any questions you had. He was very willing to meet outside of the classroom to help with subjects to do with the class, or anything else you may have inquires about.
Matt is a great Lab TA for 3005. If you get him, you will have a really good semester. He makes the 2 hour lab session painless and sometimes fun.

I don't know why people complain-- he's great! Tells you exactly what you need to know, gives cheat sheets, and uploads past exams that are just like the one you're studying for.  He even gave a 6-pt curve on the third exam, so you could get 105%!  Just go to class.  That's all you have to do to do well.  Honestly.  And he's so friendly!
The best TA I've ever had ;)

DO NOT TAKE FREEMAN! TAKE MIKAMI! Mikami makes the material in this class incredibly clear and understandable, considering how difficult it could potentially be. She teaches exactly what will be on the test, so there are no tricky questions... it's very possible to get 100s! Everyone who had Freeman wished they had Mikami, definitely take her!
TAKE 305 WITH MIKAMI! It is so much better than Freeman. I wish she taught 306.

Fantastic professor! Highly recommend. Just review the homeworks before tests, follow the rubrics for paper-writing to a tee (TA's have to be sticklers for APA format), and you're good to go! An A is definitely achievable.
Professor Mikami is awesome. She really cares about whether you understand the material and puts concepts in terms so unbelievably simple to understand. If you have to take 305, take it with her.

Although new at teaching, I thought he was an effective teacher still figuring out the kinks. He's young, he's gotta start somewhere and get experience. That being said, I'd take advantage of it...he can't hold you to impossible standards. I found the class to be fine.

SPAN 2020.comment: I had Prof. K for 3 courses: SPAN 3000, 4530, and 4200. This man is a gem. He makes class comfortable and funny, and it is so very clear that he actually enjoys what he's teaching and is very knowledgable about it. He is one of my top 3 profs at UVA, ABSOLUTELY you should take his classHe always had his iced coffee in one hand which was relatable.

Professor David was great! Really nice guy who understands that students have other classes. His distribution of the work across the semester makes the amount of work fair but not overloading. Also, he doesn't make students take a final exam and instead has them do a project. Overall, great dude and you should consider taking Spanish with him.

The first couple of weeks are kinda fast, but that is simply because the first couple weeks are review. Technically you should have some background in Spanish before taking this class. But Professor Young is a great teacher, she works with every student and is very patient. This is a great class to take after 1010,1020, or 1060.

Profesora Bonino was a fenomenal teacher. She is extremely approachable and is always willing to help. She makes class discussion fun and inviting. No one in the class was afraid to participate because she was so helpful in and outside of class. The best Spanish teachers I have ever had.

Professor Moguel was a pretty average professor, she could be passive aggressive. The workload was more than I wanted to deal with but she is a pretty fair grader. The class is insanely heavy on participation because the class is small. She will talk at you in Spanish only, rarely English. There were a lot of projects that built off of each other.

This guy is the GOAT. As to both his first and my first experience at UNC Chapel Hill, Dr. Salado did an amazing job teaching Span 203. He genuinely cares about each of his students and wants them to excel in not only the class, but the language as a whole. Participation does matter, and Dr. Salado notices and appreciates each time that you do.

SPAN2020 is full of busywork, but Prof Romero understands that and made sure that we understand the material. As a native speaker, he simplifies grammar forms bc the textbook sometimes overcomplicates things. You'll get a good grade if you get the E-Porfolio done by the end of the semester, ask him for grammar help, and learn the grammar forms

I took 5 years of Spanish in highschool, but I learned significantly more in this class. In-class time is focused on grammar/vocab. The online homework gets tedious, but it's incredibly helpful for learning. She's friendly, helpful, and gives great feedback. Tests are fairly easy and not much studying is required if you do the homework thoroughly.

He's really good and he really cares about the students. He always explains everything very clearly, and he helps the students that need help. He really want everybody to be good, and you can go to his office hours for additional explanation. He seems a very calm person and he's never angry.

This class was clearly not made well for the online format, but I could tell how much Profe Romero cared about the class she was teaching. I wish I could have taken this class in person, and I strongly recommend doing so - great professor!

I took spanish 2020 with profe romero and i loved her class!! shes extremely helpful and kind and has the best interests of her students in mind. would highly recommend choosing her class as she makes it very clear that shes there to help you succeed and cares more about your understanding than a grade.
Have him him for many classes. Very genuine and a great guy. Loves Spanish and knows how to teach. Really makes the classes enjoyable. Just listen to him and you will succeed in his courses.
Wonderful teacher.  This is the one class I don't fall asleep in.  Plus the tests are pretty straight forward and simple.

Laura is from Murcia, Spain, and she loves to teach Spanish. Although UVa's Spanish department generally sucks, she is really good at doing her best to make it liveable. She fosters great class conversations and as long as you listen to what she tells you study, you will get a great grade. Very fun and nice person!

She is a very nice person and very lenient with grading. She also accepts online assignments late, THANK GOODNESS! She is also very approachable and is willing to help students with questions. Best Spanish teacher!

Ms. Frost is really cool and will try to make your last semester of Spanish as bearable as possible. This means very easy grading and flexibility with late work. If you want an easy A, pick Ms. Frost. You do have to get a 96 to get an A in this class (with any instructor), so the easy grading will be very helpful.
Super nice and super chill. If you forget to turn something in she will let you turn it in late. Defintely made me enjoy my last semester of college spanish

Carrie's sweet, her homework is not. My main issue with this course is how much busy work there was. Very time consuming homework assigned everyday but it's online so you can go back and touch it up before she sees. Tests aren't tricky, she posts multiple kinds of study guides on collab but doesn't really advertise them. Definitely utilize those!

Carrie is very nice and approachable. In office hours, you are not required to speak Spanish. She is very enthusiastic, and though I did not enjoy learning Spanish, she was a pleasure to have as a professor.

I had Carrie for both SPAN 2010 and 2020 and i can honestly say she is one of the nicest professors i have met. She really enjoys what she does and really wants you to succeed as well. I highly recommend taking any spanish class with her.
Bramlet is awesome. She teaches with a lot of enthusiasm and makes the class go by pretty quickly. Not a tough grader and very easy to talk to. Definitely recommend her for spanish
Professor Goman is the only good teacher I've had at UVa, and the best I've had period. Would absolutely take her again, and recommend her to everyone interested in taking Spanish.
Prof. Climer brought enthusiasm to what is often a prereq class.
Great teacher. He's very nice.  He actually managed to make some of the most boring grammar painless.  If you dread taking Spanish, this is the man for you!!!

Phenominal TA. Her interest in her subject matter well demonstrated in her teaching. One of the very best TAs or professors that I've ever experienced at UVA. Expects you to give your best. Always available to give you assistance.

He's alright, but he definitely doesnt take an interest in you learning the language. We did way too much individual work, & one class he handed out worksheets for us to complete silently while he worked on his laptop. Grading is inconsistent; sometimes just he'll give out a's but on the exams he grades like he expects us to be fully fluent. Avoid
Absolute legend. If you go to class and show effort he will 100% hook you up. I wish I had him for every spanish class I had to take.

EGMT 1520.comment: I took her engagement class which was very lovely. Fun topics, interesting final project, easy enough assignments, and lots of discussion within table groups. Willing to work with students on extenuating circumstances, and a fun person in general. This was an easy and entertaining engagement course that I would recommend.

Prof. Schoppa encourages class participation, but when the wrong take or interpretation of a text is taken, direct feedback is given in front of the class. It would be helpful if the class EGMT 1520 accepted multiple perspectives  on required readings rather than a single correct answer. This is something that is reflected in grading as well.

He's got to be the most frustrating and shallow-minded professor I've ever come across. He asks you to critically think and make up a hypothesis, then shuts it down because when he's the one who isn't understanding the ideas you come up with. He's nitpicky in the worst way, like he's purposely trying to make his class relevant enough to care.

Schoppa is incredibly condescending and passive aggressive when responding to assignments, in emails, and even in class discussions. He takes points off for interpretation that he didn't get and doesn't allow for credit back or explain why an answer is wrong. He also words questions incorrectly from what he wants you to actually answer. Terrible.

This class was the most disorganized, unprofessional conglomeration of nothing I have ever sat through. Prof is very intelligent but conveys this in no way through her lectures. Grading is harsh and unjustified given the lack of clarity, construction, and specificity.

Probably one of the worst, most incompetent people to work at this University. She does not teach, but rather just wanders around talking to herself about irrelevant and incomprehensible things. There are few assignments and they are graded incredibly harshly. Do not take under any circumstances.

Class is the easiest A: you're only graded by weekly 1 page reflections and a group project at the end that you work on in class. Dr. G is so nice, caring and passionate. You just go on weekly walks around Grounds and learn about UVA's history. Very political, but informative. In-class lectures definitely get boring, though.

This was a great EGMT course to take (both enjoyable and easy). You are expected to show up to class, which consists of a lecture/discussion once a week and a walking tour around Grounds to better understand the history learned in the previous lecture the other day of the week. I thought that she was incredibly kind and helpful. Great first class.

Professor Rosenblith, though I only had her for seven weeks, is someone I can assuredly call an excellent professor. Her lecture style and personality were very engaging, and the work she assigned was simple, reasonable, and purposeful. Her knowledge of the subject matter was also observably extensive and allowed me to learn a great deal.

We discussed a lot of interesting existential topics like ET life, black holes, dimensions, creation, etc. Lots of reading and overall it is a decent amount of work for an engagement so I wouldn't recommend if your not interested in stuff like that. Good professor

did not like the class because it felt like too much work for an engagement and sometimes the in class lectures were uninteresting and seemed to drag on. would not recommend unless you are superpassionate about astrophysics

delusional. She treated a first-year engagement course like a theoretical physics PhD understudy. She expects every student to have been fascinated by the realms of astronomy since the womb. Expect atleast 4-5hrs of work per week. She teaches out of her own book ( the ego ) and has no sense of getting back to people over email.

she is the most awful professor i have ever had she grades so harshly and strictly it is crazy. i have emailed her more than 5 times and she never got back to me. her syllabus was so confusing and not straight forward, i would avoid this class if i was you. she thinks she is the star of the world and she is very entitled

Unnecessarily hard for an engagement. Don't take the class unless you're REALLY interested in the topic. Too many readings, discussion posts, and projects that weren't even contributing to your understanding of the class. Also, quizzes are a big part of the grade and the final one covers all the material. If you want a good grade, be ready to work!

Awesome professor! She's one of those professors who gets super excited when you show interest and effort in the class. Although you could argue that she picks favorites, they are often picked as favorites based on the effort and attitude they bring with them to class. The class itself was incredibly interesting!

Professor Greenland truly is a sweet, amazing, and caring professor. She effectively and clearly communicates the course content, along with her expectations. The only homework was reading articles and contributing a discussion post. Highly recommend this interesting class and phenomenal professor!!!

Prof. Greenland is a very engaging and caring professor. It was interesting to learn from her and she was always accessible to students and cares a lot about them. She gives very clear instructions and expectations from day 1 of the course and was a great communicator throughout the semester. HW was reading+notes but they never were too long.
Gotta love Louis. Had him for an engagement and hes about as good as they get

One of the most caring and genuine teachers I've ever had. Topics are repetitive but extremely interesting and philosophical/theory-based. He is super passionate, which is refreshing. After looking him up, I learned that he's a very respected, well-known researcher in the mathematics world, but you wouldn't know it because he's so humble.

Measuring Discrimination was a great class under Professor McLaren. He is an intelligent, passionate, and easy-going man who really wants to share his passion for statistics and economics with others. The class homework consisted of readings where you needed to make at least one annotation and a final group paper based on a data set. Very sweet man

The professor really does not want to give you a lot of work and is understanding if you are stressed or getting behind on the work. She gives a good amount of reading maybe 5-15 pages a week but you will only have to spend an hour max outside of class.
Priya cares a lot about upcoming STEM students, but believes all students could and should care about science. Very kind and invested in students.

This whole class is a group project, so depending on who you're with (and what time you have to take it), your own experience may vary. Bill Pearson is a pretty light-hearted guy with an impressive background, and he knows his stuff. However, this is an Engagements class, and he teaches it like a high level Biology class at times, so be warned.
He was a great prof for EGMT1520. Take his class. Easy A. No tests or quizzes. Reading material are comics he draws himself. Content is very interesting and intuitive.
i took the engagement course "why we hold hands" and it was really interesting. there were no tests and professor coan is truly a great guy. highly recommend.

Josh tried so hard to be friends with us. He really wanted to be a fun, cool professor, but it flopped. There was an absurd amount of reading for each class meeting, sometimes upwards of 100 pages (class met twice a week). For a class centered around engagement, he just lectured the whole time, usually on unrelated topics and without visual aids.

CHEM 2410.comment: (Pt.2 review below). The grade is spread out between HW, iclicker questions, quizzes, and extra credit that she adds to your final grade (this really makes a difference!) She gives cold exams as practice for the tests and they are 95% like the exam. Study based on those and you will be fine. She dropped 1 exam, 1 quiz and 1 HW.

Dr. S. is overall a great professor. She knows the material and can explain things in different ways if you are having a hard time understanding it. She is available to be a mentor if you need and when I thought I was failing she told me to go to her office so we could work things out. She is there to help if you need and truly want to learn Ochem.

Super nice professor! She was a great teacher and presented the material clearly. The tests grades were padded with homework, participation, and extra credit grades and she drops the lowest quiz grades. Not flexible with grades.
Very nit-picky and passive aggressive.

Do NOT take this class with him. He is extremely disrespectful and does not care if you are struggling. He will laugh in your face if you are struggling. Organic Chemistry is already a tough course, but he makes it impossible. Switch your prof if it is at ALL possible, trust me. You won't regret it.

Professor chruma is an amazing professor. One of the first who really made me understand chem, i had him for orgo 1 and orgo 1 lab and now ill have him for orgo 2. AMAZING lecture style, chalkboard and goes slow. very litrle homework and its not graded by correctness tests are hard but he offers chances to boost grade. READ THE TEXTBOOK!

Professor Chruma cares about each of his students. He learned the names of everyone in his 200 person lecture and was always available to talk and help students. Organic chemistry is a hard course and you will not get away without putting effort in but if you go to Chruma's lectures and read the book it is difficult to fail.

GREAT PROFESSOR. DON"T TAKE ANY OTHER ORGO PROFESSORS AT UVA. He really understand the material and makes it easily understandable to his student. Tests are really fair and not hard at all if you study a decent amount and do some practice from the book.

Dr. Frantz is an amazing lecturer. She will make most everything in Organic Chemistry clear through her lectures, so do not skip them. 35% of the final grade is free, one mid-term is dropped, but the tests are unusually difficult. There are test corrections. Find the textbook key online and run yourself through each chapter's practice problems.
No. Just no.
She doesn't put up with dumb questions or people who aren't willing to put in the work. Definitely one of the harder chem courses here, but if you pay attention in class you won't have any issues.
Do not recommend her at all.

I have nothing good to say about Frantz. Her class was my worst experience at UVA. I cannot seem to justify the amount of work she assigns -there is just no good reason for it. This is supposed to be a weed out class and wow Frantz good at it. I'm convinced it's the only reason she still has a job here. If you like yourself don't take Orgo w Frantz

Frantz is a horrible professor. Her tests her ridiculously hard, she does not spend time teaching difficult material and just blows over it like her students should already know it. She is not understanding about absences or grades. DO NOT TAKE HER ! Try samonina or chruma

This class is tough but Frantz uses an engaging curriculum that teaches students through examples and problems. She has a ton of TAs and everyone is always willing to help. Wiley plus (the textbook) can be super annoying but it does have good practice problems

Frantz is an okay professor at best. She gives a ridiculous amount of work that feels impossible to complete. Her tests are much more difficult than the other Orgo professors, and she is not very understanding of her students. She is the reason you will be doing work on Friday nights while your COMM major friends are out partying. Take Samonina!

I absolutely loved Professor Frantz, probably the best teacher I've had at UVa. She is great at explaining complicated material and really pushes you to know your stuff. Be ready to work, but I can't recommend her highly enough. Also be sure to attend office hours when you can - she's really helpful there.

Orgo is hard, but Prof Frantz made it manageable and easy to understand. Her exams were difficult and the final was really something else, but this class was overall enjoyable. Don't be scared about this class, but get ready to work. Do the readings, do book problems, do test corrections, go to office hours (so helpful), and you will be fine!

Frantz is fantastic and made orgo a lot more manageable through her clear explanations of topics in lecture. Frantz herself is very easy to talk to and the TAs are good as well. Furthermore, Frantz's exams are difficult but you can get up to half your points back through test corrections. My one complaint is that the Top Hat book has many errors.

45% of her grading scale should be easy points (clicker points, homework), and each of the 3 midterms is only worth 10%. Rewrite for half your points back on each midterm plus extra credit from discussion, which is usually 2-4 points. Lectures are more practice problems than teaching, but the grading scale is very forgiving. Take orgo with her

The most professional, caring, and excellent lecturer. Initially, she does seem cold, but this is far from the truth. Serbulea cares deeply for her students, but you must show that you care about your grade, her course, and learning. Attend office hours, do the extra credit, meet after exams and see how much she will invest in your success.

She says "study chemistry every day." This is not a friendly jest. Worst grade I got in college... would take it again 100%. Amazing professor, so eager to teach. It is a rare opportunity to test your limits to the breaking point. She is an amazing professor and, if you put in the work, it will still be paying off years from now. Commit to it.

Overall, a very good professor. She teaches you all the important things you need to know in lecture but expects you to know everything in the textbook (except for specifically excluded sections). All material listed in the syllabus is fair game for the exam. Although it is important to stay on top of things as she'll teach you stuff day of exams.

She is a really great lecturer. She makes everything so understandable in class, but then the exams are like NOTHING you've ever seen before, I mean straight up impossible. She's very structured (mandatory weekly homework) and timely, but she's unapproachable. I would never go to her office hours for help because she's scary. Many clicker questions

The class is overall very well structured and her lectures are amazing. I learn a lot during class and she really helps solidify my understanding of the subject. However, one on one, she is not as approachable as some teachers. She tends to be condescending and impatient, which can rub some people the wrong way.
Serbulea is an amazing professor who really wants her students to do well. She's funny and engaging. But you do have to put in the effort to do well. Definitely recommend taking her class for orgo
Dry lectures would have more sleeping students if not for caffeine and pre-med anxiety. Presents material deeply and clearly.

She is good at explaining things and her lectures are clear. Her clicker questions are fair, her tests are very difficult, and she does not curve. Serbulea is very mean person. If you try and ask her for help she will knock down everything you say in the most condescending way. Probably the most unapproachable teacher I've had at UVA.

Professor Serbulea is a difficult but very fair teacher. She goes through the lectures very thoroughly, and her lectures and exams are based off the textbook. She may be intimidating, but if she sees that you continually go to office hours and ask questions, she will remember and appreciate you. Exams were difficult but fair, and I recommend her!

She moves quickly; there's almost no time during class to recuperate and gather your mind. The average of tests usually was above 70, so she feels like there's no need to curve. However, the tests aren't particularly easy. Some kids are just much smarter than you'd hope (as a cut-throat pre-med). Study LOTS and do the Sapling online homework!

CHEM 1500.comment: I took this class because I wanted to take a college Chem class without jumping into gen Chem. Professor Szaflarski is a really accessible instructor. She always makes time for her students, and she made this daunting subject seem less scary. Plus she allows corrections on exams for a few extra points :)

CS 2100.comment: Prof. Morrison is a clear and engaging lecturer, though the course moves quickly and can be heavy without prior data structures experience. TA support is strong. Recordings sometimes fail and aren't re-recorded, and her office hours can feel inconsistent. Still a worthwhile CS course.

Despite there being an active shooter on Grounds, she was more concerned about updating us about when our Lab time was, rather than student safety. She was grading assignments and expecting student to show up even when status wasn't "All Clear" and still was "RUN-HIDE-FIGHT".
Poor communicator. Very set in her own ways.

She's a good professor. I appreciate how she projects her voice, speaks clearly, and can balance being funny while still staying on topic. Some reviews mention she's unforgiving with a late assignment (and that is kinda true) but she reminds you to learn from it (as you get one free drop). I didn't find her difficult at all. She's comfy.

Morrison is dismissive and passive aggressive if you bring up anything she does not agree with. I had an issue with Gradescope, and she gave me a 0 on the assignment because I hadn't turned it in on time, which happened because SHE didn't respond to my emails to fix the issue until it was too late. Don't take a class with her if you can help it.

Impossible to keep up with what she is teaching. Going to lecture only further confuses the student. The lectures move rapidly and she does not appear to know how to convey material to students. The in person quizzes are impossible and vague. Felt confused the whole semester.
She doesn't know what she's teaching. she tries to make up for it by giving extra credit on HW but Youtube will do a 10x better job at teaching than her.
She is highly knowledgeable in DSA, but finds it challenging to effectively convey their expertise to others.

Horrible. Ambiguous. No redeeming qualities. 

Do not take her.

Even if you know the material you will not get a good grade on her exams.

Half of the practice material is wrong to begin with, do not trust the information she gives you, 50% its wrong and the other 50% its C++, not even java

Morrison does a good job lecturing. This course in general needs refinement as there were multiple times where there was a glaring error on an assignment. The TAs were also bad. This class had a Piazza, which Morrison was responsive to and helpful. Overall this class was enjoyable, despite its flaws, and educationally beneficial.

No Tests, No Finals. Weekly Quizzes (60%) and Homework (40%) compose the whole grade. Those quizzes can be HARD! Just took the priority queue quiz, didn't have a clue what to do. There are retake options around every three weeks. And you can make up any one of them during "final"

Homework are Implementation (Wed) and Analysis (Fri). Not too hard

CS 1110.comment: For 1110, Pettit is a much better professor for students learning to code for the first time. He is much slower and goes into depth on the code. Morrison is a funny lecturer and is always available on office hours or responding to emails. Went to Pettit lectures all the time even though Morrison was my prof
Take Pettit.
She's a great person and extremely nice and easy to talk to, but her lectures don't really help. Be ready to go to office hours!

She is very friendly and nice, but she doesn't know how to teach. She went over important concepts really quickly without giving an example and spend lots of time on meaningless things. She rarely replies to your emails, too. I do not recommend taking her classes unless it's CS1110 because the class is easy and you can learn it without her.

Tychonievich is such a character, I'm really going to miss him.  I took CS 1110 without any prior knowledge of coding and enjoyed it alot.  If you dont have prior experience, find someone (preferably in your lab) who really understands and can study with you.  Make sure you go to TA office hours early because the wait time can be very long.

So if you have coding experience he is great for CS 1110, however if you know jack about coding take 1112. The class can be a lot of work and it will suck if you get behind on POTDs. I would recommend this class if you want to be a CS major because its fun and you get to code cool stuff, lots of software design. Don't take 1110 if you don't like CS

Stay away unless you love Computer Science and are ready to dedicate a lot of time and work. I had zero knowledge about coding when going in and the programs we had to write were definitely NOT intro-level. First 2 weeks might seem easy because he only teaches concepts but the material from lectures isn't helpful for HW. Use the book, it helps.
He may be all energetic and enthusiastic, but he is totally useless. I can never understand a single thing in this class. His quizzes are stupid multiple choice that are just trick questions.

Discrete Math 1-
Really nice guy and willing to do a lot to help you. Genuinely seems to love his stuff. He talks pretty fast in lecture and grades tough on tests and homework. Most people failed at least one test in class. However, there are a lot of regrades you can do and the curve is huge. You get a minimum grade before the final which is nice.
talks fast in lecture

He is an arrogant professor. He is very strict on if & when he wants to help you. A lot of the time he just expects you to know things. He makes you feel small for not getting something immediately. The only redeeming factor is that he sometimes gives a heads up for what will show up on exams. The class isn't super hard, but just tedious sometimes

As a non-CS student, I took CS1110 for an elective as well as just to try out coding, which was brand new for me. This class was still unbelievably difficult - not initially, but more so in the 2nd half of the semester. Curriculum gets shoved in exponentially, and even my CS friends had difficulties. Khargonkar does try to help and listen.

Very nice, but TAs are way more helpful. Tests were pretty difficult and she moved quickly through lectures sometimes. Most of grade comes from assignments and labs, tests are only 10% of grade (final is 15%). Can definitely be hard when coding for first time, definitely need to put time in and do all the practice problems to do well.
explains coding in very understandable terms and goes super step by step, explaining everything along the way.
Very Excellent Professor.

Pettit is great. He makes lecture fun and knows how to teach concepts properly. Before this class, I had little-to-no coding experience, and professor Pettit made it very easy to learn Python. Probably my favorite professor out of all the auditorium lecture style classes I've had. Tip: use Office Hours, they're very helpful.

Pettit is an awesome professor. His lectures are fairly entraining, and tend to be fun/funny; he tries to make them at least. 
The class itself was easy for me since I've used computers all my life, despite not knowing how to code before taking the class. Getting an A is really easy, just do the homework and pay attention in lectures.

He was very charismatic and always tried to engage with and make students laugh. The class isn't too bad in terms of content if you actually pay attention and go to lecture/and or refer to the presentations and the online textbook they offer. In-class quizzes were a bit annoying since its on paper and most students just use trial and error to code.

Coming into this class with no coding experience, this class was not too bad. Professor Pettit is a really nice guy and cares about his students. The lectures are all recorded and he uses a token system for late work. The hardest part of this class is the "in class quizzes" that are essentially exams. These are written and can be tricky.

I liked having Pettit as a professor but my only issue was how unclear the PA assignments were. I felt it was mainly an English test rather than a coding assignment, this can be very difficult as a non-native English speaker. Also, the exams were also really difficult.

Professor Petitt did a great job in teaching the first summer session of CS 1110 in a while. I went from not knowing a word of python to building a makeshift game of sorts in the span of 4 weeks. Professor Pettit is very accommodating and he clearly cares about his students and computer science education in general.

Very nice. Learned a lot from the professor and the TAs. 40% of the final grade is programming assignments, so you shouldn't worry about the tests as much. Go to labs often so you can get that 10% participation grade. If you have no coding experience, don't worry. As long as you are good at logic and are interested in programming, you'll do fine.
Nice person, wants everyone to succeed. Always open for questions. Lectures can be boring and slow, but overall a good teacher.

Professor Dill is nice and enthusiastic about CS, but his classes are somewhat bare-bones. Often times, you can get the same information he brings to lectures from texts and slides. People who prefer hands-on learning will likely do better by reading through the texts and practicing the examples. Nevertheless, his classes are easy and digestible.

Craig Dill is well-meaning, but is simply not a good professor. There is absolutely no point in going to lecture because you won't learn anything and his voice puts you to sleep. There are many much better professors in the CS department so please take one of them instead.
Sherriff is a fantastic professor. He knows that most students absolutely dread computer science, but he keeps everyone interested. Very clear in his lectures
Easy enough class, but he is very condescending if you need help. TAs will help you solve problems much better than he will. If you show up to class and try your best, you should do alright.

Only once in a generation does  a professor of this kind arise. Adventuring into Chem 402 on the first day of class and realizing what a legend this man is was as emotional an experience as randomly encountering a wild Mew and capturing it with the one great ball you had left in your pack. Do yourself a favor and take this man's class

Incredibly condescending at office hours and not very helpful. Does not realize that this is a required course, and not everyone is a CS major/ incredibly skilled at programming. I had never taken a CS class before and have no intention of taking another one after this class.
Great professor! His lectures are funny and engaging--full of useful metaphors and clear explanations that really help you learn the material.  I would definitely recommend him!

CS 2110.comment: This professor was horrendous. Be ready to sit through her classes, as she flies through a hundred slides in twenty minutes while you learn nothing. All of my learning happened outside of class through the assignments. Professor Morrison merely read off of slides, and never made an attempt to explain any of the core concepts in depth.

best professor for CS 2110! He goes through the material somewhat quickly, but if you're the kind of person that understands concepts easily then this class should be a breeze. Tycho. is a very quirky guy, but nonetheless energetic and VERY enthusiastic. he might go a kinda fast if you're looking to have him for CS1110, but he taught CS2110 well.

Very energetic and quirky but in a good way. He is very knowledgeable in his field. Attendance is not mandatory but his lectures are always engaging: so much so that I feel as if I've missed out if I miss a class. UVA needs more professors like Tychonievich.
That previous review was clearly written by Tychonievich. That said, he was pretty much on-point with his assessment of his  class.

Fantastic, energetic professor. Codes super fast, so pay attention in class, but will take time to explain any tough concepts. Class isn't tough; just keep up with homework. Entertaining lectures, with original poems and jokes.

CS2110 professors all have different teaching styles and I don't regret taking Prof Pettit's class at all. He is very chill and approachable. I have actually come to like his dry sense of humor. Don't hesitate to come to his office hours if you have questions about the course material or CS in general, he gives great advice!
Loved her! Cares a lot about students and their success in class. Very accessible and more importantly very approachable. Kind, caring, and definitely recommend taking her for CS 2100.

amazing professor, i took cs 2100 and it was an insanely difficult class but basits lectures made sense and if you got lectures you should be fine. they had opportunities for retake quizzes and gave us extra credit opportunity at the end.

An Amazing professor who really cares for every student. Her lectures and slides are incredible and easy to follow, and she is extremely helpful and responds to emails pretty fast. No complains honestly! Highly recommend.

Professor Basit is one of the kindest professors I've had at UVA. She is very open and accessible to talk outside of class and genuinely seems invested in her students' success in class. Definitely recommend taking her for CS2100.

one of the best cs profs by far :) really cares ab u as a student and will set up time to explain concepts so u can feel confident in the class. she will literally listen to u talk ab whatever thats just how nice she is. shes also super accommodating, if something comes up and u cant make a deadline shell grant extensions and try to boost ur grade

This is for CS 1110:

Professor stone is a super nice guy who clearly cares about me. I think he would be a great teacher in a smaller setting. In a lecture hall with 100 + students, he's useless. He spends most of class typing stuff into the coding software. He tries to do class discussions, and it doesn't work in a large lecture hall.

Prof Stone is simply not good at giving lectures. He seems to know a lot about coding, but he has a hard time teaching it to others. Lectures are basically him going over the slides and giving confusing explanations. He also didn't record the coding portion of lectures. If you were absent, you couldn't get that information, adding to the confusion.
Hardly teaches and lectures consist of him coding in silence without explaining what's going on
Very difficult. Professors do not answer emails. Office hours are congested. Homework is very vague and exams are very, very difficult.

Stone is a nice man but a little clueless sometimes. He actually does know his stuff quite well; hes just not a very good lecturer. I completely stopped going to lecture about a month into the semester and still ended up with an A+. If you dont mind teaching yourself this course, he's perfectly fine. Otherwise go for Basit or Hott.

This professor is a solid choice. If you do not understand the material he is willing to work with you and give help. The lectures go along well with the reading that is assigned. There are in class activities that are assigned that also help with understanding the material. Overall, he cares very much about students mastery of the material.

I had Professor Stone for CS 2110 and he really takes it upon himself to make sure his students fully comprehend the course material. He differs from all of the lecturers I've had in the extent to which he encourages in-class discussions which was incredibly beneficial to my understanding of the topics and made me genuinely enjoy the class.

Professor Stone gave clear explanations of the material and worked with students in class to make sure they understood challenging concepts. He was accessible outside of class and would even agree to meet with students outside of office hours. He helped students to make sure that they were fairly graded on tests and in-class assignments.

The course itself might sound hard but once you attend his lectures, you can explore the whole new aspect of CS field. The class is engaging and the professor is always ready to answer students' questions. He is certainly one of the best CS teachers I've met

I had Prof. Stone his first semester teaching and I'm so glad I did. Prof. Stone really cares about his students and is interested in their projects inside and outside the classroom. He will advocate for students and takes feedback seriously. If you are struggling, he will do anything he can to help out. I wish I could have him again next semester.

He is unpredictable. At times he will be lenient in grading, and at times not so much. He very much does tough love with you if you are not very skilled in programming. He speaks particularly quick, and if you miss something you had better ask. He doesn't have any power point slides often, and sometimes seems to ramble a bit.

He is interested in teaching his students but that does not mean he is good at it. I loved 1110 with Sherriff, but this course is very disorganized and not properly planned. Horton struggles to hold the attention of the class. He takes about 10-12 weeks to grade each homework assignment. If you have prior programming experience it will not help.

No point in going to class if you have a bit of prior programming experience. Homeworks take extremely long time, 2 tests and a final were decently hard. He's VERY disorganized and will likely not grade half your stuff as he won't have time

MATH 3354.comment: Math 3354 is a bit weird because it's a flipped class (Read lectures at home, do groupwork in class). Homework isn't flipped, however. Aitzhanova has great explanations for the material, and was really fair with the 2 midterms and final. She is one of the rare professors where its pretty easy to secure an A while simultaneously learning.

Lecture of Prof. Ershov are clear focused and easy to understand. He gives detailed feedback of homework as well as exams. Best professor that I have met at UVA. I will definately take this his course again!

He is useless. He regurgitates the book and has a German accent so you cannot understand him. He has two question quizzes which are tricky and grades homework too harshly even though he has not taught us how to do any of it. Teach yourself if you want to learn anything.

Francesco is the best professor I have had at UVA. He reminded me why I love math. I would recommend him to anyone, no matter how slight your interest in math, because he will explain the topic well and do everything in his power to help you understand. He's a great guy.

PHYS 1050.comment: Best professor ever. I am not a STEM person and was definitely not a fan of physics coming into this course, but Prof Neu is a wildly engaging lecturer and such a sweet guy. Learned a lot, always looked forward to class more than any others. Daily demonstrations (very cool, interactive and effective). Not crazy hw load. TAKE THIS COURSE.

(I took 1060 not 1050). Probably my favorite professor that I've had at UVA. I didn't have a huge interest in physics but took the class to fill the requirements. Easy to talk to, funny, and extremely passionate about teaching. All of the work except the final is online and open-note so it's easy to get a good grade if you do your work and study.

Chris Neu is easily the greatest professor I've ever had. I took PHYS 1050 as someone who does not like physics and this was my favorite class. Professor cares about each and every student and is willing to give extra credit opportunities. Midterms and quizzes are open note, and you have to put in work to get an A on exams, but 100% doable.

If youre taking PHYS 1050, please do not.  Professor Neu is very nice in person and has cool lectures, but the tests are actually impossible and he warns you at the beginning that only about 20-30% of people get an A.  The first midterm average was a C-, and it was open note if that tells you anything. Do not recommend at all. Youve been warned.

He doesn't teach physics in the same way that other physics professors do. Basically every class has a demonstration and he clearly seems very interested in the subject matter. The only issue is that the unconventional teaching method makes it hard to seek help from outside sources because even Physics majors can't really do the problems he gives.

I think he was one of the best professors I had and he was my academic adviser as well. Wonderful person, the class is easy in a sense but requires adequate work. I liked the class a lot- cool demos and useful knowledge.

Bloomfield is incredible, interesting, and has such great memory - he learns every student's name! His experiments are awesome. He knows his stuff and I learned a lot of cool concepts. Exams are easy, just look at past exams! Read the easy book.

Yeah, college takes work people! This class wasn't too bad though, one of my easier ones. Lou is an amazing professor & does his best to keep things interesting & to get to know everyone personally. I wouldn't recommend buying the physical copy of the book though; you don't use it all that much, and online is convenient & where the hw is anyways.

LOVE LOU! Okay..the other comments specify that you are required to go to class..to pay attention..and to do the work..But last time I checked, we are in college and should be doing all of the above. Grades are NOT just handed to you..do you forget that this is a prestigious University? Anyways I say TAKE THIS CLASS..merely because Lou is the best!

This class is wonderful!  He does lots of fun demonstrations and is always willing to help if something is confusing.  You can work with other people on the problem sets which is nice.  Study old tests to prepare for the tests.  It's the best way!

PHYS 2660.comment: Looking back, Fundamentals of Scientific Computing is one of the most important courses for a physics undergraduate. Learning to code for the first time is hard, as is learning Linux and how to interact with the OS using a terminal - but Neu does a great job.  I do wish we had done some scripting.
Overall awesome professor, one of the best I've had at UVA. Very funny and clear during lectures, if you get a chance to take him for a physics course definetely recommend him!

COMM 2010.comment: incredibly ass professor who isn't very intelleigent or a good professor. is more of an annoyance than anything

This review is for COMM1800 but Mr. Martin is a funny guy and if taking 1800, I definitely recommend taking it with him. Material is very interesting and all expectations are set day one.  Assignments are relatively easy and tests are fair (will drop questions if majority of class got it wrong) The only con is that he doesn't accept any late work.

One of the worst classes, probably followed by COM2010 also by Roger. This class was in enjoyable in every definition of the word. He lectured maybe 45 mins the entire semester. You would have a better time buying McGraw hill on your own dime.
Good class and Professor Martin's end of unit reviews for Intro to Financial Accounting are super useful. Sends emails to congratulate students who significantly improve their test scores.

This course was by far the worse one I have ever taken at UVA. I am unaware of why he even gets paid to instruct the course when in reality our teacher is the online software and textbook. This class made me reconsider why one would pay so much for a UVA education only to be taught accounting from a computer-automated program.

Online class this semester. No actual lectures- did not teach anything. Left all learning to smartbook reading and questions and did really minimal if any work himself. Did not have any leniency with bumping grades and grading scale he used makes a typical grade percentage wise a whole mark lower. Strict on this after doing no work himself
Beware of tricky homework, for they take time and practice to receive some ideal credit.

Mitchell is very accessible, cares about her students succeeding, and is very knowledgeable. However, accounting is brutal - you have to put in the work and GO TO OFFICE HOURS IF YOU DO NOT UNDERSTAND IT. Too hard to try to teach yourself. Use the TAs & Mitchell. Tons of homework and it's a huge time suck but you just gotta grind through.

Youre given very few grades in this class and she is unable to clearly teach concepts required for the test. Much of the learning is required at home. Not sure she should be teaching at this level yet.

Despite accounting being slow she makes it impossible to sit through class. Speeds through difficult concepts. Failed over 1/3 of students on a test that had nearly no information from in class and did not curve. I received an A-/B+ but was still one of the worst professors Ive had.

So I probably shouldnt be bragging about this but I skipped class like 2/3 of the time and got a B+. Shes really not that hard of a teacher. Homework was realllllly hard but thats probably cuz I wasnt in class. Her tests were hella curved and she was a nice person overall. The subject was boring but she was a good professor in my opinion.

Katie is a nice professor that really cares for all of her students! she wants to make the class worth going to! the material (and textbook), however, are hard to understand at times, and the homeworks do not relate to the tests very directly. Tests are hard, HARD, but the curve is very comforting. Love Katie, dislike financial accounting

she is a super duper nice lady, but goes very quickly and gives hard tests. the homework and textbook don't reflect the tests, but she does curve and tries to help you cushion your grade with an easy project and the homeworks.

It is true that the homework and textbook are not that useful but she gives out in-depth guided notes and gives time for questions. Not a fun class just due to the subject but McDermott is a pretty good professor who is really passionate and is fair when it comes to grades (92 average on the first test, second was rounded to a B average)
Teaches little to no broad concepts, prepare to memorize steps and compute hidden values.

Very, very dry professor. She teaches at a fast pace which makes it tough to follow. I find it hard to learn accounting with her teaching style. Accounting itself is not an exciting subject, but she manages to make it even more boring somehow.
Middleton is very nice, very helpful, and extremely accessible outside of class. Unfortunately she wasn't the best at conveying the big picture of her material.

Prof. Erickson was a great professor. She explains things extremely well and if you read the textbook it also helps. I would definitely recommend this class, just the tests are extremely difficult due to the difficult nature of the material. Be prepared to study.

It was one of my favorite classes for the first semester - definitely a nice way to start off commerce. The tests are doable, even easy enough to get an A if you work hard for it. Careless mistakes are costly, and aim to do well for every exam. I flunked my first one by a large margin, and had no way to make up for it.

She is a very helpful professor.  The content can be tough, but she is great at explaining things.  Attendance is not mandatory, but if you want to do well, you should at least skim through the chapters and pay attention in class.

3 exams, assignment. Erickson's explanation is very clear, and exams are fair because they cover core material that she teachers, so note down every word she says in class. She is a great resource for out-of-class questions about accounting in the real world. Accounting is not a breeze, but practice helps! I will get A/A- for this class.

Accounting isn't as bad as everyone makes it out to be. You must take the time to study the concepts and actually understand them because the tests will require you to compute numbers in a different way than the examples she gives but if you can do that then you're fine

This was one of the hardest classes that I've taken at UVA comparable with STAT 2120. Erickson is a good teacher but her lectures can be very boring. You have to go to class or you will really feel like you're lost. Each exam increases in difficulty with the final being almost impossible. I ended up with a B- but that took a lot of work.

She is a great teacher. She is very knowledgeable about accounting.  She will help with any questions you may have. SHe even prints out notes for you so when you go to class you don't have to write as much.  As for the class, its tough, but make sure you stay on top of your reading and you should be okay.

COMM 2020.comment: Gets paid to just make the students read the textbook while doing absolutely no work. I'm sure he's a smart guy but I haven't learned a single thing from him this semester and have the same style course with him again next semester because these are requirements to get into the UVA school of Commerce.

He is an incredibly unforgiving Professor. I had three deans send him an email for my extenuating circumstances due to very serious personal issues in order to grant me an extension on the exam and assignments and he did not respect it. Instead he asked me to prioritise his class over my everything in an email and refused to grant any extensions.

This class is a grind, just like 2020. Mitchell is very caring and accessible, but since it's asynchronous you just won't come in contact with her often. Class is hard: please use TAs/office hours/study groups, etc. Too hard to try to figure it out on your own. Just as rough as financial in my opinion.

Professor Mitchell is amazing! COMM 2010 was my first accounting class ever, and I loved it. Professor Mitchell makes the class feel as synchronous as it can be! She responds to individual and class questions in Teams quickly and thoroughly, and you can tell she really cares about her students. I would recommend stopping by her office hours.
The worst teacher I have ever had. Absolutely no empathy for students, even if you have an extenuating circumstances. She made me want to transfer.
Mary Middleton is willing to work with you to help you get better. The big picture and large examples are hard to follow; however, she is really passionate and she wants everyone to succeed.

SPAN 3420.comment: He's very much an old-fashioned type of professor who gives long lectures mostly from his memory--maybe not for everyone, but a really good experience in my opinion. He cares a lot about getting students to engage with the world around them and will like you if you're chatty.

I really didn't like Opere at the beginning of the course and had a lot of trouble understanding his accent. By the end of the course, Opere became one of my favorite professors. My Spanish improved immensely, especially my accent and my ability to comprehend a fast-paced genuine Spanish accent. He's passionate and knowledgeable. Take his class!

SPAN 4700.comment: I had the misfortune of having Opere for two classes this semester, and so far it has been awful. Not only are his expectations totally unclear, he clearly does not care at all about his students. Because he had to travel, he insisted that we make up a class on a Friday evening. He is also making us purchase our own tickets to a flamenco recital.

PHYS 1660.comment: Very nice, no matter the problem, he can answer in under a minute.
He basically does the homework for you in office hours, and gives really good feedback for every homework assignment you do. Seems to take off lots of points for frivoulous reasons though.

MAE 2100.comment: Great content, Great class, Great guy. Take his class for many laughs and some inspiring life stories.
Hard to understand sometimes but genuinely nice guy and gives out a lot of extra credit in the class.

Arguably the worst professor/teacher I have ever had. Completely incapable of relaying information clearly. Changed the grading policy in the middle of the semester. Avoid any class with him if you can.

Where do I start? His section is a mandatory 9am MWF for mechs and he gives pop quizzes. He randomly calls on students in class, changes the course grading policy every week (eg he put in clickers half way through the semester), and he is hands down the worst lecturer I have ever has the displeasure of learning from.

I really thought Laufer was a good professor.  I had mixed feelings about him throughout the semester, but he was an effective teacher, and if you put in the effort, it paid off.  He tries to make class as entertaining as possible and succeeds 50% of the time, but it's Thermodynamics.  Overall, one of the better professors I have had.

Knowledgeable and covered all topics. Followed textbook and had interesting experiences to make lectures more lively and enjoyable. Students who wanted to be spoon fed and lazy will not like this type of old school professor. But he does teach well and is worthy of respect. I liked him.
Useless professor. Didn't learn a thing. Avoid at all costs.

Hendrickson hasn't taught for 10 years prior to this, and unfortunately it shows. He seems ignorant to the needs of his students in class and moves through both conceptual material and example problems too quickly. If he returns, I don't recommend this class.

GCOM 7050.comment: This professor provides long useless lectures with a complicated grading procedure that doesn't follow most school/university standards.

Zhao lectures about the importance of a growth mindset yet approaches her class with a fixed one. She claims she never makes mistakes when grading, discourages us from approaching her, and is unclear in her expectations. The material is easy, but she writes her tests so students do poorly because "OB is a hard subject to master" in her own opinion

Professor Zhao thinks way too highly of herself and has the arrogance to claim she makes no mistakes. Her class is boring, redundant, and doesn't teach anything going significantly beyond common sense. Her class is just another annoying psychology class optimized to reduce the professor's effort as much as possible.

FREN 3031.comment: She wants you to do well. Participate and go to office hours! Work according to her rubrics and plans very precisely. Quizzes are hard, papers are better because they are longer term.

Mme. Ogden is an incredible professor! She really loves the language, she's incredibly encouraging, and she is extremely helpful. She knows the matierial is difficult but she does her best to make sure you understand every nuance. She's a really good grader too. If you're going into high-level French, take her class!!!

Love Spyridon: so kind and super flexible about deadlines. Class was mainly grammar quizzes, a few readings, and writing/speaking assignments. All quizzes/final were take-home open-book. Class itself was mostly group discussion. (tons of participation) Good class to take if you had AP french credit in high school. Not hard to do well at all!

I really enjoyed taking Prof Simotas' class. He is a genuine guy and honestly wants his students to succeed. He even came to one of my theatre performances. Although the workload was pretty heavy, I learned so much when I got into the swing of things. If you ever need an extension, he is accommodating. He is a fair grader and gives good feedback.
Very effort and participation-based. Professors super friendly and makes class engaging. Work loads pretty light

Kind and reasonable. I was never afraid to ask questions, but her lack of organization had me worried all semester. She relies on Collab (which is prone to crashing) a lot, so be sure to save your documents. I definitely learned a lot in this course - in writing and speaking - and enjoyed the positive, interactive atmosphere.
She's pretty nice and very understanding when it comes to turning in assignments. She also clearly wants you to do the work to learn it, not just for the grade.

Mme James is a great French professor! The class is tough, but she is very patient with her students. Lots of work with grammar homework and speaking in class, journal entries every week, four essays, and a video interview project. But you will definitely get more out of the class than your 101-202 classes! Highly recommend this professor!

This is a required course for the major/minor that focuses on an intensive grammar review and writing (6 compositions, grammar exercises, midterm, and final). Prof. is energetic, quirky, smart, and unbelievably kind. She expects you to work hard, but gives you the tools to succeed. You will learn to edit your writing really well and improve a lot.
very sweet, always tries her best to help you understand the grammar, though she can be rather disorganized.

FREN 3556.comment: Prof Ogden loves the language and wants you to succeed. She is strict and has expectations that you must follow. She used specifications grading for this class which means for each project there's criteria that you have to hit, and then you'll get full credit for the assignment. Easy to do well: MUST participate and come to all classes.

FREN 4585.comment: Ogden is a brilliant professor who studies medieval French manuscripts and uses this class to show students the connections between medieval legends and modern ideas of heroism. She pays extraordinary care to the health and wellbeing of her students.
She is the best teacher!. I highly recommend any of her classes. She is very helpful and easy grader.

FREN 4500.comment: Ogden is one of the best professors I've ever had. She's my advisor, and I couldn't have a better one. I thought the class was going to be boring, but I was fascinated. The class discussion is sometimes less than scintillating, but the readings are interesting and the assignments make you learn a surprising amount. Excellent!

HIAF 3051.comment: GOAT!!! Made the class interesting and engaging despite the topic overall being a little boring. Clear syllabus of what was expected of students and how the grading for writing would be handled. Dropped a writing from the end and also was just fun to talk to before and after class.
This review is for HIAF2002, not HIAF3051. Amazing professor, probably the best I have had at UVA. I highly recommend taking his classes.

For HIAF-2002 (RMP wouldn't let me change). Great professor both in sharing content, answering questions, and teaching. Very reasonable assignments and gives clear feedback on papers. Highly recommend for Modern African History!
Prof Syed is the best professor I have ever had at the school he is amazing and his class isn't too much of a commitment. As long as you keep up with the material somewhat you will be golden

I learned so much from this class without ever feeling stressed or overwhelmed. The readings were all engaging and helpful and professor syed gave lectures to help contextualize the information better. Mostly graded on 2 open note exams and a paper.

EGMT 1510.comment: I had Marianne for the Art of Collaboration engagement, and the class was so fun and chill. We did 5 assignments max, and she gave the whole class A's. She is easy to talk to, fun, and makes the classes engaging and super interesting. Would definitely recommend to anyone who likes to move around during class and is looking for a chill engagement.

The absolute sweetest man and such a great professor! I did the London First program and would recommend it even if just to get to have Levenson as a teacher. He inspires you to be intellectually curious and every conversation you have will be so interesting!

I had Professor Levenson for the London First Program, and he was genuinely the kindest and most caring professor I have ever had. He is incredibly engaged with his students, and will make the effort to have a personal relationship with anyone willing to talk to him. He is an incredibly reasonable grader, and his course is genuinely enjoyable.

Professor Levenson is one of the sweetest instructors I have ever had. He was in charge of the London First Program and was the instructor for my engagements, which were (contrary to most Engagements) very fun, as we traveled around the city and watched plays and films as a class. I loved the discussions he led and he was always available to chat.

I did Global First, so I took Professor Levenson's class in London. It was a great experience, and much of the class involved taking field trips and discussing plays we saw. He was very engaging, and discussions were always interesting.
He's a great professor! You'll love him. I had him as a professor in London and he made the experience brilliant. Take the class. You won't regret it.

An absolutely fantastic professor and person. I had him when he led the London First Program for the first time, and he was incredible and the made the experience even more memorable! Every class is engaging, he works hard to contextualize and make information more tangible, and truly cares about his students. Definitely take a class with him!

There was a LOT of reading for this class (EGMT 1520 -- From Language to Data), but ultimately, I learned a lot! This class is probably not for everyone, but as someone who finds artificial intelligence with respect to language very interesting, it was really interesting to see how relevant this topic was.
Fredner is one of the best professors at UVA. His class was very easy yet the class that I learned the most in last semester. I highly respect him and he is definitely a students first teacher.

Erik is genuinely the best professor I have ever had. Very well-spoken and kind. I took American Satire with him, and I learned so much fun, valuable information from him. There's definitely a good bit of work/readings but if you do it on time and put in an effort, you'll get an A. The content was SO interesting, and he just made learning so fun.

I took Fredner for American Satire and overall had a good experience. The overall workload depended on how much you did the readings. You really learn as much as the effort you want to put in. Contract grading is a free A, and makes everything essentially for completion. He's a nice guy, and this is a solid engagements option.

Okay class, she's very smart but sometimes her tone can be condescending. If you're looking for an easy engagement I wouldn't recommend. If you follow her syllabus, you should be okay. Do the reading so you can write the papers, she grades kind of harsh. Overall, not bad, annoying at the start, she really sticks to her syllabus.
She dropped my grade due an absence in the class when I clearly stated that I was sick.

This professor lacks a lot of empathy and is extremely particular and strict. She has managed to make an engagement class (which is supposed to settle first years into college and introduce them to new topics) stressful and boring. She assigns way too much work for an engagement and offers no room to be imperfect. Don't take this class :)
