Peter believes each of his students has the ability to do great things both in and outside the classroom, and he creates an incredible learning environment that brings out the best in every MSMIT graduate. 5 stars!

Peter had a deep knowledge of his subject matter, enterprise strategy.  He was always available and helpful with ideas and commentary to help the class improve.  The course was tough, but a ton of fun and applicable in the real world.

Peter provides clear expectations, a readiness to support you, and active communication.  His instruction and enthusiasm for the material on business strategy helped me appreciate the content and be successful in one of the most difficult classes of the MS MIT program.

Peter easily intertwines business strategy concepts & complexities with relevant case studies that create a robust and enduring foundation of knowledge. His expertise extends beyond a linear comprehension of strategy and reveals the impacts and dependencies of business networks and behaviors. His classroom is engaged, interactive and energizing.

Peter Gray is an excellent instructor. He is crystal clear in making his expectations known. His lectures are interesting and on point, providing very useful guidance for formulating and discussing business strategy. This was one of the most valuable of all the grad classes I have taken. He is not "easy", but you will learn a lot from him.

GCOM 7840.comment: Professor Gray is tough but fair, pushing students to reach their potential. He's always available outside of class to offer guidance. His commitment to student success and the direction of the course is evident. You'll leave with a solid grasp of the material and a sense of accomplishment.

Prof. Gray taught & managed the Capstone Proj. for MS in MIT. He gave excellent lectures on Innovation & Tech. Mgmt. He also managed & supervised all student teams that spent 4 months on the Proj. His regular feedback was detailed, highly relevant, & motivational. He wanted all students to succeed. You have to work for him, but it is worth it.
Professor Gray is really intelligent. However, when asks for clarifications and answers he rejects the students when they ask question. Other professors are welcoming compared to Gray.

Professor Gray was one of the most knowledgeable and effective instructors of the MSMIT program. His enthusiasm & experience in the subject areas of business strategy and innovation are outstanding. He surely urges students to dive deeper into their research which results in a more profound understanding of the material covered in in the program.

GCOM 7820.comment: Excellent professor.  Brilliant and engaging.  One of the best professors I had in graduate school. Whenever I think about strategy in my career Peter Gray's lectures always come to mind and they are very useful.

ANTH 2590.comment: I took this class in the spring with very hi hopes. But that didnt last to long. He is very nervous and very boring. It didnt appear that he knew the material very well. I would not recommend him.

George Mentore is a God. His class changed my life and if I could take a class with him in every subject I would. For those of you looking for easy classes,why do you even go to UVA?Of course his classes are not easy, but if they were, what would be the point?He will push you to the brink edge of insanity, and literally rock your world.

Prof. Scherz is respectful, humble, and encourages discussion not just about course material but also about the school community. Engaging, fun lectures, no text, articleschapters on Collab. Was a stress-free but thought-provoking course with attendance, 3 online quizzes, and 3 short take-home essays.

Professor Scherz is incredible. I took her class in the fall and am now taking another one of her classes this spring. She is really, really wonderful. She caters to students' needs, has accessible office hours, and loves to just chat about what your interests are. She genuinely cares about her students. PLEASE TAKE!

Honestly, worst professor possible. The man has absolutely no clue what he is talking about and will take you on a loop of nonsense throughout the course. I would rather drop out than take another course from this fella. His grading system is terrible. He is very antagonistic during class discussions. Avoid him like Pablo Escobar avoided prison.

CHEM 2120.comment: CHEM2120 is an second writing requirement ethics class, so it worked a lot differently than her other classes, but I'd definitely recommend taking it. There were no exams, just a lot of writing, which she always took time to give useful comments on. Lecture was interesting, and there was a fair amount of class participation.

CHEM 1421.comment: People always conplain about intro chem lab 2, but I honestly loved it. Yes pre and postlabs get annoying but I found the labs fun to do and I also had a good TA (which REALLY influences your happiness in this class). Lisa pops in time to time, but never spoke to her lol. Regardless, quizzes were okay and chem lab wasn't much of an issue.

I mean she's good but she spends way too much time on her job. You know that one teacher that made you do arts and crafts in like the 7th grade. She reminds me of that teacher. She's just over the top and its kinda annoying. Sad part is she's the second best Chem prof at UVA. Stains is EASILY #1. She's new so she's not well known but she's the best

This lab class was run by TAs and Lisa just planned the experiments. It may have been a 1-credit class but felt more like 3. The quizzes are unreasonably difficult and there were a couple nobody did well on due to poorly written questions. Some TAs are alright but they can be very hit or miss. Postlabs are very harshly graded and coding is a pain.
Bryant is a bad lecturer. His lectures are boring, and attendance has slowly decreased as a result. I think it's clear that he loves chemistry, but he is not right for teaching gen chem.

CHEM 1411.comment: I enjoyed CHEM 1411, but it had almost everything to do with my TAs and groupmates. Prof. M posted videos on Canvas explaining assignments, which were very helpful, but you won't see her in class. The experiments can get confusing at times, so definitely put in the work, and if you're with people who contribute equally, you're set for the semester.
CHEM 1411 is a joke. It's literally impossible to not get an A

The first thing people need to understand is that this lab is run and graded by TAs, not Morkowchuk so don't get mad at her. My TA (Paolo) was clearly uninterested and didn't want to be there, but an easy grader. Overall, the lab can be annoying because you can fail an assignment by just a little bit and how to then use a token to redo.

This class is very easy because it is graded by mastery, rather than by correctness. That being said, some of the work is time consuming for only 1 credit. She sent out a weekly update for each section that was extremely helpful. Your experience in the lab and workshop depend on the TAs you have. There are unclear guidelines for the plans and labs.

Content-wise it was easy, even without taking lecture. The class is lenient on grading, since everything is essentially pass or fail. This professor makes the class pretty straightforward in terms of knowing what's due. 

Workshop was difficult though if you didn't have good TAs, since you are given little guidance on how to plan experiments

I love her.

Great experience overall.

Teammates are important, this is a group-project based class.

Do not be the one who takes a free-ride!

I can't grade Lisa because I never saw her during the lab. The lab itself was awful, the experiments are either boring or confusing and the grading is totally dependent on your TA. Lisa gave videos to provide background on the lab work which were never helpful. If you don't have to take this lab, don't. It sucks way too much for a 1 credit class.

I had Prof. Morkowchuk for CHEM1411 Lab, but she also did a couple of the video lectures for CHEM1410. Those recorded lectures were on the longer side, but the readings for the lab component were very reasonable. Quizzes are mostly straightforward; not too much homework & plenty of time to do it, but some assignments can be graded somewhat harshly.
Lab was easy and straight forward. I took the physics lab online during COVID and it was absolutely hell compared to this. This lab is so much better I literally cannot express how good it is.

The entire lab was online due to COVID, which was super lame. The entire thing was run by TAs and I never even met Professor Morkowchuk. I thought the content was super boring and the labs weren't engaging or interesting at all.
The class was run by TAs- I never once had Morkowchuk pop in and say hello or anything. The grading is very harsh on Postlab assessments, but the other grades aren't awful.

At first, it seemed that Leung genuinely cares about his students and therefore challenges.After the terribly rude email he sent out, I realize otherwise. He is evil and his tests are impossibly difficult. He assumes we all learn the same way and uses ALEKS which will is the bane of my existence. DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS.

This was the single worst class I have ever taken in my life. You could study two weeks in advance for a test and still get a 60. Said he "aimed for an average in the 60s." This class will ruin your life and gpa.

I had him for lab lecture and he would always give super hard iclicker questions, especially at the end of class and then giggle because he was keeping us over the allotted class time. The information he gave for labs was irrelevant and he was more annoying than helpful. I didn't listen to him and I did fine in the labs.

The only negative thing that I can say to expect upon taking the lab is the grading scale. My TA even described it as unfair, but that she had to follow it anyway. There is no room for mistakes, and even when you don't make one, they will create one anyway. This class inspired me to take all other Chemistry elsewhere.

CHEM 1620.comment: I took 1610 with Professor Welch and his teaching style was very different than what I was used to I suggest Morkowchuk who teaches more traditionally as I took her for 1620. Pretty good lectures, engaging in such a large class and good notes.

Not easy, but he is very smart and an interesting professor. he does take some getting used to. no need to take notes since he posts his slides and the slides cover everything important from the text. if you like chemistry I would take his section but if you are only fulfilling a requirement and don't care much for the subject, take someone else

He's not the best lecturer--really boring, slow, and unenthusiastic.  I hardly ever went to class.   I've got to give him some credit though, because he seems like a really nice guy who genuinely cares about his students.  He's just not a good lecturer.
Extremely organized and lecture notes are crystal clear.  Quizzes aren't terrible but you need to study.

SLAV 2360.comment: Take Dracula if you get the chance. Summer session was very fun and low stress. Lectures are great. He goes off on tangents fairly often, but they're always interesting so nobody minded.

Stanley is such a homie and his class, well, its the bomb. speaking of bombs, failing the class is probably the greatest challenge you'll come to face here. lowest stress levels I've ever felt taking a course in my entire academic experience. You just get to chill out and learn about odd funky things.

SLAV 2360: Dracula was an easy and fun A for me. Professor Stepanic is an entertaining lecturer, and the grade was largely based off of a lot of simple lecture and textbook questions. He made everyone feel welcome and never tried to talk about some political agenda. Warning: the class talks about some violent and sexual stuff.

TAKE THIS CLASS! Stepanic is awesome, the material is fascinating, and the lectures are engaging. For the final, we even got to do a LARP game in the Rotunda. If you have the chance, you have to take Dracula!

Professor Stepanic is a great professor who doesn't assign much work. Exams are done online over several weeks and are open-note and open-book. His lectures are interesting and he's extremely approachable. Readings aren't really necessary if you go to lectures (which you should for participation) but you need the book on Top Hat to do homework.

My favorite UVA professor by far! You can tell how much he actually loves what he teaches. I took the summer session and he made waking up early every day enjoyable with film clips, interesting facts, and his enthusiasm on the topic. On top of being a great lecturer, he's a really cool person if you take 5 mins and talk to him too. Take this class!

My favorite professor at UVa hands down, and across all of my education. Passionate about his subject, eccentric, approachable, interesting, all around awesome. His Dracula class is incredible and is the only class I have only been sad about missing because of a snow day. 11/10 6 gold stars

I absolutely loved this class. I looked forward to going to lecture everyday and you don't have to do the readings if you go to class. Prof. Stepanic is extremely intelligent and I came away from this class with so much knowledge on the topic as well as random facts he shared along the way. If you're looking for an awesome class TAKE THIS ONE!

I absolutely loved this class. No reading is required (though they are recommended & posted) but basically as long as you do your papers and listen to lecture you should be set. Professor Stepanic is also super intelligent and full of knowledge. I honestly looked forward to going to class everyday. If you're looking for an awesome class, this is it

This class was awesome! First off, it's about vampires...everything from demonology to the origin of the vampire to vampires in pop culture. There were 4 5-page papers that were graded so easily (when you go to pick them up, you can see that just about everyone got 25/25 on each essay). Never read books and got a 99 on the final. Awesome AND easy!

I LOVED this professor. The class was always interesting and he was VERY approachable. This was overall my best class I've taken in college. He keeps you engaged and is fair. If you do the reading and come to class, there is no reason you shouldn't get a good grade. If you can take a class with him, I'd HIGHLY recommend it.

An amazing class, and an amazing professor in every respect. Tests exactly what he teaches, lectures are actually interesting and at least a third of the class is watching movies. If you're physically able to, take his class.

Greatest class ever.  I don't think I've ever had a class where everything was so clear and comprehensible.  Really opened my eyes to how much a simple piece of folklore has affected so many things.  Very helpful, fun, yet stern when he needs to be.

POL 1210.comment: Stepanic is clearly very excited about what he teaches and maintains a casual, enjoyable class environment. Emphasis is pretty much entirely on learning and participation; there is zero reason to be concerned about grading in this course. Would recommend for anyone interested in Polish language or culture.

RUSS 2010.comment: This guy knows everything about Russian!  I didn't like the book we used, but it wasn't his fault.  It was a previous book from another professor who started the course.  Stan and his assistants did a great job making the class better for us!
He's wrong half the time and his expectations are really unclear.

CHM 2410.comment: The class IS hard as reviews below say, but its as hard as any other stem class would be. If you practice, write notes before class AS PROF. FRANTS RECOMMENDS you will do just fine. She offers test corrections that gives up to 50% of missed points & its hard NOT to get 100% on HW & quizzes. If you arent willing to work hard, just do liberal arts.

BIOL 2200.comment: She's very personable, and the lectures are interesting and engaging. The wording on exam questions can be a bit tricky, but it gets easier once you do the practice questions and get used to how she words things. Attendance isn't mandatory, but exams are mostly lecture content so it's in your best interest to go.
Excellent professor. Fair grading. Reasonable workload.

Expect to spend 10+ hours per week for exam prep for this class.

Go to P2L, rewatch the lectures. Easier than 2100 by far, but still have your work cut out for you

She offers close to 1.5% of extra credit

Lectures were cool but make sure you study what is on the powerpoint (beyond just what she says). Textbook is useless once you get to evolution, but crash course is great! Study the details to the extreme for this class.
She's nice but her tests were actually ridiculous. Every single question was her trying to trick you with wording. I could have recited everything from her slides and still received a C on the test.

Dr. Manson is a great person and professor, and she cares deeply about her students. I think many are upset because the material seems memorization/easy at first. Dr. Manson will test you on connecting and applying. So go to lecture and office hours, you'll do well, she will help you! Also she deserves more respect..

Professor Manson's lectures are engaging and she has many office hours for help outside class. Her exams can be difficult and questions are often very specific. However, all information is given in lecture. When taking exams, check every answer choice for something incorrect. She does genuinely want to help students.

professor manson is extremely nice and her lectures are pretty engaging but her tests are so convoluted and not super based on class material which is extremely frustrating for a student. I for one studied for her tests extremely hard and knew her lectures better than anything and still received C's on the exams due to the poor question selection.

Professor Manson seems nice, but she focuses many of her lectures on examples from her research and on things she is interested in. Her tests are very difficult, every question is trying to trip you up. I studied an immense amount for these exams and still felt unprepared. Read the textbook and go to lecture.

This class was nice because lectures had info on the slides, but you need to work to study for tests. There was a lot of weird wording that was confusing on exams that had to go back and be fixed. But if you can learn the lectures well you'll be fine.

Manson is kind of the worst. She has an obsession with plants and that's basically all you learn about. There are like a thousand vocabulary words you will need to know regarding plants and other things. Topics are super dense and impossible to remember. Tests are insane. Lectures put you to sleep unless you, like her, have a plant fetish.
Honestly, what she tests you on isn't explicitly what's in her lecture. Cool professor though.
Manson gives a pretty good lecture and puts words on her slides, which is appreciated. Never went to her office hours since I didn't think it would be worth it, but overall pretty decent professor.

Professor Manson is very bad professor who does not seem to care about the success of her students. Her lectures are unclear and she does not take the time to answer questions. I often read the textbook prior to class and prepared heavily for tests yet the questions were often confusing and unclear in how they were written.

I thought Prof. Manson was about on par with Kittlesen (the other intro bio professor) in terms of test difficulty but her lectures were easier to follow. This class is about as much based on memorization as it is on application, so Quizlet is your friend. If you keep up with the (admittedly heavy) readings the class is fairly straightforward.

Not the best prof. Record her lectures and take notes very carefully. Know everything she says in class in detail to the bare bone. I kid you not, there were questions on her exam that I thought she introduced in class "just for fun". Since the exams are filled with ambiguous questions, going to exam review afterwards can sometimes earn pts back.

She is easily one of the best professors I have ever had. She genuinely cares that students do well; office hours are extremely helpful and she gives credit where credit is due. Not everybody likes the focus of her class, but it prepares you extremely well for upper-level courses. Test-heavy grades, but you learn so much.

Despite her haphazard passion for BIOL 2200, Manson fails at engaging students. Her class is extremely plant focused, speeding through the human anatomy, and swooning over her love for all plants. Nonetheless, her style and Canadian butchering of English words is bearable if you're a good test taker. Tests are 80%.

She is an amazing professor and is so excited when she teacher Biology. She is funny most of the time, and always makes the lectures interesting. She is a real gem. She is always available to talk and is the best Biology teacher I had here at UVA.

BIOL 3450.comment: Prof. Manson lectures like a storyteller, which connects the content of each lecture into an engaging, coherent takeaway. Her enthusiasm for biology is contagious. She cares about her students understanding the topic more than she values busy work or unnecessarily hard grades. 2200 was hard, but this upper level class is easy and fun!

This class is horrible! she doesn't know what she is talking about most of the time...She puts pictures on the slides and just names the animal.  Her exams are hard and she doesn't fulfill her duties as a teacher.

Enthusiastic teacher--one of the better lecturers I've had at UVa. However, I have to agree with other reviews that her tests are ridiculous. The material seems so easy (sometimes to the point of boredom) in class, but she asks a lot more on the tests. Some people "get" them, others don't. I couldn't get higher than a C on tests.

BIOL 4130.comment: I took population ecology with her and loved it! It seems that people are kind of 50/50 about her when she's teaching intro bio, but I would definitely recommend her for upper level bio classes. When she's teaching about things she loves, she's super engaging and friendly and takes the time to make sure you understand tougher concepts.

PHYS 2020.comment: She's very caring and clearly wants students to succeed. Ask questions and take advantage of office hours, and you'll do fine.

He does a great job at explaining the concepts and really cares that his students are absorbing the material. The homework is not relevant to the tests, so prepare from the regular quizzes. He curves the overall grade. The tests and quizzes are graded on selecting the correct answer but you get points for every wrong answer eliminated.

This man is extremely kind and he seems to care, but honestly I don't see why he has such amazing reviews. His lectures are not helpful and unclear. He speaks at a lightning pace.I would choose to skip class everyday almost except there are clicker questions that count as part of your grade, therefore, I attend.

Professor Hirosky is not an amazing professor. He goes pretty quickly in class and you barely have time to write anything down before he is on to the next topic. I essentially learned the material through the textbook. Tests can be tricky, but I tended to do fine just by using the textbook and the posted slides.

Well let me tell yall about the time he stared at his powerpoint for a solid 5 minutes and didn't understand what was happening. You literally just have to go for the clicker questions but even then it is a torture to wake up and have to sit through lecture for an hour and 15 minutes just to come out even more confused. Escape while you can.

CS 6161.comment: Let me tell all of you what happened in his research group: UVA CS department will sponsor all PhD students during the first year, and the advisor needs to sponsor after that. This guy admitted 6 students and kicked out 4 of them after the first year, and he always does so. In thosrt, just AVOID and ESCAPE!!

Professor Wang is friendly and approachable, but he is a terrible, terrible lecturer. Not only does he use someone else's slides (which were poorly written to begin with), but also he just reads them in a deeply depressing voice without offering any additional insights. His homework and exams are on the more difficult side too for an algo class.

PHYS 2415.comment: Professor Yoshida does a wonderful job at providing real-world intuition behind abstract concepts in Physics. While PHYS 2415 is a tough class, his demos and lectures are very worthwhile.

Alright professor. Most learning came from books and not the lectures. Professor is nice and does want you to get a good grade in his class, however I believe his lectures could be better paced as it often felt like there was no time to take notes as we went one slide to the other. Provides good resources on canvas too.

Not that big into physics, especially E&M, but Chatterjee is the man to take if you're going through PHYS 2415. Pretty funny guy and cares a lot about his students. He repeats over and over that everything is going to be fine, even when people are struggling a bit (a lot) in the course. Everything turned out fine in the end - surprisingly got an A.

I really enjoyed taking this class with Prof. Chatterjee. Yes, the lectures in Physics 2 can be very information heavy but Dr. Chatterjee is very accessible outside of class and is very devoted to making sure his students understand concepts both within and outside of class.

Professor Jones puts his students first. The material covered by this course definitely is not easy, but Prof. Jones' lectures are engaging and he is always flexible to help students outside of class. Definitely go to office hours when you don't understand or need help on a homework problem. He is great at explaining.
Prof. Schauss was okay. Very monotone lectures that didn't really help you learn. You ended up mostly teaching yourself from the book. Office hours were somewhat helpful.

Under no circumstances would I recommend taking 2415 with this professor. Trying to learn physics from him is like trying to go to space in a Honda Civic. I sit in class, pay attention and leave dumber than when I walked in. I can't begin to express how frustrating it is to go from enjoying physics to taking this sorry excuse for a class.
This class is very useless in general but you gotta go to class to get the clicker questions. Try to take at community college/online if you can.

MESA 2559.comment: This class has been really great. The books we've read are interesting, and Marie is good at picking-up common themes amongst them. She is also a very fair grader and is very helpful when it comes to writing papers for the Second Writing Requirement. However, enthusiasm is a must for this class, or you will probably hate it.
Marie is a very nice, helpful person. She does not assign too much work and keeps discussions very interesting and engaging.
Marie is a really cool professor. She doesn't give a lot of work, keeps the reading reasonable, and is really nice. Usually in the English department but offered class in MESA this semester.

Professor Omar is awesome. I learned SO MUCH in this class. She knows what she's talking about and is passionate about the subject! There is no exam and mainly your grade consists of 3 short papers, a book report, and discussion. She's not too tough of a grader but you should attend class for a discussion grade. She takes attendance daily.

intimidating at first, but once you get to know him, he is fantastic. he does put you on the spot to see if you have done the work and if you can defend your opinions, but he is always open to discussion. he's friendly, personable, and very funny. extremely knowledgeable about many subjects.

MATH 3350.comment: Had him in Fall 24 for 9B-- Nice guy and willing to help any time with questions or any clarifications you may need.

UCR student here. Filippo is a super nice guy; lecture attendance is optional. Just do your work, and go to his office hours. I'm not even good at math, and I ended with a 98% in Filippo's MATH 009B. He's very smart, and tries to show alternate explanations toward solving problems. He's very easy to approach, and always able to answer questions.

Math009B at UCR, scored well above the median on both midterm and final but forgot how much weight he puts into his homework filled with typos and content that he just never taught in lecture, 60% average in homework. Only take if you have premium ChatGPT to do the homework. Still processing how the homework brought down my grade.

I am currently taking Math009B and I feel that he doesn't teach well at all. You mostly need to do your self-study. The webwork homework problems ARE FRUSTRATING as half of those problems were not addressed during class. This class becomes an unnecessary load by the end of the quarter. He is a caring person otherwise but refrain from taking him.
Strict grading with respect to assignments that are beyond the teaching syllabus. Mandatory group projects are useless and better if working on these alone.

BIO 3010.comment: The 40 questions in 50 minutes of it all was crazy, I couldn't manage completing it on time without submitting several guesses. I can't understand how the class averages were so good, HAD to be some quizlets involved. I can't articulate what my problem with the content was - the volume, the specificity, the poor lecturing - probably a combo of all.

The only grade is tests. They are open note, 25 questions, and you have 2 hours to take them. Couple questions are straight up unfair. Hence why the averages would be an 80. I rewatched every lecture recording until my notes were a transcript of his lectures and still couldnt get an A. You can do fine with hard work, but getting an A is just luck.

BIOL 3010.comment: Lecture and test heavy class (only graded on midterms). Go to the lecture for the content or watch on Zoom (attendance not recorded) but slides on their own aren't enough. My tests were online and open note but timed and I found the questions not straightforward at all. No curve, but Parichy gives credit back for wrongly graded questions.

Pretty confused by the negative reviews, Dave was very organized and clear with all of his lectures. The class wasn't easy by any means, but as a non-bio major I was able to come away with an A- by keeping detailed notes and rewatching lectures before each exam. Everything you need to know is in lecture and on the slides -don't bother with the book

The worst professor I've ever had. Orgo was easier than taking one of his exams. I honestly recommend not taking this class if you can avoid it. I honestly hope they kick him out because his exams were poorly designed and seemed like he made them last minute because he would always have problems with it and email us about it.

He won't respond to emails. His exams include answer choices that are ambiguous like "some of the above". Some of his questions don't correlate to what he taught in lecture. Doesn't give you anything to study from besides some useless study questions. He'll email you during the exam and tell you there are problems with questions. Honestly the worst

Dr. Parichy is a great lecturer and makes a lot of references to his own research during his lectures. I really enjoyed having him as a professor this semester. He was very detail oriented in lectures and on exams, but studying hard and paying close attention will ensure success!

Parichy is extremely knowledgeable in genetics but his lectures are difficult to follow, and his exams often require specific details from examples in class. The textbook barely followed the course material and was not much help. The study questions he provided as exam prep were not very useful either. Avoid unless your major requires his class.

Seems a bit sick/tired so please go easy on her for that. The main issue is that she's not a good teacher. She talks like she's describing a picture in text-to-speech. She's not explaining what's happening. If you read the book, you already know the content so you're fine. But if it's your first time hearing the information in lecture, good luck.

Guler is not good at communicating and really just throws material at us to understand on our own. He does have an accent but that's not the problem, it feels like he mumbles half the time. Genetics would be so much easier if the professors really taught the course better here. But be prepared to do the majority of studying on your own.
A good and caring professors proudness must be interaction with his/her students not the asking out of context questions.

Genetics is not an easy class; it has a lot of busy work, which means you will ALWAYS have some sort of work to do, and the exams are extremely difficult, mainly because there's no partial credit. CC is a really entertaining professor who cares about her students but you should read the textbook and do practice problems and you'll do fine.

Genetics is hard. You biology majors have to take it. The memorization portion of the class isn't that daunting; it's the ability to integrate the endless amount of concepts learned throughout the course (and discussion sections) that is the real challenge. BUY THE SOLUTIONS MANUAL. DO THE HOMEWORK. AND EMAIL HER REGULARLY. You'll thank me later.

horrible teacher. condescending and belittles student answers. takes an interesting subject and makes you hate it by the end of the course. tests are manageable but completely out of left field. Like in lecture, she asks questions, she expects answers on the tests that cover material she fails at covering herself. too bad u need it for the major.

Professor Cronmiller was great!  The class is hard but doable if you stay on track with reading/practice problems, and she really tries to make it fun!  Even did a self-written "genetics rap" for our class!

Tests are impossible, huge curve at the end, discussion session helps your grade, but not your comprehension of the test material. Worst professor I've had, take Wormington instead. Avoid this abomination of a class and teach yourself genetics without the pressure! There is no support in this class...Lectures/ Office hrs./TA's not helpful.

Tests were nearly impossible and the questions were sometimes pretty ambiguous even if you understood the material. Everything is curved pretty well at the end of the semester though. VERY approachable outside of class.

This professor is one of the worst I've had. She does not explain the material, and going to lecture to listen to her ramble about topics not on the test is almost useless. The tests are extremely difficult and she does not give partial credit in most cases. Do not take this class unless you have to!

PHYS 1420.comment: Baessler is not the best lecturer-he is are hard to follow that no one takes notes. But, he is a very generous grader and wants the best for his students. I recommend asking questions for better understanding. However, he can a be a bit condescending  when answering questions. Overall, read the textbook, attend class for exposure, and study.

Professor Yagi was great, but the lectures were pretty slow/more focussed on derivations than on what was asked during midterms/final. The final/midterms were to a large part multiple choice questions, which made them very tricky, and there was a lot of weekly homework. But he is always open for questions during class and office hours.

PHYS 1720.comment: Pretty fly for a white guy. Ask him about his time in the war. Nice guy, means well, not a great lecturer... Seriously, I go to class like once a week because it's not very helpful, it's early in the morning, and and he doesn't mind.  However, he is very helpful one on one, so if you ever have trouble, office hours are great.

PHYS 2620.comment: Very unclear, hardly ever finished the point the was making in a clearconcise manner. He was so inaudible (mostly while writing) the first few weeks that he had to get a mike to be heard. I got little out of class time. He posts all his notes online though, which are pretty good information sources.

Arnold is a really nice guy; modern in itself is a very challenging class, and the tests are brutal with medians typically not rising above F's, but there's a huge curve at the end of the class so that just about everyone leaves with at least a C. Stay on top of the homework and you'll do fine.

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS. The homework is very easy but it does not prepare you for his tests. He does provide chapter questions with answers but once again they are useless because they do not prepare you for the tests. I am learning nothing in this class. Huge mistake taking it. The text book is one of the worse modern physics textbooks I have used

MUEN 3620.comment: Very fun, chill, and caring. I always looked forward to class!!!

GERM 2010.comment: Cares for her students and makes learning a new language as stress-free as possible. Tells you exactly what's gonna be on the tests, which are fairly easy if you do some studying. I really enjoyed her as a professor and highly recommend taking her. What's a little annoying is you need 3 online textbooks, but that's just how the class is structured.

ENGL 3610.comment: Professor Levenson is a great lecturer, and I really enjoyed the course material! I feel like I've learned a lot.

Levenson is a great lecturer and deep thinker. The class is built around reading global literature and discussing it. The grade will come very easily, so focus on enjoying the class and getting as much out of it as you can. The exams and assignments are easy. The subjects discussed are not! Levenson is a must-take prof at UVA.

ENGL 3820.comment: Levenson is the best professor I've ever had - everyone needs to take a class with him
Take this class. I don't care if you're a commerce major or philosophy major. Don't graduate without taking this course. The lectures are amazing.

Levenson is so good it's difficult to describe him with anything other than platitudes. He's the man that turns business students into English majors. Lectures are actually fulfilling to some long starved center of the human soul.
One of the best professors at UVA. His lectures are incredible.

One of the best professors in UVA's much-famed English department - and that's saying something. Extremely well read, outgoing, funny, and brilliant. I noticed that he would be mid-sentence in seminar, but if he saw a hand of a student, would stop and call on them. Take a class with him before he retires. I bet you'll love it.

VERY difficult to understand in lecture -- would express incomplete thoughts that trailed off into confusion for the students.  Did nothing to help my understanding of the works we read, and I'm a dedicated and interested reader.

This man's mumblings make his lectures practically incomprehensible. If you are able to follow what he says, he has interesting insights into the texts. 382 focused a lot more on history than I would have liked and there was a ton of reading with under 70% covered in class. His outfits are the best though, especially the red pants!

Pretentious, obnoxious, condescending. Impossible to understand in lecture because he mumbles and his vocabulary is so overreaching that you haft to sift through all the fluff and fodder to understand what he's saying. Also, in a paper prompt he called it egotistical or foolhardy to want to pick your own paper topic. Avoid avoid avoid
A majority of the class nicknamed him "Mr. Mumbles." Enough said. Even when he does talk, it takes a dictionary and a translator to understand what information he's actually trying to relay.

Booth was dreadfully boring, at least for 3820. Her lectures were full of useless information regarding publication and biological information about authors, and she spent very little time discussing the readings which were covered on the exams.

ENGL 3830.comment: Levenson is the best lecturer I've ever had, bar none, in addition to being one of the nicest. 'Inspirational' gets thrown around a lot, but it really applies to him. His enthusiasm for the material (and Joyce in particular) is pathogenic.

Easily the best lecturer at UVA. Basically every sentence to come out of his mouth was something profound and poetic that would probably get hella notes on tumblr. His reading assignments are about half what you would expecthalf not, but in a good way. When I wanted to switch majors, he was the one who made me want to stay w English
Fantastic instructor who gives his all to each and every lecture. His infectious love of literature really shines.

I've had Megan for an ENLT and as a TA for ENGL 383 and she was PHENOMENAL in both settings. She expects quality work and thought, but is totally fair in grading and bends over backwards to be helpful and accommodate your schedule. Any chance you get to learn with her should be taken!
One of the most instructive and passionate T.A.'s I've ever had.

Had him as a lecturer for both this course and CPLT 2020. While he's enthusiastic about the material and capable of delivering beneficial insight, Cantor often focuses far too intently on cramming in page references (which are relevant, given his exam style). He has a tendency to drone on, but there are worse English professors.
Cantor was a a fun lecturer and always made good points on the works we read. I recommend him and Luftig if you need to take 3830!
Hands down the best TA I've ever had.

EVSC 2010.comment: dismissive of student ideas, assigned mostly her own work, more interested in gatekeeping the environmental field than encouraging students to go into it and learn alongside her. well covered important environmental policy changes but otherwise ineffective to train and inspire future environmental activists

Whew. As previously stated, Thomson is clearly a genius. She also has a soothing NPR voice that knocks out a quater of the class immediately (which is funny). Her reading demands are ludicrous, with upwards of 120+ pages PER WEEK. She grades her discussion sections on a bell curve, which lowers the quality. She is unclear and unhelpful. BOOO

Prof Kelly was an engaging speaker and I liked his lectures a lot, but you absolutely have to read the textbook - this class has a lot of reading quizzes, and he often took questions directly from the book. Overall, great class that I'd recommend to anyone (even if the topic doesn't seem that interesting to you at first)

Professor Kelly gave good and engaging lectures, and was pretty funny. He spent a lot of time focusing on topics which were particularly confusing, which made the whole class easier to understand. Tests were extremely difficult, however.

Shiflet is the man! Although his lectures can get boring, you get more out of it the more you put into the class. 3 non-cumulative midterms were easy if you do the readings and look over the powerpoint. You can study for the exams the day before and do fine. Take it if you need a gut class!
Awesome professor! Definitely take this class! He is really nice and knows a lot! He keeps it interesting and keeps the reading light. TAKE THIS CLASS!!

Classes are kind of boring but you get 10 extra points on your final grade for going. It is an easy A if you study for the 3 exams you have. Exams are not that difficult and are not commutative. Professor Shiflet is extremely helpful and nice. The class is very easy for a science class.

WORST PROFESSOR EVER!!! Goes off on tangents that have no relation to the class.  You will be studying for the exams  noticing that you covered only half of the material in the lecture.  If it weren't for the extra credit points rewarded for attending the class, I would not waste a single minute in his lecture.  Good Class, sorry professor

PLAP 3500.comment: Literally so much reading. Have never had to print so many things in my god damn life. And she actively doesn't understand any of the science we talk about, but won't let the climate science professor who coteaches explain anything to us. Honestly a terrible professor.
Do not take a class with Professor Lawless.

Took one class with Prof. Lawless's which was a disaster. She was combative, condescending, and dismissive to students and her co-professor. Exams emphasized irrelevant trivia over substance, and the poorly designed final project was harshly graded without feedback. Avoid poorly taught, and frustrating courses with Lawless—not worth your time.

Lawless is extremely unapproachable and judgemental towards students, she frequently acts defensive in class and through email and is not receptive to critique and questions. There is very little room for dialogue with her, creating a discouraging classroom environment. Quizzes and exams are very picky and are excessively difficult to study for.

Do not take this class. Lawless is extremely knowledgeable in her field, but is a terrible teacher. She is intentionally trying to trip you up. The exams ask you about THE MOST SPECIFIC stuff that they said as an afterthought during lectures. Readings dense & lengthy. Lawless strict & thinks she knows everything. Learned a lot but not worth my time

Professor Lawless is the best professor I have ever had at UVA and I loved this class.  The quizzes were very detailed but open-note/unlimited time, so not too hard. Every lecture was very engaging and I loved the guest speakers.  Professor Lawless always made time to meet outside of class to go over questions and she was always very kind/helpful

Avoid taking a class with Professor Lawless if you can. She's rude, unapproachable, and lacks any semblance of warmth or understanding toward her students. Her multiple-choice questions are infuriatingly subjective and designed to trip you up. Overall, she's not nice, and the learning environment she creates is discouraging at best.

Worst professor I've ever had. Always speaks of how she ran for Congress and lost, to the point where she added a question on our closed-note midterm asking which state she ran for Congress in. Brings in amazing guest speakers then asks other useless test questions such as whether they studied abroad or not. Would not recommend.

Professor Lawless is knowledgeable about politics but weaponizes her knowledge. She acts like she knows everything and expects that everyone in her class is a political junkie as well. I never write reviews but honestly, her classes are insufferable. The tests consist of the most specific details in the whole world. I DO NOT RECOMMEND.

Lawless is indicative of the larger problem with the politics department at UVA and its divestment from legal-centric courses. Tests are needlessly specific and material is unfocused, centering around her expensive book that reads at an 8th grade level and extended anecdotes. Not surprising that she was unsuccessful in her Congressional bid.

She expects you to remember every graph and picture she has shown in class as well as every anecdote and will test you one it a month and half later. She has quizzes almost every class as well as outside participation but it is the tests that are the worst. She is a great lecturer but her tests are brutal and so specific that its ridiculous.

Professor Potter is great, she is a great resource and very approachable. However, I would not take her again. Some political science professors are obsessed with having students write research papers like an eng lit class, she is one of them. Having us do actual research and presentations is what I signed up to do- not write literature reviews.

lectures are clear and organized, so are the readings. quiz before every class is overkill. everything is graded by the TAs who all have different guidelines. spent way more time decoding what the TAs wanted from the exams than I did going to lecture or reading. TAs handed out bad grades when there was obvious confusion and poor expectations

Prof Cary is very kind & willing to listen to students. Problem with this class was her co-professor. Wish Cary had stepped in more to voice her opinions & knowledge and had added more of her choice of readings & exam questions. Class wasn't really dually taught - but I can imagine Cary's classes by herself would be awesome. (Don't take this one)

EVSC 2030.comment: Lectures were soooo boring, she speaks very slowly, reads her notes and just repeats things from the reading. TONS of reading assigned each weak with uninteresting, unnecessary repetitive information. Made us do sing alongs in class. Tests were hard. Never got my final paper or final back so who knows how I got graded.

And oh yeah, she'll tell you about 25 times how she was a Fulbright professor. How wonderful; it makes sense considering Europe's affection for unsustainable spending/following illegitimate ideologues/lack of logic. Also, take all her personal writings with a grain of salt (or several) because they mislead more than the other literatureshe espouses

Everyone on here who says she's a "genius" is clearly not qualified to make that claim. She is one of the most biased professors (or teachers)for that matter I've ever had and every reading/lecture felt like two hours of senseless EPA indoctrination by one of the most far-left leaning people on Grounds. Highly NOT recommended. Quite unprofessional

I agree with all the other ratings that say there is a lot of reading for a 200 level class.  But Professor Thomson is absolutely an amazing teacher.  She is well over qualified for what she teaches and is one of the smartest people at UVA.  She cares about what she teaches and as long as you give her respect she will help you with your grade!

This is one of the worst classes taught at UVA. The reading is absolutely boring, and there is so much of it that you won't have time to take it. She is the advisor for the Environmental Thought and Practice Major. So, unless you plant to major in THAT, DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS

PLAP 2030.comment: The class requires extensive reading but it is very easy to do well in. She has a very generous curve and is willing to work with you to improve from the first exam to the second. Highly recommend.

This is your sign to become an ETP major. PLEASE do ETP as your second major you will not regret it I promise! Professor Freedman is literally one of the most thoughtful and caring professors at UVA. You will learn so much from him! Very energetic and upbeat - makes my day going to his class. Quizzes in class are reasonably fair and open note.

EVSC 4810.comment: Prof. Thompson is by far the least helpful professor I have ever had in 4 years of college.  She is completely unapproachable and unwilling to help students or clarify ANYTHING.  I went to her office hours often and each and every time she made me feel like an inconvenience and a bother.  Sheis the sole reason I decided against the ETP major.

PHIL 3800.comment:
Professor Barnes is the best professor I've had. Topics covered in her Feminist Philosophy (2024 spring) are fascinating. She explains everything very clearly and passionately.

Topics like epistemic injustice are still constantly in my mind as a grad student in poli sci. I regret not knowing her earlier (+ wrongly recognizing Thistle as "Fissle")!

If you never took a philosophy class before, this is not the one for you. The lectures are more discussion based and a lot of redundant examples which are unhelpful for developing clear structures and logic regarding class content. The grading is unclear as well and very subjective. She is a very nice person but not the most effective teacher.

PHIL 2640.comment: Barnes is pretty chill. She dresses like she's a Harry Potter character and has the cutest dog that she brought to 8ams. Her lectures were never too boring, but also not extremely interesting. As someone who is good at writing papers, I still had to work to get an A. Grading is determined by TA's for her classes, so make sure to attend discussion.

I enrolled in an 8-am to take a class with Professor Barnes, and I would do it all over it again. Her lectures were engaging, the assigned readings were easy to read, and the papers were short and straightforward. She's very personable and assigns a pretty light workload.
Nice person, definitely cares about her students' success. Spends a bit too much time with examples (which may be good for some people), but I would much prefer that she go more in depth.

I took her Lectures during Covid19, so the format might be different when we resume in person. She is a really sweet person who is always excited to teach. Her class was interesting and you can tell she just loves her job, which always makes a class infinitely better. We had to write two papers in this class and read 15 pg papers for homework.

PHIL 2500.comment: She is a great professor who cares passionately about her course material and, even more-so, her students. She is very accessible to out side of class to help with papers and often it will pay off to ask for her advice. Writing philosophy papers is quite different than your run of the mill college essay.
A life changing class. It shows me the way to learn about philosophy of mind and inspires me to pursue philosophy major.
I had Tony for this ethics class and he made the class really fun, and helped us understand the material even when lectures didn't. I'm taking him again for sure!

Galen was an awesome T.A! I was in his history of modern philosophy section, and he did a noticeably better job at explaining the tough concepts brought to bear in Hume, Kant, Descartes, and Berkeley than the main professor. He truly had those highly complex lines of philosophical reasoning NAILED DOWN, and was great at explaining them. Take him!

HIEA 2011.comment: Ellen Zhang is clearly an expert in Chinese history and is very passionate! Only take her class if you are GENUINELY interested in Chinese history. Readings aren't too crazy long, but the daily quizzes are dependent upon them. If you had to save time for daily quizzes, the most important text is the sourcebook. Visit office hours for the papers.

Her lectures are pretty boring and put most students to sleep. For the most part, it's an easy class and she's a pretty easy teacher. The only thing that really surprised me was her grading on the papers. She was very particular about certain things that  was not specified and marked you down for it and her prompts were very broad.

HIEA 1501.comment: It was an elective class that was treated as more; expectations were way too high. The readings are meh, the classes are LONG and mostly boring with the typical fake discussions in class for a grade.I spent anywhere from 3-10 hours per week. I never got feedback on stuff, it felt more like a major specific class. It was frustrating but doable, 2/10
Was very helpful and willing to discuss problems with students. Work level was fair. Some of the readings were boring but overall it was a good class to gain a broad understanding of Chinese culture.

Unlike many English teachers, Stolz is very encouraging when students share their interpretations, even if they are not on the mark. We spent most classes slowly working through the text that was assigned for homework, which was an excellent way to learn if you didn't understand at first. He loves what he teaches and knows the material inside out.

Prof Marcon is a great guy. Has an accent that some probably find hard to understand but I got used to it. There was also a lot of reading(like 400 pgs some weeks) but some people can probably get by just skimming it. he will sometimes make funny comments that keep the class interesting and made sure to be open for lots of office hours if needed.

HIST 3111.comment: Nice teacher, but the lecture are kind of boring. A lot of things are dragged out. However, she is a great teacher and a very kind person. I still like this class. It was a very relaxing class. Recommended!

GSVS 4100.comment: As a first year who took GSVS 4020, I didn't find the class challenging. The whole semester is dependent upon a group project, so be a good team player. Class could get very boring at times, though. Spencer replies fast to emails and if you ask questions about your project, he'll stop everything to help you. He is super sweet and funny!

I enjoyed the class topics and projects. He was attentive to emails and explained things. He did seem to be a harsh grader at times, but overall, he had interesting topics. I particularly wouldn't retake this, but I did appreciate the feedback.

GSVS 2150.comment: Replys fast to emails and is always willing to listen. The class is on the challenging side but very informative. I will be taking future courses with him.

ARCH 2150.comment: Even if you're a good student and genuinely confused, he'll still give you a passive aggressive response. Extensions aren't a thing either. You could do everything correctly and still not get a good score. It's an interesting class but not worth the hassle.

ENGL 1500.comment: This has been my favorite course at UVA so far. I read many Norse texts that I found interesting and it sparked my interest in Old English and Old Norse history, myth, and language. It was relaxed and the work wasn't too much, so it fit into my schedule nicely. I loved this class and I would absolutely take it again.
Truly a brilliant lecturer. This class changed my entire perspective on Western Lit. He likes to apply ideas from reading to happenings on Grounds, which is always very interesting.

For a 1000 level class "designed for non English majors" this class had more work than a 2nd writing requirement and an inhumane amount of reading, 200 pages and a short essay due on a Sun night and assigned Fri night was a common thing. Tucker has no sympathy for students and doesn't respect medical notes from CAPS. Lectures boring and pointless.

Professor Kinney is an incredibly intelligent woman and I enjoyed her class even if there were times that I felt it dragged on a little bit -- if you love English, though, you should definitely consider taking one of her classes.
Gothic Lit. I really enjoy Booth's class. The projects are fun and the papers are short. More than just literary analysis. Reading is manageable. I would definitely take another class with her.

ENGL 3010.comment: Easily one of the best classes I've had at UVA. Before, I had zero interest in this topic, but Prof. Hopkins was so engaging and made the material fascinating. The class structure and assignments were great, especially the open-ended projects and final presentation. And he is always happy to talk to students before class or in office hours.

DANC 3400.comment: Unreasonably harsh grading. I had a 97 but got an A- because of nitpicking on citations in a dance class. Expectations changed last minute, and the final was graded like a research seminar. Rigid, unforgiving, and disconnected from the course's actual focus.

DANC 1440.comment: Do not be fooled by this 1000 level Drama class. This professor makes you work and I would only recommend this class for people serious about the Dance minor. The few assignments we have are graded strictly and seriously for both content and form. Quite often, homework would consist of a 10+ page reading and a 30+ minute long dance piece.

MATH 3310.comment: He teaches straight out of the textbook and is very hard to understand. Lectures are usually fast paced and complicated, and he often misunderstands students' questions. That said, he is a great person - at his office hours he is happy to explain anything, including the homework. But the tests were too hard for me to take a class with him again.

Professor Kuhn is really inspirational and let you visualize. Although he is not really strict about proofs, he actually gives you a very good intuition about analysis, which is significant for following studies in math.

I really didn't think Ramirez was that bad.  No, he's not a great professor, but he could be a lot worse.  He's teaching a really boring topic, so of course his lectures are boring.  His tests are pretty straightforward though, and the homework isn't required.  Ended up with a B+ because I didn't take the final seriously.  Lots of memorization.

MATH 3100.comment: Boring lessons with not a lot of insight, he is liked because he is an easy grader. UVA statistics in general is subpar

Terrible teacher. Has done problems incorrectly multiple times and has had to be corrected by students over and over again. He does not have a good grasp on the probability he is teaching. Also tests on things like definitions as opposed to making you apply the definitions to problems. Overall terrible class if you are interested in learning prob

You don't need to work hard if you attend his lectures. We had about 35 students in our class, but only about 10 would ever show up, I being one of the 25 that rarely showed up. He makes sure that the class understands the material, though, which is a big perk of signing up for his class. Not hard to get an A, but you can't slack off and expect it.
Professor Do is a great professor who has optional attendance. However, not attending may make you fail and only a small majority of my class attended lectures.

Professor Sy is very patient and understanding. He is easily accessible outside of class, with many times he even set up appointment with me the next day right away. He prepared us well for the exams by giving us class time do to the practice problems, and go over it with us. He gives homework every two weeks, but they're long so pace yourself.

Nice guy with a sharp sense of humor. Nevertheless, I often found that the textbook was far more interesting and easier to understand than the lectures themselves. The concepts aren't too difficult to comprehend, but it's mostly up to you to figure them out on your own. Exams are pretty tough, but the only way to fail is to leave questions blank.

Funny guy, but lectures are so dry and plain that it is hard to comprehend even the most basic concepts in the class. As long as you do the homework and do "well" on the quizzes (you either get a 100% or a 0%), you'll be okay. Tests are much more harder than homework problems and trying to prepare is even tougher.

Arone is the best math professor I've ever had. His accent is goofy but more endearing than frustrating. He truly cares about helping students understand and will go back and teach a topic in an entirely new way if you ask a question. Always very available with office hours/email. The class was difficult and fast-paced, but doable and interesting.

Material covered was sufficient, but far from complete. The course lacked examples that could have elucidated the concepts better. Most examples were just pulled from the text. Exam and quiz difficulty was not commensurate with the in-class material. Substantial self-study was required. The class presentation lacked formalism.

He definitely knows the subject matter and can teach by giving clear examples. But his class is not really challenging at first. The problems on textbook and Webwork is much harder than the class example. However, the exam was not too bad though... You need to understand the textbook to do the webwork problems sometime for this class.

STAT 2101.comment: DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS. Holt is a nice guy but doesn't teach you anything. the quizzes and homeworks are easy because you can use excel but you get screwed over on the midterm and final because you can't have a computer.

COMM 3420.comment: This class is 100% tests. Moore is fantastic, hilarious, engaging, you'll learn a lot. CL2 is definitely harder than CL1. My section's final was hard for no reason and she put stuff on there I'm positive she never taught us, so that was a bummer. You must attend every class or get the notes from someone else. The whole class is lectures & tests.

Wheeler is the greatest professor at this University. The class is almost exactly like Comm Law I. It talks more about property law which personally I liked Comm Law I better. But Wheeler still makes the class a lot of fun and interesting. Pretty easy, just follow the lecture notes that he sends out for exams.

COMM 3410.comment: PHENOMENAL class. No reading/HW, literally just go to lecture and take notes - she will literally tell you what to write down. Content is fascinating, she is HILARIOUS. An A is hard b/c of weighting but put in the work. You get cheat sheets for the tests even though they're hand-written. Sherri is accomplished, knowledgeable, and SO engaging.

Professor Moore's COMM 3410 is one of the classes that you will tell your children about. She is passionate and truly cares for her students' success. There are no readings and no work outside of lecture, other than studying for exams. Her exams are multiple choice and her grading system is very fair. I recommend this class to everyone.

This class was hard - yes. You have to put in the effort. Prioritize taking notes on what she teaches in class. Study for the weekly quizzes. I did not get an A but I still enjoyed it. Professor Moore is a very compelling lecturer. She is a good professor and she deserves the praise - she is also a genuinely nice human being.

Professor Moore's class is probably the most overrated at UVA. If you are looking for an easy class, thi is not for you. You are graded on very few things. a 40% final which is cumulatitive and the hardest exam ever. 2/10 recommend
The class material can get slow at times but this class made learning the law fun and interesting! Professor Moore is also such a wonderful lecturer and person.

Sherri has been doing this for a long time and knows what shes doing. She is a very dynamic lecturer and makes going to class fun. Be prepared to take notes fast because she can talk quickly, but her exams are always straightforward. An A might be hard to achieve, but an A- is very doable.
Overall great teacher. Note-taking in her class Comm Law 1 is a grind but there is zero reading or anything outside of the class. Genuinely a great and interesting person as well.

Sherri is the greatest professor I have had. She makes Law interesting and applicable to a students life. The class is not difficult and you do not need to get the book. Go to lecture and pay attention and you will get a good grade in the class.

Professor Moore is very friendly and a good Professor. You really need to be able to apply the concepts to real situations if you want to get an A on her tests. I know that sounds simple, but she makes you work for it.

No longer an easy A but attend lecture, take it somewhat seriously and you're golden. You'll start to love Pr Moore and subconsciously work to not let her down. The material is sometimes dense but honestly everyone should take this course (lots of information about leases, contracts, your rights as an individual). Weekly quiz, extra fred, 3 exams.

To students who will take it in the future: this class is no longer an easy A class! You may find that from 2011-2012, people were saying that this class was very easy as long as you listen to her and take good notes...But, it is definitely not easy anymore! The test questions are tricky, and you have to have some background knowledge!!!

Great Professor, tries hard to make law relevant and interesting to students and is incredibly helpful during office hours. Students can use up to two pages of notes on the midterm and final, and almost all the material is covered well lecture. Tests are relatively easy as well. She uses clickers a lot though, so attendance is required.

Amazing interesting and funny teacher. I came in expecting commercial law to be bored but her class made me like the material so much. Her tests are open note so as long as you took really good notes and paid attention in class you'll get a A!

Prof Moore is awesome! Her Comm Law class is always interesting and definitely useful in the real world. She is very approachable and helpful. Reading from the textbook isn't necessary as long as you understand your class notes. Definitely recommend this class!!!

Great teacher who is very friendly and approachable. She makes the class interesting and you learn very valuable real-world lessons. Reading was usually unnecessary as long as you took notes and paid attention in class.

Wheeler is a great professor and really loves teaching law. He only uses the board to lecture from, but he uses a lot of great examples so that you really remember this stuff. He gives a oral exam at the beginning of every class, but it's really easy as long as you go to class. The midterm is pretty hard, but the final pretty easy.

MDST 2000.comment: Class is boring, it's SO theoretical - you're just studying theories and methods of thinking about media the whole time. Half of classes were on Zoom, easy if your TA is an easy grader. Exams are take home essays with no time limit. Not hard to get an A, just made me not want to study media studies anymore. Must show up to all discussions.

Easy 4 credit class, but poor content. He just lectured about politics, Trump and how bad he was, and other random stuff the whole time. The lectures were unhelpful and if you got a tough ta, like I did, your grade will reflect. If you get a good ta you will do fine so look out for that best you can. Williams is a poor lecturer and is overpaid.

I enjoyed MDST 2000 a lot, but not much of that was bc of Professor Williams. His first few lectures were interesting, but as the course went on, they became less focused and near-irrelevant to the reading and quizzes. The quiz due dates and listings were extremely inconsistent. He repeatedly cancelled lectures with no communication to anyone.

I'm not one to skip class, but I barely ever went to this lecture because every single minute of it was so mind-numbing and infuriating. It's just him rambling about Trump and/or Screenagers for 75 minutes. Super easy class if that's all you're looking for, but if you want something interesting, RUN.

Unfortunately, Professor Williams is teaching the wrong class. He seems to be much more interested in teaching politics than media studies. 

The class itself was not too difficult. As long as you are actually doing the readings, there is no reason why you should not get an A. Williams is a bit unorganized, so keep track of your work yourself.
Avoid this course, please. The lectures have very little to do with any exams, and headache inducing. Overly difficult course for how easy the content is.

Worst prof I've had at UVA. The class wasn't hard but he was utterly disrespectful, uninvolved, and a bad teacher. He continuously ignored TAs' and students' questions. He was extremely rude to those who disagreed with him. He also input the wrong final grades in SIS and has yet to respond to any of my 10 inquiring emails over the past 2 months.

Many people had mixed feelings about Bruce, but I personally loved him. He has such a kind heart and although he would get extremely side-tracked during lectures, I learned a lot of valuable things from him. The class itself is relatively easy if you do all the work. Keep up with the readings/quizzes/online responses and you should be just fine.

His lecture is not very systematic, but readings are easy. This intro course only focus on some basic ideas and we have a lot of freedom on what we want to write for papers. If you go to office hours to talk to him, you will get a lot of support. But he sometimes may lose contact. Kind professor.

Lectures were mostly irrelevant, but his notes were accessible online. The midterm was solely on the book and a few readings. The final was AWFUL; 50 MC and 5 essays - which half of the material I had never seen before - even from lecture/lectures notes; no idea where it came from. Didn't answer me or TA's emails. Reading heavy with two papers.
The lectures can be interesting at times but he tends to drone on about certain things. The difficulty really depends on your TA as they do the grading.

Professor Cavalcante gave interesting and engaging lectures. He doesn't allow technology, so get ready to be writing all your notes down. He was very understanding when COVID hit, and changed the syllabus to be much less work heavy which I greatly appreciated.

Professor Cavalcante strikes a balance between strict and easy-going. He starts out very stern, but after hes established his expectations, he relaxes into his fun-loving self. His lectures are very traditional in structure, but his jokes liven them up. Ovwerall, a great, dedicated MDST & WGS professor and friendly person. Highly recommend.
Anthony was a super helpful TA and he made discussions fun. He was clear in his expectations and truly wanted us to succeed in the course.

Anthony is an easy going, approachable TA with a great sense of humour . He makes discussions entertaining and worthwhile. He often would go over readings to help the class gain a better understanding which really helped and he gave opportunities for extra credit, like peer reviewing essays. I would definitely recommend him as a TA for this class.

Anthony is the BEST! He was my TA for MDST and he is hilarious!! He made class fun, while still worthwhile - I was actually excited for my 10am discussion. He cut through the BS and made sure that we had meaningful conversations. His feedback on papers was also very helpful. 10/10 TA - one of the best I've had at UVa.

By far the greatest professor/TA I have had at UVA. He is hilarious and can make any class fun. He often connects concepts in class to anthropological questions that are really engaging and get you thinking. He grades fairly, and he really cares about every student and their success. I HIGHLY recommend taking a course with him.
Very easygoing, chill, yet helpful TA. Would definitely recommend taking it with Anthony
Amazing class great at relating and teaching. Funny guy and all around positive atmosphere definitely worth it.
He is the best teacher ever. Really helps you to understand topics and understands college students.

I have never seen lecture halls so empty until I took Rubin's class. About 40 people showed up for a 500 person lecture each week, I counted. Pointless lectures, we talked about absolutely nothing. Discussion was super interesting, easy A, but it made me hate media studies.
Boring Lecturer, seems to just restate material in readings, and not necessarily a good job at it.  Gives interesting material in relation to music and is friendly/approachable.

MDST 2010.comment: If you like straightforward answers, this isn't the class for you. Siva takes a nuanced approach to the topics which I appreciated. Though the multiple choice exams are subjective, they encourage critical thinking. The extra credit from completing all the in-class essays really helped my grade. Readings were boring but he's an amazing lecturer.

Professor Vaidhyanathan lectures consist of him rambling about irrelevant material or his own books. The exams are take home but SO subjective they're almost impossible. He doesn't add points back or address the exams at all in class. He is so incredibly frustrating, do NOT take media studies with him.
Worst professor I have ever had. So unorganized and late on giving out exams. Questions are subjective. Does not respond to any emails and incredibly boring lectures.

Do not recommend. Very inefficient professor. Lectures are extremely engaging, he doesn't seem to care about what he's teaching, inconsistent, TA's do all the work yet he still is extremely late on posting assignments. Do not take this class if you can avoid it.

Siva is very pompous. It is basically a class were you read his books and books by his friends. The lectures are very boring and so are the skype conversations. I wanted to be a Media Studies major, but Siva has single handedly changed my mind.

Phenomenal professor. Some of the material can be dry given that it's an intro course, but Prof. Ali's lectures are lively and entertaining. He clearly demonstrates his passion for the subject and explains things very well. Outside of class, he is easily accessible and goes above and beyond for his students. Take a course with him if you can.

MDST 3680.comment: Loves to lecture about himself and his personal political opinions sooo the lecture feels absolutely pointless (nothing abt readings). He gets frustrated when attendance drops... yet the student success rate remains the same without attendance. Uses in-class assignments as leverage to get people to show up, but still skippable for the most part.

HIEA 3151.comment: He clearly enjoys and is passionate about the topics. There is a lot of discussion involved and he challenges the class to think about the material. All around extrememly knowledgable and conveys the information in an effective and entertaining way. The class is challenging but not hard as long as you do the reading and keep up with the themes.

This isnt a history class. Its a political and economic theoretical class with bits of historical information. If you want to read 5+ thick books with only 4 big essays throughout the course then youll like this class if not then youll hate it. This format of teaching applies to most of his classes.

Very, very, very focused on political philosophy and the nation-state form. Assignments had more to do with these philosophies than with actual history. Some assignments were rather unclear. If you want to learn more political philosophy than history, you may enjoy this course.

HIEA 2071.comment: Professor Stolz is a lot more focused on political-philosophy and the relation between nation-states and capital (socialist background) than the actual history of modern Japan in his lectures. You will have to do a lot of your own reading and research outside of class to get a base understanding of what's going on. You MUST answer questions his way

HIEU 2772.comment: Not your typical approach to a history subject but if you get past trying to view it through this lens you will realize how fascinating of a lecturer professor Stolz.  Not a super difficult class but you have to do the readings - the weekly reading quizzes definitely help.

ARAB 1020.comment: Professor Maanaki has got to be my favorite professor at UVA. Arabic is not easy, but he makes it very approachable for his students. He assigns a decent amount of homework, but he truly wants students to learn in his class. He cares more about this than grades themselves -- so don't worry about the grade. Maanaki is the best first-step to Arabic!
Bilal is amazing and inspired me to stick with Arabic.

Her exams are very difficult and she wont give you higher than a B or C. Very tough grader. lacks the ability to respond to emails efficiently. If really interested in global affairs take another teacher at least no her. Her class is writing heavy and takes days long of work.

GLOBAL AFFAIRS 101 

This class is one of the hardest mason cores. Do not take. This class is very time consuming @ Mason
Gives soo much work. Avoid her take another GLOA 101 teacher. I thought she was nice and easy grader in the beginning of the year. Not anymore...

Very sweet, but if you dont show up to class and she finds out :|  

I enjoyed her class; her midterms and finals ARE HARD but everything else is self explanatory or a guaranteed A if you put in your work :)))
Love her. Favorite professor. If you have any problems, talk to her! She wants to help you in any way she can! Just do the homeworks and you'll be fine.
Very helpful in learning Arabic but should probably require more speaking to help with the next level.
