ARAB 1010.comment: Maanaki is amazing and made learning arabic a breeze and a joy. would 10/10 recommend him to anyone looking to start arabic. make sure to come to class and do your homework.

He is very caring, and as long as you complete your homework, it'll reflect on exams. Practice speaking, writing, and listening. Your grammar is very really important! He gives you practice exams that are like his real ones. He's also really funny and makes a lot of jokes. Bilal is the goat.

Bilal is extremely enthusiastic about teaching. I enrolled in Arabic for my language credit at UVA despite my linguistic challenges. I will be referring him to everyone since he genuinely cares about his students, and my Arabic conversational and discussion abilities improved drastically as a result of his teachings.
I LOVE Bilal.  One of the best teachers I've ever had!!  He's very funny and super kind.  Super helpful if you need it and a pretty easy teacher.

She's very lovely and intuitive about learning the language. She integrates common conversational words and phrases that aren't in the textbook in class which keeps everyone involved. I feel like I'm learning the language through her and not only through the text book.

Online classes with Suad were... interesting. I don't think she was prepared for Zoom. Lessons were very disorganized and nobody really knew what was going on. At least it was just intro, so we were okay. Discouraged a lot of people from continuing, though.
So much reading and writing. I took global affairs from this professor, you will get a good grade if you do the work.

One of the hardest global mason core requirements. Very hard grader and extremely heavy on class participation. Not the best professor for online at least and does not like it if you don't participate in her class otherwise she reducts points on your assignments if she knows. Do not take her at least. Global affairs is a lot of work so choose else.
I hate her class; took her for global affairs.... hated her final project was soo time consuming
Spent 40+ hours on her final papers and especially project for GLOA 101 don't take

Gives way too much work. Took off 40% my final grade [100 to 60 %] because of no class participation or adding on to teachers lectures like those kids that talk the entire class. Technically i do get the work done except  don't feel comfortable talking in class especially since i have to take this online class in public.

GLOBAL AFFAIRS 101

Her class is quite long: imagine a history class somewhat similar to that. She gives tremendous amounts of work and writing essays and especially the final, midterm, and congo project was a lot to keep up. Overall a decent grader just her class is time consuming. Her project midterm and final takes 10+ hours of work.Sweet prof.
Professor Abyad really cared about making sure her students understood the topics and was always available outside of class to give feedback and to further explain more difficult topics.

Hassan is the best! Arabic is hard, but he tries to make it interesting and clear for all his students. He also plays us music and brought us food on the last day! I've talked to other people with other teachers, and I'm happy I took Hassan.
Very helpful for the first semester of Arabic and very approachable but sometimes difficult to understand.

ARAB 2010.comment: Bilal has made Arabic genuinely fun, and even though it's an everyday class each class is engaging and makes my brain work consistently without getting burnt out. If you need a day off, that's fine. He likes to let go early on Fridays, too, lol.

ARAB 3010.comment: Bilel was a great professor. His class was laid back and he was flexible with due dates for homework. He gave us "survival" arabic to learn how to communicate at airports and hotels. He does give a lot of homework but our class only met twice a week.

CS 4640.comment: Professor Hott is a great professor, despite being a little bit awkward. He teaches material well and gives assignments that really enforce your understanding. For this specific class, however, those assignments were non-stop, and took actual days to complete. I definitely feel like I learned a ton though.

CS 2130.comment: Robbie is a very kind person, and a pretty decent lecturer. He obviously cares a lot about his students, but man, he really expects a lot out of them. Overall, I'd say he's fair over anything.

Hott is a gigachad. Excellent lecturer, caring, reasonable. Grading expectations are clear, tests fair (entirely stuff covered in lecture). Generous w/deadlines. Grades WILL be tight if you're weak in a 40% area, so do your best. People complaining about either exams or the hw is a skill issue imo... it's all uphill from bit fiddling!

Be aware, you will spend 10+ hours a week on your homework assignments because the difficulty between the lecture material and homework is so, so vast that you will sit in office hours to get through each problem. Good luck.

Robbie Hott was a great professor, he had a rough semester along with all of us and was very considerate and easy-going with some of our assignments and deadlines in order to make things as stress-free as possible. His lectures were sometimes hard to follow, but the website gave a lot of explanations. His blog is dope too.

One of the best professors I've had at UVA in terms of his ability to keep you captivated. CSO is not an interesting topic but somehow he manages to keep you paying attention. He's a bit of a character but in the best way possible. You can tell he's a very smart professor and is genuinely interest in what he's lecturing.

Grading: Tests (40%), Homework (40%), Lab (20%), Weekly Quizzes (20%)

A very tough course. The lectures are great, but sometimes it doesn't have to do with the content in the quiz or exam. Failed the last test. Homework Assignments are HARD AF!

Bit fiddling, Assembly (I hate the bomb hw), and schat (asks you to make a chatroom in C Programming)

My first CS class at UVA and I loved it. DeLong is a great professor who is always open to helping out after class/through email with literally any homework/lecture problem you have. Great lectures, answers all questions or if he can't, he follows up later. Offers extra credit and very comprehensive exam reviews

Overall, very nice professor who definitely has a passion for what he's teaching. However, he falls short in his ability to convey course material effectively and has a hard time reading how much material students are actually learning during his lectures. He also departs somewhat from old curriculum which made studying old exams not too helpful.

This semester was an entire whirlwind but there were extra credit opportunities. He was receptive to student and TA feedback. Topics aren't too difficult, just make sure you have a network to collab stuff, start everything early, take extra credit chances, if you don't understand a topic, get someone to explain it to you/ it may make sense later.

Daniel, while knowledgeable outside class, shows extreme incompetence in curriculum design and fairness. Exam 1 was problematic, resulting in a sub-70% average even after question removal,  exam 2 was chaotic with lost papers and unfair grading choices, and the final exam's online option for those claiming sickness further compromised integrity.

He is utterly detached from his students, makes trivial mistakes, and annotates lecture slides with obvious grammatical let alone content errors. In spite of all that, he has the audacity to brag about how his exams "separate the A-students and the rest" with questions that are more difficult than homework. Truly unbecoming of an educator.

This professor means well however he is a pretty poor lecturer. He rushes through lectures with too many slides to cover in 50 minutes. Homework and lab assignments are enjoyable and interesting however exams are extremely, extremely difficult, and practice exams are not representative. The exam averaged at about a D/C- even after a heavy curve.

Terrible lecturer but nice guy. Constantly makes mistakes when showing examples. Tests are a weird mix of questions that are too easy and questions that are unreasonably hard and were never covered. The only saving grace of this class is that labs and homework are fairly easy points.
you would survive the pain of diving into a pool full of rubbing alcohol unskinned before surviving this course.
He does not know how to explain and the exams are extremely hard!

The professor tries to teach difficult concepts in an easy way, but does not succeed and moves on. He is constantly messing up during lectures. The practice exams are useless and the mock exam that he made is also useless, as it was very different than the actual exam.

ISLS 3000.comment: Dr. Horton has high standards for his class and sets his expectations clearly from the beginning. Sometimes it can get overwhelming if you are not a natural writer. But if you put in your efforts, you will succeed in the class. The classes are very engaging, and group workshops are very helpful. Three 3-4 page essays of high-quality writing.

I had Dr. Horton my first semester at UVA.  He gives the most thorough/thoughtful feedback of any professor I've ever had, making a video recording of his thoughts on your papers and what you did well/could have done better.  Conscientious, easily accessible, maintains high standards for students and himself. Makes UVA feel welcoming. High quality.
Professor Matthews really cares about her students and the methods taught have made me a better writer.

Charlotte is a true gem. The types of assignments were varied and interesting and I genuinely felt like I was a better writer by the end of the semester. She is fair but firm. There is a clear and concise rubric for all of the writing assignments and as long as you are satisfying the different criteria, you will do well. Go for it!

She's a great professor! Really focuses on sharpening your writing to make it more effective, and creates a really safe and respectable place for students to express their opinions and beliefs in a non-judgemental and helpful manner.

HIEU 2041.comment:
A hard teacher (~150 pgs/wk, difficult exams), but grading criteria is clear and it's possible to do well.

Professor Meyer is incredibly knowledgeable and her lectures are very engaging. I'd absolutely recommend her courses if you‘re interested in the subject material, but wouldn't take it if you're just trying to fulfill a history requirement.

Not the easiest class (there's a lot of reading and a lot of it is dull), but it's definitely doable if you put in the time. Lendon is an incredible lecturer. He's crazy and entertaining as all hell. I'm not a history major but I'm very glad I took this class.
Awesome and very interesting class, but not easy

HIEU 2031.comment: phenomenal professor, you will learn a lot. exams are hard work but doable.

Prof. Meyer is incredibly knowledgeable and teaches a fascinating course filled with great information. She's a gifted lecturer who clearly conveys themes/stories in flowing lecture that speaks of her acuity and experience. However, it is a VERY difficult class that demands your full attention and lots of time to reading ancient sources.

Harder than expected. Tons of reading and ~300 terms of which to memorize the identity, year, location, and significance. You will never find out what "significance" is supposed to be, but yours will never be good enough. Unhelpful TA who compensated by grading extremely hard. You cannot miss one discussion without a huge grade dock.

DON'T TAKE THIS CLASS, I went from being very interested in Greek history to hating it. The professor picks the most obscure terms for the test. Trying to recognize a quote from close to a thousand pages of reading whilst trying to remember 150 terms to identify was unbearable, WASTE OF TIME. The TA was also quite unhelpful.

Prof. Meyer is so passionate about her subject matter and likes to have fun with it! She is demanding and expects her students to put in the work so don't take this class if you are looking for a slacker class. She is amazingly helpful if you go to her office hours, she loves it when you come and ask her questions!! I loved this class!

Professor Lendon was an amazing professor. At the beginning I was scared of him but he's really just passionate about the topic and makes it interesting for people that aren't as interested. I had a great TA so I always knew what was going on in class. I learned so much from this class and would love to take another with Lendon.
Definitely a lot of reading and hard work, but very interesting lectures and coursework.

Hands-down the best prof ever. I'm not a history major, but this class was close to convincing me to switch. Lendon is the best lecturer you'll ever have, and you can tell that he cares so much about teaching. (Also a hilarious man.) My TA was awesome and I always felt prepared for exams (essays and IDs). GO TO LECTURE or you won't pass!!!
Great person who cares about students. He is really open and funny during class. Great lecturer and easy class overall

A seriously great professor with a true passion for what he's lecturing. The class is very difficult and as a first-year I felt ill-prepared. Had to work my ass off, but I think that overall it was worth it.
Lendon is a great professor and lecturer. Definitely requires a lot of work but you will find that his class is rewarding.

Lendon is one of the best professors I've ever had: he's extremely knowledgeable, has a great sense of humor, and, indeed, makes you work for your grade.  If you are up for the challenge, I would definitely recommend taking one of his courses.  You are guaranteed to learn a lot about the subject.  Overall, he's a great professor.

Brilliant man, seriously knows his stuff. He's really funny and easy to listen to, the lectures are very interesting. BUT this class A LOT of reading and the tests are very detail oriented and difficult

Take it! In the lectures Prof. Lendon narrates the events in a very funny way with his own understandings. The discussions (with pop quizs) are all about readings (200 pages per week) Grading standard is made very clear. My TA is Nicholas and his discussions are great! It's not just bubbling, you actually learn! And he's not a hard grader!

Good professor, a lot of reading but the lecture is a good supplement to most of it. Attendance to lecture is not mandatory but go. Discussion is required, quizzes are important but don't stress over them. Lendon is a great lecturer but eccentric. I am a chem major picked the class as a lesser of 2 evils but it turned out to be almost enjoyable.

Lendon is very quirky but very interesting. There was A LOT of reading, to the point that I just gave up halfway through the semester. I barely did any of the readings but I went to class and memorized the IDs and ended up with a B. I would recommend taking a class with Lendon purely to witness his lecturing abilities- they are that good.

Pretty difficult class. Lendon is a wonderful lecturer, and provides students with a general overview of the material. However, you must do the reading in order to provide the in depth answers expected on the exams. Also, be sure to have the ID terms memorized prior to each weekly discussion section as pop quizzes are given randomly.

Although he initially comes off as eccentric and a bit scary, This guy really grows on you. His Ancient Greece class is very in depth, but he lectures in a way that makes everything so much easier to understand. There is a fair amount of reading, but its pretty good stuff if you are into ancient history.

HIEU 3041.comment: Tough class with several hundred pages of reading/week. Tests were exceedingly difficult, but she makes up for it by grading relatively easily on the papers. If you do the readings and participate well in discussion, she will notice and you will reap the benefits. Learned more in this class than in any other class I've taken. Amazing professor.

Professor Meyer is without a doubt the greatest history teacher i have had the pleasure to learn under. She is passionate about Roman history and has ingenious ways of igniting that passion in her students. From mock court cases, to the incredibly entertaining "Game" she uses effective pedagogical practices. Could not rate higher.

Amazing professor. Meyer is certainly tough - expect 100-200 pages a week and come to class ready to participate (or be glared at). She may seem intimidating at first, but is really accessible and helpful if you ever need to talk. I actually think she's a very fair grader, not to mention a genius and expert in her field. Classes always enlightening

Prof Meyer has inspired me, or at least inspired me to warn all students that come to her class that its ridiculous. HIEU 3041 was terrible. Her tests are a test of endurance versus knowledge and she is more picky on papers than any prof I've ever had. Lastly she is also the least helpful prof I've had, I always felt like an annoyance.

LOVED!!! Professor Meyer is an absolutely fabulous lecturer and the material was fascinating. She loves what she teaches and she makes everyone else love it too.  That being said, you will work your tail off. If you love learning ancient history and are up for a challenge, this is the class for you. One of the best professors at UVA

HIEU 3150.comment: Meyer's a tough prof, but that's what you should expect from UVA. She knows her stuff and is really passionate. I found her lectures clear and her discussions enlightening. Get ready to read and participate.

CS 2102.comment: Prof. Tychonievich is absolutely fantastic! He really tries to explain everything as clearly as possible and provide plenty of resources for everybody to learn the material. He was very patient and always willing to try to explain a concept in another way to help someone who was confused.

Professor Tychonievich is a wonderful discrete math instructor! I went in not knowing even what discrete was and now he's made the topic fun! He teaches with pen and paper rather than computer, however it's still a great course! Quizzes almost every friday, however for a 20 minute quiz, you get a 30 minute review. Take this if you can.

The class should be easy if you study with a group. He might be good at teaching CS, but he is terrible at teaching math. He consistently misuses definitions and gives handwavey solutions and proofs. If you ask him questions in office hours, he sometimes gives you the wrong answer, so beware. Easy pass, but don't expect to learn rigorous math.

Sullivan is a really nice dude, and most of the concepts are super interesting. However, he is very unorganized and class is not mandatory. Most of the learning will come from the TAs or yourself. I highly recommend going to office hours, as the TAs are super helpful, and if you have little coding experience then will you be confused by lean.
He did his best and the class was easy

Great professor. Course was taught in Lean, which is a functional language specifically designed to assist reasoning so this course kind of double functions as an intro to functional programming. The downside is that few people uses it so googling doesn't help. I'd say it's a solid choice if you keep an open mind and explore a bit on your own.

Worst professor at UVA. You will not learn Discrete Math. Nice guy, but terrible professor. In this class you will struggle and struggle to comprehend the basic functions of the poorly documented and very ambiguous proving language "lean" while not learning any discrete math principles whatsoever.

He's not bad if you keep an open mind. Can be disorganized, and he often emphasizes high-level understanding over practical knowledge, but he genuinely wants you to succeed, and he pitches concepts pretty convincingly with an emphasis on real world justification. He puts a lot of work into his classes. You'll do well if you do what he asks of you.

He is THE MOST ridiculous teacher I have met. He used this dafny software, which he apparently is not familiar with. He talked about a simple factorial function back and forth for five classes. I learned absolutely nothing from him and its such a waste of time. His phone rang multiple times in class, seriously how hard is it to turn off your phone?
Prof. Edwards is very good at explaining the material clearly, is good at creating class participation, and has the cutest children. I will miss him next semester.

Prof. Edwards was really fun, even though my discrete class had upwards of 200 people he made it feel as interactive as a high school class. Asks for questions at the beginning of every class, even if it takes 15 min. Sometimes frustratingly easy, as in spends a lot of time on easy topics. Funny. I chose his class next sem even though it's early :D

Knight is a bit boring, but if you're interested in the material, every once and a while there will be a fantastic lecture. The class is not hard, just do the assignments on time. The tests are much harder than the class suggests.

Challenging, material takes a lot of practice and the weekly problem sets aren't always relevant. But Reynolds wants everyone to understand, pauses a lot for q's, is approachable, pretty good at explaining things, tries to bring in news stories and real-world applications to get people interested. Taught from the ppt so pay attention in lecture!!

He is strict on grades, of course. But he is really a nice professor, patient and always willing to talk with you. He wants to make sure you really understand the materials instead of working towards a "grade". Hard and challenging, but helpful.
This professor is a liar. And I quote "if you attend class everyday and do all the homework, you should be fine." Nope, that is not true. He schedules office hours so that you can never attend them.

A math class taught via powerpoint, just like all of Reynolds' other classes. He gives example after example without any concrete way of how to work a problem. His test averages are terrible, around 55-60% and he mumbles in class. He is by far the worst lecturer I have had.

CS 2501.comment: Fantastic. Favorite, most enriching class Ive taken so far. Apparent that Tychonievich put a great deal of thought and effort into the assignments in such a way that gives students a great understanding of the course material. Never has a class been so exciting and rewarding.

CS 1112.comment: I found this intro class to be very easy, and L. Tychonievich was very helpful in keeping the class fun, interesting, inspirational, and educational.  He was great at teaching the class, gave good feedback, solved problems with ease, and was excellent in interacting with the class.

Awesome prof; easy-to-understand lectures, plenty of resources, and very available for help outside of class. She is very caring and wants her students to succeed. Most lectures have a lab at the end of class, where attendance is recorded. Make sure to show up! Exams are not bad and the final is a group project which is very doable!

First and foremost there was no syllabus or schedule for this class. He made his own separate website where we have to do everything there. He did not teach clearly and stutters when to explain something in detail. He's TA had to do all the work, all we did was watch her type and copy what she wrote. There was no in class assignments.

Insanely easy course. Pay attention during lectures and you'll do fine. Really likes questions and participation. There's a lot of homework, but they take like 5min and can be completed before even attending lecture most the time. If you have complicated questions/ concerns, TA's are usually more helpful than prof.

I found that this class was very easy personally, however I do not believe that this professor is the most clear concerning the course material.  He often stumbled when asked to explain something in further detail.

This class was okay Prof. Cohoon class at first was very easy to understand. However, after the first few weeks the material became very condense really fast. This class was not organized because there was not a set schedule or syllabus in fact. Every class he had a TA type notes which we had to copy down or follow along wish there were more e.g.
Cohoon is such a good guy. The assignments arent super difficult, and the tests arent bad if you pay attention in class!

Insanely easy course. Pay attention during lectures and you'll do fine. Really likes questions and participation. There's a lot of homework, but they take like 5min and can be completed before even attending lecture most the time. If you have complicated questions/ concerns, TA's are usually more helpful than prof.

Cohoon is so clear during his lectures. The homework assignments are very straightforward. I barely had to do work outside of class to do well. It was a nice breather during an otherwise hard semester.

Cohoon is the man. Really seems to care about his students, and takes questions at any point during class. Concepts and problems are not difficult, and assignments are basically just coding puzzles to figure out. A very easy course if you're a logical thinker.

Most of the ratings on here are simply WRONG. This man is such a great professor! The class is so easy. I had zero programming experience, and all I did was show up and work on stuff in class to get an easy A. If you need a CS class, take 1112 with Cohoon!!!
Super easy A - finished most of the homework before I left class. Learned a lot though.

Great Professor!!! I thought I hated computers and then switched my major to computer engineering after taking his class. He's super helpful, fun, and you will learn CS well! His textbook is also very clear and helpful.

This guy should really have a much higher grade on here. Really awesome, caring professor who is VERY interested in getting interdisciplinary students into Computer Science. Class is really easy, but you will learn A LOT if you pay attention in lecture and do the minimal reading. Favorite class this semester, could not recommend enough.
Cohoon is great. He really wants the students to learn and even gives candy to demonstrate methods. He does care a lot about attendance and homework but will reward students if its done.

While Cohoon can sometimes be more confusing than he thinks, the TAs are really helpful. It's not hard to do well in this class if you just do the homework and study a little for tests. This class was really interesting overall, not a waste of time.
really easy class. professor is clear and helpful, really tries to let everyone learn the material. very nice guy too. tas are helpful as well. def take it if never taken a cs class before

Great professor! Lots of class participation. A few strange rules, but they are basically asking you to be a good student. TA's are great. Not the most organized, but he knows and enjoys the material. If you have no experience with programming, take this class! Favorite class this semester!

CS 4810.comment: Even though the professor is super smart he teaches at way too fast of a pace and gives too much work. Avoid this class.
Class is super hard and involves a lot of math. If you are not good at math, stay away! He lectures at a breathtaking speed so if you don't understand something once, seek help immediately.
Always helpful at office hours and answers all questions. Great lectures but workload was high.

Very entertaining in a nerdy, quirky kind of way. Goes through lecture material very quickly. He's hyper intelligent and really helpful outside of class so I highly encourage going to his office hours if you're stuck. Recommended only if you're a CS major and interested in the topic he's teaching though because he does expect a lot of work.

Too much work given. Does not realize that the students have other courses/a social life to take part in. His homeworks make you build a graphics engine from scratch forcing you to use his arbitrary input syntax while there not being any online resources that are helpful for the homework - probably because no other graphics class is as tedious.
Hard Class, but worth it.  Assignments take forever.  You don't really need to read, but you should be in class.  Tests are hard but fair.

DRAM 7350.comment: SHE IS PERFECTION.  No one can compare to Marcy Linton.  She's the only reason I'm still at UVA!

CS 3100.comment: He's a good lecturer, and I feel like I have a good understanding of the material, but he's horrible at communication. He always gets grades in late, with very little communication about why he blew past the deadline he told us. Both he and the other instructor, Raymond Pettit tend to be very passive aggressive when students ask questions on Piazza

He's smart, and he clearly understands the data structures very well, I just think he's not prepared for the lecture. He'll repeat the same sentences multiple times like he's trying to convince himself. I think someone else wrote the slides and he's trying to read/interpret them on the fly. The TAs and professor also take forever to grade.

Algorithms courses are difficult, and I have no doubt that Prof. Pettit knows his algorithms. But when he teaches, for some reason, it feels as though he is just reading what he sees on a powerpoint. The reason is that he can spend 15-20 minutes essentially saying once sentence in multiple ways. He'll read out a new concept without explaining, too.

CS 2150.comment: Overall a good class and learned a lot. I felt the course was difficult but fair. You should start labs early as you never know how long you may be stuck on them. It is not overly difficult in terms of understanding the material but is difficult in terms of the amount of work and time needed. Workload 20-25 hours / week generally.

Bloomfield is one of the best profs at UVA. I took his class during the Spring 2020 semester and he handled the switch to online learning really well. The class is one of the toughest I've taken, but if you don't procrastinate and stay on top of the labs, doing well shouldn't be a problem.

Bloomfield's a great professor, among the best at UVA. This class is hard, probably one of the first "real" programming classes you'll take, since it's a bridge between lower level and upper level CS classes. He's a great lecturer and the labs are notoriously hard (especially hash lab), but the class is worth it since you learn so much.

When COVID forced us into online classes, Bloomfield was the most accommodating of any of my professors. He cancelled/extended assignments, made lectures available online anytime and held frequent office hours, and when Collab crashed during our final, he handled every single student's exam situation individually to ensure we were graded fairly.
CS 2150 is a great class and Bloomfield is a great professor. There is so much to learn, but Bloomfield is the guys to teach it.

Aaron's actions are those of a hypocrite.  As far as office hours are concerned, for some reason he will go to the office hours of other professors, like Abhi Shelat, and talk to Abhi during his entire office hours session while students are waiting to ask Abhi questions about the difficult material in his algorithms course Fall 2011, pink rules AB

I love him! I think he is the best professor at UVA. Great lecturer and really cares about his students. Also, just the sweetest guy. Really wants everyone to do well and will do whatever he can to help you out. So long as you work hard on 2150, start labs early and don't slack off. This class should be fine.

It's a well-organized class. Bloomfield was one of the hardest professors I've had, but easily the best. His lectures have a great blend of humor, knowledge, and clarity. His lab assignments (split into three parts and function as homework) are notoriously difficult and lengthy, as are his tests. But it's worth it. You will learn so much.

this guy is pretty good at teaching. i'd say one of the best in the CS department. just remember to go to his office hours instead of TA office hours. labs are pretty hard if you don't already have a background in programming and the tests are pretty bad. overall the work was my least favorite but the professor was my most favorite.
He is awesome! A very passionate and energetic professor who would make those hard materials interesting. Labs were disastrous but you'll gain a lot after a semester with him!

He's pretty sexy in my opinion... He tries to be funny but he's too nerdy so it doesn't work. He's good at explaining vocally, but his written lab instructions are abominable. Be prepared to be endlessly confused and hate your life when doing his labs.

Bloomfield is my favorite professor in UVA! He is remarkably organized and helpful, and I'm attracted to his class because of his great sense of humor. Yes this class requires a decent amount of work, but it's totally worth it!

He's a very good professor, probably my favorite CS professor. The labs were difficult at times, but if you start early, you'll be fine. He's organized and clear. Tests are a bit tricky, but he curves the grades if the average is too low. There's always help outside class if you need it, which was nice as well.
Really hard professor, his test are impossible, BUT if you go to class and pay attention you should be good.

Bloomfield expects A LOT from his students, and he tells you that up front. Be prepared to spend many many many hours a week on this class. That said, I learned more in 2150 than all other classes at UVA.

Lectures are recorded and optional, but they are really helpful for labs and exams. The labs are tough but the office hours are useful and theres usually lots of TAs there to help. Overall the workload isn't terrible.

Floryan is an exceptional lecturer who does the course material justice. CS 2150 covers a lot of ground, even though the course is relatively easy. Floryan can explain concepts well to newcomers and is pretty entertaining.
CS 2150 is the hardest class I have ever taken, but Floryan is also a fantastic teacher. Hilarious and you can just tell he's legit.
Tough class, but an amazing professor. He's funny, engaging, down to earth, and really knows the material. It's a lot of work, but Floryan is a great teacher.
2150 was one of the hardest classes I've taken, and though Floryan tends to be a tough grader, he is a fantastic lecturer who really cares about the students learning and doing well.

CS 1011.comment: This is the best class I've taken at UVa and the best lectures I've sat through. Bloomfield is an awesome professor.

STAT 1601.comment: Professor Roland is probably one of the most understanding and caring professors I will ever have. I am not interested in statistics or any sort of STEM and I think she understands that her class is not interesting for everybody, so she takes extra effort to make it digestible. I really appreciated all of her help in office hours!!

Professor Roland is amazing. I have to admit, lectures can become boring at times listening over and over to her talk about code, but her office hours were so helpful. She will take the time and explain to you what you are misunderstanding. (basically got all of my HW done there). You can work w/ people on HW assignments. Weekly quizzes (open note)

He does not teach well. He uses little examples and the assignments are more complicated than what is first shown. Expect to answer your own questions and figure everything out on your own or from someone else. He also assigned 3 assignments over Thanksgiving break.
This is genuinely the worst teacher I have had. If you have a problem, expect to solve it on your own. He does not have deep knowledge of the topics he teaches. Horrible.
I recommend to staying away from this professor. He against Chinese.
Does not teach well. I found it easier to learn the info on my own. Attendance is required and is pointless. Extremely disappointed in the university for hiring this professor.

Prof. Brown is a great person but not great at teaching. He is often confused about certain concepts or gives confusing explanations. He's a funny guy, but that's not enough to successfully teach a class. The class was much harder than it should've been because of his teaching style.
Amazing professor! There is a reason no one has left him with less than a 5 star rating.
Professor Afriyie is the goat. Definitely take his intro to R course, easy A as long as you takes notes in class, and he is the best professor I've had at UVA so far.

Love Prof Afriyie and recommend this class to all math/stat/CS/DS students! Lecture was so interesting as we coded with him. Cracked jokes, answered q's well, there for students outside the classroom. Work is so easy if you are engaged, it becomes wanting to make great code. Don't slack on final project. Foundational and inspirational!

Professor Prince is such a nice person and also a great professor! He explained coding in such an easy way to understand ( even if you do not have experience in coding) The homework is pretty easy, there is a group project which is not too bad, and there are two tests: the first one was hard because of coding and the second is easy.

He is a super cool professor, really nice guy. He is so understanding and goes out of his way to help students in any way possible. The class is not that hard if you watch all of his lectures and pay attention, but (as with all stat classes) if you don't know specific codes it is difficult.

Professor Afriyie is incredible. He is such a kind man, cares so much about his students. Always very willing to stay after class if you have questions about hw. I signed up for this class not knowing anything about it and ended up hating coding - Professor Afriyie is the only thing that made the class bearable just because coding is not for me.

One of sweetest professors I've had. Had 1 hw assignment each week that was similar to codes and exps he taught that week (highly recommend taking good notes during lecs). We had 2 exams and a group final project (no final). He was a great lecturer, understands that most students have no prior knowledge of R, so he repeats concepts multiple times.
Really kind, interesting anecdotes, and an interesting intro to statistics.
Professor Afriyie is a very good professor. His class isnt too difficult. He is also very accessible and his exams arent too bad either.

Professor Prince explained topics very clearly and made his lectures fun. Not much homework every week. Fair exams with only things he has covered. We had one group project, but he decomposed it with different parts due through out the semester so I didn't feel very stressed.

ANTH 2430.comment: Prof Armik was so caring! The lectures were well structured, but sometimes it was unclear if what he was talking about was relevant or just a side note. Discussion sections were critical, and they were the main sources of extra credit! I easily amassed 20+ points. No matter how much experience you have with linguistics, this class is amazing!

Armik was a good lecturer and it was obvious he was incredibly passionate and knowledgable about linguistics. Even without any background knowledge, it is very easy to get an A in this class and there are tons of extra credit opportunities so make sure to show up to class.
Fantastic professor who always cares about students.
Professor Mirzayan is the BEST professor I have ever met in UVA. I would definitely take all the courses taught by him
He is really knowledgeable about linguistics but his lectures can be a little boring. Takes forever to grade homeworks but the TA will usually be very accessible and can help.

I took this class Fall 2020 while it was online. Prof. Mirzayan is a visiting professor, and it seems he was not ready for so many students online. He is a sweetheart and loves going on tangents, but his lectures can go off topic quite a bit. He only could do a handful of HW assignments and a final paper, and is terrible at returning grades quickly

The lectures are so aimless, the professor essentially just lists facts about the topic but it does not follow a consistent lesson plan or tie any of the ideas together. Yet you are expected to understand the topics like there was a clear curriculum or expectations were set at any point ( which they are not)

ARCH 1020.comment: Professor Crane is such a kind person and clearly passionate about the course material. This class was not very difficult, but I still felt like I learned so much.

Professor Crane is an excellent speaker and is very knowledgeable about what she teaches. The lectures can get somewhat boring, but she tries to make the topics intriguing and interesting. The weekly assignment questions were annoying and the readings were dull. However, the class was ultimately pretty easy.

Hardly anyone goes to class.. I feel bad for her because she is such a horrible public speaker.  I think she knows what she's talking about, she just can't explain it.  She seems like a really nice lady! I guess it's a good class if you want to skip all of the lectures and wing it in discussion.  Midterm, paper, final
He is one of the smartest, most genuine professorsteachers I've had, though his lectures and assignments can be baffling they do push you to learn about yourself and your environment in new ways.

She's a great teacher! This class takes a lot of work to do well, but every required project helps you learn more. Her and the TAs have office hours that are helpful to attend if you want a good grade, and going will help you improve.

Love this course!!!! The works we've done seem not that related to architecture but in fact they do. Every project in this class help practice and improve the ways of thinking and the ability of aesthetic appreciation--fundamental skills that you need to become a qualified architect.

For a student not in the architecture school, Sanda is a phenomenal and engaging professor. She is truly compassionate towards her students. There is a ton of work which is why the class is hard, however, Sanda is very encouraging and will give you a good grade if you do everything and if you put in your best effort. Also a good TA is helpful.
I loved Professor Iliescu's personality, but as someone not majoring in architecture, I felt the work was rather extreme and I quickly became tired of the class as it was such intense work.

Took this as a requirement for architecture major. Difficult and pushed my boundaries. Very abstract. Be prepared for a project due every week. Be sure to get a good TA, they can make or break your experience (and your grade). GO TO OFFICE HOURS! She is only helpful if you ask for it. Recommended for majors and those interested in arch. Enjoy

Sanda is a fantastic professor, and really pushes for the students who show an effort or appreciation for the class. It is a good basics course for anyone who wants to learn design. Keep in mind that this course is a precursor to the workloads in studio, and should be taken seriously by anyone who is in the a-school or thinking of transferring in

If there is anyone that has had Erin as either a professor or advisor who finds her the least bit HELPFUL or even INTELLIGENT I would like to meet him/her.  I feel bad for her during lectures because, at times, she seems to know less than the TAs/students.  God help her.....

ARH 1020.comment: I enjoyed Professor Crane's class. The class meetings were her lecturing, and there were weekly readings and assignments. Overall, the lecture part of this course was generally pretty good; participation does matter (at least it's strongly encouraged). Grades are determined by TAs, so it can depend a little bit on the luck of the draw.
She's really passionate about the subject and is really personable one-on-one!

ARH 2401.comment: Prof. Crane is a great scholar. I think she might be better in directing researching than lecturing. She is smart and patient with students. I think her class was challenging but I did learn a lot!

ARH 7401.comment: Professor Crane is a very good scholar. She is very knowledgable and helpful. This class is a high level class and it is challenging.

Sheila is an amazing professor, who truly cares about presenting herself as a standout educator. She is always available for discussions either through email or office hours, allowing students easy access. She is so organized and clearly defines her expectations for tests and assignments. All of her course materials are on Collab. A great class!

BIOL 3070.comment: In 2018, Prof. Condron had errors in our final exam and refused to correct them which affected several students. Looking back, his integrity was lacking especially for a research professional. I've come far enough in my life to know that this behavior was unacceptable and

The curve was generous, my scores were bad but I got a B-. A lot of material to memorize, but you just have to focus on what's in the lectures. Best way to study was to answer questions he gives you for each lecture. Get someone to do them w/ you, it makes preparing much easier. The info was valuable and interesting! :)

BIO 3050.comment: Condron is definitely one of the kindest and funniest professors I've had. His lectures can be a bit all disorganized, but as long as you go and take notes they weren't too bad. It's graded on 3 exams (4 total, drop 1), but you get to bring one side of a paper per lecture. Do the practice questions (they are from old exams) and GO TO LECTURE!

Professor Condron is a great lecturer and makes class interesting. The course grade is only determined by 3 exams weighted equally and they're pretty difficult considering “none of the above” is almost always an option.

Professor Condron is disorganized and his lectures are hard to follow. He speaks extremely quickly and brushes over difficult topics while lecturing. He will often list the parts of the pathway and not explain in depth. He did not have a grade scale posted until a couple of days before grades were due. Do not take this class unless you have to.

Professor Condron is an amazing lecturer, but be ready to put in the work to get a good grade. Your grade is based on four open-note exams and the lowest drops, but don't be fooled, these are not easy! Questions are very tricky, but pay attention in lectures (perhaps even re-listen to them) and you should be prepared. Overall highly recommend!

In terms of Barry, he's fine. As a professor, he's nothing special. This class is the worst class I've ever taken. His tests are almost impossible to do, they're timed and 42 questions each, and there are no corrections or anything like that. At least tests are take-home. If you can avoid this class, do it!!

Barry Condron is an absolutely amazing professor. You can tell he really wants everyone in the class to do well. Tests were open note, but they were really hard. Optional final to replace one of the 3 tests. Absolute saint of a man.

BIOL 3050.comment: Overall, he's a fun and intelligent individual who made every lecture worthwhile. Dr. Condron doesn't exactly explain everything in detail in lecture though, so be sure to supplement with a little textbook reading. Some exam questions are very tricky, but doable if you take your time. Go to lecture!!!!

Really great and accommodating, he listens to and respects students. It's important to go to lecture prepared or re-listen to the recordings after. He talks quickly and jumps from topic to topic, and it's hard to create a structured set of notes while in class. He is interested in what he talks about, and is able to answer any question.

Gave the whole class an outline of his grading brackets and what percentage corresponds to what grade (generous brackets overall), but come the end of the semester grades did not match that bracket at all and what would've been an 87%  A was really a 93%  A. He manipulated students to think their grades were better than they really were.

Prof Condron is a bit scatterbrained and his lectures are all over the place, but this makes them pretty entertaining. Interesting stuff and he has some funny stories. There were a lot of wrong answers on the HWs, so don't wait until the last minute to study using these. Concepts weren't bad, but he does write some tricky/weird exam questions.

Dr. Condron was an amazing professor. Its neurobiology so it's a hard course but he makes it a lot of fun and manageable. You can tell he's so passionate about the course. I would take it again in a heartbeat and I wish he taught more classes. He really inspired me and I highly recommend taking this course.

I must say, let alone the tricky hard tests. THIS CLASS IS BY FAR THE MOST INTERESTING CLASS I HAVE EVER TAKEN IN MY WHOLE ENTIRE LIFE. I just can't tell you how captivating this class is. Prof Condron is so amazing. sometimes it doesn't matter what grade you're gonna get in the end, what matters is how much you learned.
Prof. Condron was the BEST - he had funny lectures that were also dense with material - and wrote fair and challenging exams. He also let you come by and see a real human brain during exam week :)

Barry is an amazing teacher! Very well respected by his students and he makes learning a lot of fun, you can tell he is very interested and invested in what he's teaching. Tests are difficult, but if you study the power points and listen to the lectures you should be fine. Office hours are great resources and he will give lots of hints and tips.
He's a pretty awesome professor. Do YOUR part and you will succeed.

Barry is one of the best professors at UVa. He is SO inspirational to his students, and really cares about what he is teaching you. He is not the common professor who tries to trick you in tests or make them super hard. SO easy to get an A if you do this simple trick: write down everything he says (record lecture) and do the flashcards he gives.

Condron is incredible! If you get the chance, take this class. It's heavy material, but if you like neuroscience you'll fall in love with the class and his lectures. He's very helpful both in an out of class, and you can get away with not reading if you attend class (although I would recommend it). Absolutely wonderful, favorite class by far.

Condron is my favorite teacher I've ever had! I advise going to every lecture and recording them.. Before tests listen to them again and only use the book to look up things you do not understand. His tests are hard, but straight from lecture. He's also very good about letting students reschedule exams if there is any sort of conflict.

Iggy is a nice, friendly guy, but he has organized his class around lectures and lectures are not his strong suit. He does know what he's talking about but you're better off asking him in person than listening to him fly through 30 slides. Tends to wax romantic about Nobel prize winners who don't matter. His exams are hard.

I don't know about every class, but in BIOL3050 Mellon could not have cared less about the class. He gave his lectures in a record-breaking 30 minutes or less most days (for a 75-minute class), average more than a slide per minute some days. His passion clearly lies in his own lab work, so don't expect him to care much about you. Nice guy though.

BIOL 3170.comment: Condron has been my favorite professor at UVA so far - loved this class! Lectures are dense but still interesting - Condron is a funny guy :)  If you want to do well in this course you MUST attend lectures.

His lectures are jam packed with info but he makes it very succinct and spells out what he wants students to know. He often ended early, but still had more substance than other profs who drone on the whole class time. He seems like a nice guy too, couldn't have asked for a better experience. I'd say to take the course w/prior bio knowledge.

Amazing prof, extremely animated and tries to explain things in ways that you can understand. He extremely passionate with neuro & it's infectious. He never makes it boring even though the material was dense. Funny guy. Be prepared to do a lot of studying, 3 exams only, no hw, 20+ ch, & they are TRICKY but decent curve at the end. Best UVA prof.

Barry is great.  He is very passionate about neuroscience and his lectures are extremely fun and informative.  The tests are tough, but the curve is great.  Overall a great professor.  I will miss his class.

He was an awesome teacher, much better than Provencio! Interesting, informative... he definitely made you want to come to class. Essentially, it's a good bio elective. The curve at the ends brings up your grade substantially. Think cell bio and be prepared to study a lot. All in all, this class was great!
Friendly, approachable, clear, engaging. There's a lot of material and conceptual information to know and he explains it very well. One of my favorite professors in one of my favorite courses.

He is a nice guy but this is a hard class and he doesn't make it easier.  Its hard material and his test is picky.  Hes helpful though and will sit down with you and explain things.  Also he does make clear what he wants you to really know.  And that stuff you really have to inside and out
Its a hard class but he explains well and he tells you what you do and do not need to know so it really narrows the material well.  Hes pretty straightforward.  Good teacher.  Fair test.

SOC 3559.comment: Professor Makarova's class is group discussion-based. There is a good bit of reading, but it's worth doing because it's almost always covered during class. The midterm and final had multiple essay questions, but it is relatively low-stress since the material is thoroughly discussed. Participation is important; at least the material is interesting!

He did not lecture at all.  The students ran each lecture by being divided into groups at the beginning of the semester and then being assigned weeks to present for both Monday and Wednesday for an hour and 15 minutes. Midterm assignment was unclear which resulted in a ton of low grades but he gave us a second chance to bring up those grades.

Olick is very enthusiastic and presents the material in an interesting way. He incorporates real-world examples seamlessly into lectures to help explain concepts and genuinely values student input and discussion. However, he does tend to assign lengthy readings.
Professor Jakelic could probably teach anything and teach it well. She is knowledgable and passionate about what she teaches. She makes you want to learn. You will look forward to going to class.

SOC 3559: Masculinity. Fantastic professor! I had a small class with him and he is genuinely invested in the students' progress. All papers and exams allow you to demonstrate what you learned rather than taking hit/miss mult choice. He is funny, engaging with the class, and compiles interesting materials and lectures. Take him before he's famous!

AMAZING. He is one of the best Professors in the department. Readings are reasonable and VERY interesting. He really knows what he is doing. He is clear concise, his lectures connect and make sense. He has great organization and knowledge of the subject. Grade Distribution: Two non-cumulative test, two reading guides, participation, Final paper.

SOC 3490.comment: GREAT professor. Interesting class (cities and cultures) pretty easy and straightforward. Lectures can get a little rambly.. but easy class, interesting material. HIGHLY RECOMMEND. if you're looking for a medium workload class that's interesting and chill = BINGO!

BIOL 3410.comment: she is an okay professor, but she is also the only anatomy professor.

I enrolled in this class with high hopes, but my experience was far from good. The lectures were uninspiring and the class felt very disorganized. She is a nice professor, but lacks the skills to engage with students, which she tries to make up for with 30 minutes of TopHat questions. However, the lecture exams are not difficult with some effort.
The most disorganized professor I have ever had the displeasure of meeting.

This class was interesting, and probably my favorite Biology class. The class itself was very unorganized. Lab is way harder than lecture. The lecture exams are not hard if you put effort into learning the material using her words. Either go to lecture, watch her pre-recorded lecture videos, or do both. I didn't read a single thing and did fine.

Class is NOT easy, but it isn't Massey's fault. She offers a lot of resources like her own videos to help with the material and the textbook carries for this class. Nice lady who has many anecdotes. Lots of work, but doable. Labs are difficult and have LOTS of material. Interesting topics, but can be frustrating. She grades last minute.

It is not too difficult, however, she takes forever to grade. By week 10 of class she had not graded a single one of our weekly quizzes. The lab is more work than the lecture and the weekly quizzes are hard and do not reflect what is done in lab. She also does not care if you are sick and assumes you are lying and will penalize you for it.

The professor is very unorganized and unclear about assignments. She does not care about students grades. I missed an exam for following COVID related university wide policies and was not allowed to make it up. The exams aren't difficult but the lab tests are nearly impossible and always have content that was never mentioned in class or lab.

My advice would be to read the textbook, but use the slides he gives in lecture to pick and choose what information you can expect to see on exams. Learn the diagrams and be able to explain functionality. Kopeny is a really sweet professor who wants you to learn, so definitely seek him out for office hours. I might just take 3420 to have him again!

The lecture and exams on lecture material in this class aren't too bad. Lectures can make material seem worse than it actually is, just read the book. But the lab for the class is certifiably awful. It counts for 40% of the grade and is just a 3 hours long cram session where your TA will just sit back and watch. By far the worst lab I've ever taken

If you're taking this class, be prepared for terrible/hard to understand lectures. Also, be ready to make your textbook your Bible because you have to know every little detail about every page of that book; the tests are very specific. I was disappointed in this course because I was looking forward to the material but it was not delivered well.

I seemed to really struggle in Kopeny's class, but many of my friends did well. GET THE TEXTBOOK!! I found labs to be super easy, but I also took anatomy in high school. You really need to spend time studying for the exams because they're application and interpretation based. Office hours are really helpful and he does care to help you understand.

BIO 3410.comment: The lecture and test were overall easy, but the lab was not very well organized and often disconnected from lecture even though they were paired as one course. If you attend lectures she is very specific on what will be on the tests, but you can pass by just reading the textbook. The lab requires a lot of memorization with minimal guidance.

PSYC 3990.comment: I cannot overemphasize how compassionate and enlightening she is. So funny and such a good lecturer. I feel very well prepared for facilitating.

PSYC 1020.comment: Although Prof. Nagel is in charge, the facilitators are the ones you get to know and meet. They are your peers at UVA, and the curriculum for Hoos Connected is nice. I made nice connections in the class, but this class did cost me from being on Deans List. It's okay though, I made countless memories in this class that I wouldn't trade.

PSYC 3006.comment: Graves and the TA's are great and super helpful. Very knowledgeable people. Beware of the horrific group projects though - your classmates will quickly become your enemies.

Professor von Oertzen is a really nice guy and is super organized with his lectures and slides. I had to miss class once and he went through the entire lecture separately with me during office hours. He also has the best practice exams. I would recommend attending class and review sessions. Get to know him outside of class because he's really cool!

Tests exclusively from the notes and objectives sheets w/ generous curves. Three tests (drops the lowest grade) and a final, all of which are cumulative (but tests 2 and 3 are heavily weighted toward most recent material). Gives a cheat sheet on all the tests. Nice person, but slow/boring lecturer. Overall a good/straight-forward class.

Worst experience of my life! She belittles everyone that asks questions and expects you to get the material on the first try. Exams would be cake without her trick questions. When she explains why certain answers are wrong, she even sounds ridiculous. Crazy lady...should've taken Freeman for sure! Biggest regret at UVa
Schmidt is a good, fair professor, and she does her best to keep things interesting.  I thought she was reasonable, and while I didn't love her class, I have no complaints about her as a teacher.

If you had Freeman for 3005, you'll love Schmidt, just because of how bad Freeman was in comparison, but Schmidt is actually kind of tricky. You'll really only do well if you take the time to teach yourself the material outside of class, because she doesn't really go through the math with you in class. She's also kind of crazy...not in the good way

She is one of the worst teacher's I've had at UVA. She's extremely condescending when people ask questions, and not very helpful when explaining trickier topics near the end of the semester. Overall, she was boring, rude, and did nothing to make a hard class any better.

PSYC 2150.comment: Teles is super nice & seems like she loves the field. The course is hard as heck, theres 3 exams (no drop) that are crazy difficult and ask specific questions about labs/ readings that are almost impossible. got a decent grade but still, take this class during summer session because it was a headache.

This class is graded only on exams. Even though the worst score is removed, the exams are difficult and Willingham does not tell you the curve until after the final, making the class much more stressful because you don't know your grade until its over. You need to spend a large amount of time memorizing the book/lectures to do well in this class

Willingham is a great professor, the lectures were interesting but the class is graded based only on tests and they are HARD. You can be tested on ANYTHING in the book and any small thing he mentions in lecture. Get ready to take extensive notes and make sure to memorize everything if you want to get an A. He curves fairly well tho.
Great professor. Tests were difficult (everything mentioned can be tested), but the grade was curved.

The material is interesting, but the tests were absurdly difficult.  On the midterms, there were questions where the answer was only mentioned once in the text and wasn't referred to any other time in text or lecture.  You'll learn a lot about cognitive psych, but unless you devote 20+ hours to each test, your grade will likely not reflect that.

I loved Prof Willingham as a lecturer because of his personality, but to be honest the content was dense and hard to fully grasp during the lectures. My main grievance was with the exams- they were extremely difficult, particularly the final, but he's really fair about curves. As long as you read his book you should be fine

His lectures were ridiculously long, unstructured, and pretty boring. The questions on the 2 midterms and final were extremely tricky and difficult. There was no other coursework that went into your final grade, so if you don't do well on the exams there was nothing you could do to pick it up. I wouldn't recommend this course unless you need it.

Prof. has his own textbook which I thought was great because it is almost identical to lectures. The material is pretty similar to psych 1010, with emphasis on certain topics. His tests were easy, but I always thought that his lectures were a bit unstructured and hard to follow (the textbook was my bible). Super nice guy and very accommodating.

Three exams (lowest dropped) and final make up your grade. Willingham is awesome and he keeps the lectures super engaging (even when you get completely lost). For psych majors, definitely a better option that cognitive neuroscience.

Professor Willingham is one of my favorite professors at UVA. His class was very challenging but the review sessions were very helpful and he was accessible through collab at all times. His lectures were sometimes a little information heavy.

While his tests are hard, if you study and do the readings (and follow his study techniques given to you at the start of the semester), you can definitely get an A. He was very funny and always tried to make his lectures interesting and engaging. Must go to classes and you have to do the readings if you want to do well.

Dan is the man! His personality is great, and his jokes are even better. The only downside to this class is that it was a pretty tough psych course. As a psych major, I actually had to study like crazy to get a decent grade. He grades using a bell curve so it all depends how the class does as a whole. Material was interesting, but you have to study

Although my rating seems low, I definitely recommend this class. Take notes and get everything he says. He's super nice -I went to talk to him twice and he really makes you feel better about the class. As others have said, figure out the tests early (I bombed the first). The class is funny and very interesting but you must have good notes and read!
Even though he goes really fast in his lectures and sometimes can be unclear, the class is definitely worth it in the end!

...Dang. This class. The professor is kind, energetic, knowledgeable, personal and hilarious. Type really fast!! Get everything! His test questions are one of those kinds where all the questions sound right, in fact, all of them usually are but you have to choose "the one that is BEST". Killed me every time.
Class didn't have any homework other than reading. Tests are hard though. Professor is really personable and entertaining.

Incredible teacher-one of the best at UVA. Very knowledgeable about the subject and presents it with both clarity and humor. Tests aren't as bad as they used to be (33.5/40 mean on tests for Fall '11)If you go to the lectures and read the book, you'll probably get an A-/B+.

He is an absolutely fantastic professor!! Definitely recommend his class. He is absolutely hilarious, engaging, clear in his lectures, and really wants to make sure everyone understands his material. Take this class if you can even though the exams are tough. It is worth it.

Very intelligent and fantastic lecturer; clear, gets info/point across, structured, and amusing. You really must have everything down pat from the lectures and texts, because the exams are difficult and will be cryptic to the unprepared student. You will learn a lot if you put in effort. Highly recommend
Great class! Very easy if you're interested in the subject. He presents the information very clearly. Extremely hilarious and engaging! The textbook is very wordy; I didn't need it.

funny. exams are hard, but if you pay attention to the details in the text and attend most (all would be better) of the lectures then you will be fine. the questions are tricky, but that is like every psych test i have encountered. INTERESTING subject.

Dan is the man. His lectures are engaging and humorous, and he is incredibly knowledgeable about the subject. His tests are hard though, so be prepared for that. Most exam material comes from the lecture.
amazing professor!

Williamham is a great professor. He's funny and is able to keep class interesting (for the most part). The book and lecture didn't always match, so READ THE BOOK. make sure u keep up with the reading b/c it's important for exams. tests can be REALLY HARD but don't procrastinate and you'll be fine

Professor Willingham is AWESOME. He's hilarious and always keeps class light and fun, despite the (sometimes) dry material. The tests can be a little difficult, but if you study you will be fine. One of the best classes I've taken in my college career thus far.

Professor Willingham was a great professor. One of the best I have had at UVa, and perhaps even in life. Be sure not to skip any of the lectures as they are very very important. And since he is so witty and funny, you'd always want to attend anyway!
Prof. Willingham was a great professor!

D.W is the MAN! He keeps lectures interesting with his humor and wit, so they're always enjoyable. His exams can be a bit challenging but he's very good at making sure he has covered any material he puts on the exams. Go to lecture, read the book, and you'll be golden.
Very funny. Makes class subjects that would otherwise be boring very interesting by adding witty comments and the occasional hilarious pictures/links.
He's amazing. The class is amazing. My major is now amazing because it's PSYCHOLOGY! Truly inspired me to major in Psychology. Take this class. It's not an easy A but definitely worth it.

KINE 2000.comment: This class was fairly easy and Saliba is very entertaining. There is a lab component that is very enjoyable and helpful. The grade is not test heavy which is great.

Dr. Saliba can be kind of blunt with more sensitive topics during lecture, but the course itself is straightforward.

Very introductory-level, which can be a nice break & GPA-booster when you have some harder classes paired with it. Lab/discussions are mandatory, but involve some fun and field-specific hands on experience.
This course was generally easy if you have an interest in Kinesiology/medicine. I paired it with BIO 3410 and the course aligned nicely and often overlapped in material.

Really enjoyed this class, though the TAs did most of the teaching, they did a great job! There are several weekly assignments and lots of group work but the material is straight forward and easy to understand. Put in some effort and your grade will be great. Won't kill your grade to miss days here and there either. Never got < 88 on tests

Intro to Kinesiology is a great class, especially if you're looking to major in it. It's a great overview, and pretty easy overall. The TAs are awesome and Dr. Saliba is really cool. I would definitely recommend.

EVSC 3600.comment: I have taken two classes with Professor Grise and he is an excellent professor. If you enjoy weather or atmospheric science at all, I would absolutely recommend his class. He is incredibly passionate about his work and is very organized when teaching. If you pay attention in class vaguely, you will be fine on all the exams or labs.

Prof Grise is awesome! He's new so not many reviews yet. Very clear, very helpful, covers a lot of material at the perfect level of detail. Great for an intro atmosphere class. He's only been teaching like 3 semesters and is way better than most older profs. Also, you can tell he's super into meteorology. Would highly recommend.

This was a core class, so it is bound to be a horrible class to begin with. His accent was a little hard to understand, but you get used to it. His notes and lectures follow along with the book nicely. Read the book, go to the lectures, ask him questions, and you will be fine. His tests aren't hard and he is helpful outside of class.

EVSC 1300.comment: A well-organized, well-paced lecturer with a passion for weather forecasting, Professor Grise is definitely a professor worth having. Hes helpful outside of class and simplifies things as much as possible to make sure you have a clear understanding of material. Hes also just a friendly person in general, very approachable.

LOVED HIM, but I'm a weather geek. If EVSC isn't your thing, this class will be hard for you. Tests are tricky, but possible. Lots of extra credit opportunities, and final grades and all exams are curved. Homework is an easy grade (25%!). Great lecturer and a totally nice guy. Wants us to succeed. One of my favorite profs so far at UVA.

I took EVSC 1000 with Professor Davis. It's an intro level class, but his tests are incredibly specific and often include hard-to-read diagrams and confusingly-worded questions. Seems like a nice guy, but his lectures are very dry and his PowerPoints are almost entirely image-based so if you miss something, good luck going back and finding it.

While Professor Davis is a funny and good guy, his lectures are not very clear to the understanding of the class. While this is a 1000 level course it is much harder that I ever expected. He makes himself available outside of class, but his lectures just are not clear. He does not give enough analysis of the topic in which he is speaking on.

Davis is one of the funniest professors I've ever had. On top of that he really knows his stuff and cares deeply about the subject. Four tests and you drop the lowest. No textbook required. No final exam. If you're in need of a science credit take this class!
He's a really funny and helpful teacher. I would say he's one of my favorites at UVA and his class is not that hard. I definitely recommend him and I plan to take his 3300 level class.

Not recommended if you're not planning on being an Enviro major. I was planning on taking an easy science class and was told this would do it, but the tests are terribly designed and shamefully unfair. Tests make up all of your grade, so bad test scores can't be offset. He's a nice guy, yes, but not helpful to your GPA, not even in office hours.

ENGL 4900.comment: Professor Cushman is by far the best professor I have had in four years of undergrad. He wants to see every single one of his students succeed and is willing to support you in any way possible. He comes to class with so much enthusiasm and creates an environment where you actually enjoy learning. Truly a one of a kind professor!

Absolutely incredible professor. I took Professor Cushman's class on the recommendation of another professor at UVA and it turned out to be my favorite of the semester (by far). He's engaging, insightful, and brilliant. His feedback and attention to students is thoughtful and thorough. Take any class you can from himyou won't regret it.

SPAN 1060.comment: You will need to actively pay attention and participate. Kinda a cool guy but was often condescending and made us feel bad if we didn't know "basic things that we should know." learned a lot but there was a lot of work that we had to do. Not amazing but not a bad experience.

Professor Street is a great teacher and emphasizes "creating with the language" rather than memorization. This class was a lot of work, but it is expected out of a 4 credit class. Projects count a lot towards your grade, much more than tests, so it is important to do well on those.

Someone said here that his accent is terrible. Pay them no mind. Someone can speak a language perfectly and still have a (slight) accent. I know because I've met non-native English speakers like this. Professor Street is an excellent teacher who is very passionate about Spanish and teaching in general. I liked him a lot.

I took his class bc he was so highly reviewed here, but I don't understand why. He's useless. His accent is horrendous. He offers little explanation about grammar exceptions. I know there are limitations from the Spanish department about how class time needs to be spent, but I learned more from the one substitute professor we had than from Street.

Street is a really cool teacher. He'll help you out whenever you need it and he explains things well. The textbook is necessary; you have to bring it to class every day. The tests are similar to the study guides. I really liked having him. There are a few pop quizzes, but if you understand what he's saying in class, you'll be fine.

Prof. Street is a really nice teacher, and really wants his students to do well. There is a lot of homework, but it's like that for all of 1060. His lectures also really clarifies the textbook if you don't quit understand. I wish he taught 2010 and 2020!

By far the best language teacher I have ever had. He is understanding and nice. I would strongly recommend any student taking Span 1060 to get in his class. I really do not like spanish but his class was engaging and interesting and he kept the class well paced. I'm not very good at spanish and I still did well because he makes it understandable.
Very down to earth, easy to understand. Makes an effort to connect with students, definitely recommend. Wish he taught 201
Clear, makes class fun, very helpful. Definitely take 1060 with him

Prof. Street is a good teacher, this class is not that hard. He honestly wants everyone to pass, and he's fairly young so he gets his students. During class you will just do exercises the whole time, they're not hard, they're good practice. I would highly recommend Prof. Street.

Very nice guy, extremely easy to understand, the homework and tests are the same for SPAN 1060 no matter which teacher you have, so you definitely want the teacher whom you can understand in class, he is relaxed and cares about each of his students. Really easy to understand. I recommend him.

Absolutely loved Hogg as a professor! She was really nice and made the class engaging. Make sure that you continue on in the class if you get worried about the homework. When you start the Contraseña activities it seems like hours on end of work, but around half of the assignments aren't required! Only check the ones that are due the next morning.

Amazing Spanish professor. I absolutely disliked Spanish and was discouraged that I had to take it again in college but Professor O'Malley made it my favorite class of my first semester. He'll make you feel excited to be learning Spanish. He's the man! 100% recommend!

Span 1060 is a difficult and time consuming course. Professor Pasero-O'Malley was an EXCELLENT professor. Aways helpful and did his best to be available to students and help them succeed. He is kind and very energetic. He makes a difficult class more open and fun. Participate! But he always encourages you even if your answer is wrong!

Professor O'Malley is really into Spanish. Being in an 8AM is tough, but he comes in with a bright smile on his faces and bounces all over the place. It's really hard to not pay attention or to fall asleep because he's just everywhere, but in a good way.

Amazing teacher. She always has interesting activities to practice in class (e.g., pictionary, heads up, jeopardy, videos) and is very approachable. She knows this class is a lot of material, and she will prep you as much as possible for each exam by giving you *very helpful* advice on what to study. She is constantly reminding you of deadlines.

This is my first year at UVA and I was scared to take this course. Spanish 1060 is not a joke and you need to bring your MVP game everyday.  Professor Ortiz is not your typical lecturer at all, but, he will go out of his way to make sure you have a solid foundation of the language.  Great teacher and I hope he teaches SPAN2020 next fall.

Mrs. White is a nice teacher. The online homework in accelerated Spanish is excessive though. The Syllabus says about 8 hours a week for online homework. The tests are ok and there is a video project and a cultural paper. She talks as fast as native speakers that I know, but you get used to it. Would take again if it wasn't accelerated.

I loved Senorita White. She was a really great instructor. She does talk really fast, so it's kind of difficult when taking notes. If you don't understand something, tell her!!!
