Professor Allen knows this is a gen ed class and teaches on understanding and cultural appreciation over a billion small details you'll never remember by June. I would totally take again. Readings every week took 1 hour or so, nothing crazy but you HAVE to go to lecture he doesn't record and uses mostly the chalkboard.

Professor Allen is very passionate about this course, and he makes the content accessible to everyone. He is willing to stay after lecture to answer any questions and gives lots of guidance on how/what to study for the tests. It's important to participate in the discussion section for your own understanding and for participation credit.

Honestly really liked the class. Can be really boring, but as long as you use the study guides that he gives you, it's really easy to get an A in the class. Study for maybe 3 hours before each exam (including skimming the readings) and I promise that you'll do fine. Trust me, it's not a hard class at all.

I took his class on Eastern Religions during the summer through UVA Advanced (high school students), it was online though. And let me just tell you he is amazing! I learned a lot from him and his voice just draws you in. He is very passionate about the subject he teaches. You won't get bored, take his class!

I took this class during the pandemic so everything was recorded lectures, and he has a really animated voice to listen to, never got annoying or boring. he really takes the time to explain things from a student's perspective. would definitely recommend!

Professor Allen is a great lecturer and obviously knows what he's talking about. His class and the material needed for the class are easy. It's easy to feel sleepy in his class but as long as you know what's going on in the slightest bit, you'll get an a on his tests. Not much work outside of class.

This has been one of my favorite classes at UVa because of Professor Allen. He is such an adorable and awkward little man whose passion for his work just shines when he speaks, and he is lovely to talk to in office hours. He does a miraculous job of explaining really complicated aspects of different religions. Want to take more of his classes!!

TERRRIBLLLLEEE CLASS!!  Gosh most boring lectures I've ever attended.  Required reading checks every single day so I did the readings answered the question in the first 5 minute and left because there was no point.  Join a study guide at the end of the course and do all the readings for the reading check and you'll be fine.
Half the class leaves after the mandatory reading quizzes.  Did not learn a thing in class but learned a lot in section. Bring your computer because you will fall asleep listening to him.
He's really passionate about the subject and goes out of his way to help students.  His extra help sessions before exams were so helpful. GREAT teacher.

STAT 3220.comment: She doesn't ever lecture, flipped classroom so you watch prerecorded videos, attendance is not required (you work on classwork in class, which she goes over a little so it is helpful sometimes) unless for lab days, not that approachable/friendly if you have questions

Universally disliked (nowadays) for a reason. Genuinely a terrible person. If you have a family emergency, she will allow you no accommodations, even if your dean approved them. The class if not difficult, but you'll be teaching yourself. Condescending to students. Doesn't respect us. Unorganized and unprofessional. Avoid her if at all possible.

Very accommodating and understanding. The homework and assignments are frustrating as it's easy to lose points for seemingly little things, but exams are fair and she offers opportunities to skip out on a certain number of assignments.

This professor was very accommodating and approachable. She gave us grace and provided many areas for low performance scores to not be counted against you during a bad week. This was was very helpful, especially being a person whom struggles with mental health. Instead of stressing about my grade, I was able to take care of myself & catch up later.
Very unorganized. Delivers change in materials untimely, usually before deadlines. Not a hard class, but a horrible professor to follow along with. Self-learning is sufficient.
paul is a great guy. he is a fair grader and highly knowledgeable about the material. he wants you to do well and cares about his students. nice guy and a fair teacher.

RELB 2054.comment: very nice dude, attendance wasn't mandatory and he always made it very clear what would be on the test and what you needed to study. also pretty interesting if you pay attention. never added stress to my workload.
A fantastic professor. He talks very fast, so I had a hard time keeping up with the notes. He is VERY funny.

Germano is very poetic and really knowledgable. Pretty good about making the class interesting, tends to go off on tangents which always made me laugh. Kind of on another wavelength. Not all the readings are necessary by any means. Eva (TA) grades easily. I loved this class, it was interesting and Germano is hilarious.
Germano rambles and says a whole lot of words without really saying anything useful. The readings don't make any sense. The class is interesting, but not at all what I expected.

Ronis is a new teacher and you can tell. He goes into tangents, but he's alright overall. He got mad that too many people missed class during midterm season and started giving pop quizzes, pretty lame and high school-ish. If you're not into Buddhism or eastern studies, class can be pretty boring!

RELB 2134.comment: Fun class. The grading is a lot harder than I expected, but the TAs grade the exams. Schaeffer is a great professor, so I definitely recommend his class to anyone interested in Buddhism or Tibet.

Professor Schaeffer is passionate, helpful and always engaged. His class was fascinating, he is funny, loves to get to know students and is very encouraging to all those to talk to him. Highly recommend.

RUTR 2460.comment: I cannot explain how boring and awful her class is. She is very old school and doesn't allow any phones or computers. She thinks that she's above all. She will try to constantly correct you even though you gave the right answer just didn't word it the way she wants you to. The only B I will have this semester. Boring and snobby, do not recommend

This class is not hard if you pay attention in class and do most of the reading. Prof. Clowes is super nice, just beware that the tests require a good amount of memorization (like specific dates and artists). There are two tests and a good amount of small assignments to boost your grade.

Professor Clowes is a very considerate professor who knows a great deal on the subject of Russian culture. She assigns a decent amount of reading, but she's very realistic and doesn't expect you to necessarily finish it all. The classes can be a bit dull at times, but that's more of a question of taste and how interested one is in the material.

I think that Professor Clowes is an incredibly caring professor and really wants the best for her students. However, it is important to be warned that this is a CULTURE class, not a HISTORY class. Also, while all of the reading is super interesting, it isn't always worth it to do all of it, but it is all very interesting if you have the time.

I took this thinking it was modern Russian culture. This class is ONLY Russian history, so be forewarned. It's not that hard; study guides for the midterm and final, and no other tests or quizzes. One project at the end, group or solo, but there are basically mini essays due every day. A lot of reading but I skip a lot of it and I have an A.

STAT 5430.comment: Does not lecture. The class is more like a TA session
Grading is unclear. Professor does not teach well and does not have a strong understanding of what he is teaching.

I took this class in 2019. If you have experience in R and SAS, it will be an easy A. However, if you don't have any programming experience, you gotta work hard. All homeworks and tests are all about writing codes, so.. good luck!
This guy gives a huge amount of code work. He even failed to present us slides of requirements of the code work.

BME 2101.comment: New grading systems is bad. Take this class in the spring.

He is stubborn, likes listening to himself talk, and is just generally difficult to deal with. His new grading system is awful, it requires an unreasonable amount of perfection to get a passing score.

This professor is phenomenal! His lectures are engaging and interesting, assignments and tests are low stress, there is a large variety of assignments towards the final grade, and he gives his students a bunch of practice to efficiently learn the material. If I could take this class again, I would!

Dr. Adams is the best! He makes very complicated material fun. His class is very fair, but you do have to work hard to understand the material. He's very approachable and friendly, and he always brings his dog to the review sessions :) At the end of the year he holds a chili party at his house. GO TO IT. His chili is the best.

PHYS 5720.comment: Prof. Zheng has the right attitude towards teaching. She doesn't try to 'teach the textbook', but would work to helping us understand the material. The course is tough by definition, but I certainly felt that Prof. Zheng helped me understand the little things. Also, her constant attempts to help the class and find ways to help ppl undrstnd wasgreat

She prepared for class, though at times was unsure about her or the textbook's correctness. However, this meant that everything was carefully derived and there was no 'look at the book for the derivation' nonsense. Good introductory course with a difficulty high enough to make it worthwhile.
She worked hard to explain a lot of difficult material. Some of it still went by me, but that was due mostly to a lack of time.

Xiaochao Zheng is one of the most consistently well-prepared instructors in the department.  She moves very quickly in lecture, but is always willing to slow down to clarify a point.  I believe that this demonstrates very well her complete grasp of the material.
She prepares well for the class. Lecture notes are very well organized. But at lecture I did not get anything.

PHYS 3210.comment: To do well in this class you must spend a long time on the home works and really understand them. Professor Lee doesn't give much guidance as to what will be on the exams, but the questions are pretty close to ones that are done in class or on the homeworks. He is a very smart guy and loves physics. This class is challenging no matter who teaches.

If you can avoid 3210 with Lee, do it. His lectures are difficult to understand, which makes doing the hard homeworks frustrating. Luckily he curves like crazy at the end of the semester. This isn't a class where you're going to get 100% on everything - 70s on the midterms and final will get you around a B (if you do the HW, show up)

PHYS 8610.comment: The worse teacher I've ever met! Don't choose this! In stead of giving lectures, he divided us into small groups and make us teach ourselves, then never review his crazy homeworks! Ridiculous terrible way of teaching a advanced course! He's accent and grammar are also terrible, which make the course even more hateful!

STAT 3110.comment: I would say that your math background needs to be pretty strong for this class. There were a lot of proofs that we went over, and it's easy to get lost if you have limited calculus background. However, I do think professor Celum tried his best to make sure that everyone was on the same page, and he was helpful if you needed to talk to him.

COMM 3720.comment: Homework takes too much time and grading is harsh. Some political opinions fly also.

she mentioned entire semester how class would be curved up to the average of B+ but that was completely false. Her explanations were unclear, and both  practice problems and tests had way too many errors, making it difficult to learn. Class was highly theoretical. Tests were confusing, poorly worded, and some questions were unrelated.

Excellent professor!!! Incredibly fair and helpful. She breaks down complex concepts in ways that are easy to follow and understand, and her lectures are really enjoyable! Quizzes and tests aren't too difficult as long as you do the homework. I think her class is pretty fun. Take her! You won't regret it!

ITAL 2010.comment: Professoressa Mattioli is a true gem! She is super available outside of class and her class is generally fun and easy-going. The class is participation-heavy, but there are lots of assignments, so it's not too difficult to get a good grade in this class. Also, she gives a lot of feedback and grades assignments fast. Definitely take her class!
The best teacher in the entire Italian department by far. Could probably take someone twice her size in a fist fight.
She was awesome, but sometimes looked mad because she has quite a strong temper. I learned a lot, she speaks very much and always Italian.

GETR 3464.comment: It's been a few years since I took this course, and it remains one of my favorite courses during my time at UVA. I loved how Professor McDonald talked about Tristan and Isolde while playing music that seems to bring you back to the era. A truly magical experience! The class has inspired my passion to keep exploring Medieval literature and music.

Professor McDonald's class was interesting! You read King Arthur stories and he lectures about topics from them. You read parts of a story and articles related to the story. Every week you write a summary about two of the articles. There are two content quizzes (it's like a midterm and final). You write two papers too.

GERM 3000.comment: Herr Mac is tons of fun and really helpful DANKE! :D

CS 3130.comment: He is a smart prof, gets right to teaching. He doesn't waste time in the lecture on the logistics of the class (so that means you NEED to read the course page yourself! It's easy to miss homeworks as the timings can be inconsistent). It's a tough class but he does what he can to give you a fair grade. His clear, concise, and answers questions.

PSYC 2006.comment: I took Social Psych with Professor MacCormack in fall 2022. She seemed passionate about what she does. She records all of her lectures and gives fair exams. She is also willing to help outside of class, for me she met with me to discuss possible career paths despite not being my advisor.

EDIS 5025.comment: Professor Allen helped me a lot when I had questions.

This was my first course in education. I am in UVA's online M. Ed. program, so the class was asynchronous, primarily based on reading and assignments. She gave really great feedback on all of the assignments. This was particularly valuable because it let me see if my knowledge was translating into usable skills. I would definitely recommend her!

GCOM 7790.comment: Stefano was a pleasure to learn from.  Knowledgeable about his subject, but willing to listen to other views.  Made class fun, yet challenging.

CHEM 3410.comment: Lecture is all random tangents. Concepts are never clear. The questions on hw are never on tests. Class is online in summer, super quick, and tests are impossible so most cheat to pass (barely). This class will consume your life - beware. Buy the solutions manual and be prepared for a class where no one understands anything.

Took this class my 4th year and loved it. PChem uses equations and relations to derive meaning out of the material. Metcalf understands this and does a great job playing with the mathematics to explain what's going on. One of the better teachers at UVA's CHEM department

Really nice guy. Outstanding chem teacher. Best I had at UVA. Problem sets come every 2 weeks but aren't bad. The tests are hard, but he's a really reasonable grader. Don't consider taking p-chem with anyone but him. I promise you'll regret it

Metcalf is definitely underrated. Took class Summer 2012 and thoroughly enjoyed it. P-chem is not a good subject or enjoyable by any means, mind you, but Metcalf made it bearable and was a good lecturer and did not try to cram a bunch of information down your throat without explaining it first.

Though the course material is exceptionally tough, Professor Gahlmann was good at working through it slowly, allowing for and answering student questions in effective ways. Office hours and individual meetings with him were helpful, and I wish that I had attended more of the lectures.

Terrible at communicating material. Spends most of the class silently writing equations on the board. Everything is take home though. 3-4 problem sets, a midterm, and the final each account for a third of the grade. Very difficult questions, but generous curve at the end. Worth taking it with him for the take home tests and the curve

Really awesome professor. I really like him. He is easy to talk to, very helpful and he makes the class a lot more fun and enjoyable with the jokes he tells during class sometimes. If you get the chance to take his class you should take it and hope that he teaches second semester p-chem also.

ARTS 2670.comment: I was extremely disappointed in the lack of respect Akemi has for her students. She is jaded/ gives inflexible technical explanations, once, with no real connection to printmaking history. Her comments on technique and content were unhelpful or even confrontational. She is there to answer questions, but will give minimal or redundant information.

Clay's lectures are wonderfully clear, interesting, and hilarious!  Taught through example.  The course is work intensive, but well worth the effort.  Clay is a wealth of information (true, the info is sometimes about random glue ingredients...)

ARTS 2672.comment: This professor is one of the most amazing people I have ever met. Sure, if you do not work, then she won't be happy but, why are you at UVA if not to work hard and produce results? She takes time, she is understanding, she is brilliant-knows her techniques through and through. She is a shoulder to lean on and will get you through the hard times.

Do not take this class if you are a female athlete. No point in reading textbook- she doesn't understand the techniques in it. Also stay away from office hours... she had weird conversations with me about her personal life and likes to hear herself talk.

So helpful. THE BEST. the most helpful professor I have had at UVA. Do NOT pay attention to other comments about being a perfectionist, yes she likes clean borders, but when you get a certain kind of project that requires borders, any professor will want they clean, its embarrassing for you if they are not. I have had her for three semesters.

CHEM 1820.comment:
What is up with all the negative comments being flagged for Serbulea? Pretty convinced she's flagged them herself geez.
Ex-Serbulea student here. Don't do it. She isn't worth it.

Like you will hear from many, Professor Serbulea is very intimidating at first, but she really does care about what she teaches and the students she has. Organic chemistry is not easy, but she does a very good job of setting students up for success. Lectures are great, exams are rough if you do not take the time to study, and homework is not bad.
He often becomes confused, and is impossible to follow at times in lecture.

CS 2120.comment: While the course work can be challenging at times once you understand it, its not to terrible (took me to long to understand it). The cause of these challenges tend to come from the professor who gets off topic very easily and  glosses over some important material.

Not very professional. Does not explain concepts thoroughly and clearly. This is difficult for students who are taking discrete math for the first time. The professor's annotated notes are not very organized, which makes it hard to understand what is going on in the examples.

She has a great, energized, and inclusive attitude in the class! However, I wasn't a fan of how the class had little opportunity to boost one's grade (outside of quizzes). Overall though, even though quizzes were basically every week, the way she structures class and allows students to use notes on assessments was greatly appreciated.

Orrico might be my favorite professor I've had so far at UVA. She's such an entertaining lecturer and although her humor can be cheesy at points I think she's hilarious. She's also very friendly and approachable. Her quizzes can be pretty hard but the workload is definitely manageable. Brunelle is also great but I really enjoyed Orrico.

Professor Orrico gave very light-hearted lectures and tried to make them fun and entertaining. Considering the material is relatively stressful and hard to wrap one's head around, it generally made the class far less painful. She isn't the best at actually delivering an effective lecture in my opinion, but if you pay attention you'll be alright.

Weekly quizzes compose the whole grades. You will be given opportunity to make up any screwed-up sections on the finals. If you are satisfied with your grades, no need to take the final exam. Great lecturer, caring about her students, great sense of humor. She spends almost 10% of the time talking to her students rather than lecturing during class.

easy material and Professor Orrico super funny and just wants to make class fun. Only problem with this class is how they test you. EVERYONE in this class KNOWS the material, but the online quizzes are there to trick you. she even admitted herself that they are meant to trick you. Attendance is mandatory on fridays for quizzes which you will ace.

Disagree with the comment that the professor is disorganized. She is incredibly understanding and is always ready to help. The class is structured in a way that if you try and put in the effort, you will pass.

Although her intentions may be great, I am disappointed to say that Orrico is quite disorganized, especially with her lectures. Although the class isn't difficult, it can be a little confusing to be caught up with Orrico's method of teaching.

Very disorganized, and her lectures seem to be all over the place. Many times I find myself watching Brunelle lectures to gain the understanding I need to do well on the quizzes. However, she does make a good effort to involve students and keep content entertaining.

Elizabeth is a great person, and a very fun teacher. She can be disorganized, but she will give you the info you need to pass her class. Plenty of times has nearly given quiz answers in her reviews before quizzes, so pay attention to lectures and you'll do fine. The class itself wasn't hard, and her positive attitude made the class more fun

PSYC 2160.comment: Not a psych major, but this class was so dull it was almost impossible to sit through. Horrifically unpleasant teacher, the material clearly made sense to her but she made no effort and had no success trying to present it in a way that made sense to literally anyone else. If you want to enjoy college stay far away from Nicole Long.

Probably the worst professor I've ever had, extremely rude and makes it super difficult to get a good grade in her class. She does not want students to do well, beware because this class was an absolute nightmare no matter how much I studied.

This is now a 3000-level course, which it was not when I took it, so I can't pretend I'm not a little bitter about that. Even still, I can't pretend like I wasn't super interested in the material. Prof. Long does a solid job teaching a really interesting subject, but you really need to study hard to pass. This class is no joke, seriously.

I like this class, but it is pretty difficult. Professor Long does her best but sometimes rushes through lectures when she could have gone a little slower and more in depth. I haven't used the textbook at all, and the tests are based entirely off of the lecture powerpoints. Missing any day of lecture will be extremely detrimental.

PSYC 3160.comment: Professor Long has poor knowledge regarding the subject & often answers "I don't know but I can guess" when asked questions in class. She has only memorized material and has no humane touch to her work. I am a lover of neuro and have taken multiple neuro classes. She is the only professor who has managed to make the content dull

Prof. Long was really hard to reach and get feedback from; she doesn't let students see what they got wrong on the tests unless they make an appointment with her (or a TA). The tests were unnecessarily difficult. I enjoyed the material but it was so much effort to still get a terrible grade.

Attendance isn't mandatory and all lectures are posted online. She drops the lowest exam grade out of 3 and the lowest 5 quiz scores out of 10. Material is lecture heavy, but textbook is needed to supplement that info and only that info. Assessments can be difficult, but can also be easy once you know what information to focus on.

took this class fall 2019 and absolutely hated it. material was so interesting but lectures were just so dull. she read from the slides pretty much word for word. exams were so detail oriented. you have to memorize the material inside and out if you wanna pass. there's barely any application, just pure memorization on the most useless concepts.

CS 3102.comment: The content of this class was sooo boring, but professor Brunelle did an outstanding job at teaching it. His grading policy is clear, giving you an extra opportunity to retake two quizzes out of about six at the end of the semester. His name is under the definition of GOAT.

Amazing! Super understanding and a great lecturer. Not only is he smart, but is very good at teaching, which cannot be said for all professors. He cares about his students and is very kind and approachable.

Brunelle has been the best prof I've had in the CS dept so far. His lectures are engaging and he makes complex concepts easy to understand. The class model was a little annoying at times- you are put into a cohort of 5-7 people based on when you can meet 2x a week and you are stuck with them for the entire class. No tests tho which is great.

This was the first class Nathan's taught. He's a really great guy. He has a good grasp on the material, his classes are funny and informative, and he's always willing to help you outside of class. He's very zen. Whenever you put in the effort, he's going to make it worth your while.

Hands down one of the best professors at UVa. Not only does he do an exceptional job at explaining difficult material, he is also a wonderful person who passes on his wisdom to students. CS3102 is as hard as you make it, since you have infinite extra credit. Take advantage of this opportunity to really understand and enjoy the material.

Gabriel Robins is a fantastic professor. He really cares about the students learning and enjoying the class, as such a lot of the grade is towards attendance and extra credit opportunities. Highly reccommend
He's very smart and students respect him. However, most tested material is not taught in class but is thrown at students in large problem sets. Unnecessarily difficult.

Big worth knows his stuff, appreciate being in the presence of a master in the subject matter.  His lectures are gems, copy every little thing he writes down, him and Stankovic are the only ones I know that put in the effort to use the chalkboard and their own notes, the least students can do is put in the effort too and learn something.

Worst professorteacher I have ever had.  He mumbled through the class, handwrites (badly) his lecture notes on paper and refuses to post them, has no clear grading criteria, and basically just lets you sink or swim on your own until you hope you get a good grade at the end.

Horrible professor! never have lecture notes or any other resource online. Clearly make the class unfair to students. exams are too hard and you are likely to get terrible grades if you are not a master of the material before every single class. His handwriting is often confusing and unclear.

Only materials you have for exams are your notes and a textbook. The notes are difficult to take because he comes to class with nothing on his hand, just writes stuff on the board with unclear explanations. The textbook is not very well written, not too consistent with the exams. No resources uploaded online(no notes or practice exams).

No resources uploaded online, only study materials for exams are notes and textbook (no slides, nothing). However, difficult to take notes because he comes to class with nothing on his hand and his explanations about the material are not clear. The textbook readings are not too helpful for the exams either. Exam average is usually 50~60.

Didn't explain stuff very well (mumbling/rambling) and made the class harder than it needed to be... he catered the class to the people who clearly had mastered the material before it was even taught.

ANTH 2080.comment: She is literally so amazing, and literally my favorite professor at UVA. She is reading heavy but she is always available to help and she even gives many extra credit opportunities and always tries to make sure everyone knows what is going on. Her classes are always so informational and she is very passionate about anthropology and archaeology.
She rambles on a fair amount in lecture, DO THE READINGS. I cannot stress this enough. Class is fairly challenging if you do not, and I speak from experience.

ANTH 2800.comment: Professor is clearly very passionate about her subject and I found many of the readings quite interesting. The readings are super hefty though and she does tend to ramble a lot in lecture. Make sure you have a good TA otherwise the labs can get pretty complicated (there aren't many though)
Interesting topic and professor who loves what she teaches and knows what she is talking about but kind of boring which makes the lectures kind of tough.

Nice prof. The class wasn't bad, kinda boring though.  She's not the best lecturer and I feel like the class could have been a lot more interesting.  The tests are very detail oriented.  Know the textbook and the bolded vocab terms really well. That's where a lot of the test questions come from.

laviolette knows her stuff and it's obvious that she enjoys what she's teaching. it's important to do the readings and go over her power points. the tests ask really specific questions which make them tough but she tries really hard to give you as many points as she can. discussion sections are the saving grace for this class.

ANTR 2800.comment: The class is easy but the lectures are BORING!! This class is dry and uninteresting. I would not recommend it unless you have to take it. There are so many other classes at UVa that are more interesting and still get you an easy A if that's what you're looking for.

ANTH 3885.comment: Prof very passionate and knowledgeable about subject. You must must must do the readings and study your notes for the exams. Recommend

USEM 1580.comment: she's a really nice lady! she usually teaches anthro archeology classes, but i had her for a usem. it was on modern africa through film, so we watched an african movie every week and read a chapter and then wrote an essay about it. it was very fascinating because i am interested in africa. it's very possible to get an A if you just do the work.

Very smart teacher and class does not require much effort - just be sure to turn in your homework problems and do them well. There are 2 papers due, the first is pretty easy, work hard on the second one (due during finals) - it's not impossible.

I took The Rise and Fall of the  Soviet Union. Professor Urbanovich's lectures are fascinating. He has amazing stories about his life in the USSR. Readings can be very long and boring but his lectures make up for it. As long as you participate, you should get an A. Very easy grader. He cares more about how much you learn than grades. Great class!
Great professor. I recommend to anyone interested in russian history.

1 midterm, 1 final, and participation grade. Yuri gives a crystal clear image of Soviet history. Exams are fair as it consists of mostly core material that we talked about in class or read in the exam; only a few obscure facts are asked. Most important is still to note every single word Yuri says in class!

Professor Urbanovich is an extremely knowledgeable and caring professor.  This class really helped me understand the Soviet and post-Soviet periods of history.  Not only that, but I looked forward to the class each week because Prof Urbanovich was funny and engaging.  I would definitely take another course from Prof Urbanovich!

Ok, he's a nice guy, but beware: this is not a typical USEM.  It is a lecture, not a discussion.  If it is a discussion he tends to take over and suddenly we (the class) were wrong about something.  He's really opinionated and assigns an unearthly amount of reading.  Class was mostly made fun by Facebooking each other about the funny things he says

Dean Stewart is a great professor.  He is engaging in class and the literature he chose for the class was captivating.  He even invited us over to his house an the end of the year so that He and his wife could host us a celebratory dinner.

She's very excited about the subject and about what the students have to offer. Make sure to participate- it was a bigger part of the grade and determined more harshly than I had expected. Do the readings, be specific, and use examples in your papers.

Reading generally optional. Very little discussion, mostly lecture from Tolczyk. Interesting lectures but amazingly monotone voice; make sure to take a nap before class to avoid taking one during class. Doesn't seem to particularly care about the class. Very few mandatory assignments graded fairly generously. Brilliant professor, take this class.

Took his Appalachian USEM class, and it was great.. Which being from the Appalachian area gave me a great advantage over the NoVa kids, but still. He kept it  interesting and he's an extremely humorous, jolly man.

CHEM 4410.comment: This class is amazing. Do not be scared of what Dr. Grisham says in his syllabus about needing to study for 10 hours a week just to get a C. The best way to succeed in this class is to read the textbook before lecture and then just add to your notes with literally anything that Dr. Grisham says (anything in lecture is fair game).

I just transfered to uva from a community college so I was not sure what to expect, however he is probably one of the most understanding and chill professors ive had. The class is hard as hell but he wants everyone to get into med school so as long as you show up and try you'll get an A.
This was the most stressful class. Everyone fails all the assignments, so your grade is unclear until he assigns them at the end. I got

I was scared reading all comments here& IDK if things changed from previous years but Grisham by far the MOST caring,understanding,& inspirational prof. It says your grade is based on midterms only,in reality as long as you show care about class you will be happy w/ your grade. he pushes you hard on exams&you might get 50%but @ the end up with an A

Incredibly nice guy, just show you care and he will be really impressed. Lecture was right from the textbook, so make sure you read. Gives pop quizzes, but the average on them is so low that you shouldn't worry. Exams are very tough, and the averages will be low but he looks for improvement when assigning final grades. Project also boosts grade.

Prof Grisham is an amazing person but his class sucks. The average on the first exam was a 51%; and Grisham was HAPPY about it! People received no points for questions they got correct because the TAs didn't like how they showed their work. If you are not a biochem major and don't have to take this, take the premed biochem class instead.

Dr. Grisham is a great Biochemistry professor. He's super sweet and caring. I don't go to UVa so I wasn't sure what to expect, but hes the best science teacher I've had through all of pre-med. A very do-able class. Skim the book because he wrote it and do all of the back of book problems and you will be great! Definitely recommend taking him!

Professor Grisham loves biochemistry, making it fun to sit in his lectures. That being said, I feel that he didn't always focus on the most important topics, leaving the students to learn them on their own. His pop quizzes (which could happen in any class) were tough, but he often used similar questions on the exams, making them good study tools.
Good professor. He does make you work for it, but makes it clear what he expects you to be able to do.

Grisham is the most inconsiderate professor at UVa.  He is unhelpful, teaches directly from the book, and expects you to put in 15+ hours a week outside of class.  Our test averages were under 50 for every test, and he yelled at least once every class for our "lack of integrity."  Class is incredibly boring and you learn nothing from it.

Grisham is one of the worst professors that I have had. Going to class is next to useless because he just reads off the slides and tells you to memorize everything. He gives tests meant for 3 hours in less than an hour.  He expects around 15 to 17 hours a week outside of class in order to get a C (includes project). DO NOT TAKE unless required.

CHEM 1400.comment: Grisham is rude and uncaring. He messed up my grade, and when I told him so, he scowled me out of his office. He later emailed me admitting he was wrong, and changed the grade. He did it again the second semester, and never admitted his mistake. He is cocky and rude to deal with in person.

GERM 3510.comment: Prof. Grossman is really nice. The class requirements for HW may seem a bit heavy, but he typically reduces the courseload as the semester goes on. He's very understanding and I enjoyed the class with him! Do expect of do a lot of reading, but if you can't finish it, he'll usually let it slide :)

GETR 3742.comment: Jeff is the man. He is very kind, knowledgable, and extremely willing to help students.

GETR 3372.comment: He's a very knowledgeable and skilled professor and a really kind person. He was approachable, helpful, and encouraging. I found the readings and paper topics extremely interesting as well. I highly recommend taking a class with him; you can learn a lot without having your soul crushed.

PHYS 1655.comment: Professor Group is pretty good for CS1113/PHYS1655. I honestly learned more from the homework than from lectures, so I felt that I really didn't need to be in the room, but if you had questions, he was quick to answer them. His TAs were very helpful. Ultimately I learned a lot from the class and it was well structured, but it was hard: 8/10!

PHYS 1610.comment: I took PHYS 1610 with him, which is for physics majors. The class is naturally hard, and so yes it was still difficult with Group, but he's really nice and helpful. He's not necessarily a great teacher, but he's pretty good.
he was nice. His class wasn't that bad, but a lot of people got A-, and not A's even though that's what they expected

I love Keith!!! He's the most funny teacher I ever have! He does a lot of experiments and presentations in class, which definately makes class more interesting! And those things are helpful in learning a science class. He's very eager to help students so go to his office hours! I will recommend him 100%!!! Definately go take his class!
Enjoyed his class, but sometimes it was difficult to follow the lectures. He's a great professor who cares about his students, just a little difficult to follow...

Professor Pfister is a really nice guy, but for the life of me I never have any idea what he's talking about.  The class is super math intensive, and I would not take it without a good grounding in Calculus.  Exams are always way harder than you think they're gonna be.  Go to office hours all the time, but don't worry too much, everyone makes a B-.

EVSC 3300.comment: LOVE LOVE LOVE HER! Amazing teacher who wants to help us do well. Available outside of class. Tests are 75% (3 midterms, no final) but they're all very fair and you will do well if you study. Doesn't follow UVA grading scale (90 = A, 85 = A-, etc.) so class wasn't super stressful. Loved her, will take any other classes she teaches in the future.
Prof. Schiro is amazing. Def take this and her other Meteorology course. Get to know her during office hours. one of the few professors I have had that cares about her student's success.

Professor Schiro was incredibly passionate while lecturing, which was really great. She was definitely more invested in the material than any other professor I've had. Make sure you read the textbook and do the extra credit, but an A is very attainable.
Lots of math. Hard tests. Prof. Davis is cool but no extra credit. Not an easy A or B... throws out a lot of equations in lecture but doesn't really explain how to use them or when to use them.
Bob Davis is awesome! I love weather!

I really enjoyed this class, and Professor De Wekker clearly cared a lot about the material. The lectures were clear and the tests mostly followed the slides, but make sure you read the textbook too. I'd happily take another class with him!

One of the most boring classes I've ever taken in college.  De Wekker is inept and will put you to sleep.  He definitely enjoys the class, but it's no way to learn the (any) material.  By the end of the year I couldn't even go to lectures I was so bored.  I learned everything I know about the material through the book.  I feel  a bit cheated.

EVSC 3301.comment: The lab course was straightforward and relatively easy. Definitely take if you take the lecture as it will complement learning.

EVSC 5559.comment: This class was difficult conceptually, but Schiro gives you exams to help you learn the material and to see where her students are at in terms of understanding. The course was "curved." Asides from the grade, I came out of this class having learned so much. 10/10 take Tropical Meteorology if you can.

ENGL 3100.comment: Prof Casteen is excellent. I went into this class knowing nothing about Icelandic lit, but it is now one of my favorite subjects. He was very accommodating for anyone who was struggling due to Covid or other personal issues (even built in extra credit so everyone could boost quiz scores). Fair grader on the two papers for the course and quizzes!

ENMD 3130.comment: I took Prof. Casteen's Old Icelandic Lit in Trans class in spring of 2018, and I cannot think of another professor at The University who is more passionate about the material he teaches. He is a professor who will put students first, and he tries to be as engaging in his class as possible. Sure, there's a lot to read, but his lessons are priceless!

ARTH 1505.comment: Christa is an AMAZING professor!! I took her intro to art history:art and technology course this semester and while it was challenging to get a grasp on both aspects of the course, doing the readings, attending lecture, and participating in discussion really helps! Also, Christa is just a really chill prof who you can just talk to!

ARTH 2471.comment: attendance mandatory. not an art history major but i found the class and the way she taught the material so interesting that i ended up trying hard in it (real praise coming from someone who isn't the best student). tests are hard to study for but also fairly subjective and plenty of extra credit opportunities available
Great professor, it is easy to tell Singerman is an expert in his field and incredibly knowledgeable and passionate about art history. He also has a great sense of humor.

Art Since 1945: Singerman is the best professor I have had yet at UVa - his class is not easy and the lectures are very dense, but the amount that I took away from the class is incredible. I came out of it obsessed with Modern Art, and I use the analytical tools and just the common knowledge learned in this class nearly every day.

ARTH 3559.comment: One of the best professors in the art history department. Incredibly bright. Down to earth. You learn a lot.
not smart enough for how rude she is
Amazing! Love her and love her classes!

PHIL 3790.comment: I took her political science course. The lectures were clear and generated good discussion. The exams and papers are easy if you have been paying attention. Make sure you go and talk because participation counts.

PHIL 1510.comment: This girl is on fire. Best class I've taken at UVA.
Lectures are really interesting and it's pretty easy to do well in that class. Readings can be a little dull and there are way too many of them.

He teaches with a smile on his face and a twinkle in his eye. The subject matter feels exciting as he teaches. In small classes, he opens up the floor for debate and discussion, doing a good job of facilitating debate. He depicts ideas often through pictures and is quite an accomplished artist. Very open and approachable. I highly recommend him.

ENMC 3500.comment: Professor Luftig is easily the best professor I've had at UVA. He truly cares about his students and really really knows his stuff... but he's also super open to new student input and ideas. He can make any book interesting and relevant!
If you enjoy reading AND writing, you will probably enjoy this class. Rody is enthusiastic and helpful but doesn't just dish out good grades-- you have to put in some effort.

I was really interested in this class coming in, but unfortunately it ended up being a real drag. She doesn't have much to say about the material herself, the discussion is completely run by the students. It's easy enough, because she doesn't enforce that you do the reading, but that also made for a very boring class. Disappointing to say the least
Prof. is THE G.O.A.T. Enuf said.

What a waste of three credits. I hardly learned anything! She mostly lets students talk, and rarely offers more than vague suggestions of deeper meaning in the texts. Her lectures sound sourced by Wikipedia. She also makes you turn in drawings of monsters from the texts, so get ready for that. She is a harsh grader though- plan your papers y'all.

Chakravorty's great. Despite not having separate lecturediscussion class periods, she's really good at being able to balance the two in class. There weren't any tests, and she's a relatively tough but definitely fair grader. Gives LOTS of helpful feedback on papers and makes herself very approachable. Lectures were really interesting too.

Prof. C is a strange cookie. You're never sure if she's way ahead of her time, very timely, or just timeless. Turns out she's all three and that's cool. Her lectures are genius. Just dazzling. Who would've thought monsters--fascinating as they are--symbolize capitalism's dead labor?  But they do! Take any class with her. Sure to open your eyes.

ENMC 3810.comment: Very helpful professor. Not an easy class but it's worth the work.

I'm pretty shocked to see so many negative comments for Prof. Luftig. He really is interested in the material (Modern Irish Lit), and expects good analysis and visible effort from his students. I think he is a compassionate teacher and really wants everyone to do well.

Easily one of the best professors I've encountered at this university. His knowledge of Ireland and its literature is expansive, and he picks interesting texts for his students to read. Objective tests are fairly simple if you study, but he's a bit tougher when it comes to grading essays. Loves participation and really gets to know his students.

EDIS 2010.comment: Easy class that I learned lots from. Professor Wilson is the BEST.

First of all, she's probably the nicest person  I've ever met. She's constantly willing to joke around with students and really connects with each student's perspective. Her class is also super easy. She doesn't make this any harder than it should be. A+ isn't an option, but there' no reason not to get an A unless you don't do the work.

Worst online class experience ever. Modules are made up of "lectures" that don't teach anything, assignments are uninformative, and weekly discussion boards are just busy work. Worst part is the group proj. at the end where we have to "present" a PowerPoint to the class. There's no sense in doing a group proj to an ONLINE ASYNCH class.

Professor Trent is an inspirational teacher. The class is not difficult, he assigns a good amount of reading assignments, but he went over most of them in class, and I rarely read them and did fine. I wasn't sure how I felt about the class at the beginning of the semester, but by the end I absolutely loved it.
Super easy class. You learn about issues in K-12 education and you hardly have homework

Prof. Plaskon is one of the most engaging teachers I've ever had. His class is based on participation. There are a lot of handouts and a lot of grades, but it's easy as long as you pay attention and show up to class. I had a lot of  fun in this class, and in the field experience that went along with it. Good intro to teaching as a profession!

This class was very easy. If you turn your stuff in, then you're good. The deadlines for assignments are not strictly enforced ever. I love Professor Plaskon, but he wastes a lot of time. I didn't learn much about anything.

PHYS 2310.comment: Avoid this professor, his lectures bored me to tears and he teaches with a very condescending attitude.

BIOL 1210.comment: I loved Professor Seidel. She is such a kind person and her advice about outlook and mindset were really transformational for my classes going forward. Her office hours were easily accessible. Quizzes were worth 60% but werent too difficult.

Dean Seidel is an amazing person. She genuinely cares about her students' well-being and how we are absorbing the information. After each unit theres a paper we have to write to make sure we understand the concepts. Each unit last for about 2 weeks. Her lectures can be all over the place, so its important to pay attention, and go to office hours
She is disorganized and has a vague way of rambling through her lectures, jumping from topic to topic. I did not appreciate her "quirkiness."

Once you learn her teaching style, this class is great! At first I didn't understand her "conceptual" teaching method, but I quickly picked it up. She and her course materials are accessible to ensure that you learn and succeed. Seidel cares so much about students. Take the class, go to the class, and love the class!

Professor Seidel is awesome. She's very nice and inviting. Ask questions if you need to. Material is easy. I didn't have to touch my book at all, and I haven't once. The book is a good reference if you need to go over something you don't understand. Again, ask her questions if you need to. This class is lecture-based. Go to class!

She's one of those few professors that truly care about her students. Dean Seidel has a quirky, funny personality, and is always willing to help. She remembers your name once you go to her office hours enough too! Class is difficult; she emphasizes understanding and asks you quiz/test questions in her own way. Phenomenal human being. Received a B.

Awesome prof, she genuinely loves biology and it shows in her ability to teach. She cares about her students and is very approachable if you have a problem. Tests are fair and allow for application of knowledge rather than repeating memorized facts. Definitely recommend.

She is an incredible teacher. Not only will she know every students' name but she truly wants them to succeed.  She goes out of her way to make sure that her students are not just memorizing but actually understanding and enjoying the material that she is presenting.  Having her has been an incredible blessing as I am now more prepared for A&P.

I can say that this was the best class I've ever taken. Seidel is  so enthusiastic about what she teaches and it makes you want to learn. It was a bit hard to adjust to, but it really helps you learn to think. She really cares about her students, as well. =)

BIO 1210.comment: Roundabout lectures and vague instructions.  Would not recommend at all.

I would not recommend this class to anyone that does not have any interest in the topic. The professor is a really nice quirky lady however, it can sometimes be overwhelming. She teaches big concepts which are easy to understand after you get the hang of it. The lectures tend to be disorganized.

Don't let the class freak you out at the beginning, it actually turned out to be quite easy. Although most of the information is the same as in AP/IB bio classes, Professor Seidel makes you learn the larger concepts and apply them rather than the minute details. She is very quirky, but definitely wants all her students to succeed.

BIOL 9999.comment: Okay, I never had her as a professor, but i did have her as a dean.  She is, without a doubt, the BEST administrator i have ever had the pleasure of confronting (my grades weren't so great--she did not give up on me as many other "advisors" have. "not college material", my ass.).  She truly cares about students.

ANTH 7450.comment: I had 2 classes with Prof. Danziger and they were informative, well structured with moderate amount of reading material. Always available to students with questions and has reasonable expectations. UPenn educated, she caters to those who want to learn. If u think its unfair to be graded on attendence or her lectures r boring-UVA is not for u then.

PLCP 2420.comment: I enjoyed this prof because he cared a lot about students and made lectures accessible and easy to understand. There was a lot of reading, but it was manageable as long as you do the discussion post. The material was interesting and class discussions were as well. There were opportunities for extra credit. Clear feedback was given.

This class should be considered theory not plcp. Unless you love Marx,foucault and those kind of authors you will be miserable. Literally the lowest grade I have ever gotten at UVA, and the TA  is a nightmare super smart guy and nice but the harshest grader ever and neither can explain the material well if you need helP

There was a huge amount of reading, which was hard to keep up with. Besides that, though, I really liked the class! His lectures were interesting, thought provoking, and he loved to engage the students in discussion. My only class where I didn't miss a single lecture.

Do not take this professor...ridiculous amount of reading assigments...and don't even think of writing a paper that displays any sort of thinking out of line with his favorites...stay clear. only 2 A-'s in the class.

PLCP 3031.comment: First few weeks of the class i thought it was going to be easy, but it turned out to be the most unorganized class. I didn't get a grade back since mid october. I have no idea how i got my final grade. Its as if he just made it up and gave everybody a B. Don't take if you care about having a high GPA.

PLCP 4652.comment: Does not make plans for class, and as such is highly tangential, never covers all of what he intends to, and quickly and consistently loses the students' interest. Fully 80% of the kids in my class spent the whole time browsing fb. That said, a very nice guy in person and a truly passionate wonk about his subject-just not meant to be a teacher.

ENGL 2508.comment: I truly hated this course despite loving reading and writing. The prof has unclear grading standards and only graded one of the three assignments. The assignments were weighted 25, 50, 25. The lectures consisted of the prof rambling on about the book, with no clear organization, no connection to any assignment, and no relevance to the student.

Professor Griffin is extremely kind and easygoing. She will happily work with you to find a solution to any problem you may be experiencing. The course readings were incredibly interesting and engaging.

Cristina is amazing. Her class for my ENWR was easy (gender and gothic), but I felt like I was really getting something done. She spaces out assignments well, gives extensions, supports all the arguments you make no matter how half baked. Easily one of my favorite professors so far.

He is a really nice guy that assigns the amount of work I would expect from a college English class. His choice of books was very good and he continuously tried to keep the course interesting throughout the semester.

ENRN 3130.comment: This professor is brilliant, but you need to be well-read and intelligent to keep up with him. He can be hard to follow, but he is the smartest person I've ever met. His classes are absolutely worth taking. He is also incredibly helpful one on one. Thought-provoking, astounding--the perfect absent-minded professor.

PLIR 3060.comment: This review is for PLIR4150. Over a 100 pages of reading per class period; information is fascinating if you're interested in international affairs. Professor uses interactive methods to showcase course material. Professor himself is snide, crass, and interrupts students consistently when they speak. Would take class again without this Professor.

Lectures were super engaging, material is difficult & MUST do readings to follow along + get higher than a C on exams (all essays). But the content is v interesting, highly recommend to anyone interested in world affairs+politics. Annoying that we had to purchase his own book but it was a good read. Nothing is posted so attendance is necessary.
Clear and unambiguous.  Lectures from start of class to finish with no interruption.  Discussion section attendance recommended.

ENGL 3025.comment: Disappointed and upset prof could not be bothered to show up on time, and would often leave early. The "lectures" are just quotes from readings copied and pasted on a PowerPoint. She was inaccessible,NEVER offered constructive help, and syllabus wasn't followed at all. The grades were done at the end of the year and I can't believe I paid for this.

Class was great. Professor clearly knows her stuff. Very encouraging. She is big on discussion so be sure to read and be ready to talk. I took her as a senior, wish I could have taken more classes with her.

APMA 1111.comment: Pisano is a great teacher. If you DO THE PRACTICE PROBLEMS, you will get an A. I skipped maybe the majority of classes, but kept up with the practice problems and I have an A going into finals (while many are failing). Just do practice, study for quizzes and tests, and don't listen to the kids who don't do practice as they complain about failing.

PLPT 4070.comment: Honestly you can get by without doing much reading and just listen in the lectures. He loves to talk and sometimes it's too much because it makes it difficult for students to ask questions. Super nice guy and good professor but fairly unorganized. Would still recommend him for a fairly easy class.

Had professor Klosko online but I wish this class was in-person. Professor Klosko is a great lecturer; he knows how to keep it light-hearted and funny while still sticking to the material. Not hard to achieve a good grade if you attend class and do the readings. 100% would take again if I could.
This was such an interesting course but Klosko is definitely a harsh grader
Klosko's great. Loved this class so much, I'd take it a second time if I could.

PLPT 3010.comment: I LOVED Klosko. His lectures are clear and interesting and you know what is expected of you. Great Professor.

PLPT 3012.comment: Prof. Klosko is clearly smart, an enganging lecturer and well-versed on the 'great books' he teaches.  Take political theory.

HIEA 2101.comment: Seeley really cares about his students and will read your final essay as long as look over the ID terms if you ask him. He is also super quick to reply back to emails.
the syllabus is easy but he is a ridiculous grader. there's no way of telling what he is looking for on the quiz and the essays. the only way to make an A in this class is to kiss his ass

ENGL 2506.comment:
pls do not take a class with this professor unless it is life or death. Here's why:
-uncaring and inconsiderate, absolutely no sympathy for students
-doesn't respond to emails and is very picky about how they're written
-changes rules last minute
-condescending and loves to lecture in the most convoluted ways
-assignments will make 0 sense 
etc!!

*note: reviewing ENGL 2500* Jost means well, but doesn't do the best job of showing it. Quick grader, but a lazy prof who just wants to hear himself talk. Only allows 2 absences. Will treat you like a child. You have no idea how you're being graded and he refuses to tell you. An EXTREMELY unorganized man. Only take him if you have no other choice.

He's a very nice person, but his lectures are long-winded and confusing, and his class is not very well organized. He does not stick to the syllabus and often gives assignments orally without any written follow-up, so the grading criteria are very unclear. If you take intro to poetry, DON'T buy the textbooks. I didn't gain much from the class.

Prof. Ramazani is fantastic! He is incredibly kind and very encouraging. Some of the most in-depth feedback I've ever received on an essay in college has been from this course. Show up to class and start your essays a few days early, and you will be fine. Scheduling office hours can be really useful if you need help. Would recommend!

Professor Ramazani is a supportive and intelligent professor. You can tell he really values the voices of his students. He grades papers very quickly and gives extensive feedback on them. No matter your interest in poetry, Ramazani will undoubtedly introduce you to new works and make you appreciate them. I'd take this class again if I could!

Professor Ramazani is an amazing person and very good prof, very respected at the university. However, he gives very little expectations for writing and is a VERY hard grader. Despite my best efforts I think he did not care for my writing style, and I was never able to push into the A range for him, which was very frustrating

Jahan makes poetry very interesting, and tries really hard to make content current and applicable to everyday life. His focus on Black art and artists in Fall 2020 was a huge eye-opener for me (white student).

Her american poetry class is so manageable, with short readings (since they are poems). Barely any work outside of class, except for when there are papers due. The first and last essays are 2-4 pages, and the middle two are 5-7 pages. You also have to make 2 poetry memes for 10%. The discussions are chill, and the class satisfies SWR.

CPLT 2010.comment: Lectures are confusing, discussion saves your grade.

Jost is a really nice guy, but he has no idea how to give a lecture. He rambled for an hour and a half about nothing remotely important. Attendance is not needed whatsoever, just figure out when the papers are due and show up to turn them in. An easy class if you are a good writer.

Superlatives I would use to describe her are knowledgeable and passionate for CPLT. She gives constructive feedback on essays which is great because improvement is rewarded in this class - good incentive for hard work. Christian's lectures in discussion were vital for clarification of the texts! It was a true pleasure to have such a fantastic TA.

Professor Howard was extremely helpful throughout the course of taking this class.  She is very knowledgeable, and has a lot of interesting ideas about the texts.  Conversation during discussions is very beneficial.  She also gives out a final review, and grades all your papers, so she's an important person to listen to

When the dismal lectures seemed almost impossible to comprehend, Christian cleared the way for understanding. She is intelligible on every topic and gives great insight to discussions. While she's a tough grader, she gives very constructive criticism. I owe any and all success to her as my TA because I would've essentially failed without her.
She made some pretty impossible lectures comprehensible as my TA. Bit of a tough grader but I definitely got better as the semester went on. Made discussions interesting. Definitely recommend.

I really enjoyed having Christian as my TA for my comparative literature class. She always clarified any questions we had from lectures and was very enthusiastic and caring. I would definitely recommend taking a class with her or choosing her as your TA!

ENGL 2010.comment: Assigns a ton of reading. His lectures are abstract and often not connected to the papers he assigns. He made some interesting points, but he also goes on long-winded tangents of philosophicalanalytical musings. Not a great lecturer, but a very nicegenial man in person; he loves it when students come to office hours. A good TA helps a lot.

I loved Lara. She's hilarious and relevant, and she really respects everyone's opinions. She definitely a fair grader, not an easy grader. Some of the grades she gave me I didn't like, but in retrospect, I definitely deserved the grades. I appreciate that she calls you out on your bull, and she is ALWAYS willing to talk.

ENAM 3500.comment: Without a doubt one of the best professors I've had at this school. Genuinely cares for his students. Actively tries to encourage them thinking in new perspectives. Uses lots of humor and everyday events to get his greater philosophical points across. The best.

CS 4414.comment: Worst professor I have taken in 3 years at this university. His operating systems class uses an in development language called Rust with a buggy compiler and no real world application. His assignments deal with web servers and shells and emphasize learning this language rather than operating systems.

CS 2220.comment: Professor Evans expects a lot from his students and often gives us very challenging problems. Sometimes I feel that he is too smart to know that someone might not understand what he is talking about. Despite that, he is very knowledgeable about the subject matter. I learned a great deal from his class and it was also fun to work on the projects.

CS 1120.comment: Worst class I've ever taken. EVER. If you can avoid him, do that. Sitting through lecture is like being tortured. And he's just such an awkward person to be around. He might know what he's talking about, but he certainly isn't very good at explaining himself.

Professor Evans knows just about any question you can ask him. The class is challenging for everyone, it's not as hard for people who have had programming before but still isn't easy.  Class is taught for people with no prior CS experience.  Tough course but is definitely possible to get an A if you put in the time and effort.
He wants to help all of his students. Sometimes he gets frustrated, but nonetheless he cares about his students.

This class was fun because the TAs were awesome and I made some friends so we could all suffer the time commitment together. This class definitely sucked up my time and the tests were not easy, but Weimer rewards you with a good grade in return for selling your soul to him for the semester.

The class is quite challenging and time consuming, since it's only an into level class. But Wes is absolutely a fabulous professor! He is patient, knowledgeable, humorous, and energetic all the time! He makes this class much more interesting. I recommend taking it if Wes is teaching, but be prepared for a large amount of work outside class.

LPPP 3559.comment: Professor Zimmerman is amazing. She definitely assigns a good amount of reading, but she always connects them to lectures and class discussions. The class is incredibly interesting and great for students looking into going into policy, government, nonprofits, law, or even military. She has lots of experience in the field and is very knowledgeable.

MDST 3640.comment: Worth all the hype. I was finally able to take his Breaking Bad/Better Call Saul class, and while there is ~40 pages of reading each week, it is absolutely worth the time and effort. His grading is fair, and he is extremely willing to speak with students to ensure they do their best work. His excitement about what he teaches is totally infectious.

Profound, patient, brilliant, generous. 
A passionate professor who gives eye opening lectures and encourages his students. Amazing taste
Best professor at UVA. Leads awesome class discussions. Tough grader but very willing to help you do your best work in any way he can.

MDST 3500.comment: Took Gangster FIlm with LIttle. Very little textbook usage but assigns one or two readings per week, and quizes. Quizes are easy and in a pinch you can get by with wikipediaing the movie and watching a few clips online. Very good, helpful, willing to talk, sometimes takes things a bit too far as far as analysis.

ANTH 2410.comment: Super nice guy, horribly disorganized. I had an A in this class all semester only to finish with initially a C+ from him entering grades wrong, then a B which I still believe is incorrect. DO NOT take this class for an easy A because he pulls grades from thin air. There's 0 feedback on exams and work is never graded in a timely matter.  Skip this.

Nice professor, very friendly and fun. Fairly easy but some exam questions are tricky/worth a lot of points - just make sure you know the material/do the reading. Subject and lectures were interesting, although group projects could get tedious.

CLAS 2040.comment: She's really passionate about Greek Mythology and really eager to teach it. She explains the myths and concepts really well and makes funny jokes and comments during some classes. I recommend Greek Myth if you have any interest in it. There are quite a few texts/books you will need and read throughout the course, but most are interesting.

Prof Evans is super nice. His lectures, though a lot, are meaningful and focused on the readings and providing background. His comedic side needs growth but he means well. Would seriously take his class again.

BIOL 4310.comment: Lectures are jam-packed with information and sometimes I wish he would add a 5 minute break in the middle. Overall, and amazing professor though.
One of the best professors at UVA. Really taught some neat things and very engaging. Exams were cake. This class didn't require a lot of work....

BIO 3170.comment: He Is not a good proffsor at all, for all of you who feel you don't understand him in the first classes just drop his class and don't waste time, he is not clear, his exmas are super hard, to be fair he has a nice character but if you wanna get good grade in his class you have to study neuro 24/7 if not you'll definetley fail his class!

SPAN 1020.comment: Professor Neff is the best professor for anyone who is taking Spanish for the first time. She is very patient and pushes her students to speak in Spanish in class. She is a sweetheart and always makes herself available to students outside of the classroom. She is very understanding and tries to make the lectures fun at times for the students. AMAZI

Professor Neff is by far my favorite professor at UVA. Not only is she extremely passionate about teaching Spanish, she truly wants all of her students to learn and be successful. If you put the effort in and do the assignments, you will get a good grade, both in 1010 and 1020.

SPAN 1010.comment: Very talented professor who has an ability to be understandable to someone who has never learned a word of Spanish. She is gifted in this sense and it allowed me to be able to pick up on so many parts of the language simply from paying attention to her.

Professor Neff really taught the introductory course extremely well. She comes to class very prepared and creates a welcoming environment that allows everybody to feel comfortable. Learning a new language can be difficult, but she really helps and allows students the chance to learn. I'm excited to take the next semester with her.

She was absolutely amazing for both SPAN 1010 and SPAN 1020.  She goes above and beyond the rest of the intro level teachers to help you understand what she's trying to convey if you're not quite getting the Spanish. She gives excellent feedback and has a variety of in-class activities to make the material more relevant.

Easily one of my favorite professors. She is extremely passionate and caring. Unfortunately, the course itself has lots of annoying hw to do but if you just do it you'll be fine. She is easy to meet with and very helpful. Put the work in and you can definitely get an A. I am taking her again for 1020 and am super excited!

A very nice person. There's rarely English during class even you come to the class with no knowledge of Spanish. THERE ARE A LOT OF HOMEWORK and they's due every Sunday to Thursday. And you have to do a video project about Spanish speaking country's culture. Generally the class is not hard as long as you study.
Profesora is awesome! She is extremely nice and always helpful! She responds promptly to emails and even made me consider becoming a spanish major! Definitely take this class (101) with her!

MDST 3140.comment: Professor Freedman is so wonderful! He's very enigmatic and clearly passionate about his work. Awesome guy, awesome class!

Prof Freedman is the bomb!! He is so funny, quick and inspirational. I was always excited for class (despite being at 9am)- Mass Media Am Politics was such a cool, eye-opening course esp. during the election. Freedman is so passionate and has published his own studies. Careful, he will include very specific details from lecture in the quizzes.

PLAP 3160.comment: Took this course during May Term at UVa's Morven Farm. Really enjoyed this interesting course and the chance to interact with Prof Freedman in a smaller class setting. Although this class is somewhat intense because it meets for five hours a day for ten days, it was fun and very worthwhile.

Professor Freedman is wonderful. His lectures are always interesting and animated. Although the class I took with him was 5 hours per day for 10 days, I was never bored. He is very accessible and happy to help with paper topics, reading questions, etc. I highly recommend taking any of the courses he teaches.

PLAP 2500.comment: Freedman is entertaining and funny. I hope to take one of his classes again. First A I ever received in college!

I took Freedman's summer Political Advertising course. Freedman is an amazing lecturer, and he's pretty funny. His class is easy if you skim the required books, participate, and pay attention in class. He does not try to trick you on the midterm/final; the questions are VERY straight-forward. Overall, the class was pretty easy. I received an A.

RELG 2210.comment: Professor Jenkins very much cares about the material he presents. The papers are all graded by TAs but I have never heard of anyone being graded harshly. The word count for the papers are also pretty short. The online discussion section is very easy - discussion posts are biweekly and for completion. Very thoughtful and entertaining Professor.

Did not do any of the grading but was probably the best lecturer I've ever had. His slides are informative and interesting and his passion for the topic is so evident. He was willing to meet outside of class to talk about my career path and general interests even in a class of 300. I 100% recommend it to everybody.

One of the best lecturers I have had here in my two years. He takes very complex readings and topics and makes them so interesting and engaging yet easy to understand. Readings are a lot but he does such a good job of breaking them down and explaining them it is worth it. I would 100% listen to him lecture again. 10/10. He is very knowledgeable.
I LOVE THIS GUY!!! SUPER SUPER SUPER EASY and interesting. He's literally the best!!! His classes are extremely interesting yet very easy.. trust me! You will learn from the best

PAVS 4500.comment: Fantastic guy. Endearing, funny, and scintillatingly smart. Top 3 professors ever at UVA. He shook my foundations of everything I ever thought I knew.

EVSC 4290.comment: Professor Pace teaches limnology, a topic he has a lot of experience and appreciation for. His lectures are very interesting and tests are not made to trick you in anyway. Not a lot of outside work despite a very small project every now and then and studying for the tests. Make sure to study well for the tests as they count a lot for your grade.

EVSC 4250.comment: This is my third class with Pace (Ecology, Limnology, Ecosystem Ecology). He is an awesome professor! His classes are easy (he posts slides online), but you learn a lot. He is very helpful with projects and papers that are due.

EVSC 4050.comment: Goes off on random tangents, tests are filled with random, minute details, syllabus is at least a decade old and hasn't been updated. Weekly labs are boring, tedious, and not helpful. Class is difficult to sit through and Canvas page barely has any information on it about class or assignment expectations. Do not take this class if you don't have to

Great guy, Macko's got a heart the size of a small blue whale, which are not, in fact, small.  Take the class (2050 or 4050!) and learn cool stuff about the ocean. Macko's a pro, he's been doin it for ages!

It's important to do the reading because most of the test material comes straight out of the book, but it's interesting and not difficult to understand. The labs were tricky, but if you go to office hours the TA will give you the answers to all of the questions. There were several extra credit opportunities. Overall easy class.

This class is a breeze. Tests are very easy. It can be quite boring, however. Attendance is not mandatory. Labs can be a bit tricky but if you talk to him he'll push you in the right direction. Take it, especially the 400 level class, its not much harder at all, just a paper at the end which is on whatever you want.

EVSC 2050.comment: I took EVGE 5850 (not EVSC2050) class with professor Macko in fall 2021. He is a very nice and humorous lecturer. Labs in this class were pretty fair and useful and could learn a lot from them. Sometimes he also gave real life problems. No exams in this class but there would be final paper and presentation in your final week.

Took his oceanography class over the Summer in the UVA Advance Program and absolutely loved him. He is a great teacher, although he does go off-topic at times, however, his class is very engaging and is willing to answer all questions.

Took the class this summer. The class is entirely based on labs and multiple-choice tests. There is a textbook and you need to definitely read it regularly. Tests are fairly difficult and refer to specific information. Grades are very curved though, so an 80 is an A. Labs are very tedious and tricky. Personally, I found them to be annoying and hard
Dynamite professor. Lots of experiences. Grade on curve. Go to class and read the book.
Do the readings, go to class. Fair grading scheme. You get to throw one test grade away. Tells lots of stories based on experiences.

pretty hard class.. the only grades are labs and multiple choice tests. ALWAYS go to the TA's during office hours bc they give all the lab answers. The tests are VERY tricky, they mostly focus on random minuscule details and his lectures are unorganized and confusing. Just take the 4050, it has more grades so its easier and more room for error.
Wide knowledge of the Ocean. Has lots of experiences to relate to. Gives "pop quizzes " for extra credit. Will find time to just chat. Go to class!
Lots of Stories based on his experiences. Curved  grades. Go to class. Tests are based on information covered in class.

Macko is a bit of an odd bird (but what EnviSci professor isnt?) but entertaining enough for a pretty boring subject matter.
