Labs are take-home and pretty easy, and his tests are all multiple choice and allow for extra credit. You will fall behind schedule, Macko will tell the same oceanography stories over and over again. Straightforward class.
Go to class, read the book. Grades on a curve.
good class. Go to class and do the readings= good grade

I took this class this past summer as my first semester. His class is challenging if you don't put time into it. Definitely make use of office hours, ask questions, read the book, and do the practice quizzes on his website. The labs can be tricky. He's really passionate about what he teaches. Super nice and inspiring.
hard tests. labs useful, but easy to get an A on them- done outside of class

GET OUT OF THIS CLASS!!! There is a huge curve which makes the class GPA like it is, but the labs are hard and the exams are impossible. What he lectures about is not on the exam. It all comes from the book and the key terms he puts online. I worked my ass off on the labs and I still got an 80 average. Terrible lecturer.

I took Macko's summer Oceanography course. The class was fun, and Macko is a great professor & person; he's also very helpful. Attendance isn't required, but you'll want to come to class because Macko's really engaging and he brings in interesting things. Pay attention in class, read the book, and you'll be fine. The labs & tests require thought!
Good Professor and fairly easy class. Lecture is usually pretty boring, but it isn't really mandatory. Tests are easy and fair.

ENNC 3500.comment: Cristina is warm, funny, and extremely intelligent. She's got a fantastic memory and makes a strong effort to know every student inside and outside the classroom. One of the kindest, most brilliant and articulate professors I've had the pleasure of getting to know. Ask her about her love for the Great British Baking Show!

This class isn't exactly an easy A; you have to work for it.  That being said, Ann puts in a lot of effort to help and if you put in the work by reading and doing assignments in a reasonable amount of time, there's no reason why you shouldn't do well.  You should be prepared to read A LOT and write a discussion post for every class.
Professor Booth is passionate about what she teaches  and speaks accurately about the subject. Her class is run like a discussion but she gives talks and is always the master of what's going on.

ISSS 3180.comment: Professor Guttman has a lot of experience in his field; he knows his stuff. We have a weekly writing assignment and class discussion. Everyone has a time to speak and to share their opinion. The class is very predictable, and there is no variety. He is kind but can be difficult to communicate with outside of class.

Expert in his field with tons of experience, and great stories to provide additional context for class material. Very fair grader, encourages participation, and quick to respond outside of class. I learned so much from the weekly papers!

Not a lot of lecturing and no note taking required. Lots of open discussions between students guided by prof. Prof is balanced/fair in presenting political issues and great at navigating controversial/sensitive topics. Prof runs class in a way that helps us listen to each other and express our own views. An expert in the field he teaches.

PHYS 3420.comment: Asked professor for guidance ahead of an exam and he insulted me. Does not want students to succeed.
Awful. Didn't curve grades, even smart kids got horrible grades. Doesn't explain anything. Just avoid any class that he teaches, even though he is brilliant.

HIEU 2112.comment: Uptight and with odd rules such as requiring the purchase of physical texts instead of ebooks despite having absolutely no stated and or logical reason as texts were only ever read outside of class time. Lectures were not suitable to notetaking and felt almost pointless to attend.

Linstrum is really a great professor. I love going to lecture and, although I could have skipped many times, I never wanted to. He gave lecture outlines at the begging of every class that really helped me structure my notes. Only two papers, neither are very long or difficult. The TA was very good at helping to understand things. 10/10 would take!
Fantastic professor who kept me engaged with both interesting lectures and assignments; I would highly recommend the class to anyone with an interest in European History.
He's a TA, and a good one.  He works hard when the students won't.  The one lecture he gave was good.  He reminds me of Jim Broadbent's portrayal of Professor Slughorn.

HIEU 3152.comment: My favorite professor at UVA.  Really knows the material and is always happy to help!

Linstrum is a young guy who's very active and happy to be teaching. He gives out helpful course outlines and makes expectations clear. The readings are very long, but you can get by without reading every detail. For someone teaching about the British Empire, he really doesn't seem to like Britain, and teaches with an agenda, but I got by that soon.

One of my top 3 professors at UVa.   Linstrum is relatively new to UVa but that just means he gives his students that  much more individual attention. If you try in this class and go to office hours, you can get an B+/A. Absolutely adore him. His knowledge of the British Empire is impressive and he's so passionate.

HIEU 1502.comment: Great course! Professor Linstrum is very approachable and really encourages you to participate.

I had Professor Floyd in the Spring for another class that was held asynchronously and it was really good. He has clear expectations and asks you questions to push you to think outside the box. I am taking this class with him again as I like the subject matter. As long as you try, he will help you.
Jane Austen - great class, great readings, interesting assignments, great professor.

SPAN 3040.comment: I had her for Business Spanish, and she really is an amazing person, but the workload for the class is kind of crazy. You always have to be on top of things because deadlines are almost always back-to-back. This class consists of a lot of projects and group work, but she is always there to help and if you like business, then def take the class!

SPAN 3020.comment: She gives a lot of unnecessary homework and makes everyone do blog posts for every reading through Collab. This class is more about culture than it is about grammar. When we do grammar, though, it's very easy. I would have liked to take this class with a different professor. She a very nice person, but my Spanish didn't improve.

POVEDA IS AMAZING. She is engaging and helpful, really eager to help her students but also wants them to learn how to write better and how to understand deeper topics (biculturalism, identity, immigration) better. Her use of vosotros is a bit off-putting at first but it's not difficult to get used to.

I have Señor Ortiz currently for SPAN 3020. While it is a challenging course, Ortiz is so helpful and absolutely hysterical. He always makes us laugh in class and I can honestly say I'm learning a lot. He will give pop quizzes if he thinks the class is slacking on readings. Besides that, he gives great feedback on essays and is very knowledgable.
Really encourages students to participate. She's patient with students who struggle and holds lots of office hours.

I think she is fantastic. She is really understanding and very nice. Apart from her personality, she really taught me a lot, and I definitely came out of her class with a stronger grasp of the Spanish language as a whole, despite its focus on writing.

She has a great amount of interest in Hispanic culture. She's lived abroad and integrates her experiences there into the class. In addition to teaching us to write well, she loves discussing controversial issues in the Hispanic community. Only negative: She takes a long time (understandably) to return papers, so it's hard to know how you're doing.

I had her twice for 202 and 3020 and I love her!Very friendly and, as someone else commented,always smiling and also funny which makes class much more enjoyable.I'm not sure if she's teaching anymore after this year, but if she is, I definitely recommend her. Amazing person and great teacher!

BIOL 3250.comment: Very, very difficult to understand. His lectures are trailing and lack focus. You'll do well if you rely on the textbook and learn it inside out, but don't expect to get anything from the lectures.
Prof Kawasaki is the best. He's hard to understand at times but lectures are very interesting. I recommend this class.

Worst Class at the University.  No clear expectations, he does not outline or stress important information, tests are entirely comprised of trick questions and the professor seems disinterested in providing help. A shame because it should be a fun course, do not take if you don't have to.

Great class if you are interested in the subject material, animal behavior.  Probably not a good class if you prefer the molecular realm of biology.  Tests are relatively easy if you study, just like any other class.  He gives extra credit just for attending class.  Videos in class every Friday are a nice break, and they can be pretty entertaining.

One of the most uninteresting and worst classes I have ever taken. Makes his tests cryptic for no reason at all. Intentionally tries to trick students. Unhelpful once asked for clarification and he told me to use the glossary. Spends one class period a week watching a video which are extremely boring and not useful to the class at all.

ENWR 3610.comment: I had Sydney Blair for a few creative writing workshops back in college, and she was by far my favorite professor. She line-edited every single student's story and was so generous with her feedback--it meant the world to have my writing taken seriously. I wanted to be just like her and try to approach my own students' work in the same way today.

She is a great fiction writing professor.  Her advice is spot on.  She creates a safe environment where writers can share their stories.  She is encouraging and very willing to meet outside of class to give story tips and advice.  She was extremely helpful and gives excellent feedback.  Not a tremendous amount of work.  Loved it.

PLAP 1010.comment: This guy is boring beyond belief. He stands at the front of the room and rambles with no slides and no chalkboard. Getting a good TA is vital to make this class not take way more effort than a 1010 class should because god knows the lectures are not going to help you.

I wasn't sure what to expect with Professor Ceaser going into PLAP 1010, but I was pleasantly surprised. He did go off on tangents during lectures, but his demeanor makes lectures feel like you're listening to your grandfather talking. 

I had a great TA, and I'm unsure of how the other TA was. This was an enjoyable class, I recommend it and Ceaser

I got a B- in a 1010 intro to American politics class. How? This should be one of the easiest classes you could take. Prof. Ceaser is terrible, I would leave his lectures with maybe 3 bullet points of notes because the lectures have nothing to do with the material. He goes on random tangents for what seems like hours. Awful lecturer.

Ceasar's lectures are extremely boring and tangential, and often have little to do with the readings. I often find it hard to take notes because he simply stands in the corner of the room and rambles with seemingly no direction. I have yet to see him write anything on the chalkboard or use any form of presentation.

Professor Ceaser is a great lecturer. He sometimes goes on tangents, but he always talks about current politics and tries to keep the mood light while lecturing. There was a lot of reading per week that was necessary for the discussion. Both primary sources and textbook readings were needed for the final.

He does tend to ramble in lecture but throws in funny tidbits. He's very knowledgeable. Reading is easy. It's an easy class because it's material you learn in high school civics or just by being aware of your own political system. Overall I enjoyed the class. Some people describe him as a "cute old man". I missed 50% of lectures and received an A

Professor Ceaser's lectures are incredibly boring, but that's okay because the material is so basic you won't learn anything from them. It's an easy A if you know anything about American politics. Most students skip lecture, and only attend sections which are mostly a review the readings.

I think I went to a total of 3 lectures and still managed to get by with a B. The class should be easy; it's essentially just a review of high school Civ/AP Gov, but the readings are dry and lengthy and Ceaser is getting too old and distracted to keep up each lecture engaged and interesting. Only 2 exams with a lot of specific multiple choice Qs.

Interesting class, and Ceaser is hilarious. He tends to ramble, but if you listen, you'll still hear the desired main points of the lecture. Not the most difficult with two papers, two exams, and weekly discussion sections(go, they help). Overall, would recommend.

Lectures are boring, unfocused and clearly supporting his own right wing ideology. If you know anything at all about American politics, do not take his class. The lecture hall is almost empty because so many students skip class
He smiles the whole time! Which makes me smile lol

Ceaser is a wonderful professor who is truly passionate about what he is teaching. Though his lectures may seem boring to others, those who actually pay attention will appreciate his sense of humor and stunning good looks. This class is sure to be the highlight of your semester, for more reasons than one.

Despite having a large class size of 300-400 students, Dr. Sabato makes a sincere effort to make himself available immediately after class and tries to create a personalized connection with students.  His lectures are solid and have many personal anecdotes that maintain interest.  He does not spoon-feed the material.

This class killed my interest in politics.Like the gridlock in DC, Sabato and my TA love to hear themselves talk but say nothing. The TA you get is critical. I hear some care. Mine does not except about hearing himself speak. Little guidance in what to study. Exams are set up to twist and turn meanings. Speakers are great though. Class is not.

Nothing pleases Sabato more than hearing himself talk. And every sentence he says he has a freakout. Lectures aren't very important. TA's DO matter though. They do all your grading.  Carah Ong was my TA and she was awesome. Try to snag her if you can.
Okay. 2 tests. 1 page weekly papers. Exams are hard.

Professor Klein is kind of awesome. Makes all his lectures conversational and seems to get his point across without any difficult language or concepts. Encourages class discussion which you have to write a single-page paper on once a week. Tests aren't that difficult. Open-book, and as long as you take good notes or have a friend it's fine.

HE IS THE WORST. DO NOT TAKE ANYTHING WITH HIM. He twists everything you say to make you seem wrong then repeats your original point as correct. He makes everyone uncomfortable and doesn't teach just wants you to debate pointless things with your classmates. He also likes to pick kids out that aren't prepared. RUN AWAY.

ARAD 3100.comment: George Sampson is amazing!!! Definitely enroll in his courses!

ARAD 3330.comment: This man is simply amazing. His class is fun and he tries to eliminate as much stress as possible. Only teacher I've had that also takes a personal interest in your life and wants to help with non- class things like resumes and finding internships. Truly my all time favorite professor at UVA.

FREN 1020.comment: Professor Perrot is awesome. He really cares about his students and wants them to succeed. If you do the assigned work and study for the quizzes, you will get a good grade for sure.  He makes class fun with videos and music and he also will always schedule office hours if you are struggling or want to practice speaking French.
A fantastic French professor. Easily one of my favorite professor's on grounds

He's really laid back with homework and projects. He also makes himself available after classes or by appointments if you wanna go over certain things. His French accent is great (he's from Paris) and he's also a stickler on pronunciation in a good way. He makes classes fun with personal stories and french videos.

I loved FREN1020 with Katia, shes really attentive and understanding, her exams arent too hard if you study, and homework is on VHL which pretty much guarantees a good homework grade if you put forth effort. Very transparent about assignments and not judgmental, which was nice for an elementary level course. Highly recommend Katia.

Katell is hands down the best French teacher I've had here so far (of the two). She is clear, speaks slowly enough for you to understand, funny, and extremely approachable. There is a lot of new grammar and vocabulary in 1020 but it's not half bad with Katell. Also, she made French cake, so bonus.

FREN 1050.comment: Mathieu is easily one of my favorite profs on grounds; he really cares about his students and often asks about workload and tries to make sure he isn't overwhelming us. Offers review sessions, extra credit, and isn't a stickler about being a few minutes late or needing a little more time to complete an assignment. He made class 5x a week enjoyable!
Really great professor. Really cares about his students, makes the class a lot of fun to attend, and wants his students to succeed in understanding the material and passing his class.

Madame Labadie was so sweet! I had a very tough time in her class but she was understanding and helpful. Make sure you do all the online homework and get help ASAP when you don't get something, otherwise it will very negatively impact your grade. Labadie was a fantastic professor and I wish she was teaching 2010 next semester!
Take your class with her. She's great, accessible and cares. Can get relaxed a few times in the semester. Homework wise, the class was a grind, but it was a 4 credit class.
Loved Madame Erhlich! Would definitely recommend to anyone. She's so sweet and so helpful.

I really disliked French all throughout high school and was extremely nervous to take it again in college. I also did not want to participate at all. After the first couple days of class, I found myself loving french and participating. Chris is the best! He explains everything very well and makes the class extremely interesting and fun. A++ RATING

Great teacher.  He managed to make two and a half hour class periods bearable with his sense of humor.  The class moves fast so if you haven't taken French before I would recommend a lower level but otherwise the workload isn't bad and the tests are pretty fair.  I would highly recommend this teacher.
Sage is so great! She really made class interesting and went above and beyond to help students out. She even offered to write my recommendation for study abroad!
Sage is a really great teacher. I was not a huge French language fan going in but this class is really fun. I have done better this year then I have ever done in French. Take this class with Sage!
Sage is awesome. For an accelerated intro French course, I was a bit hesitant, but its not bad at all. Highly recommend.

HIEA 2031.comment: An amazing and knowledgeable professor of Chinese history. He made this lecture interesting in a way of telling a story about the materials that I am never bored in his class. Exams are easy since the study guide is provided and it's the same thing. Your paper and exam essays are graded by your TA, this can very impact your score.

My favorite class this semester by far. Professor Reed is a charming professor who is evidently very knowledgeable and passionate about the history he is teaching. His lectures are extremely engaging and he makes history come to life. I looked forward to every lecture and would definitely recommend this class for historical perspective requirement.

Professor Reed is one of the best professor I've had at UVa. Although his assigned readings are quite hefty, his lectures are super interesting. If you pay attention a lot in lecture, you can get away with only skimming the readings. Tests and essays are alright if you've been paying attention in lecture and discussion section.
Great, Interesting Lectures. Notes are a must. The tests were graded fairly strictly. The TA you have matters a lot.

Professor Reed seems like a nice guy, but lectures are very dry and boring. Uses a lot of complicated definitions and goes fast, making note taking difficult and stressful. Tests/papers graded harshly by TAs with little feedback. The entire class is based on 3 assignment. Dont take just for nonwestern perspective requirement.
No contest the best professor I've had in my life. I looked forward to lecture every single week. He made history come alive.
Best prof. I've ever seen in UVA. Very easygoing, very accessible outside class. Must take his class!

Took Mod China, he is an absolutely engaging lecturer -my favorite professor of the semester. The TAs do all the grading and grade midterms harshly (tip: include dates and the sig/big ideas for maximum points). Th professor definitely knows his material (organized lectures). However they simply skim the surface and reading is essential -& lot of it

HIEA 3112.comment: Greatest history professor ever!!!!! Love the way he taught the material and definitely have a deep understanding of Chinese history!

ASTR 1570.comment: Kelsey is great. She's very blunt, yet entertaining with her smart elic-ness. Her notes and lectures are very dense, and so are the readings, but she is very helpful if you have any questions. Her tests are also very fair, and she offers tons of Extra credit.

ISSS 3410.comment: Dr. Berube is a great psychology professor who cares about her students. She did not assign a lot of homework, and the workload was very manageable. She made her lectures very interesting and the class was fun.

I have been pleasantly surprised by Dr. Berube. Even if it's for an elective -- TAKE HER! What you see is what you get from her. Professors at UVA are great, but she is down to earth and her true self. She doesn't give unnecessary work compared to others, and will go the extra mile to help in any way.

Dr. Bentley is one of the newer professors at UVA; his expectations were wild for the non-traditional undergrad student. The material hardly matches up with his pre-created slide show & weekly quizzes. The online textbook was hard to navigate; assignments were very in-depth, grading took forever, and we begged for a study guide for the final.

He openly conducted an "experiment" using a premade open-ed course instead of authoring his own class. Weekly HW sometimes forced open-ed content creation; obscure software took days to learn. Grading was petty and inconsistent. The text contained errors/biases throughout. He didn't care about how he affected students. Unheard of, in academia. Run.

Unfortunately there isn't much to say about Dr. Bentley. He used an Open Source learning platform that was very confusing. Dr. B relied heavily on the quizzed provided by this open source which sometimes didn't even have the correct answer. The assignments consisted of learning new application interfaces. The class seemed like a bad experiment.

FREN 3032.comment: Prof.Lyu is very kind and cares a lot about her students. She gives many challenging assignments at once and can make things overly complicated. Felt frustrated and annoyed with the challenge until we'd talk in class and then she was so likeable I forgave her. Difficulty of the French often felt beyond the scope of the class. Nice grader, so doable
Professor Lyu is such a kind and caring professor. She gives amazing feedback on papers and genuinely wants to help you get better with your French. I would highly recommend taking her class.
extremely caring and well-spoken. her french is impeccable and she always offers the best insights. this class/madame lyu have made me fall in love with french poetry and literature!

Had a great time in this class mostly because of Professor Ferguson's contributions to the discussion and his history knowledge. Especially in the beginning of the semester, it felt like a lot of work, but I told my friends multiple times about how fascinating I found our classwork after class discussions unprompted.
simply put, Gary slays
Adorable and so so so nice. Sometimes a little unclear and disorganized but overall her class is very easy and enjoyable. Definitely take a class with her if you can!

Dr. Lyons is very helpful and straightforward. He obviously cares that his students process and understand the material on their own but is always willing to help if you fall behind. Highly recommend.

Such a great professor. Supplemented the overwhelmingly white textbook with works from varied African authors. If you want to study French, you have to look beyond Paris! If you want grammar or structural help on your papers, he's really helpful at office hours. Final exam covers the entire course, so good notes are key.

only take this course with her if you are a perfectionist like her. she's insensitive towards non-native speakers. she assigns 3 papers: one is 3 pg, 2nd is 4 pg, and 3rd is 5 pages. all of them must be 1.5 spaced and she is the only teacher that I have heard of that does this. however, it wasn't noted in her syllabus so beware.

This was my least favorite class taken within the dept. She was a dull instructor and lessened my interest in continuing with the language. Grading was very biased and going to office hours or asking for extra help/advice  wasn't as effective as I expected. Readings were a lot, but weren't bad. I advise taking this course with another instructor.

never take a class with a new teacher like her. she expected way too much from students. the final paper is a 5 page 1.5 spaced paper which meant you had to write about 7 pages in french. i don't know of any teacher at the university who assigns such a ridiculous assignment. it seemed like she was trying to prove herself as a new teacher. avoid.

Demanding class in terms of reading and analysis, but if you are interested and put forth effort then it pays off big time. Best prof I've had in french. Class was always interesting, she has a good sense of humor and is extremely intelligent and chic. Very, very helpful in office hours to make sure you understand the material and are comfortable.
She is lovely and intelligent!  And yes, you do have to work hard, but you will learn so much if you put forth the effort.  Go to office hours.  She really takes the time to help her students.

Interesting class but terrible professor. She is not good at explaining what she wants from the students and expects perfection. Day to day is all reading and discussing texts, grade is based on 3 papers and participation, with a few tests. Good subject choices, but clouded by bad professor.

FREN 4582.comment: She is very nice but her class is difficult

ENGL 3001.comment: Holsinger is a genius and extremely talented writer and reader. His lectures are funny, engaging, and fascinating. Discussion sections were relevant and helpful. Not all of the readings were discussed heavily, but you can basically decide what you want to be tested on in the exams and essays. Slow to or does not answer emails in my experience.

An incredibly gifted lecturer who assigns an inclusive set of readings. Lectures usually connect pre-1800 writing to recent events while establishing the context in which authors were writing. A surprising number of guest lecturers to introduce students to the department. Participation is 40 percent of the grade but includes weekly written work!

I really enjoyed this class. Professor's Kinney is quite harsh in terms of marking your work and her tests, especially the final, are worth a lot of your final grade. That said, you do learn a lot, and if you do the reading and the assignments you can get an A without too much stress.

ENGL 3810.comment: Favorite English professor. Taught me to love M&R literature. Great lecturer that cares about students. Declared English major solely because of this class.

Holsinger is brilliant. An excellent lecturer, and outlines his lectures ahead of time, which is refreshing. The reading is manageable and incredibly interesting, and he is incredibly personable. He came to my discussion section just see how things were going. He is also prompt if anyone has further interests concerning anything covered in lecture.

He is entertaining and really tries to keep your attention but can get a little off topic and vague with slides...write fast. It is a fun class and he is hot; plus you have to take the class as an English major

I LOVED this class. Clare Kinney is absolutely amazing. She solidified in my mind my desire to become an English major at UVA. There are pretty hefty readings assigned before each lecture, but I thought the material was interesting so it was never painful. She posts lecture outlines on Collab so note-taking is really easy.

Parker is easily the best lecturer I've ever had for a class. He does readings in lectures that really come alive, and his views on the material are incredibly insightful. He makes you want to read the material, which is great because he designs the midterm and final to be easy as long as you've been going to lecture and keep up with the reading.

Parker is no doubt one of the smartest professors at UVA. On top of that he is a delight to talk to in his seminars. He challenges his students and expects you to bring 100% to each class, and in return you'll have one of the most enjoyable, most beneficial semesters.

Parker is a fantastic lecturer. His insights are awesome! He is really hot, too. Go to lecture, take notes, study, & you will do well on the Mterm & Final. Only the works discussed in lecture appear on the exams.If you do not do this, you will fail, just like he tells you at the beginning of the course.

John Parker is the reason I am an English major. I loved going to his class everyday. His examinations of the text are intriguing, clear and his excitement for the reading is tangible. No English majors should graduate without taking one of his courses.

He is hilarious, very insightful, very interesting.  Not an overwhelming amount of reading.  The tests are based on the information covered in lecture so attendance is a must (but you only need to study what is covered in lecture).  Exam forced you to ID title, author, who is speaking to whom, give context, and list important themes.  Loved it!
Do NOT take a class with this TA.  She has ridiculous expectations for papers and grades very harshly.  She is not helpful if you don't understand something and class is not interesting.

TA for the discussion section. A brilliant person, and cares so much about her students...if you show that you're trying hard, she'll help keep your grade high. Such a caring person, always more that helpful, and always has insightful things to say. Very down to earth and quirky. Loved her, one of the best TAs I'd ever had!

Have her for a TA and she is absolutely terrible. Nice lady, but should not be teaching. She has poor hearing, which may explain why her responses to students are confusing and completely off topic. I'm sure she is a very smart woman but she does not know how to facilitate discussion or create an environment conducive to learning. DO NOT TAKE.
Ginny is a great teacher. She is very enthusiastic and makes the topic interesting. Her grading is a bit on the tougher side, as are most UVA professors, but she's fair.

ENRN 4500.comment: I took his crime fictions class and it was amazing! The material he chose was great and the discussions we had in class were great as well. As others have said, he is a stickler for grammar. However, his close attention to grammar and eagerness to help those understand their grammatical errors helped me improve my writing. Take a class with him!
TBH if you take an English at UVA, take Professor Parker!

ENMD 3559.comment: Holsinger is incredible. Leads discussions well and constructively, fair grader, eloquent speaker, sense of humor, and really nice to look at. He really knows his stuff but is open to a lot of what students have to say. Very approachable too. He IS a stickler for grammar/mechanics so proofread closely. Take any class with him! He's great!

ITAL 2020.comment: Prof. Calamita is an absolutely amazing professor!! She is so sweet and does a great job teaching Italian. My Italian improved so much as a result of taking her class, and she inspired me to be an Italian minor! Would highly recommend taking this class with her.
I had Hiromi for three semesters. 10/10 every time. She is the best professor at UVa!!!

LPPL 2110.comment: Professor Davis is one of the most incredible professors I have ever had. He is so kind and truly takes the time to listen to his students' responses during lecture. I highly recommend everyone taking his course at some point because it is truly life-changing. He is a very supportive professor that is easy to talk to, both during lecture and OH.

Batten School grading is rough to keep that in mind. Prof. Davis is so kind and just has such an amazing personality. There were a lot of readings that sometimes weren't too interesting, but if you like to read, take this class. The quizzes were okay, they were tricky when the questions were about the book. Take the feedback on papers.

BIOL 1040.comment: Did not find his course engaging, he was unclear during lectures on what was material and what was nonsense filler. Took two months to grade most assignments.

I would really recommend him and this course, especially if you're a non-biology major just trying to tick off a science requirement - it's a fascinating class. Hilarious guy, engaging lectures, straightforward tests. His exams for BIOL 1040 are multiple choice but do not skip class and review slides, it's only easy if you're paying attention.

The content is engaging but the lectures are very long, which can be tiring. The tests weren't terrible, but he often sometimes includes information that is not on the slides and specific numbers.  The only major downside with grading is that the tests are worth a heavier amount, and one "off" grade can significantly impact your final grade.

Professor Taylor truly cares about the content he is teaching and it makes it easier for you to be engaged. My only issue would be he doesn't really emphasize the important material and sometimes goes on side stories which may make it hard to decipher what needs to be learned. Other than that, Professor Taylor is an amazing & passionate professor.

Prof Taylor was consistently engaged and excited about the content. He was always available for students and encouraged questions/comments/debates during lecture. IMO he could've done a better job on the pure biology portion (DNA, PCR, etc), and on the ethics portions maybe a little more opposing views. Overall a caring professor; would take again.

Professor Taylor is an amazing instructor who gives engaging lectures and makes the science content accessible to everyone (he even relates many topics back to UVA). One of my favorite professors. Your grade is composed of clearly worded, fairly graded multiple choice tests, a few easy homework assignments, and a group paper. Highly recommend
Professor Doug is one of the sweetest professors ever. He genuinely cares about students and their feedback. highly recommend taking a course taught by him!

Good guy, good professor. I took 'The DNA Revolution' and it was my favorite class all semester. Two weekly lectures (which are super interesting), no readings, almost no homework. Class grade is based on 3 (multiple choice) tests and a 2000 word paper (group project). He is also very caring, accessible, and open to feedback.

It's clear that Prof Taylor really cares about the subject and his students. The material is really clear and not hard to grasp because it's designed for non-majors and he always keeps that in mind. He tries to make things fair by giving back points, which is good because sometimes his test questions are confusing.

ANTH 3840.comment: Was pretty nice. Gave us a lot of extra credit and food in class.

COMM 1800.comment: Prof Hoopes is strict but also a very kind person. Class is EXTREMELY straightforward: come to class, follow directions & do the assignments on time and you will def do well. Great intro to business class - you learn a little about a lot which was great. Tests are extremely vocab heavy but also very fair. Easy to do well if you put in the effort.

Lectures were often boring, but she includes videos and in-class activities as well. Pre-class quizzes and other assignments saved my grade after getting a C on the midterm. Most concepts are common-sense, but there's LOTS of vocab to know. Grading is somewhat strict, but if you follow the detailed assignment instructions, you'll be fine.

I did not think this class was bad at all! It's very manageable as long as you do the readings and attend class. There's a lot of busy work, but she does specify everything, you just have to be careful to include everything, or else you'll get points off. Everyone should know a little about the business world, so definitely take this class!

Sometimes it feels like she treats students like children, but she's nice. It feels like the content is  common sense a lot of the time, which is better than it being difficult, but because of this you have to memorize every little fact she mentions so that she can make her tests hard. She is rigid when it comes every little detail on her syllabus.
Shes super inconsiderate and strict.

Honestly, easiest class ever, and Professor Hoopes was great. Don't listen to all the bad reviews the class was a breeze. The only negative thing I would say is that the homework took some time but the content was very clear.

Amazing teacher - participation will significantly help you - it's optional. Do the readings, study early but not too much. 2 tests, midterm was very reasonable, but final was harder and much more comprehensive. Do assignments early. Take decent notes, but more importantly pay attention in class. She provides study guides + office hours - USE THEM!

Hoopes is over-hated in general, but the material is boring and lectures are no better. Do the readings and take notes on them. It will pay off. Hoopes is a nice person, and she is very straightforward about what to do. Lots of easy little grades are good because they cancel out things like the second test, which was hard.

Professor Hoopes is nice enough, its just the class material itself is really boring. It's all rudimentary ideas about business that you probably learned in 4th grade. I understand its a first-year class, but for some reason she decides to randomly drop the class average every once in a while with some unfair exams.

Attendance is measured by PollEv questions that you can't answer unless you're in the room since questions are on board. Lectures are nothing special, just powerpoints. Homework is normally reading 1-3 articles and then answering a short 5-10 question quiz online. Overall, class was ok, but do not take unless you're considering mcintire

Professor Hoopes was a very nice instructor and person in general. Her exams are directly derived from lecture slides and the readings, so definitely take good notes and study (mostly memorization) a week or two before the tests. It's very possible to get an A or B in this class, it's just a lot of busy work.

Class is not too bad as long as you stay on top of your work. 1000 point system and in some cases points can be taken away for weird reasons or even no reason at all. The test is solely memorization and there are some instances of oddly specific questions. Attendance is taken for a grade each day as well. Do the work and you should get an A.

Professor Hoopes had really interesting lectures but gave SO much homework to the point that it felt unnecessary. Very little feedback was provided on the assignments, and so often there was no way to know why you didn't receive an A. Tests often focused on random details, so make sure you pay attention in lecture and takes good notes.

This class is pretty straightforward. As long as you attend lecture, do the homework assignments, and prepare for exams its a pretty easy A. There is a lot of busy work but it is nothing challenging. The homework assignments and in class assignments can seem pointless, but it definitely gives you the opportunity to boost your grade in the course.

I loved Leopold! He is super accessible outside of class and I highly recommend seeing him during office hours. There is a lot of homework, mainly to make sure you are doing the reading. The exams aren't too bad as long as you understand the basic concepts. Group projects and your DL are important, so make sure to focus a lot on the discussion!

Professor Leopold always tries to create an enthusiastic, positive, and open environment. He is kind and patient when answering questions and fixing arising problems. Although there are some long readings, if you have good study skills, everything is realistic. He brings his experiences from Capital One and Circuit City City to enhance the course.
Lots of homework and the multiple choice tests are hard! But he's a good lecturer and a really nice guy!

Professor Leopold is a great and knowledgable guy. It is clear, however, that he is over qualified for teaching an introductory commerce class. The lectures are hardly helpful as you can download the slides after class. I enjoyed the subject matter but a lot of the course's work seemed to be busy work

Although some lectures seemed useless, Leopold is a very good prof. Gives lots of engaging stories and is really fun to talk to outside of class. The midterm is tricky and yes some questions are a bit annoying, but if you understand the concepts, do the homework/reading (which honestly is minimal compared to other classes), you'll be fine.

Super "engaging" but the second half of the syllabus was useless. In general he just loves testing in a way that hurts you because "two answers" seem almost identical. He loves the whole "the most correct answer" approach. Lots of questions were about the bio's of the guest speakers instead of actual content, its ridiculous. Don't take comm1800whim

Class is strictly memorization. Don't take it unless you need it for comm school, Kemp is nice and funny but his lectures are random, you'll have to get everything for the tests form the textbook, which he wrote, and it has so many typos.

Do not take this class unless you intend on being pre-comm. I hated it. Most of what he says in lecture is irrelevant, but he has about 5 minutes of "takeaways" each class, and you have to memorize those takeaways for the exams. This class doesn't have much to do with understanding - it's literally all about memorizing his textbook (which he wrote)

Easy B+A-.  Tough to get an A. Kemp's lectures are kind of long and boring (and repetitive if you read the chapters).  Many of the terms are weirdly defined, and you have to know his specific definitions for them.  The GAs do most of the grading, so make sure that you contact your GA to ask specifically what heshe is expecting on each assignment.
Pretty straight forward class. It's kind of tough to get an A because you need a 95%. An A- or B+ are easily achievable if you put some work in.

Relatively straight forward class. Everything Kemp ever talks about is in the textbook he wrote. There are guest lectures and "take-aways" you need to know for the 3 exams. 80% of the questions on the exams are online beforehand in practice quizzes, but the rest can be tricky. Kemp himself is funny, but arrogant and repetitive. Beneficial overall

Do not take this class unless you intend on being pre-comm. I hated it. Most of what he says in lecture is irrelevant, but he has about 5 minutes of "takeaways" each class, and you have to memorize those takeaways for the exams. This class doesn't have much to do with understanding - it's literally all about memorizing his textbook (which he wrote)

Loved Professor Kemp as a person and would love to adopt him as my grandpa, but his lectures felt a lot like regurgitation of the book. I did enjoy his stories and the requirement to know takeaways ensured that I always went to lecture. Exams are easy, but TAs were either easy or crazy hard graders.

Kemp is a nice guy. The class is boring though. You have to attend to get the "take aways" which are word for word on the test. Other then that, if you read the book there is no use for the class whatsoever. He's very excited about the material but he just repeats what is in the book. Its a rather easy class to get an A or B in w/o much work.

He seems like he is experienced in his field but his lectures are useless. You still need to attend because he gives out "takeaways" of current events that you will need to know for the exams. Exams are very vocal-based. It made me feel as if I was in high school again. Also, he gives out very tedious, time-consuming assignments.

I liked Kemp, thought he was a good-spirited guy, really experienced in the field and he genuinely likes to teach and wants to see everyone do well. The course itself is really tedious though, SO many assignments. VERY VOCAB BASED. Make sure you know your terms for exams.It's easy to get an A as long as you actually do all the work (I didn't).

MAE 6210.comment: Professor was very unprepared for lectures became confused by her own notes easily. Many times when introducing problems she was unable to describe the problem well enough, when students would ask her for clarity she would just say "look at the picture" and point to a crudely drawn representation of the problem. Also refused to use vector notation.

MUSI 2120.comment: Professor DeVeaux is an entertaining guy, and the textbook (that he wrote) is beautifully done. It's definitely not an easy A, though. The listening portions for the midterm and final exam are tricky, especially if you don't have a musical background. DO NOT wait until the last minute to listen to the material - it takes time to absorb what's

Deveaux is by far the best professor I have had at UVA. His lectures are very entertaining and he is hilarious. He mixes in lecturing with playing music himself in order to keep you interested. The tests are not too difficult but you do need to read the chapter outlines and go to lecture. Definitely take this class!

I had History of Jazz with Dr. DeVeaux 23 years ago, and it still stands out as one of the best classes I took at UVA.  I'm rating him now because RMP did not exist when I was in school, and the music I learned about in his class was life-changing for me, even though I was not a music major.  Thank you, Dr. D., for making the last 23 years richer!

Deveaux teaches with his old powerpoints he's very familiar with. He gives cool piano examples to help the class understand what he's saying better. Read the textbook (which is basically all his powerpoints are on) & you'll do fine. Listening can be a bit tricky for beginners but not impossible if you keep up with them too. I enjoyed this class!

Deveaux plays the piano during class and gives tons of musical examples. The tests have a listening and history portion. The history is easy if you memorize his powerpoint. The listening wasn't too bad either and my highest musical experience is middle school orchestra. You also have 2 papers, but I also had some help from the TA, so it's not bad.

This class was easy if you studied hard. I enjoyed listening to the jazz music and the discussions were helpful and not too bad. The papers were a little difficult but the tests were not very hard. Good class overall. I recommend it if you are at all interested in music.

DeVeaux is remarkable. He has incredible passion, energy, and knowledge that he always brings to lecture. His tests are not too difficult; a few of the listening questions can be a bit ridiculous, but overall they were fair. He is truly one of the best professors at the University.

Professor Dearth was one of the best professors I had during my time at UVA. He is extremely knowledgeable and clearly passionate about what he talks about. I took a summer class with him this past year right before I graduated and it was the best decision ever - he made those long hours fly by. I really learned so much from him!

MDST 3402.comment: This man is so chaotic that it literally drove me insane each class to watch him get up there and lecture about god knows what. The only reason this man gets two stars is because he is actually one of the only professors to show an ounce of sympathy for my mental health AND sit down to help me finish his class with a good grade.

MDST 3406.comment: Interesting subject matter, but the professor was insufferable.  I've never encountered an educator that is so close-minded.  If you express the slightest bit of cynicism, he publicly humiliate you.  It is an easy A if you just nod your head and agree with everything he says.  If that isn't something you are willing to do, don't take his class.

Bruce wants to have open and honest discussion in his class, but he doesn't tolerate opinions that differ from his own.  In one instance, the class was discussing the controversial  Rolling Stone article (which has since been retracted).  When a student criticized the disgraced article, he condemned the student for taking away from the real issue.

MDST 2001.comment: For a lower level class there is a ton of reading. Reading from the textbook, as well as reading from Collab. I had Francesca as a TA who clarified most of the topics. Bruce is really enthusiastic about the material, but I showed up for office hours three times after communicating with him and he wasn't there. :/ Interesting class-ton of work.

CE 2010.comment: Easy class. Tests are easy. The homeworks are so hard u can't do em without going to the TA hours. Make sure u get 90s on the HWs. The hardest part of this class was the huge learning curve for Civil3d.The semester project was annoying, do not fall behind on the deliverable due dates. Smith is a pretty chill guy and i enjoyed his alumni interviews.

Easy professor, keeps everything very practical and interesting. Likes to get class discussion going instead of asking rhetorical questions and immediately giving his own answer (like some profs do). Is very available even though he's super busy (chairman of Civil department), and is very reasonable and helpful.

CE 4000.comment: Great professor for a great class (if you're interested in construction). Has lots of practical experience with construction processes and management, and brings in guest lecturers from contracting companies. Took it as a 3rd year so the hardest part was competing with the 4th years who already interned at contracting companies (skewed the curve)

MATH 3000.comment:
Pros: Prepared, organized. Specifications grading (like Chem 1411)
Cons: It's hard to keep track of how well you're doing in the class. Dr. Bergner gave no benchmarks for how well we should've been doing at any one time. She wants the students to learn themselves, to the point where it seems she avoids teaching altogether. HW was very stressful.

Abramenko is a fine guy, just lacking as a professor. Lectures are boring -- straight from his notes to the board -- but very easy to follow along and extremely easy to study for, because his notes are the most organized thing you've ever seen. Material could be confusing and he wasn't all that helpful in office hours, but the tests were very fair.
A great teacher who cares about his students and math, teaches well, and runs class efficiently. Also very quick at grading, he once returned grades from a test only 8 hours after it was done.
He's very unclear and hard to understand.  He just kind of says something and expects people to automatically understand him.

She is a nice lady and is very interested in the subject matter. There was a good amount of homework but then again it was 4 credit hours. I would definitely take another class with her. She writes REALLY fast in class but provides lots of her examples.

PSYC 4645.comment: She is so lovely and a great professor. Our class was mostly open discussion and learning games, very rarely an actual lecture. 100% recommend.

SOC 3180.comment: Be prepared to read full books and participate a lot.  Her grading is tough and the assignments can be kind of confusing.

Really interesting material and he keeps things exciting by using different teaching methods. Really invested and would definitely recommend.  Never did a reading an A on the exam. Definitely take for ease and for interesting class.

SOC 5140.comment: Pugh really cared about her students, loved this class and would recommend

Pugh is so unengaging. The material isn't hard, but she makes things unnecessarily complicated, and often contradicts herself.  The course itself was interesting, just wish I hadn't had to do it with her.

PORT 1110.comment: I loved Professor Feitosa, and I will be taking another class with her next semester. Though there is a lot of homework, they're simple and pretty short. She's very caring and goes above and beyond for her students. Highly recommend if you're looking for a language to take at UVA.

Did I get an A? Yes. Was it easy? Also yes. Would I EVER recommend this class to anyone? Absolutely not.
Worst teacher of my life.
-announces homework/exams HOURS before (often at 12-1 AM, with class at 11 next day)
-awful teaching, but blames students, has called us "failures"
-I've taken 2 semesters but learned NOTHING. Class is a waste of time.
Prof Feitosa really cares about her students.  Lots of homework but not difficult.  She makes her requirements very clear and as long as you put in the work you will get an A.

She is SO nice and happy and a very lenient grader. If you're really there to learn, you'll get an A.  There are oral exams and one group project. There is a lot of online homework, (normal for UVA languages) and it isn't hard, just time consuming and due whenever you have a test. She speaks really fast, but I highly recommend this class.

PORT 2050.comment: Prof. Feitosa is very kind. She can be disorganized from time to time but she always makes up for any issues. She's very understanding and gives a lot of space for her student to learn. Although this class had A LOT of homework, she gave us all the time in the world to complete them. Definitely would recommend her.

PORT 2120.comment: Lilian is a super sweet lady. She is a bit disorganized, but she always makes up for it and makes sure that everyone participates in class. Her tests are easy and straightforward; as long as you pay attention you'll get an A.

SOC 1001.comment: Professor Kekelia was a nice person but not a good teacher. She gave no guidance on exams and the TAs took forever to grade so it was hard to know what grade you had in the class the entire semester. Required attendance and participation in a huge lecture but only asked one question a class so it was impossible for everyone to get credit.

I loved her. It was her 1st semester, and there were some TA issues so there were some bumps in the road, but not her fault. She really knew the topics that she was talking about. Shes very kind and understanding. There are readings but she covers the main ideas in lectures. I am taking her class on collective memory next semester. I suggest SOC101

This is Professor Kekelia's first semester at GW, but I don't think that's an excuse for the amount of reading she assigned for us to do as an introductory level class. She never really told us what was on our midterm and final, just that they consisted of multiple choice and essay questions. Also, during lectures, she just repeats the readings.

EDIS 6220.comment: Although the PowerPoints were helpful, the instructor provided feedback that contradicted the assignment rubrics and the best practices that students were tasked to implement.

Teaches giving student feedback but gives horrible feedback herself. MANY weekly assignments worth 0 points but if you don't do something it drops your grade.Graded on three things, if you don't do well on one you don't do well in the class. Nit picks and tears apart every line of your work. Her feedback and grading contradicts PowerPoints & book.

RELC 2360.comment: Paul Jones is a great lecturer, especially for this class. It is very reading heavy but the topics can be thought provoking. Personally, I would not retake the course but I would recommend taking a course with this professor.

Professor Jones is great! Do your readings. Be engaged in discussion. Talk about the material and really parse it out. The TAs are phenomenal. Talk to them too if you have ANY questions. Really great course. I highly recommend.

Great professor!  Some of the readings are hard to get through, but he makes them much easier to understand and if you read at least occasionally and attend the lectures, it's easy to feel prepared for all the papers.

An amazing professor with incredible insight. His lectures are interesting and even more so when you actually do the readings. Go to office hours and get to know him!! This course is a lot of writing to start off the college experience with, but it is worth it and a great introduction into how to manage your time, readings, and papers.

This was my first relg class and jones was a great professor. He is humorous, engaging, and a genuinely warm person.  His lectures are very helpful in understanding the readings & i frequently went back to them in writing the papers. grade was composed of 3 response papers, 2 midterm papers, 2 final paper, & section participation

He's such a cutie. Lecture attendance is not mandatory, but go because he's funny and it helps clarify the material. Papers require you to think very analytically. No memorization. I enjoyed his class.

He is an amazing professor! The material can be difficult to read, but the office hours are really helpful and he is open to questions about it. I really enjoyed this class and the papers to write were not very difficult, plenty of time to get them done. A very low-stress class and interesting!!!!

He is an amazing professor! The material can be difficult to read, but the office hours are really helpful and he is open to questions about it. I really enjoyed this class and the papers to write were not very difficult, plenty of time to get them done. A very low-stress class and interesting!!!!

RELA 2750.comment: This was definitely my favorite class of the semester-Prof. Hoehler-Fatton is a really engaging lecturer and the material is really interesting.  She really does care about her students success and she was a pretty easy grader.  We did have reading quizzes, but she dropped your two lowest if you did the course evaluation.

RELA 3900.comment: LOVED this class, and I'm not even a religious studies major. Prof. Hoehler-Fatton is very knowledgeable and one of the most approachable professors I've ever had. An extremely nice woman. You had to know the material, though, no faking it. She posts a lot of study guides and those really help.

AMST 3180.comment: Prfsr Chong is easily the worst professor I have had at the University. She refuses to hear and interupts opinions which aren't her own, is exceptionally rude to students, jokes at wildly inappropriate themes, such as genocide, casually insults students' intelligence, and grades inconstistently. I can't stress enough: Avoid. This. Professor.

The most insane professor at this whole University. She will discredit your opinion due to your "white privilege" and said that "all white people who adopt Vietnamese children do it because of their white guilt". She is a bizarre grader and only accepts opinions that align with her own. STAY AWAY

The class is fine but the way some liberal arts teachers grade papers is just bizarre to me, they give you no rubric or any real advice on what they're looking for and then give you just one shot to do well on something that makes up a large part of your grade. The material was interesting, but not to an incredible degree.

This teacher does not care for your input unless it reinforces her point . She has no interest in discussing an opinion in class which is not completely in line with hers. Will shut you down immediately if you start expressing your opinion. Class is not difficult and material is interesting. A shame she skews everything sometimes non factually.

EDLF 2080.comment:
Lots of work, but lots of grades to boost your overall score.

Offers a lot of extra credit towards the end of the semester.

Very nice professor, cares a lot about his students' success. Will explain any questions and work through them, regardless of length/difficulty. Available to meet very easily through Zoom or in-person, also great via email.

ECON 2559.comment: So boring. Talks at you for an hour and 15, nothing interactive. Would be helpful if the class work was more applicable to exams and assignments. HW is hard and Mid-term/final are average. Lecture is long and boring. WOuldnt recommend gender in the workplace

ECON 4160.comment: I absolutely loved ECON 4160 with Professor Miller. In my opinion, she's always very clear and she's funny, too. I would recommend this only to people who like economics, though.

PLAP 3270.comment: Prof. Winter is smart, funny, and engaging (in a nerdy professor kind of way) and talks about research in his field a lot. The lectures are sometimes very detailed and sometimes wander. Grades depend a lot on stuff outside of class: a research project worth 50% of your grade and two exams which draw mostly from readings. Hard but worth it.
Great class. You get to delve more into the "art of research papers".

Amazing professor but this class requires a lot of outside hours. You do a semester-long research project which makes up half of your grade, then the midterm and final were surprisingly difficult; they required awfully specific points from the numerous readings from this semester.

Winter is clearly interested and knowledgeable, and even funny in class. However his course lacks a cohesion, and there is little direction overall and within each lecture. The grades are two tests, based entirely on readings (of which there are many), and a research paper. This paper is 20 pages, and you're left to figure everything out yourself.

Exams are ridiculously hard. The average on the exams were usually 65, then he had to add 15 or 20 points for curve. The research project is a pain, but not hard to do. You must go to lecture to take the exams, but they are confusing and boring. He is a good teacher though.

Definitely take his class, he is honestly one of the funniest professors that I have taken at UVA, always full of energy and willing to answer any questions that you may have. Very funny guy, by the way the freaking tests are online.....

PLAP 4140.comment: I really liked professor Winter! I took him the class for Gender and American Politics, and was really surprised with how much I liked the course. There is a LOT of reading, and participation in discussing it was vital to your grade, but he was super accessible if anyone was unclear on a topic. He's also super enthusiastic which made class fun!!

PLAP 2270.comment: Terrible class by far the worst I have taken at UVA
Worst class in UVA. Prof Winter is unable to explain the theories and there is a lot of work load. Don't take the class

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS! It is clear Winter means well but the readings don't connect to the lecture and then lecture does not connect to discussion. It feels like separate class material and classes. Seems easy because it is so boring but tests are absurdly detailed. My least favorite class by far.
Another class that is not too difficult if you prepare. A bit to hard for the subject matter. Should be an easy A, but be ready for a B.
Attending lecture isn't mandatory, but in certain cases can be helpful. Amount of reading assigned is fair. As long as you prepare well, the exams and essays are simple and straight-forward.

PLAD 1234.comment: Smarmy and arrogant but you'll pass.

PHYS 2410.comment: NL is a really nice person who cares about his students, but not the best lecturer. Basically talks for the entire lecture without stopping to make sure everybody is on the same page. He has a relatively forgiving grading policy, though, which is nice.

PHYS 3110.comment: This class was pretty easy and Prof Liyanage had some great demonstrations to go with his lecture. He also posts all his notes online (and they're up on or the day after that lecture). The homework problems given as well as the examples from class help prepare you for his exams (there were only 2 plus a take home final).

ANTH 3152.comment: he is a bit arrogant like other people said, but also brilliant. ideas are sometimes hard to grasp, but they'll shift how you think in the future, so it's worth it. i recommend taking one of his classes if you're an anth major! grades come from 4 exams written in a blue book during class (45 min) + they're based on personal application of material
I spent three days a week in Mentore's class for an entire semester and learned nothing because I was too busy appreciating how gorgeous he is. Take his class if you need a reason to smile everyday.

I absolutely loved Mentore! Yes, he is hard to follow. I noticed that people that were geared towards STEM majors and that type of mindset struggled, but if you're open to new ideas and philosophical thought, take his class!! All exams are 45 minutes written essays and you just need to show your thought process and why you think that way.
Interesting topic but reading is definitely required to do well and must pay attention in lecture because material is very abstract. Great professor who really loves what he does.

ANTH 3770.comment: Amazing professor! Asked him after the class to help advise me on another project, and he has been incredibly helpful!

If you're trying to genuinely think about why/how modernity operates and the problems with binaries and representation inherent in anthro (or just think in general) take a class with Mentore! He's probably the most thoughtful professor I've had. Invest in the class by reading everything before and reflecting outside class - this is real education !

ANTH 2325.comment: This class should really be a 2000s level, and would probably be a best fit for anthro majors/minors. No power points or study guides, just long lectures full of tangents. Asking him for help served quite useless too- he really only had one way to explain things, and it was often quite abstract. Tests are not too difficult though.

ANTH 3370.comment: He's brilliant but intimidating. Topics are complex, lecture is deep, but you learn a lot and work for it. Biggest downside is that he speaks like a Dickens novel, one sentence has two hundred words and twenty commas. No idea where one sentence ends and another begins.

His classes are geared toward anthropology majors like myself, but they can be rewarding IF you pay attention and listen. The theory he discusses in class is often high level anthropological theory, critical theory, and feminist theory, and if you don't have a vested interest, you may not follow. Inspired me to pursue anthropology
Every person if granted the opportunity should take one course with George Mentore

Horrible professor with a horrible ego to match. Biased against whites, americans, greeks, UVA, etc. Final was not something that anyone in the class could have prepared for. Strongly suggest NOT taking this class...but I did get an A- so if you can deal with his horrible class it might be worth it for the grade. Do the readings.

ANTH 2190.comment: This class is just way too abstract and a lot of it sounded like BS.  Mentore is really hard to follow; for every 100 things he says, 20 make sense.  It seemed like the anthro majors in the class really liked him, but if you're just looking for a "different" class, don't take  this one.  so much reading and the discussions in class don't make sense

I liked Mentore overall. He really brings to life an important perspective that he stems from his own experience. I felt he was too defensive in class discussion and often would try to argue the point without understanding it a hundred percent. Regardless  I'll advise people to take his class on exchange - no regrets.

Heard about him since being a first year. Now taking his class as a fourth year, anthro and comm school major. Really great how he integrates business practices and anthro. Super though for non anthro ppl and first years... should be a 3000 level class.

This should definitely not be a 2000 level class. I went to almost every class, and took notes, but he tends to speak as if he's talking to a bunch of Anthro majors, which I'm definitely not. Also very unclear on what it is he wants in papers... take this only if you're really interested in anthropology.

ISHU 3080.comment: Save yourself from this teacher yall. this is an elective class anyways and no one would want to get a F in this class. very rude and he would talk to you like you owe him an apology.
very rude and unprofessional. he says its very hard to pass his class lol. if you miss an assignment he will give you an F no second chance. no replies to emails.

Luke has very high standards for himself and for you. He's very knowledgeable. Expect a lot of reading, a lot of writing, and about a third of a letter grade lower than you usually get from other professors.

ISHU 3810.comment: Very rude and will tell you he will give you an F if you email him one more time and ask for help.
the only unprofessional professor I've ever had at UVA. very rude and would not respond to ur email. has a whole way of him teaching where he never teaches just posts questions.

Dr. Wright is absolutely brilliant, he is very knowledgeable. His lectures are insightful. He introduces very relevant concepts with an equally relevant personal anecdote to go with it. Grades a little tough, he appreciates critical thinking and well source papers. I had him for 3 semesters and learned a lot from him.

ISIN 4510.comment: We ordered a bunch of books and used one of them. There was no plan for the class at all. We'd show up, he'd talk about how great he was and then get frustrated when we didn't have anything to say. Say something about what?! There's no structure! There's no lesson plan!

I found professor Wright's lectures very insightful and although I found the assigned readings a bit boring and at times unintelligible, I do feel I came away with a better grasp of the subject. Be prepared to do a lot of reading and writing. He's eccentric and can be critical of your ideas but if you do the reading and writing you should be okay.

ISLS 3210.comment: I found him to be pompous and full of himself.  He doesn't want your ideas in your paper.  He only wants to make sure you get his opinions clearly stated.  I have never before or since had a college professor who tore down my papers so much simply because my ideas were showing through too clearly.  Of course, he would never use those words exactly.
Charlotte is a great teacher. She puts so much work in to her job shes a true pro.

She seemed very passive aggressive. She undercut my class participation grade even though I was there and participating fully. The way my grade numbers added up at the end, I earned exactly enough to be just under what I needed for an A because of my final participation grade. Not sure how I upset her, but don't do it if you take her class.

Charlotte seemed very passive aggressive. She undercut my class participation grade even though I was there and participating fully. The way my grade numbers added up at the end, I earned exactly enough to be just under what I needed for an A because of my final participation grade. Not sure how I upset her, but don't do it if you take her class.

SAST 2559.comment: She clearly has favorites in the class. We broke into groups to look over projects and she called out "stronger" students and had "weaker" students pair with them. She then (in front of me) hugged my partner and without looking at her essay, said "Oh she is so amazing, Im planning to give her an A+ in the class because she is such a joy to teach".

Professor Farooqi is  hilarious, a sweetheart, and a bit of a badass. She made lectures really fun but isn't afraid to call you out if you did poorly on an assignment or didn't do assignments; she means well, so don't take it personally. She's a bit scatterbrained, but her lectures were always interesting and fun. Definitely recommend the class!

SATR 3000.comment: This class was a real commitment, but extremely rewarding. Papers are a core part of your grade, but there are rewrites and other make-up opportunities. The actual material is not *hard*, but to really enjoy it you do need to get involved. STEM major here, loved this class.
It is a shame to have professors like Farooqi in UVA. UVA is supposed to be a good school with good professors but it is very unfortunate to have professors like Mehr Farooqi are 10 yeared at UVA!
Professor Farooqi is so supportive. People try to hard to get in her classes because she keeps them speaking and energized. I still look forward to taking more classes with her.

SATR 3559.comment: I was really looking forward to this class. Farooqi made it unbearable. Being South Asian, she picks on you for knowing a little more about the subject than non-South Asians. Not only that, she humiliated a girl in class for not being a stereotypical South Asian. She thinks she is clever, but really just mean and an ineffective professor.

SATR 3110.comment: Like you potential student pondering whether to take a class that knocks out two pre reqs like Dracula, I too was excited for this course. Nonetheless, Farooqi is a terrible professor who basically taught the class on a whim, was not available outside of class, and left the grading quite ambiguous. DO NOT TAKE!!!

SATR 3300.comment: Professor Farooqi in nature is the nicest woman ever. Humorous, kind, passionate, caring, and intelligent. She honestly is like a mother away from home. She puts in 150% percent, and genuinely cares about the well being of her students. Honestly, she is amazing. I highly recommend this class to anyone who wants to experience the beauty of UVA.

FREN 3585.comment: I learned so much with Mme. Krueger. The content was particularly engaging and distinctive -- I probably wouldn't have learned what I did with another professor. The writing could be challenging but she gave great corrections that paid off with the final paper. She clearly cares about her students, and she's incredibly intelligent.

Cheryl is by far the reason I decided to major in French. She not only is very passionate about her topics, but is genuinely a caring person. She makes herself very available outside of class and gives specific comments and provides areas for improvement on assignments. I have taken four classes with her now and am still amazed at her dedication

Roger is fantastic. He is native French and only teaches at UVa for half of each school year, but when he is here you should try to take him. He has an encyclopedic knowledge of French-American history and literally has his own Wikipedia page. He grades tough but because of that his letter grade brackets are adjusted accordingly. Talk in class!

Mme. Bargach is AMAZING! She is very open minded, always willing to help, passionate about the material she teaches and incredibly resourceful. She does have fairly high standards  though. She has taught in France, so it is a very authentic experience to take her class.

BME 2000.comment: This professor adopts a reverse classroom where you watch lecture videos at home and do coursework during class time where TAs and the professor are there to answer any questions. Lecture videos are interesting and "savvy". The major group project is interesting and engaging to a real issue in biomedical engineering. I do wish he graded quicker.

Excellent teacher; very engaged and committed to student learning. Goes out of her way to ensure that students have ownership in the learning process and that they are exposed to authentic and relevant topics that will benefit their education and training.

Professor Walker is a god among men.  If you can't understand the simple clarity of his expertise, perhaps you should think about switching majors to, say, Hospitality or Marketing. His teaching style is, admittedly, less "kindly country doctor" than "results-oriented CEO"; please see my comment about switching majors if you can't hack it.
He's pretty much the worst.  He's only at UVA to work on his own research and not to care about you.

BME 2315.comment: This professor gives you all the information you need to complete coursework efficiently. I just did homework based off of his class notes, this class could be an online class. I found lectures to be boring, hence why I barely went, but he gave great feedback on homework in order to improve for tests. We also got to make formula sheets for tests.

Saucerman is a fantastic professor. His lectures tend to be a little long, but the content is interesting, and he uses Kahoot and other tools to foster in-class participation. He also gave minimal extra credit for test corrections and participation (so don't rely on it). Problem sets were challenging but stimulating - great class overall!

APMA 3100.comment: This professor is somewhat difficult to understand in class and is disorganized. The grading system implemented in the class itself is awful. Your entire grade relies on timed quizzes and 2 group projects. We aren't given enough practice problems that mimic quiz questions to do well. I just wouldn't recommend this class at all.

Attendance isn't mandatory but class is very lecture-based and although the notes are posted online the lectures help. There's a lot of work: worksheets and webwork every week and a few projects throughout the semester. I didn't understand the material super well, his teaching style was boring and made me want to zone out.

hardest and worst class I've ever taken. not entirely professor Fulghams fault. He always had office hours and worked with you, but the material and tests felt impossible. I never wanted to participate in class because if I got something wrong in this class it would be beyond embarrassing. Classmates are very competitive in this class.

Overall just an ok experience. The material is not easy, especially if math is not your strong suit, and Ryals doesn't do a lot to help with that. Taught as a reversed classroom, so you watch recorded lectures outside of class and do practice with a group during class. Hw on webwork could be tough sometimes and the tests are pretty hard.

She is a lovely person, very understanding and always on time for her office hours; I know I am not the best critical thinker, but I always study hard to make up for it. Everything was fine for me until the first exam, open-note, it was nothing like the homework. If you are fast at solving new problems, I think this class might suit you well!

I can confirm many of the other comments here, at least as I experienced class with Prof Snider. I found her condescending as well.
