The worst part was her unwillingness to correct grading errors when she was in fact incorrect. I like all the other professors I've had at UVA, but I would not recommend Prof Snider.

Snider is a good instructor in that she gives clear, consistent explanations with lots of examples. She is not trying to be your friend, and has a 0 tolerance policy towards lateness, talking, eating, texting, laptop use. She is extremely condescending, there is no other way to put it. Be warned, the final is MUCH more difficult than the tests.
AVOID AT ALL COSTS!!! DARIA WILL MAKE YOU HATE MATH
She has a condescending tone. She had generally inconvenient office hours. You are really going to have to try hard in this class.

When studying for quizzes and tests, she tells the class to "go for the understanding". But when grading, she'll take points off for semantic errors even when it's clear the logical steps and answer are correct. She is incredibly condescending and impatient when answering students' questions in class. And she teaches almost directly from the book.

ANTH 3010.comment: Easily one of the best professors.

Professor McKinnon is a really nice person and a good professor. She made this class bearable, and that is a huge achievement considering that 3010 deals with very dry and difficult theories. She is helpful, nice and responsive to your thoughts and ideas. Take this with her!
was intimidated by her at first, but she's extremely helpful and nice one-on-one. her class is hard but if you're actually keeping up with the readings and everything it's not impossible.

RUN FOR YOUR LIFE!!!!!!! THE HARDEST CLASS I EVER TOOK IN MY LIFE....I DON"T USUALLY DO PROFESSOR COMMENTS BUT I'M TRYING TO SAVE SOMEBODY A BAD GRADE......RUN AND DON'T EVEN LOOK BACK YOUR NOT MISSING ANYTHING

Class was mandatory, but we were graded on a extremely literal summary of articles. Translation, THERE WAS NO NEED TO GO TO CLASS!!!If you put in anything outside of the article for the paper, you would be graded low.

PSYC 3040.comment: Emery expects you to remember every single word he says in class, every single word in the textbook, every and single word in the scientific journals (about 10 per week). If you're on the verge of a mental episode and need a straw to break the camels back, this class is perfect for you!

PSYC 2410.comment: Such an interesting course and Emery is clearly passionate about what he is teaching. There are extra credit opportunities available and although it is a lot of textbook reading it's not unmanageable

Robert Emery is fantastic! He clearly cares about his students and he is very approachable. His lectures are very engaging, but they do deviate from the textbook content so you need to both pay attention in lecture and do the readings in order to be well-prepared for the exams. He offers extra credit opportunities in the form of easy papers.
Emery is my favorite prof I've had at UVA. The lectures are interesting, the tests are pretty easy, and there are extra credit opportunities to improve an entire letter grade. I highly recommend.

One of the worst professors I have ever had. He was an arrogant man, and makes you read the textbook that he wrote. His tests were formatted to trick you, and your grade is based solely on those 4 tests. He was a dry lecturer and it was a challenge to stay awake. I read every chapter and still struggled to pass - DO NOT take abnormal psych with him

Definitely not an easy A. There are few tests, and they are extremely difficult. However, she does curve so that the class average is an 85, which is super generous. Lectures aren't recorded, and tests are mostly based on powerpoints, so definitely go in person! One on one, she's very kind and knowledgeable.

Horn is a very nice lady, but the class is hard. Your entire grade is 3 exams + the final and the exams are extremely detailed. Questions are on the smallest, seemingly unimportant facts/topics from class. She also offers 6 extra credit papers, and if you pass them all your grade is boosted. The ECs are VERY difficult and have unclear expectations.

This class is famously difficult, but if you love psychology or just mental health in general, you might just be okay. This class is what a lot of people think psychology is all about, and while that's not entirely true, the material is very important and I recommend all PSYC majors take it. Credit to Prof. Horn though, because she made it work.

I loved the course and Dr. Horn is a very intelligent person. Her tests are a little tricky but she curves them (in everyone's favor) and so they end up being fair. She provides all you need to know to do well on exams, but her lectures can sometimes be monotonous. There is extra cred, its tough to get but definitely worth it.

Dr Horn is a decent lecturer, albeit somewhat boring/monotonous. Her lectures are extremely dense with information, and you can tell she's slightly anxious while giving lectures. Her exams are very tricky, with at least 5/6 questions each exam being ambiguous and poorly asked. She is very nice and helpful outside of class.

BME 2104.comment: Prof Zunder has no regard for time spent outside of class. His lectures always spill over into rushed-through postvideos and extra long prelectures. There is no textbook, either, so you have to study what he says IF he remembers to record class, and be prepared to rapidly answer polling questions. Only redeeming value is the easy project deadlines.

Great professor. Very approachable during and outside of class, and will answer even very complex questions during lecture to the best of his ability. The class is challenging, however, and it can be easy to fall behind if you don't manage your time well. There is a major group paper that is a significant percentage of the overall grade.

PETR 3559.comment: Milani is a nice lady in the appearance, however her classes are really boring. We basically talked about the same subject over and over at her class.

I took a class with her for the second time and I highly regret it. Milani doesnt like for anyone to disagree with what she thinks. She also Isnt a fair grader. Her grades highly depends on how much she likes you.
Mialni finds her own ideas brilliant and doesn't like for any student to disagree with what she thinks. She also assigned many books for purchase which were never used in the class.

THE GREATEST PROFESSOR IN THE LAND!! but seriously-- this class was incredible. milani has a lot of interdisciplinary expertise to bring to classes aside from being literally the top of her field in forough farrokhzad. count on profound insights and interesting observations from her every class. easily one of the top 3 classes i've taken at UVa.

SWAG 3995.comment: She is inspiring, intelligent, classy, clear assignments, interesting readings, and she would do anything to help anyone. She is a true scholar and it really shows. She was definitely meant for teaching. I never met someone who didn't like her or enjoy her class.

PHIL 2420.comment: Ross is a great lecturer and this class mostly relies on lectures. Only outside work was the weekly discussion questions but even that didn't take much time because we went over them in discussion. If you miss class he'll cover the material one on one. He's super chill and understanding. The material is difficult but he's not a difficult prof.

He is an amazing professor! He is clearly passionate about the topic, and despite it being an 8am class, it was my favorite of the semester. He makes the lectures funny but also explains even the more difficult topics in a simple way. The tests are pretty difficult but very manageable if you do the work. I'm taking him again next semester!

He is a great professor who explains complex well and is always able to further clarify points. Attending class is preferable but he provides detailed notes of his lectures online. Going to class is worth the time though since he goes through examples of more complicated proofs which help when doing the weekly discussion questions.

Fantastic professor! Had him for Ontological Themes as well. He is extraordinarily talented at explaining very complex things in a simple and understandable way. One of my favorite philosophy professors.

Easy class if you do all the readings and coming to every class.  Homeworks are great because you can check to make sure they're correct before you submit, and that's 40% of your grade.  Needs to make sure his mic is on before lecturing with his back to the audience.  My TA was great and explained things well, so that also helped.

THE BEST! very helpful, especially in office hours, but the class itself/the material is very difficult...he is a wonderful old man, though. truly caring and someone who wants you to understand and will help you get there if you make the effort, too!
Awesome ta. He's really nice and helpful outside of class. Doesn't have set office hours but pretty flexible about meeting up. Only con is he's incredibly sexy which makes it hard to focus at times.

PHIL 3400.comment: The class was very interesting, and Professor Cameron was a great lecturer. The grading being 3 non-cumulative take home tests was convenient. It is definitely a step-up from PHIL 2420 difficulty-wise, although in my opinion it was less work/homework than it. If you're interested in logic or like mathematical thinking, I highly recommend!

AAS 2224.comment: Lisa's class was amazing! She is an excellent lecturer and is extremely knowledgeable. Discussions and lectures are so interesting you will want to go to class. If you aren't ready to do the reading, then don't take this class! Every day there is a short and super easy homework quiz (easy if you've done the reading!).

EDHS 4300.comment: He's a good man, that cares about each student he comes to meet that shows him that same respect. Give him grace and he will give you grace. Do the bare minium and show up and youll do good. Hes a good guy.

Loncke is one of these cool older profs at UVa who just does his thing and if you're into his thing he's happy to share. His exams are not hard at all, so I wouldn't have gone to lecture if it weren't for iClicker points because they get a little boring, but he's a sweet guy and makes them as funny as he can. He likes learning students' names.

Kind, funny, adorable Dutch accent, tries to learn students' names in a 130 student class, engaging lectures, uses lots of videos in class to keep things interesting. Make sure  you do all the assignments listed in the syllabus- there's not that many, but easy to forget bc they're not all directly related to class. Only skimmed book b4 midterm

EDHS 5020.comment: Professor Loncke is a nice and approachable person. Class was easy and chill, though kind of boring to me.

EDHS 5080.comment: Prof Loncke is so helpful and excited about speech science, it makes this ridiculous 3-hour long class bearable because he is such a great professor.  The midterm and final are moderately easy if you study the powerpoints and come to class.

RELI 2010.comment:
I wasn't in RELI2010, but the course titled "Debating Islam," which is an engagement. It was low stakes, pretty stress free. During lecture, he can get lost in his own thoughts which becomes difficult to follow. Often plays devil's advocate during discussion for better analysis.
Grades were primarily determined by two essays and two presentations.
Talks slow and repeats himself a lot. Reading is very similar to the lectures.

RELI 2080.comment: boring, uninspiring lecturer despite interesting course content. doesn't respond clearly to questions or e-mails. can be patronizing. would not recommend religious studies at uva.

very good professor, makes you question current situations. Very knowledgable in his area hence he manages to increase our enthusiasm and curiosity by just asking the right questions. However the class subject is very clear, stick to the book and you'll be fine.
The class wasn't hard, but lectures were kind of disorganized or boring at times. The content of the class is worthwhile, though.

ECE 3750.comment: It's a good thing Powell is on his way out because his methods of teaching some of the hardest matrerial offered at UVA are archaic and beyond frustrating. Prepare yourself for excruciating labs that don't correspond learned material and help that never goes beyond "Have you tried doing the reading?".

Great professor if you are willing to learn the material. He is also most amazing in office hours. His tests, however, are often too long for a 50 min section. Overall, you will learn from him if you just listen attentively during the lecture. The book is alright

Extremely unclear, obviously more concerned with his research than students.  Class periods are uninformative and replaceable with the textbook.  Examples are rife with errors and the homework is hard.

ECE 2660.comment: Electronics is a hard class, but Prof Powell does everything he can to make it easy on you and is very understanding if you are having a hard time. If you are not a native English speaker, you may have a hard time with his accent, so be prepared to read  the textbook and work with TAs. If the lab graders are being harsh, let him know. He'll fix it.
he is kind of shy and he makes alot of mistakes. I don't think he prepares before he lectures, but he is very knowledgable in the content

Very poor grading policy with no communication about students? grades.  Majority of homework problems were trivial and did not provide specifics about circuits. The professor presented lectures in a poor fashion and jumped from subject to subject. Overall, the professor did a poor job teaching this subject.
Brandt-Pearce is very smart, and tries to be a good lecturer, but unfortunately comes across as very disorganized.

ECE 3250.comment: Great Professor. The class is somewhat involved but the material is interesting. Self-teaching is required especially if you are interested in greater detail. Expect to spend 4-6 hours/week on homework, 8-12 hours on Transformer Design Project and 15-20 hours on Final Research Project.

LATI 2010.comment: Professor Kuin was very kind and made the readings relate to our everyday lives.  There was a lot of group work but it's enjoyable because it's nice forming new connections and hearing other opinions.

Pros:
-She explains things well
-She's very nice and will go out of her way to attempt to compliment your translation even if it is wrong
-Office hours are great
-She holds extra help sessions
Cons:
-Participation is 15%, and she DOES NOT GIVE 100s. I had to convince her to give me a 97.
-She doesn't explain the composition assignments at all.

Knows Latin & ok at presenting new material but wasn't always prepared for class. Sometimes he spent class time trying to figure out the translation himself. Rather unapproachable outside of class. Sometimes condescending in response to questions.  Never posted grades online. Often unresponsive to emails. By far the worst TA I have ever had.

DS 1002.comment: He is a funny Italian, but he is a horrible teacher unfortunately. Very unorganized, all over the place and gets himself confused.

MAE 6410.comment: Teaches from Premade notes that are riddled with errors

APMA 1100.comment: Terrible teacher. He'll show a single, simple example that will take an entire class for one problem, then expect us to figure out how to do the complicated multi-step problems on the quizzes and tests in 5 mins. He has 2 office hours, makes frequent mistakes and is often unclear. Expect to spend lots of time in workshops/tutor sessions to pass.

APMA 1120.comment: Guadagni is a joke.  The worst math teacher I have ever had, and this guy supposedly has a PHD in math.  He does not even know the values of the unit circle. If you want to learn from a guy that relies on the textbook for his information go ahead and take him.  Oh and good luck asking him for extra help. He has 2 office hours a week.

MATH 1110.comment: He is a machine at math.  I enjoyed not having to attend class.  It was difficult material and I prefer to use my book, but I think if I had attended class more often then I would have had no trouble.  I learned the material.

A lot of my classmates and I were surprised this is an introductory course. There was a good amount of online homework with the textbook website. There were two midterms (one was oral) and one final. There were three quizzes and three written homeworks. This class was okay.

Mark manages to use three entirely separate platforms to base his grades after. If you are not capable of checking each of these platforms at least three times a week, you will miss something. He is condescending and beyond unapproachable. If he is asked to explain something again, he says the exact same thing only slower. Not worth the time.

JAPN 2020.comment: I like his class. He is a nice guy.

JAPN 2010.comment: He likes to drink. And is a good class

SYS 2202.comment: Just stay away from her. Terrible.

He s probably the worst professor in the systems curriculum. He teaches you nothing, reads directly off powerpoint slides, then expects you to know how to do things he hasn't taught you. He thinks we're all worthless and don't try, but he doesn't teach so he's the worst. If you want to learn in this class, you'll have to teach yourself.

COLA 1212.comment: He's the sweetest person and cares about what he teaches. He's a bit unorganized and is almost late to class but he makes a boring topic interesting if you try to pay attention.
He's really nice as a person..

GETR 3330.comment: He is all over the place and not very organized. He does not know how to present the information in an effective way and is very confusing. I do not recommend taking a class with him.

Professor Kaiser, although a very nice person, did not provide a syllabus until a month into the course and then did not even remotely adhere to the syllabus. We only had two graded assignments: one paper and the final. He also liked to hear himself talk and spent every class talking without caring if anyone understood the concepts.

STAT 7100.comment: He has the most complicated grading system and class calender. Each class he spend some time introduce the rule, the rest of time is left for other student's presentation. This is a math or stat course.

STAT 2012.comment: Certainly a very difficult class, given the content. However, Professor Spitzner knows his stuff and is very generous. Just make sure you study.

STAT 6120.comment: Prof Spitzner is a great teacher who explains difficult concepts as clearly as they can be explained.  He's very helpful and the tests, while very challenging, help you truly understand the material.  It's not a memorize-and-you'll-be-fine course, but it is one where you'll learn a lot if you put in the time!

AMST 2001.comment: Fairly easy class, but a lot of reading that isn't really necessary to excel in the class. Just pay close attention to your TAs when it comes to your discussion class. She comes off as rude and entitled sometimes, and did not personally make me feel welcome to be in the class after I had to join in a bit late. If you need help, just go to a TA.

Professor Hale is one of the best professors I had in four years at UVA. She keeps it real like few professors I've ever met; she is open about her opinions and embraces conversations with opinions that differ from hers. Her lectures are brilliant, her seminars are thought-provoking and she is someone you should visit in office hours.

Dr. Hale is an amazing teacher with a world class command of the history of the American South.  Highly recommend her courses.  She is sometimes hard to follow because she thinks so fast- be prepared to work to keep up!

Professor Hale is awesome -- even though she seems disheveled sometimes, she is super knowledgeable about the subjects she teaches and brings a great perspective to the table when it comes to race and the south. She is a scholar but could easily be an on-the-ground activist, so she is passionate and easy to talk to. She has a good sense of humor.

Professor Hedstrom was truly the saving grace of this class. He was funny and kind and truly knew of the materials he was lecturing about. Very clear in lectures and easy to understand, and made topics interesting to learn. Fairly easy class, just pay close attention and ask questions when it comes to your discussion section with your TAs.

Such a passionate and personal professor - would definitely recommend. The material is interesting with only three grades for the semester. Midterm, project, final (take home). All were pretty fair and interesting. Definitely recommend and not too hard!

Hedstrom is a really nice guy who is really invested in his specialty (religion and american studies) and tries to bring both disciplines into his teaching whenever he can. He is young, funny, interesting and easy to talk to during office hours. Take any classes you can with him

HIUS 3232.comment: Dr Hale is a great lecturer, super engaging. There are some times where the classroom environment is a little weird. She'll seem a little harsh sometimes but she actually cares about her students so if you feel weird about something she's said you can totally talk to her about it. Graded on weekly reading responses and two exams.
Professor Varon is engaging and the material is interesting. You can tell that she cares about the topic and about her students. Absolutely would take again.

RELG 2660.comment: I took his Spiritual but not religious this semester, he is the best lecturer I've ever had, now I finally know what a college-level lecture should be like. He has the appropriate amount of humor and he knows a lot about what he is teaching. Taking his class is very enjoyable, will consider taking his class again!

I can't recommend Professor Hedstrom enough. He's really funny and engaging, which made lecture enjoyable. I've had him for Intro to American Studies as well as Spiritual But Not Religious and I wish I could take another one of his classes. He manages to teach in a though-provoking way yet you won't be fretting about your grade. Take his classes!!

Hedstrom is fantastic. He is an adorable nerdy man who is definitely willing to get to know you and is so interested in the material (he came up with the curriculum for the course himself). This class is also super interesting.

30% of course grade is from participation in discussion. Lectures can be dry, but exams are free response and pretty broad. Lots of readings from equally dry books. Definitely worth it to knock out gen-ed requirements.

AMST 2500.comment: Amazing professor. Very helpful and enthusiastic about whatever he teaches. Great response. Willing to bend over backwards to help students. Engaging, and funny. TAKE HIS CLASSES!

Class was interesting because of the people. It's an easy class. It's a good easy second writing requirement. 3 (3-5) papers, 1 research (10-15) paper. But it's easy! Common, everyday topics. Discussions everyday. Only thing annoying is hw.

Very enthusiastic about her course materials, discussions were interactive and a comfortable setting. Professor Goff really knows what she's talking about, and will help you out if you ask. Not an easy grader, but if you do what she asks you can do well. If you're interested in American Studies, take a class with her!

Pretty interesting class. Readings can be heavy at times, but manageable. Most of class is just discussion and your grade is primarily papers and the final. Goff is passionate about the class and welcomes accounts of personal experience and real life examples that relate to class topics.

RELG 2455.comment: Hedstom is a great professor.  He is newer to UVA so he isn't widely known yet.  While he does require a bit of reading from primary source books, he creates literally the best study guides for exams (the exam comes directly from the study guide) and he is very helpful with questions.  Wonderful professor!  He is also kind of funny.

ENCW 2300.comment: I took this class as an ENWR substitute and I absolutely don't regret it! Lucas is very kind and truly cares about his students, and is very easy to contact if needed. All that is required is a few big writing assignments and weekly poem assignments, which are super thought-provoking and fun! Loved this class.
I loved having prof Seu as my instructor, she cares so much about her student's success and writing/creative development. She was always my last class, but it was always the highlight of my day.

An incredible professor and an incredible course. It was so rewarding and everyone learned so much about themselves as writers. I have never taken a college class in which such an amazing peer/professor dynamic was established, and it was definitely a product of Professor Seu's nature as a person and teacher. Would recommend to anyone & everyone<3

Prof. Seu really made it easy for me to get excited about poetry. This is unlike a normal English class that involves tons of reading. Instead, any reading you do helps with in-class discussion. Prof. Seu is amazing at giving feedback and really tailors it to every student. Get ready to write your own poetry that only gets better as time goes on!

Professor Seu is honestly one of the best teachers I've ever had, and the reason I'm pursuing an English minor. The work load is totally doable and she's always available outside of class for questions. She makes her classes fun and really interactive, I was always excited for what she had to teach. One of the best classes at UVA hands down!

Professor Seu has been one of the most inspiring professors I've had at UVA so far. She always makes each class engaging and thoughtfully planned. She's really changed the way I see poetry and transformed my poetry to another level. Professor Seu gives great insightful feedback during discussions and workshops and creates a community of comfort.

From the first day of class, Prof Seu worked to build relationships with each of her students. This translates into a class environment where everyone is excited about participating. Her feedback on assignments was thorough, thoughtful, and constructive. She is insanely passionate about making her students better readers and writers.

I've learned to appreciate poetry through her class. Her classes are very engaging, with many chances for students to express themselves. In addition, she is really great discussion leader, sparking many great conversations in the class.

Prof. Aimee inspired me to become the poet I am today. Without her, my confidence would have died, but she helped me reach for the next level in my craft and creation... I will forever be profoundly grateful for the impact she has had on my poetry and my life.
I LOVE THIS TEACHER. Professor Aimee is so cool and nice! The class is all workshops but she makes them helpful! Not hard but a decent amount of work.

I'd never had much experience with poetry before this workshop, but Professor Aimee not only inspired my interest in poetry writing but offered specific, incredibly helpful feedback during class and consistently made herself available to meet one on one. Her class was also a ton of fun, and she's such a kind, funny, down-to-earth person. Amazing!!!

As a student who hasn't really had much experience writing poetry, Professor Aimee really helped me cultivate creative writing skills, both by consistent encouragement and detailed constructive comments. Also, her style of conducting class is awesome! I felt that everyone benefited from having group workshops, since you brought amazing energy!

Prof Aimee was one of my favorite professors in college so far. I had never written poetry before her class, and after workshop with her, I had a whole new level of confidence because her feedback was constructive and detailed but also encouraging. She also brought an energy to class that was just amazing! LOVED this class! Such creative lessons.

Prof Aimee is super respectful and moderates poetry workshops really well! Her feedback is always very detailed and she always makes sure to explain why she thinks a certain change should be made. I came in not expecting much but the improvement in my poetry has been astounding!!! I always look forward to class- there is so much worth learning!
Professor Seu really helped me improve my poetry writing. She was very helpful with poetry revision during workshop as well as during office hours. I wish I could take this class again!

Emily is the most influential educator I have known. Her class was insightful, introspective, and explorative. The poetic tale that she weaved was entirely original and riveting; its not just Whitman and Eliot, but a collection of unique voices that all have something important to say about the human condition. Whatever she is teaching, take it.

I had never taken a creative writing class before nor had I ever written poetry, but none of that mattered when it came to this class because Ms. Lawson is such a great professor. She truly cares about all her students, she loves the material, and you can tell that she really enjoys teaching. I loved this class.
Amazing class! Lawson encourages creativity but not at the expense of insight. She introduces you to poetry in a really unique way--you won't be reading a who's who of the Poets Hall of Fame!

The world needs more teachers like Emily! She is incredibly thoughtful, considerate, and open minded. She really worked to understand each student as an individual and created a warm, collaborative, welcoming classroom environment.

I took Sean's Intro to Poetry Writing last semester and it was an amazing experience. He is a great speaker and listener; he challenges you to do your best without being overbearing. Class was always enjoyable, lighthearted, and constructive. Be ready to spend time writing and discussing your poems. Really awesome class and teacher!
Sean is an excellent professor. Created a great environment for students to share their poetry, which is impressive considering how personal this activity is. Would definitely take his class again!

Sean is really knowledgable in his field and engaging his in class (and outside of class--he is very approachable). He facilitates workshop in a manner that encourages participation and thoughtfulness. He truly wants his students to learn and succeed. Would recommend taking this class and/or another one of Sean's classes!

HIME 3559.comment: Professor Gratien makes difficult work enjoyable. He treats everyone fairly and is very equitable and understanding. He is one of the easiest professors I've ever worked with in terms of accomodations and assistance. He is super approachable and incredibly knowledgable - he also has a podcast, which is kind of cool.

I really liked Gratien's Mediterranean class for a number of reasons. His class is not grade-focused, and an A is easy. The majority of work is in the form of short papers on readings, and one very long paper at the end of the year. You only need to go to like 2/3 of the lectures to get full credit, but the lectures were interesting. No tests.

PHYS 1060.comment: I really didn't like the class, not because Lou wasn't nice, but because Physics really isn't my area of interest. I wanted an easy science course to fulfill a requirement, and it is "easy" in the sense that there is a big curve, but the professor isn't the best lecturer and questions in testsproblem sets are very confusing. But Lou is nice.

I loved Physics in high school but had a much better teacher who made it more interesting.  If you can stay awake, you will do well.  Grades on exams don't mean much.  He skews the grades and you will never understand how he does it.

Lou is funny, very approachable, and somehow knows the names of most people in his large lectures. Despite the rumors, this class is not easy, per se. It is simply conceptual as opposed to mathematical, though admittedly simplified. Tests are highly curved, but graded strangely (he account for guessers). Just go to lecture, he's the cutest.

Lou is one of the best professors I've had. He's funny and very approachable. He takes the time to get to know all of his students, even in a big lecture. That said, this class IS NOT as easy as it's made out to be. It's not bad but remember that you really need to put effort into doing the work and you'll enjoy it and do well

DO NOT BE DECEIVED BY THIS CLASS! I was told this was a very easy class but it is harder than it seems. You do need to attend lecture for clicker question points. The tests are difficult and require attendance in class, reading the textbook, and studying. Prof. Lou is a great guy but this class requires work. Beware!

HIST 2002.comment: Very knowledgeable and experienced but sometimes came off as quite cocky

He is very knowledgeable and clearly loves to teach history. The class is demanding with one 75 min lecture and then a few hours a week of watching lecture videos and then a few hours of reading. There are weekly online quizzes & class quizzes based on videos & readings. Several papers and grades depend on your TA. Exams are written to confuse you.
very smart! relatively approachable. Love the online lectures.

Tests are very very tough and requires you to read or skim over all readings since that is what they are based on. I didn't have study much (or at all) for the exams because I did the readings.He is a good lecturer but lectured on things I was not interested in. I did well but would not take this again.

This is the first time Zelikow has done this class, and it's... challenging. There is a TON of reading for each class and supplementary reading quizzes. You MUST read for the two Midterms. Lectures are neither bad or good. If you're in love  with History, I suppose it wouldn't be awful, but otherwise the readings are overwhelming.

This class was easy but very confusing because of the way he teaches and views history. Daily THPs were a pain and some people never got the hang of them. Map quiz every week so you have to go to discussions. Reading the textbook helps, but really only for the map quizzes. No exam, only 2 short papers and 1 long one at the end of the semester.

HIUS 3456.comment: Professor Zelikow loves to answer questions, but be ready for a super long response and tangent. Overall a lot of reading and you better do it because he has daily quizzes. He is a great lecturer and knows his stuff. He has great experiences and stories to share. If you love history and foreign affairs, this is the class for you.
Excellent lecturer, expert in his field, tough grader. One of the best and toughest classes I took at UVA.

HIST 3452.comment: Zelikow is an absolutely phenomenal lecturer. This, mixed with the interesting subject matter of WWII, his insightful nature, and a bit of comic relief, has made him by far the best professor I've had. The catch is that there are really only two grades (both papers). However, if you have gone to class and are able to write well, you should be fine.

HIUS 2052.comment: As long as you do the readings, this class is a breeze, but Zelikow's lectures are some of the best at UVA

Incredibly knowledgeable about the stuff he teaches. Phenomenal lecturer and in discussion (seminars). I've taken both a 15 person seminar on The Rise of Liberalism and the much larger History of American War from WWI on with him and both were amazing. It's a good amount of writing, but you don't need to memorize any tedious stuff for tests.

Zelikow is one of the most interesting professors I have had. He has served several high level positions in the government and uses his experiences in the lectures. This class requires about 100-150 pages worth of reading each class, with a weekly quiz on it. The midterm and final are both 12 page papers. The discussion section was engaging as well

HIEU 2162.comment: took russian history w/ rossman & while there was a LOT of reading (both textbook and packet readings) it was very rewarding. not too much work outside of the reading- three 2pg papers due throughout semester which weren't too hard + midterm and final. grading was pretty lenient. lectures very fast-paced & contained a lot of info so don't skip

hist of russia since 1917 is a great class. rossman is a fantastic lecturer and very knowledgeable. lots of reading but not unmanageable. the essays are annoying but you can basically write them in one sitting. he seems grumpy when you ask questions but still answers them well. participate in section and read the class packets and u will be fine

My first ever college course as a visiting student in Summer 2015. His material really opened my eyes & the professor was certainly knowledgeable & competent, but after attending several years of community college he seems pretty average in retrospect, don't fall behind on readings or lectures.

The class was pretty easy as long as you kept up with the reading (there was kind of a lot of it, but not unmanageable). Professor Rossman is really knowledgeable and passionate about the subject and I think that both of the TA's in my class seemed really nice. They didn't grade very hard at all.

His lectures are pretty interesting. His knowledge on Russian history truly is extensive and impressive. And you really don't have to read the textbook if you attend his lectures and read the packets.

HIST 3281.comment: Professor Rossman is a great lecturer and handles this difficult subject in good taste. You don't have to read the textbook to do well but you should at least read the supplementary readings that are assigned in order to be prepared for discussion and they will show up on the midterm and final which are short answer and essay questions.

Final exam is 50% final grade. Best lecturer I've ever had to date. This class makes you work for it but it's worth it; you come out of this class a more perceptive and empathetic person. The subject matter is of course extremely heavy, and was really hard emotionally.
Very into what he's teaching. His voice draws you in and you can't help but pay attention. Only 3 papers and one midterm. Very manageable.

ANTH 2400.comment: sicoli is absolutely fantastic. took language in human evolution with him (ANTH 2415)- one of the most rewarding classes i've taken. very easy- not much reading + all lectures offered on zoom. discussion was easy & interesting. lectures made me think about things i'd never thought about before. highly recommend this class/any class taught by him.
LOVE Sicoli, such a good lecturer. ANTH 2415 Language in Human Evolution is one of the best classes I've taken here--super interesting and easy. would love to take another of his classes

Professor Sicoli was a wonderful instructor when I had him. He clearly cares very deeply about the subject of linguistic anthropology. If you're like me, you might think that subject to be too nebulous to care about, but honestly, I'm now more fascinated in language than ever, all thanks to Mark.

Professor Sicoli had three tests and discussion sections were 28%. He offered a few extra credits and that was nice. His lectures were specific and he had good PowerPoints with them. You only use two books and they are both interesting.

Prof. Sicoli is extremely knowledgeable and a great professor. The texts in this class are pretty easy to understand and his tests are a breeze. He is also extremely caring and considerate toward the needs of his students. I learned so much from this class which I was not looking forward to at first. I highly recommend it to everyone.

I love Grace so much. She is so knowledgeable in her subject and her passion for it radiates through her lectures and assignments. She asks intelligent questions and can answer anything that you throw at her. I decided to minor in lx anth because of this class - I loved it and her so dearly!!!

I actually liked Anth 2400. I had never taken an Anthropology class before, and I'm glad that I was able to have her as an instructor. There are 4 assignments for the entire semester. One is a group project. There is a lot of reading, but you definitely don't have to read everything to pass. I loved this class. Grace is a very easy grader!

It's been a couple of years since I took Language and Culture with Adam, but I still think about his class whenever I hear someone put on an accent. He's a super laid back teacher, but you learn a lot because he knows his stuff and knows how to explain it.

Significant amount of readings (all hit or miss), but manageable. Lectures = readings in verbal form sometimes. Ellen is pretty cool. Just 3 non-cumulative tests. SUPER interesting & SUPER applicable. Loved this class by the end of it.
Really easy and we watched a lot of videos and read interesting articles. The professor was really chill and so was the TA.

SOC 3120.comment: Pretty straight forward class and professor Skubby is very helpful. By taking good notes on the lectures, read the textbook, and participate, you'll do good!

Skubby does not allow you to ask for lecture slides if you miss class. He has three exams, two midterms, and one final. You need to literally memorize his slides and if you reword things, he deducts points. He assigns so much homework for the almost two hour labs. He is also really boring.

This is my 3rd class with Professor PeeksMease. He is why I switched to a Sociology major. Watch out though because the other professors are not like him. I wish I could take more classes with him. If you get the chance take him. I mean he even makes stats relevant and understandable and awesome.

Taking this right now. He actually makes all the lecture examples about UVA students. So like he gives us the #s of different racial grps @ UVA and then has us figure out ratios and percent changes over the years based on real data. Makes it more relevant and interesting. Plus he actually knows how to teach and cares. Highly recomend the class.

It's stats and he makes it enjoyable to attend class. Odd but it is my favorite class this semester. Cool guy and really accessible. Always in his office hours and even met me outside office hours. Lots of energy and makes it really relevant. Awesome class and wish he taught more classes at UVA.

SOC 3700.comment:
Professor Skubby was one of the worst teachers! Boring classes and mandatory participation. He wants you to memorize his slides and write them down word by word in the exams!!! 
Assignments are five books to read, one 10-page book review, one scholarly written paper (around 15 pages), five midterms, and five articles for discussion. Don't take him.

Prof. Skubby is the BEST! Ive taken 2 of his classes and am about to take a third. He keeps class interesting + engaging, sticks to the syllabus (so no surprises!), and has open office hours 4-5x per week. Though it is a lot of reading (5-8, 100-300 pg books/semester), the books are applicable + entertaining. 1000% would recommend his classes.

Professor Skubby and his TA Heidi are both awesome. I found the course interesting, but there is a ton of reading and writing. It does count for the 2nd writing requirement, but it sure is a lot of work. All grading, though, is very, very fair.

CLAS 2559.comment: Took Athenian Democracy with her, where students roleplayed as ancient Greeks doing politics - amazing beyond words. Not for everyone as the class requires a lot of public speaking/plotting/creativity/loud debates (very DND-like), but if you want a unique class, it's a must! JAM is intelligent, kind, fun, has unique projects/exams, incomparable.

CHIN 1010.comment: she is offensive and easily angry with students.

Chen laoshi is incredible. She's very sassy, which can make it hard to get along with her at first, but you'll find that as long as you put in a decent amount of effort, she'll like you and you'll be able to do very well.

Chen-?? is very understanding. Though she is very intimidating in the beginning, it is only because she is trying to root out unserious students so that interested ones can get in. She is very flexible with her hours, but her temper can fray at times.
Love Ran Zhao to death. She was the best professor I has first year. If you get the opportunity to take her at UVA take it

I cannot say enough good things about Zhao Laoshi. She is one of the best teachers I've ever had. Chinese is an incredibly difficult language, but Zhao Laoshi makes it fun and makes you really want to put in all the work. There is a lot of work! But it is completely worth it. If you work hard you will absolutely earn her respect and do well.
Literally the best professor at UVA. Had her for 4 semesters straight. After just 2 years of Chinese with her, I went to China for a summer, and they were astounded by how exceptional my chinese was.

Feng Laoshi is the best! The most fun class I had this sem. Most looked forward to it everyday. You learn so much and have to study everyday, but it is so worth it. She is very helpful and so sweet. She grades well and is consistent. The class started from knowing 0 Chinese... now we can talk. And write. And read. 我很喜欢&#

Bao Laoshi is the greatest Chinese teacher ever.  I learned so much in this class.  Although the workload was intense she motivated us to work through it.  I will now go on to the next level with a strong foundation in the language.  Sadly, i believe, she is only here for one year..so take her in the spring if you can!! it might be your last chance

CHIN 2010.comment: Chen laoshi makes her students participate in every class and do daily homework exercises, but it pays off. She gives feedback on every assignment and will not leave a student to struggle without help. This class is a heavy workload but Chen laoshi will give you a good grade if you put in the effort.

STAT 1100.comment: Just go ahead, you'll never regret taking his class.

We pretty much didn't learn any actual statistics. He's a nice person but not the best teacher (not native english). I would recommend this class for a relatively easy A/B. The homeworks use python alot and take some problem solving so they can be time consuming but you have a week to do them, they're 40% off the grade and a bunch of grades drop.

At first I had high hopes for this professor. All quizzes and home-works are graded for completion and he was always available for office hours. However, beware of this professor, he is not very clear with his explanations, and does not go over quizzes or home-works in the best manner possible. He does not give good feedback, which is needed.

RELC 1220.comment: One of, if not the, easiest classes I've taken - grading of assignments depended on TAs (some harsher than others), assignments didn't take much time at all and only required skimming the readings. Attendance isn't taken which is also nice. I enjoyed the GPA boost and Professor Spittler's enthusiasm for the subject, overall would recommend!

Seriously the easiest class I've taken at UVA! She records all lectures and posts them online, you have a weekly assignment that takes 10-20 minutes to do and is graded super leniently. Class materials are free. You don't have to do the readings to do well in class (she gives you all the info you need during lectures) and there are no tests.

Dr. Spittler is a great professor, I took her New Testament Christianity class, she keeps a balanced perspective and her assignments are easy to follow and to do well on. I would totally recommend for anyone, but especially if you want to learn more about New Testament Chrisitianity. When I took her class our grade was made up of 12 assignments.

Kyle was so helpful. Very knowledgeable, clear, and offered lots of extra credit. He was willing to meet with students for lunch during the week and was just overall overflowing with enthusiasm for the subject matter. If you're taking this class try to get Kyle as your TA. You'll learn a lot.

Don't take this class. He's really boring and the tests require you to know which verse came out of which book in the Bible. If you absolutely have to take this class, don't pick Chris as your TA. He gives pop quizzes and isn't very approachable

Gamble is great!  Easy lecturer.  He might be a bit boring, but if you listen to what he says it's VERY interesting.  He reminds you of an old grandfather teaching his grandchildren about the bible. Pretty easy class too.  Reading isn't terrible.  Homework assignments vary based on the TA, but ours were very easy.  I recommend it - you learn a lot!

PHS 3050.comment: An easy-ish class but expect busy work; Professor Hornsby knows her stuff and invites a lot of knowledgeable public health experts to speak which is fun, but quizzes were quite random and group assignments didn't help me to understand things better. This class was what made me realize I didn't want to do public health, but I enjoyed the GPA boost.

Worst professor at UVA. Both of her classes that I was required to take were honestly my least favorite I've ever taken. It's not that they were difficult, it was because she gives nexts to no feedback and her grading seems random. When asked, she doesn't give clear explanations. She assigns lots of busy work and I didn't feel I learned much.

PHS 2050.comment: Professor Hornsby is incredible. She gives great feedback. The class is part-lecture, part-discussion based and requires attendance. Intro to Public Health is interesting and a great class for anyone interested in medicine or public health. Expect a few online quizzes per semester and one online midterm/online final, along with a group project.

Professor Hornsby is a great introduction to public health world. The class is fairly easy, just a few online quizzes and a midterm/final. She does assign one group project for the semester, but it isn't too terrible. Overall, would recommend if you need to take a public health class/want an easier science elective.

ISIN 4520.comment: I took Prof Andrews for ISHU3623 and loved him so much I took his ISIN4520 the following semester. The work was always engaging and interesting and he emphasizes personal growth and reflection rather than spitting out information. I will take every class he offers during my time in the program. 1000% recommend, you will not regret it!

Professor Andrews cares about his students and their mental health. The timing of this course (Art and Insanity) went well with the state of things at the time (COVID-19/stress).The require readings were fascinating! Moreover, the final research paper and accompanying art project was a pleasurable task, even though both took many hours to complete.

Professor Andrews' class was amazing, and I would highly recommend it to anyone. The coursework was fascinating and eye-opening, while the professor was incredibly well versed in the subject. In addition, I really appreciated how interactive the lessons were and would absolutely take another one of his classes. Very supportive and caring professor!

ISHU 3623.comment: Professor Andrews is amazing! His knowledge of art is astounding. He pushes you to feel confident about your work and he always sees the best in his students. He cares about your work and he keeps you motivated and isnspired every week! He is a must take in any class that he offers!

George is one of my favorite professors at UVA - I've tried to take as many of his classes as I can. He is passionate about art and his students; he always went above and beyond to make sure his students are learning and enjoying the class. I wish all my professors were as wonderful as George!

Professor Andrews is gifted in the knowledge or art. He can teach you how to be an artist even when you do not think you have a artistic bone. His lectures are amazing so you learn a lot about the subject matter. He is a great teacher!

One of the most engaging professors that fosters an environment for self exploration and discovery. The freedom to explore and experiment is highly encouraged that creates a new outlook and approach to developing new perspectives and concepts. If you are willing to let go of self judgement and doubt you will learn a new way to express yourself.

Prof allowed the class to explore artists we were interested in as well as some we had never heard of that were fascinating.The studio part was awesome.I truly have no artistic talent but that didn't matter. He just cares that you grasp the techniques and concepts, and also how to critique art in an objective manner.

We did use the book a little. He wasn't terribly hands-on with the drawing instruction and people really need visual examples of how to make images, but he really loves art and encouraged his students to love it too.

ISHU 3621.comment: Great class. You get more from the material than you expect because Professor Andrews is very knowledgeable. The book is okay but the films he assigns are great and very relevant to the topic. He's also great at bringing out everyone's artistic abilities regardless of skill level. Definitely take any of his courses.

Take this class if you want to challenge yourself artistically. Prof allows you to express your art ability w/out pre-judgment. Was reluctant  due to lack of creative abilities. Professor critiques were always supportive and encouraging; other students' artwork-inspiring! Required: weekly writing & image forum posting, and online video screenings.

You will be surprised about how you think about art.  You will begin to notice that your daily perspective changes.  Suddenly, you will begin to view the world as a gigantic art project.  Not many professors can do that.

The course was fantastic.  The films, artwork, and discussions clarified and reinforced the topics covered in the textbook.  Professor Andrews helped awaken my creativity and passion for art which had been neglected for years.
Great class - allowed me to take up my hobby of photography that I haven't done in years.  Great class!
Fascinating class; the dynamic is energetic.

Professor Andrews was great! The class allowed people, like me, that are uncomfortable with art to feel at home exploring how they choose. It was always interesting lectures and insightful topics. This is a great class that allows art lovers and non art lovers to discover a new side of life.

I took this wonderful online class from him last semester at U.Va. and he assigned you tube or video links to view as well as submit feedback weekly to the forum and submit a weekly art project to the Media Gallery.  I never thought an art class could be this effective online but it was fantastic.  Goal=have fun!!

EVSC 1450.comment: The subject matter taught was important. However, the lectures were boring, in-person quiz questions were required daily, and she was very disorganized. I took this class in 2021, when masks were still required, and she was not accommodating for any illnesses (I took an exam with a fever and positive flu result). Not helpful outside of class.
Great teacher, very knowledgeable, passionate about subject matter. Just put effort into this course and you'll be fine.

Taken during covid, where tests were open note. Super easy, but tbh wouldn't have been hard even if closed note. Lots of other chances for points too--only 50% of your grade was exams, others included participation stuff, quizzes on chapter readings (easiest textbook ever), & a short easy blog post. Prof is super nice and passionate. No final.

I loved Prof Lawrence. To do well, make sure to read the textbook before tests, you have to stay on top of lectures (they are pre recorded) you have a 30 minute discussion during one of the class times, there are three exams and a project. You have a bunch of opportunities to do well. I think this was the best online course Ive taken.
Brutal lectures but attendance is enforced with Learning Catalytics questions. Tests are heavy on arbitrary details. Not nearly as interesting of a course as it appears. Definitely avoid.

Professor Lawrence is absolutely amazing. You can tell that she actually cares about the lectures she gives. The class super informative about climate change, and I've learned a lot. You get graded for participation in class by answering questions on Learning Catalytics. There are 4 exams (final isn't cumulative) and a blog post. Not much homework.

Professor Lawrence is a really engaging lecturer that made Climate, You & CO2 an awesome class! You do have to show up to answer learning catalytics questions and read the textbook, but if you do both of those it's almost impossible not to get an A.

easy A/B+! yes you need to go to class, but the tests are generally fair and theres no final for EVSC 1450. She's super enthusiastic about climate change and i liked listening to her. she assigns a lot of homework, but its just busy work like short easy quizzes and forum posts to get you participation points. definitely recommend. dont buy the book

EVSC 4142.comment: By far my favorite professor at UVA. She is ALWAYS available and quick to email back. Obviously wants to work with students and learn from them, too. If you like environmental science, she would be a great advisor!

NUIP 2060.comment: dr connelly has amazing lectures, office hours, attentive TAs, and cares so much about her students. the exam questions come directly from lecture notes, which are fill in the blank. i had her for microbio, a and p I, and a and p II all of which i enjoyed as classes and did well in.

Dr. Connelly is the most caring and kind professor you could have. She cares about each student and genuinely wants everyone to succeed. If you don't understand something, she is always more than willing to explain it multiple times. Her exams are fair, but you have to study to do well. As long as you study her class notes you will do great!

Dr. Connelly is a fantastic professor. She makes learning the material feel so effortless, and she is incredibly knowledgeable of what she is teaching. Her tests can be tough, but they come straight from the notes. So, study well and the tests will be a breeze.
I absolutely love her and she is truly passionate about what she teaches.
Good teacher, makes the class fair. Learned a lot.

Dr. Connelly is the absolute best. I always looked forward to going to her class and she definitely made my transition to UVA easier! She's honestly like your mom away from home, and her class isn't easy, but so worth it! She cares so much about her students and it's so evident in everything that she does.
Dr. Connelly was a fantastic teacher! She actually cared and was willing to explain things if you were confused. The tests were pretty hard, but they were straight from our notes.
Dr. Connelly is the best! She's very helpful and cares about her students. Her lectures are interesting and fun and her tests are hard but they come straight from the notes so there are no surprises.

Dr. Connelly is by far my favorite professor at UVA. She makes a hard class understandable, and she takes the time to learn all of her student's names. Her tests are challenging, but they come straight from the notes and are very fair.

NUIP 2080.comment: Dr. Connelly is so funny and the material is so interesting to any pre-health field student!!! Tests r detailed but straight from the notes so this class is "the work you put in equals the grade you get" (work is quizlets and memorizing). The notebook can take a while so find a good time to get it done early
Dr. Connelly changed my life. She is truly an incredible professor who loves and cares for every student she teaches.

PLAP 2250.comment: American Political tradition is one of the few politics courses that I thoroughly enjoyed during my time at UVA. The class is set up to draw on a lot of tensions inherent in political issues, and have students debate the readings/tensions. Professor Lykins is more than understanding, and super helpful outside of class. He wants to see you succeed.

I enjoyed American Political Tradition with Dr. Lykins. There is a good amount of reading for the class, but Lykins does a good job of contextualizing every class. He's a bit awkward, but super caring and attentive to his students. His office hours are very helpful. He is also an expert on pretty much anything politics related, he's hardly stumped.

Professor Uzzell is great. You read a ton for each class but the discussions are incredibly valuable. The class size is small which allows for you to really get to know her and the rest of your classmates.

Dr. Uzzell is an great teacher. She had a way of making a potentially boring subject ("American Political Tradition") very interesting and engaging through in-class discussion and activities. She  is an excellent lecturer, and is very helpful with essay comments and feedback. You WILL have to do all the readings, or risk making a fool of yourself.
Evan is fantastic, it's extremely straight forward and easy course. Much better than my intro to American Politics course. Even if you are not a polisci major I recommend taking this course.

Definitely my favorite class of the semester TAKE THIS CLASS. The class becomes a great discussion every time, and if you do the readings, it becomes a lot of fun. Evan may be young, but he really knows his stuff, cares about you and your grade, and works hard to make sure you get as much out of the class as possible.
Great professor in all aspects. He made the class wonderful and everyone in it had a good time because of him. Easy to approach and talk to. He is a great teacher and man. UVa will miss him.
Very fun and entertaining class. As long as you do your readings and participate in discussion you will learn a lot =)
Very nice and engaging teacher.  Readings are generally manageable, and always interesting. Good at fostering class discussion.
He's a really knowledgeable and nice guy. The readings are interesting and not too long. I strongly recommend his class!!

This class was a great start to politics. It covers several topics but also includes many constructive and in-depth discussions. Professor Russell is a great instructor and really knows the material well. The class is discussion based and he does a great job at facilitating these talks while teaching at the same time. Highly recommend

HIAF 2002.comment: He does complain a lot about people not showing up to class. He doesn't grade assignments until the last minute, and you get almost no feedback. He is kind of boring and assigns a lot of reading.

Mason is overhated for no reason. If you show up every day and communicate about assignments (it is ok to be late, but you have to email him for an extension and he will be understanding) you will be fine. This is the class I learned the most material in so far, I took dozens of pages of notes and thoroughly enjoyed this class.

Mason is not as bad as people make him out to be. He doesn't always lecture on what the test focuses on and can come off as arrogant. His class is super interesting and so are the readings. It's not hard to get an A as long as you do the work.

Mason spends his time worrying about students leaving his class rather than the ones who are present. His lectures are all over the place and sometimes I feel as if he is not prepared. The weekly quizzes is the only thing that keep you reading and coming to class. He would be a better professor if the class was only on South Africa.
unorganized. goes off topic in lectures or repeats himself unnecessarily frequently. TA was the saving grace of the class, without him, I would not have learned anything of note

weekly quizzes are impossible to get full credit on regardless of if you read. the exams test God knows what. Mason is unapproachable and completely arrogant. His lectures are boring and not worth attending.
Professor Mason is by far the worst professor I have had. The class is extremely boring, Mason is an arbitrary grader, and extremely unapproachable. Avoid taking his classes.
Really knows his stuff, and very committed. A lot of reading but it's quite interesting stuff, such as some fiction, an autobiography and a journalistic book.

While it's true that Mason is conceited, the class is interesting. The coursework and exams are not that difficult. If you get the right TA you don't even need to read for the quizzes. When he talks about his South African adventures he gets excited but otherwise lectures can be lackluster and poorly organized. All in all not awful.

HIAF 3021.comment: Mason was rude when I went to his office hours and he rambles in his lectures. We covered each topic two days in the row because he didn't remember where he was. He never returned our midterms or our papers. There is a ton of reading for this class and he has quizzes on all the readings. He chose random terms from the readings for IDs on the test.

He is the WORST TA you could possibly have. He's clearly very knowledgeable on the subject of Africa as a whole but is unclear in explanations, does not answer questions effectively, and is very unapproachable as a person. Instead of constructive criticism he merely shuts down students and provides a hostile learning environment.

ARTH 3254.comment: I was ready to learn all about Leonardo Da Vinci but did not expect Fiorani to be such a tough grader! I am a math major who took this class for fun, but it turned out to be just the opposite. Fiorani gives such touch grades on what seems to be subjective responses from writing assignments. She also does not give any feedback or study resources.

Very knowledgable about Leonardo and interesting to learn from. She grades harshly, however - on one paper, she said my only issue was that my grammar was occasionally unclear, but the content was excellent and accurate, and I got a B+. You can get away with never reading the textbook, but you should buy it anyways because it's very helpful.
Hard class. Alot of studying. Very hard grader. Not very fair about it either. No real reasoning behind  why she gives you what she does.

MUSI 2070.comment: Nice guy, cared about what he taught, Attendance is not mandatory at all, but its nice to go and listen to him. Everything is graded by essays, and the only mandatory thing is going to your discussion. Easy A, nice guy, just a good overall combo.

Miller is so much fun. Popular Musics is an intriguing course, and he did a great job of making it interesting. Lecture isn't technically required (no attendance taken), but it would likely be difficult to elaborate in papers if you hadn't gotten the material. Textbooks are just readings for discussion, which you can probably get by without.

easy class...Bishop is a horrible lecturer but tries really hard. You should go to class to get the notes unless you can get them from someone. 3 papers, midterm, final. all easy. TA's go over the information and prepare you. Easy A but you do have to do these "comments" on the readings every class period. Don't have to read the whole thing to writ

MUSI 3050.comment: Music and Discourse is a fun and interesting course when taught by the department head Dr. Miller. Class is discussion based, with short readings before every session. I learned a lot about music, the industry, and how we relate to it. Dr. Miller is engaging and fun. Grades are a few short papers and participation- any effort will be received well.

Karl is such a wonderful professor! He's great at facilitating discussion and also knows how to give interesting lectures. He's happy to just chat during office hours once you've covered the important stuff, and since he's been the go-to for music major declarations he's knowledgeable about current and future courses. So sad he'll be on sabbatical!

ENCW 2600.comment: Jana is an icon and she deserves the world.

Taking Intro to Fiction Writing with Prof. Horn was such a good choice. The class was very chill, and Prof. Horn really allowed for the class to get to know each other and feel comfortable sharing our work. She led great workshops, gave good feedback on our writing, and was very transparent about assignments and deadlines. Highly recommend Horn.

Anna is SUCH an amazing professor! There were about four short writing assignments, typically ranging from 1-3 pages; a reading due almost every class; and one final paper, roughly 8 pages in length, due at the very end of the semester. Overall, the class was super fun and Anna made it such an enjoyable experience for all of us.

SUCH a cool person, I looked forward to class every single day. Only required a couple essays/papers so nothing crazy, but I left this class feeling a lot more capable and confident in my writing abilities.

Anna is one of the most caring, thoughtful people I know. On the last day of class, she gave us all a personalized note and a book suggestion! She really encouraged us to find our creative side and always found positives in our writing. Also has a wonderful British accent, big fan. Not too writing intensive, never overbearing, and class is fun!!

ENCW 2600 with Cassie Davies was one of the most amazing classes Ive taken. Cassie really cares about her students and works hard to make the class not only helpful, but also interesting. I really grew as a writer through this class.

She's one of my favorite teachers and you really get to know her throughout the semester because of how small the class is. She knows how to moderate workshop feedback well and encourages class participation. There is 1 writing assignment per week, and those can be edited and turned in again. I learned a lot about myself as a writer in this class.

PHIL 2660.comment: She was okay at explaining things except for when she wrote things down wrong and then she'd get mad at us. She was constantly trying to put distance between herself and the students. Halfway through the semester she just stopped calling me by my preferred name but I didn't feel comfortable bringing it up to her. Avoid her if you can.

Merricks is a great lecturer but he is terrible at writing critical assessments. If you have to take this class do yourself a favor and just memorize everything he says. All he wants is to hear you repeat his words verbatim on the exam. If you're okay focusing on memorization and regurgitation and not understanding the content then you'll be fine.

I ADORED this class, despite its difficulty and my disappointment with my grade. 100% recommend.

Fantastic lecturer, unbiased, explains ideas well. Stays on topic, but is willing to talk out of class.
Unfortunately, missing a few words in a question can make you lose out on very important points, but if you pay attention in class you'll do well.

Merricks is an insanely cool professor, very funny guy. Attendance in class is a MUST, miss one day and you'll be lost for the rest of the unit. Class is based on 3 tests, stressful in that sense but he is really good about helping you prepare. Nice guy to chat with, would highly recommend his class

A really passionate bloke who illustrates hard concepts with simple and easy-to-understand examples. Funny as hell and while a moderately tough grader, creates study guides for his students and is very open to questions during office hours. Taking good notes and paying attention to every detail of any postulate/theory is key to doing well.

Merricks is a fantastic professor. He takes a difficult subject like religion and clearly applies logical arguments to the topic. The readings are not necessary, as he explains everything in lecture. Also, his study guides are key, and cover exactly what will be on the examinations.
His personal religious views really come out during class. Did not feel respected as an atheist. Awful professor.

This was the BEST class I've ever taken and Professor Merricks is an absolute genius! He goes through the material very quickly  but if you take good notes, study in groups, and go to every lecture, you'll do well in the class. My mind was blown every single lecture: take Philosophy of Religion if it's the only thing you do at UVa.
Merricks is a fantastic professor. He takes a lecture on what many students might consider boring and difficult to understand and makes it interesting and very clear. Also gives a massive curve

Best professor I've had at UVA hands down. Teaches an excellent, unbiased course in philosophy. 3 tests based solely on what is covered in lectures, can be difficult if you don't take notes. Take this class, it'll change the way you look at the world.

Philosophy of Religion fundamentally changed my thought process, and Merricks is by far the best professor I  have had at UVA. Merricks is engaging, funny, and thorough.  Tests are tough, but Merricks is fair, just take good notes and you will do great. No papers, just 3 tests. Warning: this is a philosophy class, not a religion course.

Amazing class, everyone should take it. Merricks explains even the most complicated concepts brilliantly and clearly. No textbook, only weekly (if not every other week) readings available on collab. 3 Tests total. You DO NOT need a Philosophy background to do well in this class! Just pay attention and make sure you understand the material.

SARC 5400.comment: Professor Field is a passionate and kind professor! Data Visualization is a fun and engaging course, the lectures can be long but it isn't a difficult course and office hours are always there if needed. The course is what you make of it, there's a few tools to learn like adobe, tableau, and RAWGraphs.

ENG 3500.comment: If you have any remote interest in English, you have to take a class with Professor Rody. She is one of the few professors here that genuinely cares about her students. Sure, grades are a factor, but she wants you to understand and engage with the material. She doesn't just give A's to essays written without thought, put the effort in. I love her.

BIOL 4014.comment: Dr. Pani is super nice! The class is mainly focused on reading scientific papers exploring evolutionary cell biology with a few written assignments sprinkled in throughout the semester. The only large assignments are a group presentation on a paper and a research proposal at the end. Very laidback atmosphere and easy grading.

PHIL 1600.comment: I took his class while on Semester at Sea, during the summer of 2012.  Truly challenged me to elevate my perceptions of the world.  Kind of a mind-blowing professor.  Take his class, if you have the chance.  He's one of the good ones.

PHIL 3310.comment: Great lecturer. Approachable and not socially awkward or intimidating, which is rare for a philosophy professor. also cool finding him cited in stanford encyclopedia of philosophy. Not easy but an A is possible, he doesnt lie about the tests essentially coming from the study questions. Extremely entertaining prof. Kinda hot too.

ISHU 4041.comment: Professor Floyd's classes are informative and entertaining. He facilitates class discussion based on the week's reading and prerecorded mini-lectures.

He's probably the best professor I've had - and I'm in my last semester (in BIS).  He's not an easy grader, but if you have a legitimate issue during the semester, he's extremely kind and understanding.  Definitely always knows what he's talking about and clearly spends a lot of time prepping for class. Highly recommend.

HIST 3472.comment: Great lectures and lots of fun "tidbits" in class that will make for an enjoyable and rich semester! However, he seems to be book enthusiast (what good Historian wouldn't be?) so get ready to read a LOT! Each submissions is returned with great feedback and he works with you as long as you want to keep learning! Take at least one of his classes!

Floyd is great. I took this class and I'm in a seminar with him this semester. Not an excessive amount of reading, class isn't too hard, and learned a lot. He's really clear and keeps class from getting too boring.The only bad thing about this class was the 9am MWF slot.

HIEU 3492.comment: Great professor. Not the easiest class, but Prof. Floyd was always available for office hours. Very helpful and always willing to go the extra mile for his students. Even if you're not a history major, I would highly recommend taking one of his classes.
Excellent professor. Lectures are clear and he's very helpful outside of class as well. Highly recommended. This was my favorite class this semester.

ANTH 2820.comment: Professor Wattenmaker was a good professor but had an extremely dry teaching style. She really does care about everyone and wants people to pass. Only graded by 2 exams, final paper, and participation and attendance at discussion section. Not an easy A, but it's definitely easy to pass.

Professor Wattenmaker is very knowledgeable in what she teaches and is excited to answer questions. She is very helpful during office hours and is a fair teacher-always asking the class to vote on things (such as changes in exam dates).  Definately take good notes during class because exams are free response and short answer (very fair).
Interesting topic but she was a bit disorganized. She really does love what she teaches, though which made it a worthwhile class.
Loved hearing about fieldwork and the images.  Very helpful.

Professor Trella is an excellent and caring teacher. He is willing to listen to you and answer all of your questions. He is fair with grading assignments and tests. After the tragedy that happened at UVA in November 2022, he emailed the class and let us know that he wanted to listen and help us. He also gave us cookies that Wednesday.
This teacher is very helpful.  HIs lecture was fast but not too fast if you use a laptop.  Keeping up with notes should be enough.  It takes studying but you are rewarded for your work.

Professor Trella is one of the kindest teachers I have ever had. He teaches very well and class is so relaxing and chill.  He grades very very generously. I loved it. Take his class, any of them! You'll love him too!

Anthony is a cool guy he really helps you if youre stuck and does a great job of telling you what you need to know. Hes very up front about what it is you need to and wont sugar coat anything. Would highly recommend taking his class hes hilarious and is just a real cool dude.

ANTH 5870.comment: Incredibly approachable. Maybe a bit disorganized, but if you are truly interested in her classes, this does not matter. She will not baby you, she will give you plenty of room to flourish on your own. If you show her you are interested she will love you. Pretty easy A if you put in some effort. Incredibly excited by enthusiastic students.

ANTH 3290.comment: Sylvia Tidey is a wonderful and kind professor who truly cares about her students and wants them to do well. She realises that we have work outside of her class and is always open to help out. LOVE!

ANTH 2285.comment: My first ever semester at UVA and I feel SO lucky to have had Prof. Tidey! Loved her class so much! So (lowkey) funny, caring and sweet. Very standard workload, just make sure you pace yourself with the weekly readings. If my grade suffered at all it was completely my fault, but she will always work with you for you to get the best grade possible.

Took this course with Professor Tidey in my first semester and loved it. Be ready to question a lot that you think you may know about development and humanitarianism. A lot of reading each week but can get away with just skimming. Online quizzes and take home essays make up most of the grades and she communicates well how to get an A in the class.

ANTH 2280.comment: Gave excellent and extremely interesting lectures with stories from her own experience. Definitely reading heavy, but skimming will likely be enough since the exams are only multiple choice. Would completely recommend this class as you gain a whole new perspective, take especially if you are considering a career in healthcare.
