The class is the definition of an enrichment course, he is not trying to test your history knowledge of facts/figures, he just wants you to think about the movement and the world we live in. Don't be afraid by the amount of reading.

HIEU 3412.comment: Schuker is obviously a very smart guy. However, his lectures follow no logical pattern, nor are they in any chronological order. He references books and historians that you have never heard of every other sentence. I went to maybe half of the lectures and read none of the 20+ books he assigned but got an A-.Our TA was very easy, otherwise id avoid.

Absolutely horrible professor. Extremely condescending towards the modern generation and rude while doing it. I'll admit that he can get funny, but he's frustrating FAR more often. I asked him for guidelines on books for the paper- he helped me twice and then basically declared I was dumb and refused to help anymore- not a good sign. Do not take!

BIOL 2070.comment: Professor Homyk is, as everyone says, hard to understand at times and his tests are challenging. But he is absolutely the nicest man, and EXTREMELY helpful out of class. He'll definitely help you out if you get to know him. He is so intelligent and passionate to teach- but don't take this as a blow-off class. Best class I've ever taken.

BIOL 2060.comment: He mumbles and is very hard to understand. All test material comes from notes, so this can be a challenge. If you ask him a question after class he rambles on FOREVER about irrelevant things. However he loves his job and cares a great deal about his students. It is the easiest science class I have taken here, an easy 3 credit A.

One of the best professors I've had at UVA. He teaches his own labs, grades hundreds of handwritten tests himself, and by the way he makes himself available outside of class, it is clear he cares a lot about his students and what he is teaching. A+ professor

ANTH 3550.comment: Love this guy. Remarkable. Incredibly interesting and captivating, GREAT story teller. Very enthused about ethnography, you will do great if you show some interest and passion. Definitely need to read and participate. He is so charming and an incredibly intelligent and experienced anthropologist. No one could teach ethnography better.

PHIL 4500.comment: One of the preeminent scholars on Ancient Philosophy, this guy knows his stuff.

BIOL 4480.comment: Awesome Professor.  He's a brilliant biologist who has lived through both old (Watson and Crick) and new (Human Genome, etc).  Very interesting guy to have a conversation with.  Uses primary literature-based papers as grades, which is a great way to learn!

BIOL 4240.comment: Lectures are really disorganized. He just gives a bunch of random facts everyday, I don't feel like I really learned anything new or interesting. The papers you write will only vaguely be based on lectures. When you write a paper, he'll say "great job, I really liked how you..." and give you a mediocre grade. Worthless class.

USEM 0000.comment: I took his USEM Righting Unrightable Wrongs and loved it! Professor Dukes i great! He's so nice and really made an effort to get to know everyone in the class. Very friendly and kind - he brought cookies to every class :) We did a lot of really interesting, engaging things. Never made you uncomfortable or nervous.

EDUC 5500.comment: I loved the class on PLCs.  Thomas was a great teacher and a lot of fun to learn from.

ANTH 2159.comment: Jason Hickel may know something about anthropology, but he sure can't play racquetball to save his life.

ART 2620.comment: very easy going professor. starts you on your assignment then leaves the room. there are some outside assignments but he doesn't record whether you did them or not, though everyone normally did. critiques usually involve him talking extensively. but he is very nice and complimentary towards everyone's work - would recommend him as a professor

ARTS 2712.comment: This is the third semester I've had Geiger and I definitely recommend him. He really knows what he's talking about when it comes to painting and drawing. He's fairly lax which is both a good thing and a bad thing.
Geiger is the best art professor at UVA in terms of classically trained methods.  Learned a lot about composition, value, etc.  Can be unnecessarily long-winded in his critiques.

Prof Crozier, I'll miss you and that little beret you wear! Thanks for allowing me to paint on scrapwood from the junkpile! I'll also remember the time you went around Ruffin helping me find a thing cylindrical object to wrap the canvas around!

MUSI 3336.comment: Intimidating at first. It seemed that he was on something and that his goal was to make life miserable. But over time he softened up. He is truly passionate about the subject which is by nature hard to teach; he does a fairly decent job, especially with interval training and rhythmic stuff. Enjoyable once you get used to things.

He is extremely arrogant and unhelpful.  The class was very disorganized, and he would throw random material at us to read or transcribe that was way beyond our level but didn't teach us or allow us to build gradually up to a higher level.  I learned nothing and this class was a waste of time.

PLIR 3240.comment: I hardly went to class because he just kinda rambled, i did well in the course anyway by simply studying what i was interested in.  You get to choose what you write about so I skipped over a lot of stuff.  I guess thats a bit of a loophole

GERM 3010.comment: I loved her enthusiasm and passion for what she taught- it made me way more interested in the course. Grading was not easy though. It was always consistent/fair, but sometimes I felt like she expected more work then I had time for.

ENSP 1060.comment: As was said before, she believes she is better than you. Doesnt take the time to answer your emails, won't say goodbye back to you, and offers little positive criticism. I always felt like she took joy in demeaning everyone. Not a nice person, not interesting and not good at what she does anyways.

MUSI 2110.comment: Kind, understanding professor. Material was easy but engaging and enjoyable. Consists of reading responses, 2 major papers (5&10 pages) and a presentation. You will be pushed out of your comfort zone with chants, drumming and dancing, but it can be very fun. Come to class well rested and be open, she expects full physical and mental involvement!

ANTH 2310.comment: Melissa was great!She was always helpful and explained all of the concepts very clearly and consistently. Her grading can be a bit ridiculous, but she was mostly fair. All in all a great instructor!

ISSS 3490.comment: Definitely my favorite and best professor. He is incredibly interested in the subject and very enthusiastic about the students' thoughts. He often becomes facsinated by what someone says. A bit scatterbrained and open to whim, he care very deeply about every decision made and is a very fair grader who puts forth a huge amount of extra effort.

PLAP 3810.comment: O'Brien is an amazing professor with a LOT of knowledge. He's funny, interesting and entertaining.  I learned a lot in this class although it was very difficult.  My TA was awesome too! See if Charles Aaron Flynn is available

ARTS 4710.comment: Professor Crozier is a great instructor and a wonderful man!  He has always been positive and encouraging, and makes you WANT to work hard and do well!  We will all miss his advice, stories and general presence.  He has been a valuable asset to the UVA art department which can never be replaced!

ARTS 4720.comment: Crozier is a wonderful and inspiring artist, professor, and person! His kindness, sense of humor and knowledge make the course one of the most pleasant experiences I've ever had as a student. I will miss him... :(

PHS 7000.comment: Incredible TA. He is very helpful.

COMM 4330.comment: Amazing professor.  He has a vast knowledge of negotiations throughout various countries and his stories are entertaining.  Just show up to class and turn in your work outside of class.  He does have a tendency to cold call you if it looks like you are not engaged in the discussion (i.e. nodding off).

PHYS 1010.comment: This class is horrible. Nothing the professor talks about is relevant to physics or the material in the book. The class demonstration are coherent and they always fail. Do not take this class unless you have any prior knowledge in physics, because you will fail!!

MATH 1260.comment: Really nice, tries so hard. Helpful examples, very available with office hours. Make sure you sit in the front of the classroom because he writes really low on the board.

HIST 3455.comment: sucks. terribly hard. will screw up your GPA.

HIEU 3559.comment: I really enjoyed it! Subject material was interesting, and class was engaging

HIEU 2001.comment: Basically recites the textbook in a very abbreviated manner.  If you want to pass the class, doze through class and take a few notes.  If you want to actually learn, skip the class and read the textbook.  I recommend taking this class because you will learn a lot of history and most cetainly get an A.  Also it's so easy and you don't have to attend

Not that hard of a class. Three 2-3 page papers and then one paper 6-8 pages. One midterm and one final. Lectures can be extremely boring and seem identical to what you read in the textbook. She can be monotone, which put me asleep a lot, just get a good TA.

ENWR 2700.comment: Mr. Kelly is one of the best teachers I've had at this school.  I HATE writing but I enjoyed his class.  He is a very sweet man; he let my brother (who goes to a different school), who wants into journalism audit the class.  I learned so much in this class.

He's a fantastic teacher. He is very critical, but you learn from his critiques. I feel like my writing definately improved because of this class. He's very very nice and he's leniant with turning in late papers. It's a great way to fill your second writing requirement because all you do is turn in about a page of writing a week.

GERM 3110.comment: While extremely knowledgeable in many disciplines, Hudson prefers her students repeat what she has taught rather than come up with their own ideas. Yes, she is nice. Yes, she is smart. Yes, her opinion is law. But, I do feel I learned from taking her class.

TBTN 3030.comment: Dr. Miller's Tibetan is amazing, and her instruction very clear.  She is so careful you can't possibly fall through the cracks.  The amount of time she spent on grading translations and providing constructive advise boggles the mind.  Her first-hand knowledge of Tibetan language and religion is vast, and she is dedicated to her subject.

ENG 2526.comment: I hated English until I took this class.  It was engaging, helped me with my writing, and I got to read some great books

PSYC 4605.comment: Painfully boring and unorganized, she never seemed to have it together. My biggest issue with the class was the grading system. About 75% of class participation (which was a signf portion of the final grade) is determined by your peers. I had a bad group experience and ened up getting an F for participation even tho my overall avg was a B+

ARCH 2010.comment: overbearing power tripper.  I feel sorry for those who have to take her 102 class.  Sanda was the best :(

PLAP 3150.comment: I really enjoyed the class I took with Professor Claibourne.  She was quick to respond to emails and avaliable in her office for extra help/questions.  Most of the articles we read were very interesting.  A worthwhile course.

ISLS 3050.comment: Great professor.  Keeps the class engaged, and knows exactly how to get the students to think deeper about the issues discussed.  Highly reccomend this professor!

RELG 2380.comment: Faith and doubt is TERRIBLE. She rambles on about philosophy incomprehensibly for an hour and it's awful. The only way to pass is to get a good TA because she makes literally no sense.

ARTH 2559.comment: This is a great class for people who don't know anything about art history.  He repeats the take-away point from every painting/artist and creates a little theme every class.  It's definitely doable and enjoyable.  Sit in the front and it's easier to pay attention.  He knows what he's talking about.  He's a true scholar.

ARTH 3257.comment: He?s a nice guy, but somehow manages to make Michelangelo incredibly boring. If you can?t stand monotones, stay away!

CHE 2202.comment: O'Connell is a thermo legend.  Lectures are conceptual, reading is more in depth, and homework is calculation intensive.  Tests are hard.  Class is a giant pain, but doable.  If you're confused, hit up J-POC and he'll help you out...but only if you're putting forth an effort.  Textbook. Absolutely. Sucks.

SPAN 4701.comment: This classes was really easy and interesting. The homework was a great motivator for doing all the readings (both are easy to complete). We used a variety of texts, which I really enjoyed. She's very helpful and understanding. She does read off of powerpoints and isn't a great discussion leader though.

SOC 2055.comment: Easy class. Forget the readings but make sure to go to lecture, tests are straight from the notes he uses to teach. Mostly bearable... sometimes quite annoying teacher. Expect a heavy leftist tilt, and don't question it. This guy was totally his generation's super-hippie, and he doesn't like opening the floor for ideas disagreeing with his own.

COMM 4660.comment: The best professor at McIntire period.

PSYC 5500.comment: I took the fear and anxiety seminar. Moderate amount of work weekly plus a group project and final paper. Grading is very clear and she is always available to help in office hours or by appt. I wouldn't hesitate to take the class if this is your first time taking a seminar.

SPAN 3400.comment: Gerli knows a lot about a lot, but would often go on tangents seemingly to demonstrate this. I was often unsure what was relevant to the class and what was just him liking to hear himself talk for dramatic effect. He also switched between English and Spanish so not a lot of practice if you're looking to improve the latter.

HIST 2111.comment: Only take this course if you really enjoy history. Stay away if you are looking for an easy class. I made the mistake of doing this first semester of my first year, but overall the course is not too bad if you do the required reading, participate in class (you actually get points for participation) and are a good writer. His grading can be biased

MUSI 2350.comment: Technosonics is a farce. I can't even attempt to take this class seriously. Burtner Alternates between playing random noises and saying the word "oscillator" with various mispronounced computer science terms. But it's an easy A.

ENGR 1420.comment: It's a weird class that is taught but the guy is really smart and he can answer your questions.

ANTH 4991.comment: By far the worst classroom experience of my life. Me and my one other classmate were always confused and despite our countless questions and after class study sessions, we were still left in the dark. The assignments were boring and difficult. Her cold attitude made it really difficult to approach for help. I would not recommend taking!

USEM 1800.comment: Take this class for an easy A and an unintentionally hilarious professor.

NUCO 1200.comment: Dr.Kirchgessner was the perfect professor for Intro to Nursing. He brought so many people in to speak from various aspects of the nursing fields, all of which are very interesting. Class is great when he teaches as well- great stories and nice guy. Readings were boring but are helpful when read. =)

MDST 1300.comment: Nice guy and a fairly easy grader, but for an introductory course, the readings are long-winded and esoteric. His lectures are fairly useless and he essentially expects the readings to do the teaching. Large portion of the grade comes from group work (including an eight-page, collaborative research paper), so if you dislike that, avoid his classes.

Dense readings, seems to forget it's an intro level class. Seems like he's more eager to call American students out on ethnocentrism than to teach. Doesn't lecture as much as assigns readings and lets those teach for him, does not really explain them. exams are all based on readings and theres a lot of material to study. Avoid avoid avoid.

AMH 2010.comment: Prof. Costa is very helpful and very clear with assignments. This was online class, quizzes were optional. Four main grades included 2 exams and 2 research type papers. Exams were also papers (only 5 paragraphs per question - 2 questions per exam). Great teacher to take online.

BIOL 3180.comment: I read the other comments thinking the class wouldn't be that bad, but I was wrong. DO NOT TAKE IT. He puts so much worthless information into his powerpoints that you have no idea what is important and he uses unnecessary jargon constantly. 1st midterm was easy, but he managed to kill my entire class in the 2nd midterm after the course drop date.

HIUS 3559.comment: I went into this class with some sense of it being a history of tech class.  It wasn't exactly - more a fascinating look at the way humans have interacted with technology in the last 50 years (they're talking about changing this a bit though).  It's very interactive and I felt like I was much more engaged with the material than I typically am.

Great class, excellent professor. Be prepared for a very holistic, social perspectives-based approach; it's not very factually based, especially in the second half. Balogh is super friendly and very helpful. He's always trying to get more student input, and attends many of the discussions.

EDLF 3450.comment: Keith is an incredible teacher!!! He is very knowledgeable and understands how to effectively teach. He taught me invaluable information that will be very helpful when I get into my classroom. His class is a lot of fun! Not too much work outside of class.

Keith Mastrion is truly an amazing teacher as well as a remarkable person. He has received great recognition for his teaching ability and it is clear why. He makes attending class interesting and fun. He interacts with students in a way that inspires them to accomplish the most of which they are capable. Truly an awe inspiring person.

Keith Mastrion is truly an amazing teacher as well as a remarkable person. He has received great recognition for his teaching ability and it is clear why. He makes attending class interesting and fun. He interacts with students in a way that inspires them to accomplish the most of which they are capable. Truly an awe inspiring person.

Keith Mastrion is certainly committed to teaching the technology used in elementary schools today, but more impressively, he incorporates all sorts of extra insight about the basics of teaching itself into the technology instruction. This special feature made me  doubly motivation to come to this class.

The best class I've taken within the Curry school and possibly within UVa. as a whole. Coming to Keith's class is always enjoyable-- he isn't going to drown you in reading and assignments but you will still learn so much! I'd recommend this class to anyone- regardless of whether you're interested in teaching!

Keith is the most involved teacher I've had at UVA. He really makes the extra effort to ensure that everyone is learning and surviving the college environment. Even though it was a late class, I looked forward to it every week. Seriously, this is the BEST class I've taken at UVA; I would recommend it to Curry and non-Curry students alike.
Great class! I learned a lot about useful technology in the classroom, and had a great time doing it.
Great guy-Really cares about teaching and the students! He will help you teach the emotional part of teaching rather than the content. He's awesome
I absolutely loved this class because of the professor.

Keith is a fantastic teacher.  He not only taught me the material required for the course, but supplemented it with many useful tips for teaching.  His enthusiasm rubs off on all of the students, and by the end of the semester he had us all singing about criss-cross applesauce and the ant with high hopes.  DEFINITELY TAKE THIS CLASS WITH KEITH!!

easily the BEST class i've taken at UVA so far. I was actually pre-comm before taking this course and knew nothing about teaching & now im applying to the Curry school. Keith is SO approachable, really helpful, and genuinely wants you to succeed. Minimal homework, all work is done in class. no midterm/tests/final/papers. i recommend it to EVERYONE!

Keith is great! He is totally approachable, and makes the class so interesting and fun. I look forward to this class every week, and learned a lot of helpful tips for the classroom.  There was not a lot of work, but everything that we did had a purpose and was extremely interesting and fun.
excellent teacher, one of the best I've had.  has a way of getting my best work without demanding it or holding grades over my head.  very funny, which helps in a late evening class.
He was a national teacher of the year, and you can tell by the way he teaches his class.  He was always happy, always interested and he made class fun.  He had all of us eating out of his hand.

RUTR 3500.comment: BEST PROFESSOR EVER. Seriously, *everyone* at UVa should take Russian and Soviet Film and/or America Through Russian Eyes. She's hilarious, easy-going, and crazy-knowledgeable!! A+!

PHYS 1422.comment: This guy is awesome, makes the material easy to learn, very interesting demos.

COMM 4821.comment: This class was USELESS.  We had a room filled with 40 extremely accomplished people, but I got nothing out of the class because Brown could not facilitate a good discussion.  He is very condescending, and only puts forth an extremely liberal viewpoint. I could have read the assigned books on my own and learned just as much as I did from the class.

CLAS 1020.comment: She is one of the most enthusiastic professors I have ever seen.  She knows everything about the texts and she is so helpful and fun to talk to!  Her accent is endearing and she makes everything interesting!  I love her and highly suggest this class!

EDLF 7812.comment: Very knowledgeable. Clear rubrics--I would suggest following them. Have someone proofread your papers for sure!

WGS 4101.comment: The best professor I have ever had. She cares more about her students than anything else. Take her classes... all of them!!

ISSS 4060.comment: Prof. Ronayne makes the class interesting and provides a lot of in depth material to read. he is a fairly easy grader and doesn't assign insurmountable assignments. There were three papers no more than 5 pages long.  My only complaint is he doesn't post grades for assignments right away and is slow to respond to emails regarding coursework.

LATI 1030.comment: Merkel is my favorite university professor so far. Though he's a grad student, he demonstrates mastery beyond his years in the subject of Latin. The guy's brilliant, and I am so glad that I took his class; Latin would have sucked for me otherwise. Funny, helpful, knows his stuff, and is super fun to be in class with; highlight of all my classes. A+

EDIS 5400.comment: Teaching English in Secondary Schools: We covered a lot of material in just one semester. She uses a variety of instructional methods: whole-group discussion, small group work, lecture, video, literature circles, and other engaging activities that teachers would use in the classroom. She is open to feedback and wants her students to learn.
